Title: Data Analyst PLG (Remote Europe)
Description:
n8n is a workflow automation platform that uniquely combines AI capabilities with business process automation. We give technical teams the flexibility of code with the speed of no-code, backed by a passionate community of builders. With 500+ integrations and fair-code principles, we're revolutionizing how businesses connect their systems and processes.

We were founded end of 2019 and currently:


🧑‍🤝‍🧑 We’re a diverse team of + 120 talented people
🚀 Our annual recurring revenue is growing over 7x year-over-year
⭐️ With +118k GitHub stars, we are in the top 50 most popular projects of all time on Github
🍾 We were the 25th fastest growing startup last year and 4th BtoB SaaS Rising 100 this year in Europe according to Sifted
🌱 We were Sequoia's first seed investment in Germany, and most recently secured our $60M Series B (February '25, led by Highland)


Join n8n to help us unlock the next level of product-led growth through data.

At n8n, we’re building the most powerful automation platform for technical teams. Our unique blend of low-code flexibility and full-code control gives builders unmatched speed and scalability — backed by one of the world’s most active developer communities. We're building a self-serve motion that’s already powering millions of automations across companies of all sizes. Now, we’re looking for a sharp and curious PLG & Growth Data Analyst to help us deeply understand and optimize our self-serve user funnel — from acquisition through expansion.

🎯 Your main goal will be to enable data-driven ARR growth by uncovering insights that optimize self-service user acquisition, activation, retention, and expansion.

To get there, here’s how you’ll make an impact:

🔍 Become the expert on our PLG funnel


Understand the current self-serve user journey, from signup to expansion, and map drop-off points.
Own and evolve our PLG funnel analytics to track activation, conversion, retention, and monetization.
Conduct quarterly business reviews and funnel performance analyses to identify trends and risks.


🧪 Power experimentation and growth


Analyze the results of PLG experiments and advise teams on what’s working — and what’s not.
Continuously refine our PQL definitions based on behavioral signals and user segmentation.
Evaluate pricing plan performance across user segments and surface monetization opportunities.


🛠 Build tools that make data accessible and actionable


Design and maintain dashboards that track self-serve KPIs and enable rapid decision-making.
Build and scale self-service tools and documentation to help teams answer product and growth questions.
Partner with product, marketing, and analytics to ensure shared metrics and clarity across the funnel.


🤝 Enable cross-functional success


Work closely with Product, Growth, Marketing, and Engineering teams to inform their priorities with data.
Serve as a trusted partner in shaping PLG strategy by identifying new opportunities for activation and expansion.
Champion a culture of experimentation and data-informed decision-making across n8n.


Requirements

Must-haves


🧠 Self-serve PLG analytics experience: You have 4–5 years in data roles at high-growth B2B SaaS companies with a strong self-serve motion. You’ve directly analyzed user behavior across the activation, monetization, and retention funnel, and have helped shape the product strategy through PQL models, funnel mapping, and in-product experimentation.
📐 Experimental mindset: You’ve proposed, designed, and analyzed experiments that drove tangible growth outcomes.
🗣️ Cross-functional communication: You’re known for translating complex data into crisp insights that influence Product, Marketing, and Engineering teams.
🧮 Strong analytical toolkit: You’re highly proficient in SQL and experienced with BigQuery, DBT, Metabase, and Google Sheets.
🤖 Bias for automation & AI: You’re excited about using automation and AI to streamline workflows and unlock new insights.
📚 Academic foundation: You hold a Master’s degree in a quantitative field (e.g. Computer Science, Statistics, Economics, or similar).


Nice-to-haves


👾 Experience in devtool or community-led growth environments: You understand the unique patterns of usage and activation in technical audiences.
🔧 Familiarity with n8n: You’ve used our product — or are excited to dive in and explore what makes it so powerful.
🚀 Startup-first mindset: You’re energized by ambiguity, fast decision cycles, and the ability to ship impact quickly.
📊 AB testing expertise: You’ve designed and interpreted A/B and multivariate tests in SaaS products with scale.


Why join us?

At n8n, your work won’t disappear into a slide deck. You'll have direct impact on how we scale our ARR, build our data foundations, and shape the future of product-led growth in one of Europe’s fastest-growing startups. You’ll join a supportive, remote-first team that values autonomy, experimentation, and continuous learning.

Sound like a challenge you’re excited to take on?

Apply now — and help us build the future of automation.

n8n is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

We can sponsor visas to Germany; for any other country, you need to have existing right to work.

Our company language is English.

You care about diversity and inclusion? We do too! Check out our Diversity, Inclusion and Belonging initiatives at n8n (https://www.notion.so/n8n/Diversity-inclusion-and-belonging-n8n-c1bec2fff536422d868b1a438d990e35).

Location disclaimer: If you see multiple job postings for the same role, it is most likely because we're hiring remotely for this role and posting in different locations to make sure every potential candidate can see the role. Please apply to the location you're the most likely to work from in the future.

Benefits


Competitive compensation 💸 – We offer fair and attractive pay.
Ownership 💪 – Our core value is to “empower others,” and we mean it—you’ll get a slice of n8n with equity.
Work/life balance 🏖️ – We work hard but ensure you have time to recharge:
Europe: 30 days of vacation, plus public holidays wherever you are.
US: 15 vacation days, 8 sick days, plus public holidays wherever you are.
Health & wellness 🩺 –
Europe: We provide benefits according to local country norms.*
US: Comprehensive medical (PPO 1200), dental, and vision plans.
Future planning 💰 –
Europe: We provide pension contributions according to local country norms.*
US: 401(k) retirement plan.
Financial security 🛡️ –
Europe: We provide benefits according to local country norms.*
US: Short-term & long-term disability insurance, life & AD&D coverage, and additional hospital coverage.
Career growth 📈 – We hire rising stars who grow with us! You’ll get €1K (or equivalent) per year to spend on courses, books, events, or coaching to level up your skills.
A passionate team 🤩 – We love our product, and we prove it with regular hackathons where we see who can build the coolest thing with it!
Remote-first 🌏 – Our team works remotely across Europe, with regular off-sites for team bonding. Some roles, like sales in the US, are hybrid—please check the job description.
Giving back 🤝 – We're big fans of open source, and you'll get $100 per month to support projects you care about.
Transparency 🙏 – We all know what everyone’s working on, how the company is doing—the whole shebang.
An ambitious but kind culture 😍 – People love working here—our eNPS for 2024 is 94!
Country-specific details are provided in your contract.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Join Lepaya!

We're looking for an experienced data analyst to join our team in order to empower our commercial team with actionable insights, both via reporting development and deep analytical insights. In this role, you will collaborate closely with commercial team members and senior leadership to refine the data needs of the organization and develop solutions. As a full-stack analyst, you'll have the opportunity to develop data models, define KPIs and metrics, and build the final outputs in a variety of tools. You will also have the space to influence strategic decision-making based on the insights and recommendations you create from the data you develop and explore.

What You'll Do


Collaborate with commercial leadership and team members to define KPIs, metrics, and priorities for data driven decision making
Develop data products within the data platform using modern data stack best practices and tooling
Create actionable insights and recommendations and provide guidance to senior leadership


What You'll Bring


2 - 4 years' experience as a data analyst, ideally working in a financial or commercial focus
Excellence in the areas of data visualization, report development, and insight creation using tools like Tableau, Looker, Power BI, etc
Extremely strong SQL skills with practical experience in modern cloud SQL environments like Snowflake, BigQuery, etc
Experience working in dbt or SQLMesh
Experience working in git or equivalent
Python is a plus but not required


Your first year at Lepaya


Improve and extend our commercial and financial reporting suite
Support the business through deep-dive analytical projects
Develop data products in our snowflake environment to support insights


Our mission

At Lepaya, we empower professionals to thrive in their careers and lead happier lives, driving businesses to new heights. Every member of our team contributes to transforming the way organizations develop their talent. Our specialized academies support employees at every stage of their journey. Combining human expertise with cutting-edge software, our platform integrates advanced learning seamlessly into daily workflows. With nearly 1 million individuals upskilled at companies like KPMG, Dell, and L’Oréal, and backed by $80 million in funding, Lepaya is shaping the future of professional development.

Join our global, fast-growing team as we aim to be the largest upskilling platform worldwide!

What does it mean to be a Lepayan?

We succeed together. We act and come up with solutions. We build for growth. We exceed expectations. We create meaningful impact. For a glimpse into our culture, explore our careers page.

How We Live DE&I

At Lepaya, our diverse team embraces professionals of all backgrounds. We prioritize an inclusive environment where every member is valued and empowered. We're dedicated to diversity, equity, and inclusion through initiatives like our Diversity Charter and internal DE&I team. Your unique perspective is celebrated, ensuring you feel supported and encouraged to be yourself at work.

What’s next?

Ensuring a smooth candidate journey is our top priority. Here's a sneak peek into our standard hiring process: 1. An intro video call with Tracy, from TA, 2. An hour chat with the hiring manager Rob 3. A business case 4. A chat with a board member or with one of our founders, and finally, an offer! We're all about getting to know you better, so we'll invite you to our office for a face-to-face stage, where you can meet potential future colleagues and experience our awesome office vibes firsthand!

Eager to jump on board? Get in touch!
Show more

We're looking for an experienced data analyst to join our team in order to empower our commercial team with actionable insights, both via reporting development and deep analytical insights. In this role, you will collaborate closely with commercial team members and senior leadership to refine the data needs of the organization and develop solutions. As a full-stack analyst, you'll have the opportunity to develop data models, define KPIs and metrics, and build the final outputs in a variety of tools. You will also have the space to influence strategic decision-making based on the insights and recommendations you create from the data you develop and explore.

What You'll Do

  • Collaborate with commercial leadership and team members to define KPIs, metrics, and priorities for data driven decision making
  • Develop data products within the data platform using modern data stack best practices and tooling
  • Create actionable insights and recommendations and provide guidance to senior leadership

What You'll Bring

  • 2 - 4 years' experience as a data analyst, ideally working in a financial or commercial focus
  • Excellence in the areas of data visualization, report development, and insight creation using tools like Tableau, Looker, Power BI, etc
  • Extremely strong SQL skills with practical experience in modern cloud SQL environments like Snowflake, BigQuery, etc
  • Experience working in dbt or SQLMesh
  • Experience working in git or equivalent
  • Python is a plus but not required

Your first year at Lepaya

  • Improve and extend our commercial and financial reporting suite
  • Support the business through deep-dive analytical projects
  • Develop data products in our snowflake environment to support insights

Our mission

At Lepaya, we empower professionals to thrive in their careers and lead happier lives, driving businesses to new heights. Every member of our team contributes to transforming the way organizations develop their talent. Our specialized academies support employees at every stage of their journey. Combining human expertise with cutting-edge software, our platform integrates advanced learning seamlessly into daily workflows. With nearly 1 million individuals upskilled at companies like KPMG, Dell, and L’Oréal, and backed by $80 million in funding, Lepaya is shaping the future of professional development.

Join our global, fast-growing team as we aim to be the largest upskilling platform worldwide!

What does it mean to be a Lepayan?

We succeed together. We act and come up with solutions. We build for growth. We exceed expectations. We create meaningful impact. For a glimpse into our culture, explore our careers page.

How We Live DE&I

At Lepaya, our diverse team embraces professionals of all backgrounds. We prioritize an inclusive environment where every member is valued and empowered. We're dedicated to diversity, equity, and inclusion through initiatives like our Diversity Charter and internal DE&I team. Your unique perspective is celebrated, ensuring you feel supported and encouraged to be yourself at work.

What’s next?

Ensuring a smooth candidate journey is our top priority. Here's a sneak peek into our standard hiring process: 1. An intro video call with Tracy, from TA, 2. An hour chat with the hiring manager Rob 3. A business case 4. A chat with a board member or with one of our founders, and finally, an offer! We're all about getting to know you better, so we'll invite you to our office for a face-to-face stage, where you can meet potential future colleagues and experience our awesome office vibes firsthand!

Eager to jump on board? Get in touch!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Are you a Data Analyst and eager to consider a new project?

How about a role at a large financial company in Utrecht?

General information


Start date: Asap
Duration: First contract is till 28-2-2026 with rolling extension.
No. of working hours: 36 hours per week
Location: On Mondays in the office in office in Utrecht
Contract type: Payroll
VISA sponsorship: Yes if already in the NL


As Medior Data Analyst (BI Translator) you work in a team that is situated in a rapid changing and challenging environment (i.e. external regulatory demands, new innovations, compliance requirements). We expect you to bring your experience and hands on mentality to support the team in building new data solutions that meet the needs of our business stakeholders and align with the vision of our Data & Insights team within the Financial & Economic Crime Department. You share your experience and knowledge with the team on how to manage stakeholders effectively, to gather and define requirements for the new to be build data solutions, to anticipate on needs of the business and foresee potential risks. Together as a team you deliver new, valuable data solutions according to the scrum framework.

Practical Examples


Build future proof data solutions (i.e. web application widgets, PowerBI insights) according to the technical requirements based on the business needs.
Intense collaboration with data engineers within the team and source data owners to maintain, simplify and enhance the existing application and to increase efficiency and data quality.
Bring an overarching vision and viewpoint on data products to ensure that we create valuable and sustainable information solutions.


Top 3 responsibilities


Translation of business needs into adequate development requirements and eventually data solutions in the form of information widgets. Ensure maintenance and development of the squad data products into future proof and compliant solutions
Guide and influence the team members towards the vision of the Area. Also to share your expertise with other team members.


 

Together we achieve more than alone

We believe in the power of difference. Bringing together people’s differences is what makes us an even better bank. We are curious about what you can bring to our Data & Insights team.

You and your talent


Bachelor or Master Degree
Experienced in Power BI, DAX, SQL, Databricks
At least 3 years of experience in a similar role
Experience with working Agile/Scrum
Result-oriented, have can-do mentality
Strong analytical skills, ability to learn quickly to understand complex topics
Team player: you are able to work with others well to deliver value to our organization
Able to think ahead and to take initiative to improve and optimize


Does this role spark your interest? Then please provide me with your most recent resume and contact details, so that we can discuss this vacancy more detailed by phone!

You can check other job opportunities in our website: https://magno-it.nl/job/

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Drive the future of sustainable mobility - with data!

We are looking for a Data Analyst to help SnappCar make smarter choices and turning data into insights and solutions to support the shift towards a more data-driven way of working.

At SnappCar, we're on a mission to halve the number of cars on the road by making car ownership unnecessary. Our peer-to-peer car sharing platform is active in the Netherlands and Germany – and we’re growing fast. As a Data Analyst you will help us improve the product, grow the community, and accelerate the shift towards shared mobility.

About The Job

As our Data Analyst, you’ll play an important role in enhancing decision-making across departments—from product and marketing to support, finance and sales. You’ll translate data into insights, while building and improving pipelines and data models using tools like Apache Airflow and Power BI. Success in this role depends not just on technical skill, but also on an understanding of business needs and an ability to transform data into tangible business impact.

What You’ll Be Doing


Build and maintain dashboards and reports (Power BI, Mixpanel, Snowflake) that support decisions across teams
Analyze user behavior, funnels, and marketplace trends to uncover growth opportunities
Support the product and growth team with smart data models, A/B testing, and experiment design
Strengthen and scale the data stack to ensure reliable, efficient pipelines and models
Work closely with stakeholders to present insights, challenge assumptions, and drive data-informed decisions


As we’re a scale-up, your scope will be quite broad, which is a great opportunity to learn. So next to analysis, you’ll also get to work and learn on more data engineering and data science projects.

About You


2–4 years of experience in data analytics, preferably in a product-led or marketplace environment
Proficiency in SQL and experience with BI tools (such as Power BI, Looker Studio, Tableau)
Familiarity with A/B testing methodologies and statistics
Bonus: experience with Python/R and other data modeling tools
Strong communication skills – you can tell a clear story with data
A proactive mindset and a natural curiosity to dig deep into numbers
Affinity with sustainability, mobility, or the sharing economy is a plus


Ideally we are looking for someone with relevant experience under their belt (2-4 years). And most importantly: you identify yourself with SnappCar’s mission and values, and are able to work in a scale-up environment.

Next to this, we want to stress that SnappCar is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes applications from individuals of all races, genders, ages, religions, disabilities, and sexual orientations. We value the perspectives and experiences that individuals from diverse backgrounds bring to our organization, and we strive to create a workplace where everyone feels welcomed and supported. Therefore, we encourage qualified candidates of all backgrounds to apply.

What We Bring To The Table

At SnappCar we recognize the demands of being a data analyst, and want to make sure that next to a challenging and engaging position we offer you the following:


A meaningful impact on sustainability
Competitive salary
End-of-the-Year financial bonus, based on company performance
Unlimited Holiday Policy
Snabbatical (1 month paid leave after 3 years of employment, and 3 months leave after 5 years) to give you time to recharge
8% yearly holiday pay
Free rides (SnappCar credits to save on commutes!)
A very creative, energetic and international working environment at a great HQ office in the centre of Utrecht
A supportive team driven by innovation and growth with whom we have lots of fun team days and other events.
A laptop to do your work
A yearly budget for professional growth opportunities
Travel expenses paid (so you can actually get to the office on office days)
Delicious healthy lunches on office days


Lots of fun, teambuilding and celebrating successes together!

Apply for the job

If you’re excited about using your data skills to support a greener future at SnappCar, we’d love to meet you!

Title: Data-analist
Description:
Wil jij met jouw analytische vaardigheden bijdragen aan betere zorg, onderwijs en overheidsdiensten? Bij Van Dam Datapartners zoeken we een Data Analist die data omzet in heldere inzichten en concrete adviezen.




Wat ga je doen?

Analyseren & inzicht bieden: je onderzoekt datasets van gemeenten, zorginstellingen en andere publieke organisaties om maatschappelijke trends en knelpunten te signaleren.
Datavisualisatie & rapportages: je bouwt dashboards en rapportages in tools zoals Power BI, Tableau, Qlik of Cognos, zodat besluitvormers direct aan de slag kunnen met jouw inzichten.
Adviseren & presenteren: je vertaalt data naar duidelijke en overtuigende adviezen en presenteert deze aan opdrachtgevers.
Samenwerken & verbeteren: je werkt in een dynamisch team, waarbij je samen met Data Engineers en BI-specialisten slimme data-oplossingen ontwikkelt.

Projecten met maatschappelijke impact en opdrachten die ertoe doen. Uitstekende ontwikkelmogelijkheden, zowel inhoudelijk als persoonlijk. Werken in een bedrijf waar je vrijheid krijgt, maar ook verantwoordelijkheid draagt.




Wie ben jij?

HBO/WO niveau opgeleid
Je hebt minimaal 1 jaar ervaring binnen het publieke domein.
Minimaal 3 jaar ervaring met het analyseren van data.
Kennis van datavisualisatie, statistiek en SQL.
Goede communicatieve vaardigheden: je kunt complexe analyses eenvoudig uitleggen.
Je houdt van een uitdaging en voelt je thuis in een dynamische commerciële omgeving.
Je bent proactief en neemt het initiatief om met klanten in gesprek te gaan, zowel op inhoud als op de relatie. Je signaleert kansen en zoekt samen naar de beste oplossingen.




Uiteraard staat deze vacature open voor iedereen die zich hierin herkent. We geloven dat diversiteit binnen onze teams zorgt voor groei en innovatie.




Wat bieden we jou?

Werken in een organisatie met maatschappelijke relevantie, maar ook met ruimte voor jouw ontwikkeling.
Een marktconform salaris (€ 3.750 – € 5.500 per maand, op basis van 40 uur per week), afhankelijk van ervaring.
8% vakantiegeld.
NS-Business Card of reiskostenvergoeding (€ 0,23/km).
Een laptop en telefoon.
25 vakantiedagen.
De mogelijkheid om 5 extra dagen te kopen of verkopen.
Pensioenregeling bij Nationale Nederlanden.
Thuiswerkvergoeding van € 2,40 per dag + vergoeding voor inrichting thuiswerkplek.
Toegang tot onze Academy voor jouw persoonlijke ontwikkeling.

Show more

Title: Data-analist
Description:
Ben jij op zoek naar een rol waarin je data kunt structureren en écht impact maakt in een organisatie die nog volop groeit?




Houd je van procesverbetering, communiceren met teams én wil je iets moois opbouwen in een dynamische omgeving? Dan is deze organisatie op zoek naar jou!




Over de functie




Als Data-Analist stap je in bij een organisatie waar data en systemen nog in ontwikkeling zijn. Je helpt mee met structureren en mee te werken aan het data warehouse om rapportages te maken die financiële en vastgoedprocessen verbeteren. Samen met het research team werk je aan efficiëntere workflows en nieuwe tools, terwijl je stakeholders meeneemt in het data landschap. Je denkt strategisch mee over processen zoals projectmanagement en facturatie, en onderhoudt contact met IT-leveranciers om de basis te versterken




Je krijgt veel vrijheid om zelf vorm te geven aan je werk met kansen om te leren en te groeien in een organisatie die echt de volgende stap wilt maken.

Jouw werkzaamheden:

Data structureren
Rapportages maken voor financiën en vastgoed
Samenwerken met research om processen te verbeteren
Uitleggen van data-oplossingen aan stakeholders
Strategisch meedenken over businessprocessen
Contact onderhouden met IT-leveranciers




Over de organisatie

Onze klant is een Nederlandse organisatie met een rijke geschiedenis, gericht op het behoud van waardevolle gebouwen. Deze organisatie biedt een unieke kans om iets moois op te bouwen. Het team is klein en samenwerkend, met veel ruimte voor ontwikkeling.




De organisatie is op zoek naar een specialist die ervaring heeft met IT maar zich meer in de business wilt verdiepen, of iemand die al business ervaring heeft maar graag meer technische kennis zou willen opdoen.




Wie ben jij?

Je hebt minimaal 2 jaar ervaring binnen data of business
Kennis van SQL is een pré
Je spreekt goed Nederlands en kunt communiceren met business en IT
Je bent analytisch, houdt van verbeteren en bent communicatief sterk
Ervaring met vastgoed of procesverbetering is een pré




Wat bieden ze jou?

Salaris tussen €3.802 en €4.885 per maand
Werktijden van 24-40 uur, flexibel (minimaal 3 dagen op kantoor)
29 vakantiedagen per jaar bij fulltime
Pensioen 100% premievrij door de werkgever
Mobiliteitsvergoeding
Laptop en mobiele telefoon




Interesse?




Wil jij bijdragen aan de datagedreven groei van deze organisatie? Solliciteer dan direct! Stuur je cv mee, dan nemen we snel contact met je op.

Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About The Job

We are looking for a Data Analyst to join our dynamic, international team. The Data Analyst plays a key role in shaping the future of our innovative startup.

We're seeking a data-driven problem solver who is passionate about delivering the best possible monitoring solution for our customers. As a valued member of our growing company, you'll make sure the cutting-edge analytical solutions are leveraged for our customer. You’ll be working closely with operational teams to present your insights and with technology teams to drive innovation further.

Key activities:


Maintain and improve internal and external reporting procedures
Process and analyse data from IoT sensors
Create compelling data visualizations and reports
Communicate findings and observations effectively
Maintain customer facing dashboards
Realize the onboarding of new customers and monitoring on the dashboard



About Us

At Villari, we are dedicated to extending the lifetime of steel structures in ports, infrastructure, and the steel industry through our certified crack detection technology. Our permanently installed wireless sensors detect even the smallest fatigue cracks in critical locations of bridges and cranes by analysing variations in the magnetic field over time. Compared to traditional methods, we offer continuous and accurate inspection, carefree installation, competitive pricing, and certified technology. Our unique and patented solution has earned the trust of esteemed customers such as Tata Steel, Rijkswaterstaat, ProRail, ArcelorMittal, and many more. We take pride in our extensive coverage of 1700 sensors deployed across 11 countries, ensuring the safety and longevity of critical steel structures worldwide.

Villari’s core values are the following:


Integrity - We are honest about what we know and what we don't know for certain. We treat our data with the greatest care and understand that this is of utmost importance in this critical industrial environment in which we operate. There is always room to address doubts and uncertainties, such that nothing is swept under the rug.
Expertise - Our company is delivering seriously high-tech service: we’re not building a new app to order pizza. The combination of fatigue crack growth, ferromagnetic flux leakage, and seamless wireless communication is our unique domain in which we work with a proud team of highly-skilled and intellectual people. Customers rely on us because we know what we’re doing.
Accountability - We take responsibility for our actions. There’s no “not my problem” or “I don’t care” attitude at Villari. Learning from each other and carrying both a collective and individual feeling of ownership is extremely important in order to be an effective and well-balanced team.
Exploration - Villari was founded on the idea that we were bold enough to take complex physics and turn it into a meaningful product for our customers. As such we’ve pushed quite some boundaries along the way and we’re not afraid to turn left where others go right. On all levels people should be encouraged to try out new things and to test “wild ideas”. We understand and accept that new ideas sometimes turn out to be unsuccessful, as this is an integral part of exploring.
Approachability - As a company, and as individuals, we want to always be open for discussion, feedback, doubts, or just a casual chat about a topic unrelated to work. This goes towards clients, suppliers, colleagues, and towards superiors and people under your supervision. We help each other out and listen when others have something to say, regardless of seniority.



These values are at the core of our business and identity and it's very important that all our employees identify with these values.

What will you bring?


Required Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree (HBO level) in Data Science, Software Development, Physics, or a related technical field
Basic proficiency in Python, including experience with libraries such as Pandas, NumPy, and Matplotlib
Solid understanding of data analysis methods
Strong communication skills; able to collaborate effectively across teams and departments
Proven track record of working in a highly structured and organised way. Be prepared to demonstrate this with examples from past work or internship experiences during the interview and case study
Preferred Qualifications:
Knowledge of database management and SQL
Familiarity with IoT data analysis and cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure)
Proficiency with Jupyter Notebooks or similar development environments
Nice to have:
Knowledge of electromagnetics (including principles of electromagnetic theory and applications)
Familiarity with Git version control and collaborative coding practices
Knowledge of IoT communication protocols / LoRaWAN
Skills & Attributes:
Excellent communication skills in English (written and verbal)
Ability to work both independently and as part of a collaborative team
Skilled in Microsoft Office applications (Excel, PowerPoint, etc.)
Adaptability, proactivity, and a passion for learning in a fast-paced startup environment



What do we offer?


A gross salary between €2500,- and €3500,- per month, depending on your experience.
Contribute and experience being part of a scale-up with international ambitions.
Energetic and professional company culture, based on ownership and responsibility
25 vacation days per year
Hybrid and onsite working opportunities
Travel expenses covered
Every day we will provide a lunch at our office
Participate in the most fun company events and drinks
Show more
HTML:
About The Job

We are looking for a Data Analyst to join our dynamic, international team. The Data Analyst plays a key role in shaping the future of our innovative startup.

We're seeking a data-driven problem solver who is passionate about delivering the best possible monitoring solution for our customers. As a valued member of our growing company, you'll make sure the cutting-edge analytical solutions are leveraged for our customer. You’ll be working closely with operational teams to present your insights and with technology teams to drive innovation further.

Key activities:

  • Maintain and improve internal and external reporting procedures
  • Process and analyse data from IoT sensors
  • Create compelling data visualizations and reports
  • Communicate findings and observations effectively
  • Maintain customer facing dashboards
  • Realize the onboarding of new customers and monitoring on the dashboard


About Us

At Villari, we are dedicated to extending the lifetime of steel structures in ports, infrastructure, and the steel industry through our certified crack detection technology. Our permanently installed wireless sensors detect even the smallest fatigue cracks in critical locations of bridges and cranes by analysing variations in the magnetic field over time. Compared to traditional methods, we offer continuous and accurate inspection, carefree installation, competitive pricing, and certified technology. Our unique and patented solution has earned the trust of esteemed customers such as Tata Steel, Rijkswaterstaat, ProRail, ArcelorMittal, and many more. We take pride in our extensive coverage of 1700 sensors deployed across 11 countries, ensuring the safety and longevity of critical steel structures worldwide.

Villari’s core values are the following:

  • Integrity - We are honest about what we know and what we don't know for certain. We treat our data with the greatest care and understand that this is of utmost importance in this critical industrial environment in which we operate. There is always room to address doubts and uncertainties, such that nothing is swept under the rug.
  • Expertise - Our company is delivering seriously high-tech service: we’re not building a new app to order pizza. The combination of fatigue crack growth, ferromagnetic flux leakage, and seamless wireless communication is our unique domain in which we work with a proud team of highly-skilled and intellectual people. Customers rely on us because we know what we’re doing.
  • Accountability - We take responsibility for our actions. There’s no “not my problem” or “I don’t care” attitude at Villari. Learning from each other and carrying both a collective and individual feeling of ownership is extremely important in order to be an effective and well-balanced team.
  • Exploration - Villari was founded on the idea that we were bold enough to take complex physics and turn it into a meaningful product for our customers. As such we’ve pushed quite some boundaries along the way and we’re not afraid to turn left where others go right. On all levels people should be encouraged to try out new things and to test “wild ideas”. We understand and accept that new ideas sometimes turn out to be unsuccessful, as this is an integral part of exploring.
  • Approachability - As a company, and as individuals, we want to always be open for discussion, feedback, doubts, or just a casual chat about a topic unrelated to work. This goes towards clients, suppliers, colleagues, and towards superiors and people under your supervision. We help each other out and listen when others have something to say, regardless of seniority.


These values are at the core of our business and identity and it's very important that all our employees identify with these values.

What will you bring?

  • Required Qualifications:
  • Bachelor’s degree (HBO level) in Data Science, Software Development, Physics, or a related technical field
  • Basic proficiency in Python, including experience with libraries such as Pandas, NumPy, and Matplotlib
  • Solid understanding of data analysis methods
  • Strong communication skills; able to collaborate effectively across teams and departments
  • Proven track record of working in a highly structured and organised way. Be prepared to demonstrate this with examples from past work or internship experiences during the interview and case study
  • Preferred Qualifications:
  • Knowledge of database management and SQL
  • Familiarity with IoT data analysis and cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure)
  • Proficiency with Jupyter Notebooks or similar development environments
  • Nice to have:
  • Knowledge of electromagnetics (including principles of electromagnetic theory and applications)
  • Familiarity with Git version control and collaborative coding practices
  • Knowledge of IoT communication protocols / LoRaWAN
  • Skills & Attributes:
  • Excellent communication skills in English (written and verbal)
  • Ability to work both independently and as part of a collaborative team
  • Skilled in Microsoft Office applications (Excel, PowerPoint, etc.)
  • Adaptability, proactivity, and a passion for learning in a fast-paced startup environment


What do we offer?

  • A gross salary between €2500,- and €3500,- per month, depending on your experience.
  • Contribute and experience being part of a scale-up with international ambitions.
  • Energetic and professional company culture, based on ownership and responsibility
  • 25 vacation days per year
  • Hybrid and onsite working opportunities
  • Travel expenses covered
  • Every day we will provide a lunch at our office
  • Participate in the most fun company events and drinks

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We offer you an Ocean of Possibilities. Join our family.

About Us

Hop aboard Damen Naval; the naval division of the family-owned Damen Shipyards Group, where 12,000 professionals work worldwide. Damen Naval delivers advanced naval vessels to clients all over the globe. By implementing the most innovative technological developments in practice, we continue to push the boundaries of the shipbuilding industry. You can be part of our team! Are you ready for duty?

The role

As a Data Analyst at Damen Naval, you'll hold a key position in empowering departments and management to make informed, data-driven decisions. Joining our Data Management team within IT, you'll act as a crucial liaison between the business and data management, overseeing the complete data lifecycle from secure gathering to effective leveraging. Your insights will shape the design of next-generation ships, boost internal efficiency, and extend winning deals. Due to the highly sensitive nature of naval shipbuilding, all our data is managed on-premises using SSIS/SSAS and Power BI report server, ensuring a robust and secure environment.

Key Accountabilities

In this role, your responsibilities will include:


Collaborate closely with stakeholders (engineers, project managers, supply chain) to understand data needs and deliver actionable insights.
Ensure robust data governance, including ownership, quality rules, risk profiling, and definition management.
Perform statistical analysis to identify trends and anomalies, then generate compelling reports and visualizations.
Support and train end-users on reporting tools and best practices.
Proactively identify opportunities for data analysis to boost operational efficiency and streamline processes.
Stay current with data analysis tools and methodologies, continuously improving our insights.


Skills & Experience

We are looking for candidates with the following qualifications:


5+ years of experience providing business-critical insights through data analysis.
Bachelor’s or master’s degree in computer science, Information Technology, or a related field.
Proven experience with Power BI or SSAS data analysis tools.
Direct experience with on-premises data environments (SSIS/SSAS) is highly valued.
Experience in data management within a large international company. Experience working in the maritime, defense, or manufacturing industry is considered a plus.
Excellent references, as a security screening is part of the hiring process.
Permanent EU citizenship and passport are both required. Candidates with EU (work) visa or with both an EU and non-EU nationality and/or passport are not eligible in accordance with the requirements imposed by the military nature of our projects.


What We Offer

At Damen Naval, we highly value our employees, and we will support your professional and personal development. We also provide our employees with:


A competitive salary and 8% holiday pay.
27 holidays and 13 ADV days.
Travel allowance of 23 cents per kilometre.
PME-pension arrangement with an employer contribution of 60%.
Profit sharing based on company results.
Flexibility to work from home up to two days a week.
Additional benefits including a bicycle plan and company fitness.


Application & information

Are You Interested In This Position, Please Submit Your Application With Your CV And Cover Letter, Along With An Indication Of


Your (preferred) monthly gross salary based on fulltime work.
Availability (fulltime / part-time / number of hours).
Notice period / possible starting date.


For more information about this vacancy or Damen Naval, please visit the Damen Naval website, the Damen Naval Career website or contact the Corporate Recruitment department via +31 118 485 000.

Please note that due to the military nature of our projects, only candidates who have permanent EU nationality can be considered for vacancies at Damen Naval. Unfortunately, we are not allowed to process candidates who (also) have a non-EU passport or nationality.

A pre-employment and security screening and investigation form part of the recruitment process.

Acquisition and introduction of candidates without a formal request is not appreciated and they will not be considered.

Title: UT/UTCD Data Analyst [Level 3]
Description:
PIPECARE Europe is currently looking for UT/UTCD Data Analyst [Level 3].

By providing technology and service focused solutions to the international arena of the oil and gas industry, the PipeCare Group of companies has been helping our customers ensure the integrity of their pipeline and facility assets for over 20 years. Due to our global focus and international growth, Pipecare is seeking experienced UT/UTCD Data Analyst [Level 3] to support our continued growth.

Selected candidate will be working with our project execution teams to ensure the timely and accurate reporting of in-line inspection results, with focus on our custom-tailored reporting solutions to satisfy our customers’ needs. This includes the review of customer requirement specifications, processing of in-line inspection data, the analysis and identification of pipeline features and anomalies within processed data sets, application of industry accepted anomaly assessment criteria, ensuring the quality and accuracy of the final results, and compiling the results of our inspection activities in a concise, comprehensive custom tailored report for our customers.

Industry/sector: Oil & Gas / In Line Inspection services

Qualification: Data Analyst in UT/UTCD technology [Level 3]

Min years of experience: minimum last 15+ years working as UT/UTCD Data Analyst

Other requirements: solution – oriented attitude; hands on approach; disciplined; team player; self-motivated

Responsibilities include:


Checking and approving the tool performance during the PTT
Checking the data quality of ILI runs
UTWM Data Analysis
UTCD Data Analysis
EMAT Data Analysis
Checking and implementing dig verification task at sites and preparing relevant reports
Reviewing the software inter phase
Reviewing software user manuals
Preparing/Reviewing DAD quality documentation
To ensure accurate tool sensitivity values are provided to TM in Tool Checklist
To prepare a specific Run assessment report
To identify obstructions in the pipeline; to produce technically valid Preliminary / Final report (if applicable)
To produce technically valid Preliminary / Final report
To inform HO-DAD about the results and/or to implement the results into the reports
To ensure that the coordinates are synchronized with the data
To alert the R&D regarding the software problems
To update the documentation
To produce updated standard quality procedures
To alert the DA Team Leader / DA Manager regarding the software problems
Execute all other tasks as requested by DA Team Leader or DA Manager and/or Executive Team within the assigned job role
Qualified Candidates will possess:


Minimum 4-year technical or engineering degree from an accredited university (experience in the analysis of in-line inspection data may be considered in lieu of education on case by case basis)
Prior certification as ILI PQ LIII Data Analyst in one or more of the following in-line inspection technologies: UTWM, UTCD, EMAT; or the ability to become certified
Minimum 15 years of experience in the analysis of in-line inspection data
Ability to learn proprietary software platforms; proficiency in Microsoft based applications is a must
Proficiency in English, both verbal and written
A professional, detail-oriented focus and attention to detail and high quality
Ability to communicate effectively to all organizational levels, prepare and make presentations to management and customers on all levels


Job requirements:


Ability to work for extended periods of time in a stationary position at computers and workstations
Ability to pass vision acuity and color differentiation examinations
Business travel may be required for internal training, internal meetings, site visits, and customer meetings [international travel may be required]
Ability to work flexible hours based on business and project needs
Ability to work either independently or within a team to ensure project success


Physical and Mental Requirements:


Lifting and Carrying: Ability to lift and carry up to 50 pounds
Mobility: Must be able to walk and climb to perform duties, including maneuvering within a refinery or plant environment and accessing elevated platforms via ladders and stairwells
Communication: Sufficient clarity of speech and hearing, or other communication capabilities, to communicate effectively
Focus and Multitasking: Ability to maintain focus and multitask effectively
Safety Equipment: Must be able to wear safety equipment as required by the safety department for personal protection, if/where needed in manufacturing environments.
Personal Mobility and Reflexes: Sufficient personal mobility and physical reflexes, with or without reasonable accommodations, to perform office duties and travel to off-site locations when necessary


About PIPECARE Group:

PIPECARE Group offers comprehensive In-Line Inspection Services to identify and size pipeline threats, Utilizing advanced technologies such as Magnetic Flux Leakage, Transverse Field Inspection, Ultrasound, and specialized tools, PIPECARE ensures precise detection and assessment of various pipeline anomalies.

What we do:

In-Line Inspection Services

PIPECARE provides In-Line Inspection Services to locate, identify, and size threats, supporting integrity management requirements.

Check out our AI Technology and other cutting-edge technologies by clicking the following YouTube Links:

PIPECARE Group - YouTube

SMART AI CALIPER - Inspection Experience Like Never Before

Inspection Technologies

Magnetic Flux Leakage (MFL): Detects and sizes general corrosion and metal loss anomalies, especially circumferentially oriented.

Transverse Field Inspection (TFI): Detects and sizes general corrosion and metal loss anomalies, primarily axially oriented.

Ultrasound (UT): Detects and sizes general and other metal loss anomalies with high depth sizing accuracy.

Ultrasonic Crack Detection: Detects and sizes cracks and colonies of cracks.

Caliper (Geometry): Detects and sizes deviations in the ideal circular shape of a pipeline (dents, ovalities, wrinkles, etc.).

Specialized Tools and Technologies

Combo Tools: Use multiple measurement systems in various combinations.

Specialized Tubing Technologies: Designed for Furnace and Downhole Operations.

Equal Opportunity Employer: We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy, age, national origin, disability status, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Title: Data Analyst/ BI Specialist
Description:
Locatie: AmsterdamAbout Marie-Stella-Maris

Marie-Stella-Maris is a renowned lifestyle brand dedicated to making a positive impact on the world through our unique products and initiatives. Our mission is to provide clean drinking water and better hygiene to those in need, while offering premium quality home and body care products. With a commitment to sustainability and social responsibility, we aim to inspire change and promote well-being. 

The position

Now, we're looking for a Data Analyst / BI Specialist who can help us better understand our business, our customers, and our impact. The Data Analyst / BI Specialist plays a pivotal role in leveraging data as a strategic pillar for business growth. By transforming raw data into actionable insights, this role empowers teams across the organization to make data-driven decisions, optimize performance, and create personalized experiences

for customers.

Key Responsibilities


Contribute to the development and implementation of the data roadmap, ensuring alignment with


commercial priorities


Deliver clear, actionable insights by analyzing data across business functions.
Collaborate with implementation partners and challenge data model and dashboarding design


choices.


Build and maintain dashboards for operational and strategic use.
Support data transformations in dbt to meet evolving use cases.
Ensure high-quality master data management and data warehouse integrity
Collaborate with cross-functional teams (marketing, product, ecommerce, sales, finance) to define


and implement high-impact data use cases.

Your profile


Strong analytical skills and ability to tell stories with data.
Proficiency in SQL and Power BI.
Familiarity with dbt or willingness to learn.
Familiarity with data modeling methodologies such as Kimball, One Big Table (OBT), etc.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
Detail-oriented mindset focused on data quality and consistency.
Experience with one or more modern cloud warehouses. We use Databricks but experience with
Amazon Redshift, Google BigQuery, etc. is beneficial.
Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Data Analytics, Information Management, Business Intelligence, or related field.
2–5 years of experience in a data analyst or BI role.
Experience working with external vendors or implementation partners is a plus


What we offer


Competitive salary
25 vacation days + 2 days for social responsibility + your birthday off
Workcation
Pension
20% discount on Marie-Stella-Maris products
Free refills at the office and in stores
A healthy lunch at the office
An iPhone and laptop


Interested?

Do you think you're the perfect candidate for the role? We'd love to hear from you. You can apply via the button below, and you might be invited for an initial meeting.

If you have any questions, feel free to contact us at Careers@Marie-Stella-Maris.com.

Title: Data Analyst Marketplace
Description:
About The Role

At MediaMarkt, we’re shaping the future of commerce by placing data at the heart of every decision. As part of our fast-growing Marketplace team, you'll play a key role in driving the performance of our third-party sellers and improving the overall customer experience. This role offers a unique opportunity to work in a dynamic, entrepreneurial setting within a large organization, with real impact from day one.

As a Data Analyst in the Marketplace team, your responsibilities include:


Analyzing Marketplace performance: Dive into complex datasets to identify opportunities for growth and optimization across product assortment, pricing, fulfillment, and seller performance.
Providing actionable insights: Collaborate with category managers, partner onboarding teams, and business development to turn data into strategies that improve seller success and customer satisfaction.
Optimizing Marketplace operations: Build and implement reporting tools that enhance visibility on KPIs like GMV, take rate, delivery speed, and return rates. Support automation of operational processes using data-driven approaches.
Building dashboards: Create and maintain Power BI dashboards to track seller performance, product trends, and customer behavior across the Marketplace.
Partnering cross-functionally: Work closely with the central Data & Analytics team, Marketplace Business Development, and Tech teams to align data needs and drive scalable solutions.
Contributing to innovation: Support experiments and A/B tests to validate new Marketplace features and improvements.


Your Profile

You thrive in a fast-paced environment and are eager to make a measurable impact. You are both analytically sharp and business-minded. You love transforming data into real business value—especially when it helps a growing ecosystem of partners and customers.

We Also Expect


Master’s degree in Economics, Econometrics, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science or a related field;
2-3 years’ experience as a data analyst (preferably in e-commerce or marketplace environment);
Proficiency in SQL and Python or R;
Experience with Power BI or Looker;
Understanding of cloud data platforms (GCP/BigQuery preferred);
Excellent English (Dutch is a plus);
Experience in managing data projects, with strong communication skills to influence stakeholders.


About Us

For us"Let's Go!" is not just a slogan, it is an attitude. We love technology and we want to excite. We have fun and want to inspire. We are number one in Benelux and Europe. We influence how people experience and use technology. We make the difference and are there for our customers, through all channels. Together with our 50.000 employees across Europe, we create the shopping experience of the future.

Our best solutions arise when diverse perspectives come together. Diversity is key to achieving our vision of becoming the Experience Champion in Consumer Electronics. We value diversity, promote equal opportunities, and foster inclusion—join our team!

What's in it for you?


A fantastic workplace in the heart of Rotterdam.
Flexible work environment: Choose between working from home, the office, or elsewhere.
Attractive benefits and plenty of opportunities for development and growth.
Freedom and responsibility to shape your role and bring innovative ideas to life.
At MediaMarkt, we value boldness—as entrepreneurs within the company, we offer you the chance to develop quickly and in various areas.
Enjoy not only an amazing work environment but also:
30 vacation days
Attractive employee discounts
A collective health insurance plan
Corporate fitness benefits
Discounts on various insurance products
Show more
HTML:
About The Role

At MediaMarkt, we’re shaping the future of commerce by placing data at the heart of every decision. As part of our fast-growing Marketplace team, you'll play a key role in driving the performance of our third-party sellers and improving the overall customer experience. This role offers a unique opportunity to work in a dynamic, entrepreneurial setting within a large organization, with real impact from day one.

As a Data Analyst in the Marketplace team, your responsibilities include:

  • Analyzing Marketplace performance: Dive into complex datasets to identify opportunities for growth and optimization across product assortment, pricing, fulfillment, and seller performance.
  • Providing actionable insights: Collaborate with category managers, partner onboarding teams, and business development to turn data into strategies that improve seller success and customer satisfaction.
  • Optimizing Marketplace operations: Build and implement reporting tools that enhance visibility on KPIs like GMV, take rate, delivery speed, and return rates. Support automation of operational processes using data-driven approaches.
  • Building dashboards: Create and maintain Power BI dashboards to track seller performance, product trends, and customer behavior across the Marketplace.
  • Partnering cross-functionally: Work closely with the central Data & Analytics team, Marketplace Business Development, and Tech teams to align data needs and drive scalable solutions.
  • Contributing to innovation: Support experiments and A/B tests to validate new Marketplace features and improvements.

Your Profile

You thrive in a fast-paced environment and are eager to make a measurable impact. You are both analytically sharp and business-minded. You love transforming data into real business value—especially when it helps a growing ecosystem of partners and customers.

We Also Expect

  • Master’s degree in Economics, Econometrics, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science or a related field;
  • 2-3 years’ experience as a data analyst (preferably in e-commerce or marketplace environment);
  • Proficiency in SQL and Python or R;
  • Experience with Power BI or Looker;
  • Understanding of cloud data platforms (GCP/BigQuery preferred);
  • Excellent English (Dutch is a plus);
  • Experience in managing data projects, with strong communication skills to influence stakeholders.

About Us

For us"Let's Go!" is not just a slogan, it is an attitude. We love technology and we want to excite. We have fun and want to inspire. We are number one in Benelux and Europe. We influence how people experience and use technology. We make the difference and are there for our customers, through all channels. Together with our 50.000 employees across Europe, we create the shopping experience of the future.

Our best solutions arise when diverse perspectives come together. Diversity is key to achieving our vision of becoming the Experience Champion in Consumer Electronics. We value diversity, promote equal opportunities, and foster inclusion—join our team!

What's in it for you?

  • A fantastic workplace in the heart of Rotterdam.
  • Flexible work environment: Choose between working from home, the office, or elsewhere.
  • Attractive benefits and plenty of opportunities for development and growth.
  • Freedom and responsibility to shape your role and bring innovative ideas to life.
  • At MediaMarkt, we value boldness—as entrepreneurs within the company, we offer you the chance to develop quickly and in various areas.
  • Enjoy not only an amazing work environment but also:
    • 30 vacation days
    • Attractive employee discounts
    • A collective health insurance plan
    • Corporate fitness benefits
    • Discounts on various insurance products

Title: Data-analist
Description:
Data/Business Analist - Data Governance Leaders (hybride mogelijk)




Over DGleaders




DGleaders levert op wetenschap gebaseerde Data Governance expertise en software. Hiermee kunnen organisaties datakwaliteit verbeteren, verantwoord data benutten en met vertrouwen data-gedreven beslissingen nemen. Onze overtuiging is dat Data Governance mensenwerk is: onze medewerkers dus.




Werken bij DGleaders betekent persoonlijke groei en ontwikkeling. Ons DAMA-DMBOK-programma, trainingen en je collega’s ondersteunen hierbij. Onze cultuur draait om empowerment en autonomie, initiatief en verantwoordelijkheid worden aangemoedigd. We bieden flexibiliteit, zoals ongelimiteerde vakantiedagen, om je werk-privébalans te optimaliseren. Teamwork, gezondheid en welzijn staan centraal. Sluit je aan bij DGleaders en ontdek een cultuur waarin je kunt bloeien, samenwerken en écht een verschil kunt maken.




Wat je gaat doen




Als Data/Business Analist ben je expert op het vlak van data en ga je aan de slag bij onze klanten. Je verzamelt, verwerkt en analyseert (big) data en weet deze om te zetten in inzichten en business waarde. Op basis van een gestructureerde aanpak verbeter je de datakwaliteit en breng je de hoeveelheid gebruikte data terug zodat het gebruik van data duurzamer wordt.\




Ook bouw je mee aan onze Data Governance oplossingen. Je denkt mee over de data implicaties bij de ontwikkeling en inzet van ons Data Governance Framework en DAGONGIN software. Je ondersteunt bij de implementatie bij klanten en op basis van feedback van de klant stel je verbetervoorstellen voor.




Wat wij vragen




HBO of WO opleiding (Bijv. Data Science, Statistiek, Informatica, Wiskunde of een gerelateerd vakgebied)
Minimaal 3 jaar ervaring als Data Analist of vergelijkbare rollen (Bijv. Data Engineer, Data Scientist of Datawarehouse specialist)
Ervaren met data-analysetools zoals SQL, Python en R
Ervaren met visualisatietools zoals Tableau of Power BI
Analytisch denkvermogen: interpreteren en analyseren van grote hoeveelheden data en deze omzetten naar waardevolle inzichten
Probleemoplossend vermogen: complexe problemen identificeren en oplossen door data-analyse
Teamwork en communicatieve vaardigheden
Ervaring met agile en projectmatig werken
Pré: SAS, CAP en DMBOK certificering




Wat wij bieden




Persoonlijke groei
Onderdeel zijn van een bedrijf met een groot potentieel
DAMA-DMBOK-programma en trainingen
Marktconform salaris
Onbeperkte vakantiedagen (let op: gezonde bedrijfsvoering gaat voor)
Samen sporten onder werktijd
Thee-sommelier tijdens kantooruren en DJ tijdens de vrijmibo




Lijkt het je interessant hier vrijblijvend meer over te horen? Laat dan hieronder je gegevens achter en wij nemen zo snel mogelijk contact met je op!

Show more

Title: Junior BI Specialist
HTML:
Apeldoorn – 32 of 36 uur – HBO/WO


De uitdaging

Heb jij passie voor Business Intelligence én vind je het leuk om in teamverband te werken aan het professionaliseren van (bestaande) BI-oplossingen? Wil jij onderdeel zijn van een maatschappelijke organisatie en vanuit data bijdragen aan het leveren van optimale zorg? Dan is deze functie jouw nieuwe uitdaging!


Riwis Zorg & Welzijn is een gedreven zorginstelling die continu investeert in de (door)ontwikkeling van stuurinformatie zoals de BI-tool. Om nog beter te voorzien in juiste en begrijpelijke informatie voor een efficiënte besluitvorming, is de nieuwe functie van Junior BI Specialist ontstaan.


Deze functie is een leuke uitdaging voor een professional met minimaal drie tot vijf jaar werkervaring die toe is aan een volgende stap. Er is kennis binnen het team aanwezig dus er is volop ruimte om jezelf te ontwikkelen. Belangrijkste is de interesse in BI en de drive jezelf te ontwikkelen in dit vakgebied.


De organisatie

Riwis Zorg & Welzijn ondersteunt mensen met psychische, sociaal-maatschappelijke of lichamelijke hulpvragen, waarbij geloof in eigen kunnen vooropstaat. De zorg wordt geboden aan meer dan 1.500 cliënten in de regio’s Apeldoorn, Brummen, Eerbeek en Doetinchem. Er werken ongeveer 750 medewerkers, aangevuld met vrijwilligers en stagiaires.


Riwis is een financieel gezonde organisatie met een duidelijke visie. We werken vanuit de gedachte: ‘Werken volgens de bedoeling’. Dit betekent dat alle medewerkers zich bewust zijn van de maatschappelijke missie en deze centraal stellen in hun werk, in plaats van strikt vast te houden aan regels en procedures.


Het team Planning & Control is onderdeel van het cluster Bedrijfsondersteuning en bestaat uit vier collega’s: twee Business Controllers, één Financial Controller en jij als Junior BI Specialist. In deze functie leg je verantwoording af aan de Manager Bedrijfsondersteuning.


De functie

Als Junior BI Specialist ondersteun jij de Business Controllers bij het formuleren van datavragen en vertaal je deze naar heldere dashboards. De Business Controllers fungeren als de oren en ogen van de organisatie, en samen bouwen jullie aan een toekomstgerichte informatievoorziening.

Jouw werkzaamheden in grote lijnen:

  • Je bouwt begrijpelijke dashboards in Qlik Sense en houdt bestaande rapportages (o.a. rolling forecast) up-to-date;
  • Je denkt mee over verbetering en standaardisatie van de huidige informatievoorziening en benut de aanwezige BI-tooling optimaal;
  • Je zorgt voor de juiste koppelingen tussen diverse systemen zodat informatie efficiënt kan worden gegenereerd;
  • Je ondersteunt de Business- en Financial Controllers bij diverse (financiële) rapportage- en analysewerkzaamheden.


Voor wie

Je bent iemand die stevig in zijn of haar schoenen staat en een positief-kritische blik heeft. Je beschikt over goede communicatie- en samenwerkingsvaardigheden én uitstekende analytische vaardigheden met oog voor detail.

Verder neem je mee:

  • Een afgeronde hbo- of wo-opleiding in de richting van Data, IT, Bedrijfskunde of Economie;
  • Enkele jaren werkervaring in een vergelijkbare functie, bij voorkeur met BI-tools zoals Qlik Sense, Power BI of Tableau;
  • Nieuwsgierigheid naar nieuwe (data)ontwikkelingen en het vermogen deze toe te passen in je werk;
  • Een nieuwsgierige blik en proactieve houding waarmee je collega’s inspireert en aan het denken zet.


Wat krijg jij?

Riwis Zorg & Welzijn is een zeer prettige werkgever die oog heeft voor zijn mensen. Je kunt je goed ontwikkelen binnen deze organisatie. Op basis van een fulltime werkweek (36 uur), conform CAO GGZ, kun jij de volgende arbeidsvoorwaarden verwachten:

  • Een bruto maandsalaris van max. € 4.478,- (exclusief 8% vakantiegeld en 8,33% eindejaarsuitkering);
  • Aandacht voor jouw ontwikkeling door het volgen van diverse trainingen passend bij de functie;
  • Ruime verlofregeling en andere goede secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden zoals een werkkostenregeling (voordelige aanschaf van bijvoorbeeld een fiets, telefoon, laptop en een bijdrage op een fitness abonnement);
  • Een bepaalde tijds contract voor 32 of 36 uur, met de intentie dit na een jaar om te zetten naar een vast contract.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Who We Are

Adaptfy is a turnkey data & analytics solution for the SHV family of companies. We support multiple SHV Groups with advanced Data & Analytics in all areas, elevating their operations in diverse industries across international markets and throughout entire value chains.

Adaptfy is a joint venture formed by SHV and Metyis. Metyis embodies visionary thinking in the digital world, while SHV is a globally established family of companies built on the values of integrity, trust, curiosity, passion, and inclusivity.

SHV has a presence across four continents, with businesses spanning energy, heavy lifting and transport, animal nutrition & aquaculture, testing, inspection & certification, and more. The organisation’s history reflects its courage to care—for people, for performance, and for future generations. Their success is a testament to constant reinvention through innovation.

At Adaptfy, we play a pivotal role in bringing SHV’s digital vision to life. From optimising supply chains across Europe to enhancing operational efficiency in South America, we connect the dots for SHV, shaping a data-driven future for the entire family of companies.

What We Offer


A balanced work environment where you will have autonomy, responsibility, and ownership while working with a vibrant and dynamic team. 
A modern office with everything you need (including food and beverages). 
Become part of a fast-growing international and diverse team. 



What You Will Do


Design visually appealing and business useful reports. 
Understand client requirement and suggest right technical architecture. 
Developing technically efficient, fast, useful and appealing reports. 
Technical problem solving - good knowledge of DAX and data modelling. 
Preparing and facilitating workshops. 
Manage stakeholders and communicating with executives. 



What You’ll Bring


Up to 3 years of experience in PowerBI/ BI design and development. 
Prior experience in customer facing role across functions is good to have. 
In-depth understand of data modelling and basics of azure environment. 
Solid understanding and working experience of other BI tools and powerapps. 
Profound knowledge of the English language. 



In a changing world, diversity and inclusion are core values for team well-being and performance. At Metyis, we want to welcome and retain all talents, regardless of gender, age, origin or sexual orientation, and irrespective of whether or not they are living with a disability, as each of them has their own experience and identity.
