Title: Studentische Hilfskraft (m/w/d) im Bereich Data Engineering
Company: Zentrum für Sonnenenergie- und Wasserstoff-Forschung Baden-Württemberg (ZSW)
Description:
// Zentrum für Sonnenenergie- und Wasserstoff-Forschung Baden-Württemberg (ZSW)

Wir suchen aktuell: Studentische Hilfskraft (m/w/d) im Bereich Data Engineering in Stuttgart

// Energie mit Zukunft

Das Zentrum für Sonnenenergie- und Wasserstoff-Forschung Baden-Württemberg (ZSW) gehört zu den führenden Instituten für angewandte Forschung in den großen Themen der Energiewende: Photovoltaik, Windenergie, Batterien, Brennstoffzellen, Elektrolyse, eFuels, Circular Economy, Politikberatung sowie die Nutzung von KI zur Prozess- und Systemoptimierung. Gemeinsam mit der Industrie ebnen wir neuen Technologien den Weg in den Markt. An den ZSW-Standorten Stuttgart und Ulm arbeiten dafür mehr als 300 Kolleginnen und Kollegen sowie rund 100 wissenschaftliche und studentische Hilfskräfte. Das ZSW betreibt zudem ein Testfeld für Windenergie und ein weiteres Testfeld für PV-Anlagen. Wir sind Mitglied der Innovationsallianz Baden-Württemberg (innBW), einem Bündnis aus zehn wirtschaftsnahen Forschungseinrichtungen.

Das Fachgebiet Systemanalyse (SYS) am Standort Stuttgart sucht ab Oktober/November:

Studentische Hilfskraft (m/w/d) im Bereich Data Engineering

Ihr Aufgabengebiet


Unterstützung im Projekt BirdRecorder (birdrecorder.zsw-bw.de) -Datenmanagement sowie langfristig Planung, Organisation und Durchführung von Feldkampagnen an verschiedenen Standorten
Vorverarbeitung, Verwaltung und Vorsortierung großer Datenmengen aus Außeneinsätzen, u.a. durch Anwendung und Unterstützung KI-gestützter Verfahren
Weiterentwicklung und Qualitätssicherung bestehender Workflows und Plattformen zur Datenannotation (Labeling)
Mitarbeit bei der Integration und Verbesserung von Tools zur Datenvisualisierung und Analyse (z.B. Python, Datenbanken, Git, Linux, Grafana)
Mitwirkung an KI-Themen, insbesondere zur Erweiterung bestehender Detektions- und Klassifikationsalgorithmen auf nachtaktive Flugtiere
Mitarbeit in enger Abstimmung mit dem Team und eigenständige Bearbeitung kleinerer Aufgabenpakete
Flexible Einbindung in interdisziplinäre Themenfelder rund um Erneuerbare Energien und Künstliche Intelligenz am ZSW


Ihr Profil


Studium in einem MINT-Fach, Bereich Data Science, Informatik, Umwelttechnik oder Biologie
Interesse an Themen wie Artenschutz, Biodiversitätsmonitoring und dem Einsatz technologischer Verfahren
Hohes Maß an Selbständigkeit, Zuverlässigkeit und strukturierter Arbeitsweise
Bereitschaft zu Außeneinsätzen nach Absprache (vorrangig in Baden-Württemberg)
Erste Erfahrungen im Umgang mit Datenverarbeitung, idealerwiese Python, Git, Linux und Datenbanken
Selbstständige, strukturierte und zielorientierte Arbeitsweise
Kreativität und Motivation, eigene Ideen in bestehende Strukturen einzubringen und Prozesse aktiv weiterzuentwickeln


Unser Angebot An Sie


Exzellente Forschung trifft unmittelbare Anwendung: Wir forschen für und unmittelbar mit der Industrie und gestalten heute die Energieversorgung von morgen - wissenschaftlich exzellent aber stets anwendungsorientiert
Kreative Arbeitsatmosphäre: Wir leben eine offene Unternehmenskultur mit flachen Hierachien und viel Freiraum für kreative Entfaltung
Flexible Arbeitszeiten, auch hybrides Arbeiten möglich
Gute Anbindung an den ÖPNV und Fahrradstellplätze mit Servicebereich
Modernes Institutsgebäude mit erstklassiger Infra- und Laborstruktur bieten eine ansprechende Arbeitsumgebung
Betriebliches Gesundheitsmanagement mit zahlreichen Sport- und Gesundheitskursen und Mitarbeiterrabatte


Das Arbeitsverhältnis ist nach Absprache befristet, (Mindestverfügbarkeit 6 Monate und länger) und hat einen Beschäftigungsumfang von ca. 60-80 Stunden/Monat. Wenn Sie Interesse an dieser Position haben, bewerben Sie sich bitte bis 30.09.2025 ausschließlich über den "Jetzt bewerben"-Button. Fachliche Fragen beantwortet Ihnen Herr Niko Klar gern unter der Telefonnummer +49 711 7870‐337. Weitere Informationen finden Sie außerdem unter www.zsw-bw.de.

Möchten auch Sie die angewandte Energieforschung weiter voranbringen? Wir freuen uns auf Ihre Bewerbung!

Title: Data Engineer, Senior
Description:
Remote Work

No

Job Number

R0223367

Location:

Stuttgart,DE

Share Job Via

Share


Facebook
LinkedIn
X
Email


Data Engineer, Senior

The Opportunity

As a Data Management Engineer, you will apply data engineering best practices to support the collection, processing, and storage of Publicly Available Information (PAI) and other datasets. You will develop and maintain data pipelines to extract, transform, and load (ETL) structured and unstructured data, ensuring compliance with data security, regulatory, and quality standards. Your role will involve cleaning, organizing, integrating, and maintaining data models and visualizations to enhance operational analysis and decision-making.

You will collaborate with stakeholders, including military personnel, partner nations, and policymakers, to identify and address data-related needs. By conducting large-scale data queries and synthesizing results, you will provide actionable insights that support mission objectives. Leveraging programming and scripting tools such as Java, Python, or R, you will automate data processes and design scalable data models, schemas, and structures to optimize performance. Your expertise will ensure adherence to U.S. Intelligence Community (IC) and Department of Defense (DoD) guidelines and security measures when handling both classified and unclassified data.

Additionally, you will develop and deliver reports, dashboards, and briefings for the client and other stakeholders while participating in U.S. and foreign partner meetings and committees as a subject matter expert in data analysis and PAI. You will also support the testing and evaluation of analytical tools and software, operating within a managed attribution system as required for mission activities.

Join us. The world can’t wait.

You Have:  


5+ years of experience with data engineering or in a data science environment, including supporting large data, multi-INT analytics, NLP, machine learning (ML), and automated analytics
Experience with Java and Python
Experience using Databricks and Spark for data processing
Experience designing custom tools and using scripting or programming languages to optimize data mining, cleaning, validation, and analysis workflows
Experience working collaboratively with the U.S. IC and DoD Joint structure
Knowledge of geo-enabled datasets and their application in mission contexts
Knowledge of automation, artificial intelligence (AI), and ML tools and techniques
Ability to manage multiple projects under tight deadlines
TS/SCI clearance
Bachelor's degree


Nice If You Have:  


Experience building or supporting cloud-based data solutions in secure environments
Experience applying AI and ML to intelligence problems
Experience integrating structured and unstructured data via APIs or other ingestion methods
Experience with Defense Intelligence Enterprise data tools and platforms
Experience supporting intelligence analysis or data analysis related to African political, security, or socio-economic issues
Experience working with cross-functional teams and engaging mission stakeholders
Experience developing or maintaining data governance, QA, or metadata strategies in operational environments
Knowledge of IC data standards, oversight policies, and messaging formats, including ICD-501, ICD-203, or ICD-206
Ability to design and implement custom data solutions or analytics pipelines for large mission-specific datasets
Bachelor's degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering, or Data Science preferred; Master’s degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering, Data Science, or a related field a plus


Clearance

Applicants selected will be subject to a security investigation and may need to meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information; TS/SCI clearance is required.

Compensation

At Booz Allen, we celebrate your contributions, provide you with opportunities and choices, and support your total well-being. Our offerings include health, life, disability, financial, and retirement benefits, as well as paid leave, professional development, tuition assistance, work-life programs, and dependent care. Our recognition awards program acknowledges employees for exceptional performance and superior demonstration of our values. Full-time and part-time employees working at least 20 hours a week on a regular basis are eligible to participate in Booz Allen’s benefit programs. Individuals that do not meet the threshold are only eligible for select offerings, not inclusive of health benefits. We encourage you to learn more about our total benefits by visiting the Resource page on our Careers site and reviewing Our Employee Benefits page.

Salary at Booz Allen is determined by various factors, including but not limited to location, the individual’s particular combination of education, knowledge, skills, competencies, and experience, as well as contract-specific affordability and organizational requirements. The projected compensation range for this position is $77,500.00 to $176,000.00 (annualized USD). The estimate displayed represents the typical salary range for this position and is just one component of Booz Allen’s total compensation package for employees. This posting will close within 90 days from the Posting Date.

Identity Statement

As part of the application process, you are expected to be on camera during interviews and assessments. We reserve the right to take your picture to verify your identity and prevent fraud.

Work Model

Our people-first culture prioritizes the benefits of flexibility and collaboration, whether that happens in person or remotely.


If this position is listed as remote or hybrid, you’ll periodically work from a Booz Allen or client site facility.
If this position is listed as onsite, you’ll work with colleagues and clients in person, as needed for the specific role.


Commitment to Non-Discrimination

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to disability, status as a protected veteran or any other status protected by applicable federal, state, local, or international law.

HTML:
Remote Work

No

Job Number

R0223367

Location:

Stuttgart,DE

Share Job Via

Share

  • Facebook
  • LinkedIn
  • X
  • Email

Data Engineer, Senior

The Opportunity

As a Data Management Engineer, you will apply data engineering best practices to support the collection, processing, and storage of Publicly Available Information (PAI) and other datasets. You will develop and maintain data pipelines to extract, transform, and load (ETL) structured and unstructured data, ensuring compliance with data security, regulatory, and quality standards. Your role will involve cleaning, organizing, integrating, and maintaining data models and visualizations to enhance operational analysis and decision-making.

You will collaborate with stakeholders, including military personnel, partner nations, and policymakers, to identify and address data-related needs. By conducting large-scale data queries and synthesizing results, you will provide actionable insights that support mission objectives. Leveraging programming and scripting tools such as Java, Python, or R, you will automate data processes and design scalable data models, schemas, and structures to optimize performance. Your expertise will ensure adherence to U.S. Intelligence Community (IC) and Department of Defense (DoD) guidelines and security measures when handling both classified and unclassified data.

Additionally, you will develop and deliver reports, dashboards, and briefings for the client and other stakeholders while participating in U.S. and foreign partner meetings and committees as a subject matter expert in data analysis and PAI. You will also support the testing and evaluation of analytical tools and software, operating within a managed attribution system as required for mission activities.

Join us. The world can’t wait.

You Have:  

  • 5+ years of experience with data engineering or in a data science environment, including supporting large data, multi-INT analytics, NLP, machine learning (ML), and automated analytics
  • Experience with Java and Python
  • Experience using Databricks and Spark for data processing
  • Experience designing custom tools and using scripting or programming languages to optimize data mining, cleaning, validation, and analysis workflows
  • Experience working collaboratively with the U.S. IC and DoD Joint structure
  • Knowledge of geo-enabled datasets and their application in mission contexts
  • Knowledge of automation, artificial intelligence (AI), and ML tools and techniques
  • Ability to manage multiple projects under tight deadlines
  • TS/SCI clearance
  • Bachelor's degree

Nice If You Have:  

  • Experience building or supporting cloud-based data solutions in secure environments
  • Experience applying AI and ML to intelligence problems
  • Experience integrating structured and unstructured data via APIs or other ingestion methods
  • Experience with Defense Intelligence Enterprise data tools and platforms
  • Experience supporting intelligence analysis or data analysis related to African political, security, or socio-economic issues
  • Experience working with cross-functional teams and engaging mission stakeholders
  • Experience developing or maintaining data governance, QA, or metadata strategies in operational environments
  • Knowledge of IC data standards, oversight policies, and messaging formats, including ICD-501, ICD-203, or ICD-206
  • Ability to design and implement custom data solutions or analytics pipelines for large mission-specific datasets
  • Bachelor's degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering, or Data Science preferred; Master’s degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering, Data Science, or a related field a plus

Clearance

Applicants selected will be subject to a security investigation and may need to meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information; TS/SCI clearance is required.

Compensation

At Booz Allen, we celebrate your contributions, provide you with opportunities and choices, and support your total well-being. Our offerings include health, life, disability, financial, and retirement benefits, as well as paid leave, professional development, tuition assistance, work-life programs, and dependent care. Our recognition awards program acknowledges employees for exceptional performance and superior demonstration of our values. Full-time and part-time employees working at least 20 hours a week on a regular basis are eligible to participate in Booz Allen’s benefit programs. Individuals that do not meet the threshold are only eligible for select offerings, not inclusive of health benefits. We encourage you to learn more about our total benefits by visiting the Resource page on our Careers site and reviewing Our Employee Benefits page.

Salary at Booz Allen is determined by various factors, including but not limited to location, the individual’s particular combination of education, knowledge, skills, competencies, and experience, as well as contract-specific affordability and organizational requirements. The projected compensation range for this position is $77,500.00 to $176,000.00 (annualized USD). The estimate displayed represents the typical salary range for this position and is just one component of Booz Allen’s total compensation package for employees. This posting will close within 90 days from the Posting Date.

Identity Statement

As part of the application process, you are expected to be on camera during interviews and assessments. We reserve the right to take your picture to verify your identity and prevent fraud.

Work Model

Our people-first culture prioritizes the benefits of flexibility and collaboration, whether that happens in person or remotely.

  • If this position is listed as remote or hybrid, you’ll periodically work from a Booz Allen or client site facility.
  • If this position is listed as onsite, you’ll work with colleagues and clients in person, as needed for the specific role.

Commitment to Non-Discrimination

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to disability, status as a protected veteran or any other status protected by applicable federal, state, local, or international law.

Title: Mandatory internship master data management (MDM) in finance – starting November 2025
Description:
"Tasks

About Us

At Daimler Truck, we change today’s transportation and create real impact together. We take responsibility around the globe and work together on making our vision become reality: Leading Sustainable Transportation. As one global team, we drive our progress and success together – everyone at Daimler Truck makes the difference. Together, we want to achieve a sustainable transportation, reduce our carbon footprint, increase safety on and off the track, develop smarter technology and attractive financial solutions. All essential, to fulfill our purpose - for all who keep the world moving.

Become part of our global team: You make the difference - YOUMAKEUS

Become part of our team!

Are you passionate about data and eager to apply your skills in a real-world setting? We’re seeking a motivated intern to join our data strategy & business solutions team. Our team is part of Daimler Truck Finance and supports the organization globally in all data related questions. Within this internship, you’ll be able to contribute to our daily business as well as driving a dedicated project around the topic of master data management. This initiative aims to increase our master data quality in all relevant finance processes and systems. As an intern, you’ll collaborate closely with experienced data consultants. Whether you’re interested in financial processes and systems, business intelligence, or data management, this internship offers a unique opportunity to learn and grow.

What You Can Expect


Work closely with our international team on all day-to-day tasks around the topics of data management (e.g. User story definition, project management and testing)
Drive design and implementation of concepts for master data management in coordination with the specialist departments as well as consulting and support
Ensure maintenance and coordination of master data as well as continuous optimization of the system and master data quality
Support in consulting of other finance departments
Drive and support further digitalization projects


What We Offer You


An exciting and varied role in a dynamic environment
The opportunity to take responsibility for projects and contribute your own ideas
Attractive compensation and flexible working hours
Insights into the working world of a leading company in the commercial vehicle industry
Participation and contribution to exciting exchange and networking formats within the cross-location Students @ Daimler Truck network


Qualifications

THAT’S WHY YOU ARE A MATCH


You are currently studying business administration, business informatics, economics or a comparable specialization
You have experience with BI systems, e.g. SAP BW and ERP systems such as SAP S/4 HANA
Knowledge of databases, data applications, data modeling as well as data governance, data quality and data analytics
Experience in finance processes and project management
Confident handling of MS Office, especially Excel and PowerPoint
Good written and spoken German and English skills
Your studies require you to do a mandatory internship


You don’t bring everything with you? No problem! We look for skills but hire for attitude!

MAKEYOURMOVE and apply now – we‘re looking forward to it!

Additional information:

It doesn’t work completely without formalities. When sending your online application, please attach your CV, an individual letter and any references you may have (max. 5 MB).

Please understand that we no longer accept paper applications and that there is no right to get your documents returned.

We particularly welcome online applications from candidates with disabilities or similar impairments in direct response to this job advertisement. If you have any questions, you can contact the local disability officer once you have submitted your application form, who will gladly assist you in the onward application process: sbv-zentrale-truck@daimlertruck.com

If you have any questions regarding the application process, please contact HR Services by e-mail: hr-service@hr.daimlertruck.com

"

Title: IT-Consultant (m/w/d)
Description:
Wir sind Experten für Machine Vision und Generative AI und liefern leistungsstarke, skalierbare Lösungen auf Basis unserer eigenen AI-Plattform. Fehlerfreie Produktionsprozesse, maximale Sicherheit oder lückenlose Rückverfolgbarkeit – wir transformieren komplexe Abläufe in intelligente Systeme, die Kosten reduzieren und einen echten Unterschied machen. We enable AI in a smart way – von der Entwicklung über Hardware bis hin zur nahtlosen Integration bieten wir alles aus einer Hand.


Aufgaben



Ganzheitliche Projektverantwortung – Du leitest IT-Projekte von der Konzeption bis zum erfolgreichen Go-Live, überwachst Budget, Qualität und Zeitrahmen und stellst eine effiziente Umsetzung sicher.


Methodische Steuerung & Agilität – Mit Ansätzen wie Scrum, Kanban oder SAFe führst du Teams strukturiert durch alle Projektphasen und sorgst für eine reibungslose Zusammenarbeit.


Schnittstelle zwischen Kunde & Entwicklung – Du verstehst technische und fachliche Anforderungen, übersetzt sie in Epics und User Stories und förderst ein zielgerichtetes Teamwork.


Risikomanagement & Kommunikation – Du erkennst frühzeitig Risiken, leitest Gegenmaßnahmen ein und stellst eine transparente Kommunikation mit allen Stakeholdern sicher.


Workshops & Anforderungsmanagement – Du moderierst Strategie- und Anforderungs-Workshops, stellst die richtigen Fragen und dokumentierst präzise für eine verlässliche Umsetzung.


Qualitätssicherung & Prozessoptimierung – Du überwachst den Projektfortschritt, führst Reviews und Retrospektiven durch und optimierst kontinuierlich Abläufe.


Wissenstransfer & Coaching – Du unterstützt Kunden und Teams mit Schulungen zu agilen Methoden, Projektmanagement-Techniken und IT-Consulting Best Practices.



Qualifikation



Du hast ein abgeschlossenes Studium in Wirtschaftsinformatik, Informatik, (technischem) BWL, Digital Business oder einem vergleichbaren Bereich.


Du hast mindestens 3 Jahre Erfahrung im IT-Projekt- oder Anforderungsmanagement, kennst agile Methoden und hast komplexe Projekte erfolgreich umgesetzt.


Du verfügst über fundierte Kenntnisse im Projektmanagement und in agilen Methoden (Scrum, Kanban, SAFe).


Du überzeugst mit analytischem Denken, Problemlösungskompetenz und Stakeholder-Management sowie einer strukturierten, eigenständigen Arbeitsweise.


Du bist kommunikationsstark und bringst Beratungskompetenz im Umgang mit Kunden mit.


Du sprichst verhandlungssicher Deutsch und Englisch und bist bundesweit uneingeschränkt reisebereit.


Du bist versiert im Umgang mit Tools wie Office365, Jira und Confluence und bist bereit, dich in neue Projektmanagement-Tools und Softwareumgebungen einzuarbeiten. Idealerweise bringst du Zertifizierungen aus den Bereichen Projektmanagement (z. B. PMP, PRINCE2), agiles Arbeiten (z. B. PMI-ACP, SAFe Agilist) oder IT-Service-Management (z. B. ITIL) mit.



Benefits



Ein dynamisches und innovatives Unternehmen mit Wachstumschancen


Einsatz neuester Technologien und die Freiheit, dich nach individuellen Präferenzen zwischen Android/Windows und iOS-Endgeräten zu entscheiden


Interner Knowledge Transfer in einem fantastischen Umfeld mit einem motivierten und engagierten Team


Spannende Aufgaben, die dich jeden Tag aufs Neue herausfordern und motivieren


Förderung von Engagement und Weiterbildung, um deine berufliche und persönliche Entwicklung voranzutreiben


Vom Start-up zum Scale-up! Genieße Start-up Feeling in einem expandierenden Unternehmen und profitiere von der jahrelangen Expertise deiner Kolleg:innen


On Top setzen wir Teamgeist, der innerhalb regelmäßiger und abwechslungsreicher Team Events gestärkt wird





Wir freuen uns auf deine Bewerbung!

Show more

Benefits

  • Ein dynamisches und innovatives Unternehmen mit Wachstumschancen

  • Einsatz neuester Technologien und die Freiheit, dich nach individuellen Präferenzen zwischen Android/Windows und iOS-Endgeräten zu entscheiden

  • Interner Knowledge Transfer in einem fantastischen Umfeld mit einem motivierten und engagierten Team

  • Spannende Aufgaben, die dich jeden Tag aufs Neue herausfordern und motivieren

  • Förderung von Engagement und Weiterbildung, um deine berufliche und persönliche Entwicklung voranzutreiben

  • Vom Start-up zum Scale-up! Genieße Start-up Feeling in einem expandierenden Unternehmen und profitiere von der jahrelangen Expertise deiner Kolleg:innen

  • On Top setzen wir Teamgeist, der innerhalb regelmäßiger und abwechslungsreicher Team Events gestärkt wird


Wir freuen uns auf deine Bewerbung!

Title: PROJEKTASSISTENZ (M/W/D)
Description:
TRANSEARCH International ist eine der weltweit führenden Executive-Search Beratungen und begleitet Entscheider:innen auf Vorstands- und Geschäftsführungsebene bei der Suche, Auswahl und Entwicklung von Top-Level Führungskräften. Unser Kundenportfolio ist branchenübergreifend und beinhaltet bekannte Großkonzerne, den internationalen Mittelstand und die Unternehmen von morgen. Klingt spannend? Dann sind Sie bei uns genau richtig! Zur Verstärkung unseres Teams in Stuttgart suchen wir ab sofort eine PROJEKTASSISTENZ (M/W/D) im Bereich Executive Search Zusammen mit unseren erfahrenen Berater:innen, Projektmanager:innen und einem Search-Team, das Spitzenpositionen im Top- Managementbereich erfolgreich besetzt, organisiert und führt die Projektassistenz mit viel Eigenständigkeit und großer Verantwortung das Sekretariat der Beraterin/des Beraters und ist für Klient:innen und Kandidat:innen ein:e gewandte:r und kompetente:r Gesprächspartner:in.




AUFGABENBEREICH

» Unterstützung der Beraterin/des Beraters bei Akquisition und Projektabwicklung » Terminkoordination mit Kandidat:innen und Kund:innen » Reiseplanung, Erstellung von Berichten und Dokumenten » Eigenständige Bearbeitung ausgewählter Bereiche der zentralen Administration, wie z. B. Organisation von Kund:innenveranstaltungen oder Sicherstellung der optimalen Nutzung des Datenbanksystems




ANGEBOT

Aufgeschlossenes Team, das Freude am gemeinsamen Erfolg hat • Strukturierte Einarbeitung in den Aufgabenbereich (Mentor:innen-Modell)• Perspektiven zur beruflichen Weiterentwicklung • Off- und online Teamevents • Gute Verkehrsanbindung (Öffentlicher Nah- und Fernverkehr, Autobahnnähe)




ANFORDERUNGEN

» Mehrjährige Berufserfahrung in der Assistenz, vorzugsweise aus den Bereichen Kanzleiwesen, Wirtschaftsprüfung oder Beratungsunternehmen » Dienstleistungsmentalität » Einsatzbereit, flexibel, schnell, zuverlässig, kollegial, organisationsstark » Sicherer Umgang mit MS Office und Erfahrung mit Datenbanken » Fließende Deutsch und Englischkenntnisse




KONTAKT

Title: Data Analyst with Software Development Background (m/f/d)
Description:
Advantest Europe GmbH

Data Analyst with Software Development Background (m/f/d)

Böblingen

Kennziffer: 7533

Aufgabe

As a Data Analyst with a solid understanding of software development, you design data-driven solutions that not only uncover patterns in complex datasets but also create technical concepts that streamline analysis workflows. Drawing on parametric data generated in production of precision measurement instruments, you ensure that insights are grounded in high-quality, real-world metrics. You navigate effortlessly between analytical thinking and technical implementation, playing a key role in data-based decision-making and driving innovation in manufacturing environments. Your Responsibilities in Detail Data Analysis & Pattern Recognition: Perform exploratory data analyses to identify relevant patterns, anomalies, and correlations Derive hypotheses for root cause investigations and support evidence-based decision-making Apply statistical methods and machine learning techniques for problem-solving and forecasting Design of Analytical Tools & Frameworks: Designs modular tools and structured approaches to simplify and automate analytical workflows Evaluate existing analytics approaches and identify opportunities for improvement Draft concept papers for introducing new analysis strategies, including feasibility assessments Technical Implementation & Cross-Team Collaboration: Design and build data pipelines for efficient processing of large data volumes Develop prototypes (PoC) and lightweight applications (e.g. dashboards) to present insights Collaborate closely with Engineering, Development, and Contract Manufactures to ensure holistic analytics processes

Qualifikation

Education & Experience: Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Data Science, Mathematics or a related field Strong experience in data analytics, complemented by hands-on software development skills (e.g. Python, SQL, Git, APIs) Very good knowledge in English and German written and spoken Core Competencies: Solid understanding of database structures, data modeling, and ETL workflows Experience with common analytics and BI tools (e.g. Tibco Spotfire, Power BI) Ability to draft technical documentation and analytical concepts Soft Skills: Sharp analytical and conceptual thinking Creativity, initiative, and a structured way of working Strong communication skills with technical and non-technical stakeholders

Die vollständige Anzeige finden Sie beim Klick auf den Onlinebewerbungs-Button oder unter folgendem Link:

https://jobs.jobware.net/v/0057?jw_result_piid=057175649&jw_chl_seg=NLINKEDIN

Drawing on parametric data generated in production of precision measurement instruments, you ensure that insights are grounded in high-quality, real-world metrics. You navigate effortlessly between analytical thinking and technical implementation, playing a key role in data-based decision-making and driving innovation in manufacturing environments. Your Responsibilities in Detail Data Analysis & Pattern Recognition: Perform exploratory data analyses to identify relevant patterns, anomalies, and correlations Derive hypotheses for root cause investigations and support evidence-based decision-making Apply statistical methods and machine learning techniques for problem-solving and forecasting Design of Analytical Tools & Frameworks: Designs modular tools and structured approaches to simplify and automate analytical workflows Evaluate existing analytics approaches and identify opportunities for improvement Draft concept papers for introducing new analysis strategies, including feasibility assessments Technical Implementation & Cross-Team Collaboration: Design and build data pipelines for efficient processing of large data volumes Develop prototypes (PoC) and lightweight applications (e.g. dashboards) to present insights Collaborate closely with Engineering, Development, and Contract Manufactures to ensure holistic analytics processes

Qualifikation

Education & Experience: Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Data Science, Mathematics or a related field Strong experience in data analytics, complemented by hands-on software development skills (e.g. Python, SQL, Git, APIs) Very good knowledge in English and German written and spoken Core Competencies: Solid understanding of database structures, data modeling, and ETL workflows Experience with common analytics and BI tools (e.g. Tibco Spotfire, Power BI) Ability to draft technical documentation and analytical concepts Soft Skills: Sharp analytical and conceptual thinking Creativity, initiative, and a structured way of working Strong communication skills with technical and non-technical stakeholders

Die vollständige Anzeige finden Sie beim Klick auf den Onlinebewerbungs-Button oder unter folgendem Link:

https://jobs.jobware.net/v/0057?jw_result_piid=057175649&jw_chl_seg=NLINKEDIN

Title: Specialist Data Strategy (f/m/d)
Description:
Are you ready to shape your future with confidence?

Working together to make the world a little bit better every day. This is our purpose at EY and as a team we go all in to work towards our bold ambition: to create long-term value and growth – for our clients, our people and society. Our network of around 400,000 people around the world offers you every opportunity to grow, develop, specialize and pursue your professional strengths and interests. We believe that the right career path is as individual as you are.

Your role

As part of our Data Office organization for Germany in Frankfurt/Main, Hamburg, Köln, Leipzig or Stuttgart your contributions will be instrumental in shaping our strategic roadmap for the data transformation. You will take on a wide range of tasks:


Data Strategy Management: Oversee and implement a data strategy that aligns with EY Germany's objectives and the global data office strategy
Platform Ownership: Act as the Product Owner for the data product lifecycle management platform (D.A.T.A.), managing its roadmap, implementation, and success metrics while ensuring user-centric design
Team Leadership: Lead data science and engineering teams, promoting a culture of innovation and collaboration, and guiding the development of advanced analytics and machine learning models
Data Governance and Architecture: Enforce data governance policies and design enterprise data architecture to ensure data quality, security, and compliance with global standards
Stakeholder Engagement: Serve as the liaison between the EY Germany Data Office and other departments, promoting data literacy and a data-driven culture aligned with global initiatives


Your Skillset


Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Information Systems, or a related field, and at least 5 years of experience in data management as well as experience in a leadership role
Experience in building data solutions on a scalable Cloud infrastructure, strong understanding of data mesh principles and experience in implementing data mesh architectures as well as expertise in data governance, data architecture, and data quality management
Excellent bilingual (English and German) communication skills as well as and stakeholder management skills


Your mindset


Agile: You believe that a flexible mindset is just as important for success as knowledge and skills.
Curious: You are ambitious and committed. We are looking for people who think in terms of opportunities instead of challenges and ask targeted questions to unlock better answers.
Collaborative: You value diverse perspectives and enjoy working in a team. We are looking for people to help us shape the future and create a working environment based on trust.


Your Benefits

At EY, you will work in high-performing, interdisciplinary teams with innovative technologies. We support you in your various life situations with our flexible and inclusive working environment. Inspiring colleagues as well as training and development opportunities both on and off the job will empower you to grow and develop skills that will equip you for the future. We guarantee a steep learning curve. More about our benefits.

Apply today!

You can find further information on the application process at EY on our Careers page.

Find out what others are saying about us at kununu and Glassdoor.

At EY, we embrace diversity and welcome all applications. Let us know in good time if we can help you by offering an accessible application process.

Any questions? Just call +49 6196 996 10005 and our Recruitment Center will be happy to help.

Title: Data Engineer, Senior
Description:
Remote Work

No

Job Number

R0223368

Location:

Stuttgart,DE

Share Job Via

Share


Facebook
LinkedIn
X
Email


Data Engineer, Senior

The Opportunity

As a Data Management Engineer, you will apply data engineering best practices to support the collection, processing, and storage of Publicly Available Information (PAI) and other datasets. You will develop and maintain data pipelines to extract, transform, and load (ETL) structured and unstructured data, ensuring compliance with data security, regulatory, and quality standards. Your role will involve cleaning, organizing, integrating, and maintaining data models and visualizations to enhance operational analysis and decision-making.

You will collaborate with stakeholders—including military personnel, partner nations, and policymakers—to identify and address data-related needs. By conducting large-scale data queries and synthesizing results, you will provide actionable insights that support mission objectives. Leveraging programming and scripting tools such as Java, Python, or R, you will automate data processes and design scalable data models, schemas, and structures to optimize performance. Your expertise will ensure adherence to U.S. Intelligence Community (IC) and Department of Defense (DoD) guidelines and security measures when handling both classified and unclassified data.

Additionally, you will develop and deliver reports, dashboards, and briefings for the client and other stakeholders while participating in U.S. and foreign partner meetings and committees as a subject matter expert in data analysis and PAI. You will also support the testing and evaluation of analytical tools and software, operating within a managed attribution system as required for mission activities.

Join us. The world can’t wait.

You Have:  


5+ years of experience with data engineering or in a data science environment, including supporting large data, multi-INT analytics, NLP, ML, and automated analytics
Experience with Java and Python
Experience with using Databricks and Spark for data processing
Experience with designing custom tools and using scripting or programming languages to optimize data mining, cleaning, validation, and analysis workflows
Experience in working collaboratively with the US Intelligence Community (IC) and DoD Joint structure
Knowledge of geo-enabled datasets and their application in mission contexts
Knowledge of automation, artificial intelligence, and machine learning tools and techniques
Ability to manage multiple projects under tight deadlines
TS/SCI clearance
Bachelor's degree


Nice If You Have:  


Experience with building or supporting cloud-based data solutions in secure environments
Experience with applying AI and ML to intelligence problems
Experience with integrating structured and unstructured data via APIs or other ingestion methods
Experience with Defense Intelligence Enterprise data tools and platforms
Experience supporting intelligence analysis or data analysis related to African political, security, or socio-economic issues
Experience in working with cross-functional teams and engaging mission stakeholders
Experience with developing or maintaining data governance, QA, or metadata strategies in operational environments
Knowledge of IC data standards, oversight policies, and messaging formats, including ICD-501, ICD-203, or ICD-206
Ability to design and implement custom data solutions or analytics pipelines for large, mission-specific datasets
Bachelor's degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering, or Data Science preferred; Master’s degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering, Data Science, or a related field a plus


Clearance

Applicants selected will be subject to a security investigation and may need to meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information; TS/SCI clearance is required.

Compensation

At Booz Allen, we celebrate your contributions, provide you with opportunities and choices, and support your total well-being. Our offerings include health, life, disability, financial, and retirement benefits, as well as paid leave, professional development, tuition assistance, work-life programs, and dependent care. Our recognition awards program acknowledges employees for exceptional performance and superior demonstration of our values. Full-time and part-time employees working at least 20 hours a week on a regular basis are eligible to participate in Booz Allen’s benefit programs. Individuals that do not meet the threshold are only eligible for select offerings, not inclusive of health benefits. We encourage you to learn more about our total benefits by visiting the Resource page on our Careers site and reviewing Our Employee Benefits page.

Salary at Booz Allen is determined by various factors, including but not limited to location, the individual’s particular combination of education, knowledge, skills, competencies, and experience, as well as contract-specific affordability and organizational requirements. The projected compensation range for this position is $77,500.00 to $176,000.00 (annualized USD). The estimate displayed represents the typical salary range for this position and is just one component of Booz Allen’s total compensation package for employees. This posting will close within 90 days from the Posting Date.

Identity Statement

As part of the application process, you are expected to be on camera during interviews and assessments. We reserve the right to take your picture to verify your identity and prevent fraud.

Work Model

Our people-first culture prioritizes the benefits of flexibility and collaboration, whether that happens in person or remotely.


If this position is listed as remote or hybrid, you’ll periodically work from a Booz Allen or client site facility.
If this position is listed as onsite, you’ll work with colleagues and clients in person, as needed for the specific role.


Commitment to Non-Discrimination

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to disability, status as a protected veteran or any other status protected by applicable federal, state, local, or international law.

Title: Studentische Hilfskraft (m/w/d) im Bereich Data Engineering
Company: Zentrum für Sonnenenergie- und Wasserstoff-Forschung Baden-Württemberg (ZSW)
Description:
// Zentrum für Sonnenenergie- und Wasserstoff-Forschung Baden-Württemberg (ZSW)

Wir suchen aktuell: Studentische Hilfskraft (m/w/d) im Bereich Data Engineering in Stuttgart

// Energie mit Zukunft

Das Zentrum für Sonnenenergie- und Wasserstoff-Forschung Baden-Württemberg (ZSW) gehört zu den führenden Instituten für angewandte Forschung in den großen Themen der Energiewende: Photovoltaik, Windenergie, Batterien, Brennstoffzellen, Elektrolyse, eFuels, Circular Economy, Politikberatung sowie die Nutzung von KI zur Prozess- und Systemoptimierung. Gemeinsam mit der Industrie ebnen wir neuen Technologien den Weg in den Markt. An den ZSW-Standorten Stuttgart und Ulm arbeiten dafür mehr als 300 Kolleginnen und Kollegen sowie rund 100 wissenschaftliche und studentische Hilfskräfte. Das ZSW betreibt zudem ein Testfeld für Windenergie und ein weiteres Testfeld für PV-Anlagen. Wir sind Mitglied der Innovationsallianz Baden-Württemberg (innBW), einem Bündnis aus zehn wirtschaftsnahen Forschungseinrichtungen.

Das Fachgebiet Systemanalyse (SYS) am Standort Stuttgart sucht ab Oktober/November:

Studentische Hilfskraft (m/w/d) im Bereich Data Engineering

Ihr Aufgabengebiet


Unterstützung im Projekt BirdRecorder (birdrecorder.zsw-bw.de) -Datenmanagement sowie langfristig Planung, Organisation und Durchführung von Feldkampagnen an verschiedenen Standorten
Vorverarbeitung, Verwaltung und Vorsortierung großer Datenmengen aus Außeneinsätzen, u.a. durch Anwendung und Unterstützung KI-gestützter Verfahren
Weiterentwicklung und Qualitätssicherung bestehender Workflows und Plattformen zur Datenannotation (Labeling)
Mitarbeit bei der Integration und Verbesserung von Tools zur Datenvisualisierung und Analyse (z.B. Python, Datenbanken, Git, Linux, Grafana)
Mitwirkung an KI-Themen, insbesondere zur Erweiterung bestehender Detektions- und Klassifikationsalgorithmen auf nachtaktive Flugtiere
Mitarbeit in enger Abstimmung mit dem Team und eigenständige Bearbeitung kleinerer Aufgabenpakete
Flexible Einbindung in interdisziplinäre Themenfelder rund um Erneuerbare Energien und Künstliche Intelligenz am ZSW


Ihr Profil


Studium in einem MINT-Fach, Bereich Data Science, Informatik, Umwelttechnik oder Biologie
Interesse an Themen wie Artenschutz, Biodiversitätsmonitoring und dem Einsatz technologischer Verfahren
Hohes Maß an Selbständigkeit, Zuverlässigkeit und strukturierter Arbeitsweise
Bereitschaft zu Außeneinsätzen nach Absprache (vorrangig in Baden-Württemberg)
Erste Erfahrungen im Umgang mit Datenverarbeitung, idealerwiese Python, Git, Linux und Datenbanken
Selbstständige, strukturierte und zielorientierte Arbeitsweise
Kreativität und Motivation, eigene Ideen in bestehende Strukturen einzubringen und Prozesse aktiv weiterzuentwickeln


Unser Angebot An Sie


Exzellente Forschung trifft unmittelbare Anwendung: Wir forschen für und unmittelbar mit der Industrie und gestalten heute die Energieversorgung von morgen - wissenschaftlich exzellent aber stets anwendungsorientiert
Kreative Arbeitsatmosphäre: Wir leben eine offene Unternehmenskultur mit flachen Hierachien und viel Freiraum für kreative Entfaltung
Flexible Arbeitszeiten, auch hybrides Arbeiten möglich
Gute Anbindung an den ÖPNV und Fahrradstellplätze mit Servicebereich
Modernes Institutsgebäude mit erstklassiger Infra- und Laborstruktur bieten eine ansprechende Arbeitsumgebung
Betriebliches Gesundheitsmanagement mit zahlreichen Sport- und Gesundheitskursen und Mitarbeiterrabatte


Das Arbeitsverhältnis ist nach Absprache befristet, (Mindestverfügbarkeit 6 Monate und länger) und hat einen Beschäftigungsumfang von ca. 60-80 Stunden/Monat. Wenn Sie Interesse an dieser Position haben, bewerben Sie sich bitte bis 30.09.2025 ausschließlich über den "Jetzt bewerben"-Button. Fachliche Fragen beantwortet Ihnen Herr Niko Klar gern unter der Telefonnummer +49 711 7870‐337. Weitere Informationen finden Sie außerdem unter www.zsw-bw.de.

Möchten auch Sie die angewandte Energieforschung weiter voranbringen? Wir freuen uns auf Ihre Bewerbung!

Title: Junior Managers Program - Information Technology - Trainee Program (f/m/div.)
Description:
Company Description

Do you want to turn your ideas into useful and meaningful technologies? Whether in Mobility Solutions, Consumer Goods, Industrial Technology or Energy and Building Technology - with us you will improve the quality of life for people all over the world. Welcome to Bosch.

Robert Bosch GmbH is looking forward to your application!

Job Description

As an Information Technology JMP, you focus on intelligent IT solutions.

In 12-24 months, you transition through various stations at home and abroad. You drive the networking and development of digital business models with regard to global IT infrastructure, cloud technologies, app development, use of customer-oriented platforms, and software solutions. At the heart of our work is the Bosch IoT ecosystem.

Together with us, you will lay the foundation for your future as a leader. For us, leadership means continuously advancing yourself and other people, influencing existing processes, and thus achieving challenging, entrepreneurial, and meaningful goals.

What awaits you:


Flexible starting date all year round and a permanent employment contract
Individual program length and design your program in agile product areas, corporate start-ups, or classic line organizations with a wide range of workshops and trainings
One station abroad worldwide within the Bosch Group
Preparation for a global management role with your personal career mentor from top-management within Bosch
Complement your practical experience with a variety of learning and training methods, for which you have an individual budget
Benefit from the network and experience of your personal mentor at management level


Qualifications


Personality: You are enthusiastic about solutions relating to information technology. In addition, you are also interested in entrepreneurial relationships. You enjoy inspiring other people. You see courage, openness, tolerance, and mindfulness as desirable attitudes.
Background: You have completed your master’s or diploma degree in (business) computer science, (technical) business administration, industrial engineering or comparable, above average. Your focus is on topics such as cloud technologies, web services, IoT, big data, AI, software and/or data analytics. Maybe you have already gained an MBA, PhD or first professional experience.
Experience and know-how: You have at least three months of international experience and have gained practical experience through relevant internships in the software or I(o)T environment, also in medium-sized companies or start-ups. You also have practical experience in the use of one or more programming languages such as Java, C, Python, Matlab or similar. You have a very good command of English and a good command of German.


Additional Information

Award Fair Training Program 2024

Our benefits for you:


Flexible and mobile working: We offer you flexible working (time) models.
Health and sports: A wide range of health and sports activities awaits you here.
Childcare: Use our placement service for childcare offers.
Employee discounts: Bosch employees benefit from various discounts.
Freedom for creativity: We offer you freedom for creative work.
Company social counseling and care: Use our company social counseling on site including the online counseling options as well as our mediation service for care services.


Our application process for the Junior Managers Program includes multiple steps:

a Recorded Video Interview, Assessment Center and a Final Interview.

HTML:
Company Description

Do you want to turn your ideas into useful and meaningful technologies? Whether in Mobility Solutions, Consumer Goods, Industrial Technology or Energy and Building Technology - with us you will improve the quality of life for people all over the world. Welcome to Bosch.

Robert Bosch GmbH is looking forward to your application!

Job Description

As an Information Technology JMP, you focus on intelligent IT solutions.

In 12-24 months, you transition through various stations at home and abroad. You drive the networking and development of digital business models with regard to global IT infrastructure, cloud technologies, app development, use of customer-oriented platforms, and software solutions. At the heart of our work is the Bosch IoT ecosystem.

Together with us, you will lay the foundation for your future as a leader. For us, leadership means continuously advancing yourself and other people, influencing existing processes, and thus achieving challenging, entrepreneurial, and meaningful goals.

What awaits you:

  • Flexible starting date all year round and a permanent employment contract
  • Individual program length and design your program in agile product areas, corporate start-ups, or classic line organizations with a wide range of workshops and trainings
  • One station abroad worldwide within the Bosch Group
  • Preparation for a global management role with your personal career mentor from top-management within Bosch
  • Complement your practical experience with a variety of learning and training methods, for which you have an individual budget
  • Benefit from the network and experience of your personal mentor at management level

Qualifications

  • Personality: You are enthusiastic about solutions relating to information technology. In addition, you are also interested in entrepreneurial relationships. You enjoy inspiring other people. You see courage, openness, tolerance, and mindfulness as desirable attitudes.
  • Background: You have completed your master’s or diploma degree in (business) computer science, (technical) business administration, industrial engineering or comparable, above average. Your focus is on topics such as cloud technologies, web services, IoT, big data, AI, software and/or data analytics. Maybe you have already gained an MBA, PhD or first professional experience.
  • Experience and know-how: You have at least three months of international experience and have gained practical experience through relevant internships in the software or I(o)T environment, also in medium-sized companies or start-ups. You also have practical experience in the use of one or more programming languages such as Java, C, Python, Matlab or similar. You have a very good command of English and a good command of German.

Additional Information

Award Fair Training Program 2024

Our benefits for you:

  • Flexible and mobile working: We offer you flexible working (time) models.
  • Health and sports: A wide range of health and sports activities awaits you here.
  • Childcare: Use our placement service for childcare offers.
  • Employee discounts: Bosch employees benefit from various discounts.
  • Freedom for creativity: We offer you freedom for creative work.
  • Company social counseling and care: Use our company social counseling on site including the online counseling options as well as our mediation service for care services.

a Recorded Video Interview, Assessment Center and a Final Interview.

Title: Campaign Data Systems Operational Analyst
Description:
Remote Work

No

Job Number

R0223249

Location:

Stuttgart,DE

Share Job Via

Share


Facebook
LinkedIn
X
Email


Campaign Data Systems Operational Analyst

The Opportunity

To transform in today’s evolving digital world, organizations must harness data to resolve emerging problems at scale. As an experienced analytics professional, you thrive on using your critical-thinking skills to dig deep into complex data and mining solutions, and you know how to apply your business and technical expertise to develop analytical processes, tools, and applications.

The Campaign Data Systems Operational Analyst is a critical position providing campaign travel management, administrative, data systems, and financial management support to the client, ensuring effective force deployment, campaign synchronization, and fiscal responsibility. This role serves as a key liaison between planners, stakeholders, and leadership, contributing directly to the success of U.S. Marine Corps operations in Europe and Africa. You’ll introduce and recommend new ideas that deliver deep visibility and insights while being part of a supportive team that roots you on.

What You’ll Do


You will provide technical Defense Travel System (DTS) support for execution of Operations Activities and Investments (OAI) actions and processes supporting CONUS and Europe-based Marines traveling in support of campaign activities.
As needed, you will provide the customer with after-hours on-call support for DTS revisions related to the movement of Marines and equipment, ensuring compliance with US treaty obligations and Joint Travel Regulations (JTR).
You will act as a Reviewing Official (RO) for DTS vouchers on G-35 Line of Accounting (LOA) requests funded by EUCOM or the USMC.
You will draft, analyze, and refine travel planning guidelines for events involving 10 or more USMC travelers.
In this role you will conduct stakeholder synchronization to ensure accountability of allocated funds.
As you grow in the role, identify opportunities for increased burden sharing with regional partners and maximize efficiencies in resource utilization.
You will be asked to present recommendations to leadership regarding fiscal matters, resource allocation, operational awareness, force posture, readiness, and interoperability.
Take ownership of the process and recommend best practices to develop, maintain, and administer resource and financial processes, including submissions, review workflows, voucher approvals, and associated timelines.
Over time you will advise on using business intelligence data for predictive analytics and facilitate implementation of new tools.
You will maintain proficiency in key operational, knowledge management, and fiscal data systems used for resource management of allocated forces, deployed training forces, and client headquarters personnel.
Over time you will apply analytical best practices for data collection, aggregation, normalization, and analysis.
Analyze and process data, while creating and maintaining models and report templates and developing dynamic, data-driven solutions.
You will provide quarterly training for all operational planners on policy changes.
Assist regional planners with continuous monitoring of U.S. Marine Corps force availability, and draft guidance to deploying and training forces for their deployment, and redeployment in support of Combatant Command requirements.
You will also be asked to participate in the review and refinement of the client's Operations, Activities, and Investments (OAIs), integrating them into event and exercise planning to support campaign synchronization.
You will prepare and support synchronization efforts for other staff sections as directed in support of the client's mission.
Support military member travel by reviewing and coordinating official travel authorizations and vouchers as a DTS Reviewing Official.


Join us. The world can’t wait.

You Have: 


3+ years of experience with joint operations planning at the service component or combatant command level
Experience supporting military planning at theater, operational, or tactical levels and planning large-scale planning events with military headquarters staff elements
Experience as a financial analyst
Experience using the Microsoft Office suite of programs including Outlook, Word, PowerPoint, Excel, SharePoint and Power BI
Knowledge of budgeting, expense management, and data visualization best practices
Ability to coordinate across staff functions and command echelons
Ability to brief senior-level customers, including general and flag officers
Secret clearance
Bachelor's degree


Nice If You Have: 


Experience with Marine Air-Ground Task Force (MAGTF) concepts
Experience with the Joint Planning Process, Navy Planning Process, Marine Corps Planning Process, or Military Decision-Making Process, including Adaptive Planning and Execution
Experience with ADVANA, C2IE, and Maven Smart Systems
Knowledge of naval and joint doctrine, including NATO processes
Master’s degree


Clearance

Applicants selected will be subject to a security investigation and may need to meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information; Secret clearance is required.

Compensation

At Booz Allen, we celebrate your contributions, provide you with opportunities and choices, and support your total well-being. Our offerings include health, life, disability, financial, and retirement benefits, as well as paid leave, professional development, tuition assistance, work-life programs, and dependent care. Our recognition awards program acknowledges employees for exceptional performance and superior demonstration of our values. Full-time and part-time employees working at least 20 hours a week on a regular basis are eligible to participate in Booz Allen’s benefit programs. Individuals that do not meet the threshold are only eligible for select offerings, not inclusive of health benefits. We encourage you to learn more about our total benefits by visiting the Resource page on our Careers site and reviewing Our Employee Benefits page.

Salary at Booz Allen is determined by various factors, including but not limited to location, the individual’s particular combination of education, knowledge, skills, competencies, and experience, as well as contract-specific affordability and organizational requirements. The projected compensation range for this position is $77,500.00 to $176,000.00 (annualized USD). The estimate displayed represents the typical salary range for this position and is just one component of Booz Allen’s total compensation package for employees. This posting will close within 90 days from the Posting Date.

Identity Statement

As part of the application process, you are expected to be on camera during interviews and assessments. We reserve the right to take your picture to verify your identity and prevent fraud.

Work Model

Our people-first culture prioritizes the benefits of flexibility and collaboration, whether that happens in person or remotely.


If this position is listed as remote or hybrid, you’ll periodically work from a Booz Allen or client site facility.
If this position is listed as onsite, you’ll work with colleagues and clients in person, as needed for the specific role.


Commitment to Non-Discrimination

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to disability, status as a protected veteran or any other status protected by applicable federal, state, local, or international law.

Title: Mandatory Internship Advanced Analytics starting October 2025
Description:
At Daimler Truck we want to make a change, to create real impact together. That is why we take responsibility around the globe and work as one global team towards our vision: Leading Sustainable Transportation. It's people who make the difference and drive success. Together, we will achieve a more sustainable transportation, reduce our carbon footprint, increase safety on and off the track, develop smarter technology and financial solutions. All essential, to fulfill our purpose for all who keep the world moving.

YOU MAKE US – YOU MAKE THE DIFFERENCE

ABOUT US At Daimler Truck, we change today's transportation and create real impact together. We take responsibility around the globe and work together on making our vision become reality: Leading Sustainable Transportation. As one global team, we drive our progress and success together – everyone at Daimler Truck makes the difference. Together, we want to achieve a sustainable transportation, reduce our carbon footprint, increase safety on and off the track, develop smarter technology and attractive financial solutions. All essential, to fulfill our purpose - for all who keep the world moving.

BECOME PART OF OUR TEAM!

Our Finance Analytics team develops scalable solutions for Finance & Controlling at Daimler Trucks & Buses with the goal of enabling data-driven decisions and increasing process automation. We employ Artificial Intelligence to analyze large and complex datasets, derive forecasts for key business metrics, and quantify the impact of relevant influencing factors.

Are you passionate about data and eager to apply your skills in a real-world setting? We're seeking a motivated intern to support our Cash-Flow Analytics project. Within this project, you'll contribute to scale and further develop our Cash-Flow Forecasting solution to improve the forecasting quality and explainability as well as give steering impulses to our management. As an intern, you'll collaborate closely with experienced data scientists and business experts. Whether you're interested in machine learning, statistical analysis, or data visualization, this internship offers a unique opportunity to learn and grow.

WE OFFER YOU


An exciting and varied role in a dynamic environment
The opportunity to independently contribute to projects and bring in your ideas
Attractive compensation and flexible working hours
Insights into the working world of a leading company in the commercial vehicle industry
Participation in and contribution to exciting exchange and networking events within the cross-location Students @ Daimler Truck network


What You Can Expect


Extract and process data and perform analysis using Excel and Python
Use case professionalization in Microsoft Azure (Data factory & Databricks)
Further development of the Cash-Flow forecasting method
Bring in your knowledge and ideas to setup suitable forecasting models both from a business and data science perspective


THAT'S WHY YOU ARE A MATCH


You study (Business-) mathematics, Physics, Data Science, (Business-) informatics, Economics, Industrial Engineering and Management or comparable studies
Programming skills: R or Python
Experience in data wrangling techniques, statistics and basics in Machine Learning algorithms
Strong Interest in Finance & Controlling
Knowledge of MS-Office tools, in particular, MS Excel
Language skills: English fluent, German basics preferable
Commitment, teamwork and analytical thinking


You don't bring everything with you? No problem! We look for skills but hire for attitude!

MAKEYOURMOVE and apply now – we‘re looking forward to it!

Additional Information

It doesn't work completely without formalities. When sending your online application, please attach your CV, an individual letter and any references you may have (max. 5 MB).

Please understand that we no longer accept paper applications and that there is no right to get your documents returned.

We particularly welcome online applications from candidates with disabilities or similar impairments in direct response to this job advertisement. If you have any questions, you can contact the local disability officer once you have submitted your application form, who will gladly assist you in the onward application process: sbv-zentrale-truck@daimlertruck.com

If you have any questions regarding the application process, please contact HR Services by e-mail: hr-service@hr.daimlertruck.com

If you have any questions concerning the position, please contact Mr. Thomas Lohner at the following telephone number +49 176 309 711 53

At Daimler Truck, we promote diversity and foster an inclusive corporate culture. We value the individual strengths of our employees, as these lead to the best team performance and thus to the success of our company. Inclusion and Equal opportunities are important to us – regardless of where you come from and who you are. We look forward to receiving applications from people of all cultures and genders, parents, people with disabilities and people from the LGBTIQ+ community.

Title: Junior Consultant Digital Transformation (m/w/d) - bundesweit
Description:
Klar kannst du irgendwo als Microsoft-Consultant anfangen. Oder du kommst direkt zu den Besten.

HSO ist seit 21 Jahren Teil des Microsoft Inner Circle - also der Top 1 % weltweit. 26 Auszeichnungen als Partner of the Year, 30+ Jahre Erfahrung mit der MicrosoftPlattform und 2.800 Kolleg:innen aus 43 Nationen sprechen für sich. Was das für dich bedeutet? Spannende Projekte statt Folienroutine. Modernste Cloud-Technologien direkt aus dem Microsoft-Kosmos. Entwicklungsperspektiven, die zu dir passen - ob aus dem Homeoffice oder an einem unserer Standorte in Deutschland.

Du willst was bewegen, nicht nur begleiten? Dann gestalte mit uns die Business-Welt von morgen - mit über 2.500 realisierten

Projekten, für 1.200 Kund:innen weltweit, an 33 Standorten. Weniger Bla, mehr Wirkung. Willkommen bei HSO.

Als Junior Consultant (m/w/d) arbeitest du hands-on in unseren Projekten und treibst mit deinem Team echte Innovationen voran. Dabei wächst du nicht nur fachlich, sondern auch persönlich - mit individueller Förderung und abwechslungsreichen Aufgaben:


Zukunftsprojekte im Microsoft-Kosmos: Bei deinem Einstieg in die Beratung übernimmst du erste Verantwortung in IT-Projekten auf Basis von Microsoft Business Applikationen
Kundennähe auf Augenhöhe: Im direkten Kundenkontakt hörst du aktiv zu, um die Kundenbedürfnisse zu verstehen und hilfst dabei die beste Lösung zu finden sowie diese zu vermitteln
Workshops mit Impact: In Form von Workshops analysierst du Kundenprozesse & -anforderungen
IT-Lösungen: Du setzt die Anforderungen in innovative IT-Lösungen auf Basis von Microsoft Dynamics 365 (ERP) um - dabei kannst du dich immer auf die technische Unterstützung deiner Kolleg/innen verlassen
Stärkenbasiertes Matching: Während unserem Kennenlernen finden wir gemeinsam heraus, welcher Prozessbereich am besten für dich geeignet ist - Produktion | Handel | Finanzen | Dienstleistungen - deine Stärken und Interessen stehen dabei im Vordergrund



Requirements


Ein Studium in BWL, (Wirtschafts-)Informatik oder Wirtschaftsingenieurwesen bzw. eine vergleichbare Ausbildung
Du hast Interesse an oder verfügst bereits über Kenntnisse in betriebswirtschaftlichen Geschäftsprozessen/-abläufen
Erste Erfahrungen mit Software-Lösungen wie ERP/CRM sind von Vorteil
Du kannst dich für Microsoft-Technologien begeistern
Du zeichnest dich durch eine schnelle Auffassungsgabe, Kommunikationsstärke, Sozialkompetenz und einen eigenverantwortlichen Arbeitsstil aus
Du verfügst über sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse
Eine projektbezogene Reisebereitschaft setzen wir voraus



Benefits


Result Orientation: Du arbeitest bei einem der global größten und erfolgreichsten Microsoft-Partner im Bereich Microsoft Dynamics 365 und treibst damit die digitale Transformation voran
Self Determination: Bei uns steht die Kommunikation auf Augenhöhe im Mittelpunkt mit deinen Ideen und Erfahrungen kannst du dich bei uns einbringen, eigenständig agieren und damit den Unternehmenserfolg aktiv mitgestalten
Team Spirit: Da Menschen bei HSO den Unterschied machen, kannst du dich auf eine unterstützende, vertrauensvolle und wertschätzende Arbeitsatmosphäre freuen
Learning & Growth: Wir werden dich mit Trainingsangeboten durch unsere hauseigene HSO Academy und externe Schulungspartner in Kombination mit einem individuellen Karrierepfad fördern
Onboarding@HSO: Wir heißen dich in unserem Office in Böblingen willkommen - du startest deine ersten Onboarding-Tage bei uns vor Ort, um dich mit unserer Unternehmenskultur, unseren Prozessen und Tools vertraut zu machen
Hybrid Workforce: Ohne festgeschriebene Kernarbeitszeit hast du die Möglichkeit flexibel aus deinem Homeoffice, bei Kunden vor Ort oder in unseren Offices in Böblingen, München, Nürnberg oder Chemnitz zu arbeiten
Appreciation: Ein attraktives Gehaltsmodell inklusive 20 % Zuschuss zur betrieblichen Altersvorsorge, Mitarbeiterangebote, Bikeleasing, Gesundheitsförderung durch EGYM Wellpass, Geburtstagsgutscheine und außergewöhnliche Events runden dein HSO-FeelGood-Paket ab
Workation: Wir möchten unseren Mitarbeitenden mehr Flexibilität und Freiräume bieten, damit sie ihre Work-Life-Balance aktiv gestalten können. Daher hast du die Möglichkeit, bis zu 30 Tage im Jahr unter Einhaltung der rechtlichen Bedingungen aus der EU, dem EWR und der Schweiz zu arbeiten



HSO fördert aktiv Vielfalt und Inklusion. Wir begrüßen Bewerbungen von allen qualifizierten Personen - unabhängig von ethnischer Herkunft, Hautfarbe, Religion, Geschlecht, sexueller Orientierung, Geschlechtsidentität, nationaler Herkunft, Behinderung oder Alter. Wir setzen uns für ein diskriminierungsfreies Arbeitsumfeld ein, in dem Chancengleichheit gefördert und die Unterschiedlichkeit jedes Einzelnen respektiert und wertgeschätzt wird.


Show more

Du willst was bewegen, nicht nur begleiten? Dann gestalte mit uns die Business-Welt von morgen - mit über 2.500 realisierten

Projekten, für 1.200 Kund:innen weltweit, an 33 Standorten. Weniger Bla, mehr Wirkung. Willkommen bei HSO.

Als Junior Consultant (m/w/d) arbeitest du hands-on in unseren Projekten und treibst mit deinem Team echte Innovationen voran. Dabei wächst du nicht nur fachlich, sondern auch persönlich - mit individueller Förderung und abwechslungsreichen Aufgaben:

  • Zukunftsprojekte im Microsoft-Kosmos: Bei deinem Einstieg in die Beratung übernimmst du erste Verantwortung in IT-Projekten auf Basis von Microsoft Business Applikationen
  • Kundennähe auf Augenhöhe: Im direkten Kundenkontakt hörst du aktiv zu, um die Kundenbedürfnisse zu verstehen und hilfst dabei die beste Lösung zu finden sowie diese zu vermitteln
  • Workshops mit Impact: In Form von Workshops analysierst du Kundenprozesse & -anforderungen
  • IT-Lösungen: Du setzt die Anforderungen in innovative IT-Lösungen auf Basis von Microsoft Dynamics 365 (ERP) um - dabei kannst du dich immer auf die technische Unterstützung deiner Kolleg/innen verlassen
  • Stärkenbasiertes Matching: Während unserem Kennenlernen finden wir gemeinsam heraus, welcher Prozessbereich am besten für dich geeignet ist - Produktion | Handel | Finanzen | Dienstleistungen - deine Stärken und Interessen stehen dabei im Vordergrund


Requirements

  • Ein Studium in BWL, (Wirtschafts-)Informatik oder Wirtschaftsingenieurwesen bzw. eine vergleichbare Ausbildung
  • Du hast Interesse an oder verfügst bereits über Kenntnisse in betriebswirtschaftlichen Geschäftsprozessen/-abläufen
  • Erste Erfahrungen mit Software-Lösungen wie ERP/CRM sind von Vorteil
  • Du kannst dich für Microsoft-Technologien begeistern
  • Du zeichnest dich durch eine schnelle Auffassungsgabe, Kommunikationsstärke, Sozialkompetenz und einen eigenverantwortlichen Arbeitsstil aus
  • Du verfügst über sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse
  • Eine projektbezogene Reisebereitschaft setzen wir voraus


Benefits

  • Result Orientation: Du arbeitest bei einem der global größten und erfolgreichsten Microsoft-Partner im Bereich Microsoft Dynamics 365 und treibst damit die digitale Transformation voran
  • Self Determination: Bei uns steht die Kommunikation auf Augenhöhe im Mittelpunkt mit deinen Ideen und Erfahrungen kannst du dich bei uns einbringen, eigenständig agieren und damit den Unternehmenserfolg aktiv mitgestalten
  • Team Spirit: Da Menschen bei HSO den Unterschied machen, kannst du dich auf eine unterstützende, vertrauensvolle und wertschätzende Arbeitsatmosphäre freuen
  • Learning & Growth: Wir werden dich mit Trainingsangeboten durch unsere hauseigene HSO Academy und externe Schulungspartner in Kombination mit einem individuellen Karrierepfad fördern
  • Onboarding@HSO: Wir heißen dich in unserem Office in Böblingen willkommen - du startest deine ersten Onboarding-Tage bei uns vor Ort, um dich mit unserer Unternehmenskultur, unseren Prozessen und Tools vertraut zu machen
  • Hybrid Workforce: Ohne festgeschriebene Kernarbeitszeit hast du die Möglichkeit flexibel aus deinem Homeoffice, bei Kunden vor Ort oder in unseren Offices in Böblingen, München, Nürnberg oder Chemnitz zu arbeiten
  • Appreciation: Ein attraktives Gehaltsmodell inklusive 20 % Zuschuss zur betrieblichen Altersvorsorge, Mitarbeiterangebote, Bikeleasing, Gesundheitsförderung durch EGYM Wellpass, Geburtstagsgutscheine und außergewöhnliche Events runden dein HSO-FeelGood-Paket ab
  • Workation: Wir möchten unseren Mitarbeitenden mehr Flexibilität und Freiräume bieten, damit sie ihre Work-Life-Balance aktiv gestalten können. Daher hast du die Möglichkeit, bis zu 30 Tage im Jahr unter Einhaltung der rechtlichen Bedingungen aus der EU, dem EWR und der Schweiz zu arbeiten


HSO fördert aktiv Vielfalt und Inklusion. Wir begrüßen Bewerbungen von allen qualifizierten Personen - unabhängig von ethnischer Herkunft, Hautfarbe, Religion, Geschlecht, sexueller Orientierung, Geschlechtsidentität, nationaler Herkunft, Behinderung oder Alter. Wir setzen uns für ein diskriminierungsfreies Arbeitsumfeld ein, in dem Chancengleichheit gefördert und die Unterschiedlichkeit jedes Einzelnen respektiert und wertgeschätzt wird.

Title: IT Administrator (m/w/d)
Description:
IT Administrator (m/w/d) in Stuttgart

Du brennst für die Mobilität von morgen? Dann bist Du bei uns genau richtig!

Bei PROGNUM sind wir als etablierter Ingenieur- und Beratungsdienstleister darauf spezialisiert, in vielseitigen Automotive-Projekten neue Maßstäbe zu setzen. Wir arbeiten an den wegweisenden Technologien von morgen – sei es im autonomen Fahren, Elektromobilität, Connectivity, Infotainment oder darüber hinaus.

Sichere Dir die Pole-Position und starte mit uns durch!

Das erwartet Dich


Betreuung des First- und Second-Level-Supports für Hard- und Softwareanfragen
Installation, Einrichtung und Support von IT-Hardware sowie Druck- und Scansystemen
Administration, Überwachung und Weiterentwicklung der virtualisierten IT-Infrastruktur auf Basis von VMware
Konfiguration und Wartung von Windows- und Linux-Systemen (Client & Server)
Mitwirkung an Themen der IT-Security und Informationssicherheit
Abstimmung mit internen Fachbereichen und externen IT-Dienstleistern zur Sicherstellung des Systembetriebs
Dokumentation von Prozessen, Netzwerken und Systemkonfigurationen



Das bringst Du mit


Abgeschlossene Berufsausbildung oder abgeschlossenes Studium im Bereich Informatik
Mehrjährige Erfahrung in der Systemadministration, idealerweise mit VMware
Fundierte Kenntnisse in Windows- und Linux-Umgebungen sowie Netzwerktechnologien (z.B. Cisco)
Erfahrung im Anwendersupport sowie bei der Analyse von Hard- und Softwareproblemen
Selbstständige, strukturierte Arbeitsweise und ausgeprägte Serviceorientierung
Sehr gute Deutsch- sowie gute Englischkenntnisse



Was wir bieten


Attraktive Vergütung: Überdurchschnittliches Gehalt mit individuellen Zuschüssen und ausgezeichneter Entwicklung nach Tarifvertrag
High-End Kunden: Zusammenarbeit mit den angesagtesten Unternehmen der Automobilbranche
PROGNUM-Guide - Das Besondere: Bei PROGNUM lassen wir Sie nicht allein! Vom ersten Tag an begleitet Sie ein persönlicher PROGNUM-Guide vor Ort
Moderne Arbeitskultur: New Work ist für uns Normalität (z.B. Homeoffice)
PROGNUM-DNA: Familiär, offen und wertschätzend mit flachen Hierarchien sowie legendären Firmenevents u. After Work Partys
Spitzen Karriereperspektive: Möglichkeit zur individuellen Weiterentwicklung durch berufsspezifische Trainings
…und natürlich bieten wir die üblichen Standards wie 30 Tage Urlaub, BAV, Corporate Benefits uvm.



Bei PROGNUM kannst Du Dein ganzes Potenzial ausschöpfen und aktiv zum Unternehmenserfolg beitragen

Du möchtest wechseln? Das bleibt unter uns!

Falls Du dich in einem ungekündigten Arbeitsverhältnis befinden, sichern wir Dir natürlich höchste Vertraulichkeit Deiner Bewerbung zu

Bereit zum Durchstarten? Dann bewirb Dich jetzt. Wir freuen uns auf Dich!
Show more
