  • Join an ambitious and diverse team, and work with cutting-edge technology in the fastest-growing SAM software on the market.
  • An opportunity to shape your career growth while contributing to the company’s success.
  • Other location-specific benefits.


At Xensam, Our Core Values Define Our Culture

Rebellious: We encourage a spirit of freedom and initiative within responsibility.

Humane: We foster a caring, inclusive environment that values diversity and respects individuality.

Harmonious: We promote work-life balance, creating a pleasant, supportive workplace.


Join Xensam for a balanced, collaborative, and growth-focused work environment. If you're a team player ready to thrive, APPLY now!


As part of our recruitment process, we conduct background checks on final candidates to fulfill our commitments to customers and ensure a safe work environment.

Title: Business Systems Analyst, Learning Management
Description:
About Wolt

At Wolt, we create technology that brings joy, simplicity and earnings to the neighborhoods of the world. In 2014 we started with delivery of restaurant food. Now we’re building the delivery of (almost) everything and you’ll find us in over 500 cities in 30 countries around the world. In 2022 we joined forces with DoorDash and together we keep on dreaming big and expanding across the globe.

Working at Wolt isn’t always easy, but it’s definitely exciting. Here you’ll learn more, build more, and ship more than in most other companies. You’ll be challenged a lot, but also have a lot of fun on the way. So, if you’re a self-starter with drive and entrepreneurial spirit, this could be the ride of your life.

We are looking for a Business Systems Analyst, Learning Management who will help build and maintain our new LMS and L&D tech ecosystem in order to execute our learning strategy in a fast-paced environment. This role will drive continuous improvement opportunities in order to optimize & enhance agent learning programs, to ultimately ensure our global network of thousands of support agents are set up to successfully deliver on support experiences.

What you’ll be doing


Help oversee the Lead day-to-day operations and maintenance of the LMS (Cornerstone), including assigning and monitoring security permissions for LMS Administrators, and resolving trouble tickets. by collaborating with a team of learning and development professionals.
Collaborate with a team of passionate LMS Administrators who are focused on executing daily deployment, reporting, and user maintenance responsibilities.
Develop and maintain standardized documentation and SLAs on LMS operational processes and procedures to ensure a comprehensive LMS governance model.
Communicate to stakeholders the status and project progress of all work related to training content management.
Deliver functional and technical support for other LMS users and content creators. Utilize data to make informed recommendations on enhancements, while also providing analysis and reporting to stakeholders on learner performance and training effectiveness.
Perform user-acceptance testing within LMS when new programs are developed. Create job aids and other support documents to support launch of new programs..
Make recommendations for future improvements to content management, workflow processes, and user experience.


Our humble expectations


You are passionate about learning software and administration
You have 4+ years experience in Cornerstone LMS administration that includes creating learning paths, certifications and badging programs, ideally with multiple LMS systems
You have 3+ years experience leading highly creative learning teams
You are collaborative and know how to develop strong productive relationships both internally and with our external partners
You know how to present complex information in a clear and concise manner with strong written, verbal, and visual communication skills
You are highly analytical and data driven in your decision making process. You are comfortable pulling data from various sources, reading and analyzing data, doing analysis in excel or google sheets, and partnering with analytics partners for more complex analyses
You are comfortable in a fast-paced, constantly changing team-oriented environment and able to manage multiple deadlines simultaneously with strong project management skills
You have an owner mentality: you're focused on quality, output driven, proactive, and always pushing yourself to do better
You can think strategically and recommend solutions to complex problems while also executing many projects and priorities day-to-day
Experience working with Salesforce, Asana, Lessonly, Articulate, Tableau
You question the why behind your objectives, and surface areas of strategic misalignment
You own a project / within your team; you set strategy and build an execution plan to achieve your objective with minimal oversight / guidance from your Manager
You find the right balance of data and common sense to problem solve, and think creatively when we have incomplete information


Next steps

If you are excited about working in a high-growth environment, taking ownership, and being part of an extremely ambitious team, then click below to apply and get the conversation going!

We will be reviewing applications on an ongoing basis, so if this sounds like an opportunity you want to pursue, apply today!

Please note that we do not accept applications coming in via email. Please submit your application in English via our job portal.

Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

We’re committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That’s why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.

Title: Business Intelligence Internship (Unpaid)- Start hösten 2025
Description:
Vill du vara med och forma framtidens datadrivna beslutsstöd?

Till innovativa insurtechbolaget Allina, söker vi nu en nyfiken och teknikintresserad intern som vill bidra till utvecklingen av deras moderna BI-plattform i Microsoft Azure och Power BI. Har du ett brinnande intresse för dataanalys och vill lära dig hur man bygger skalbara och smarta analyslösningar i praktiken? Då är det här internshipet för dig – med start hösten 2025!

Om Allina Försäkringar

Allina är ett svenskt insurtechbolag i stark tillväxt. Vi bygger digitala försäkringslösningar som skapar kundvärde och affärsnytta för våra partners där försäkringen integreras sömlöst i deras befintliga ekosystem.

Vårt team består av branschexperter med djup kunskap inom både försäkring och marknadsföring. Vi stöttar våra partners med den kunskap och expertis de behöver för att lyckas. Vi tror starkt på värdet i att skapa försäkringslösningar under varje företags eget varumärke. Men vi tror också att varje företag har ett ansvar att bidra till en tryggare och mer hållbar framtid för kommande generationer. På Allina samarbetar vi med våra partners för att skapa just det.

🔍 Vad får du göra?

Som BI Intern ansvarar du för att underhålla, förbättra och vidareutveckla vår befintliga business intelligence-plattform. Den används både internt och av våra partners och är en viktig del i vår digitala tjänsteleverans. Ditt arbete kommer bland annat att innebära att:


Underhålla och vidareutveckla vår BI-plattform byggd i Microsoft Azure och Power BI
Skapa och optimera dashboards och rapporter för olika interna och externa användningsområden
Arbeta med datamodellering, integrationer och datakvalitet i Azure-miljö
Bygga nya skalbara strukturer som gör vår plattform framtidssäkrad och enkel att vidareutveckla
Vara en nyckelperson i att skapa datadrivna insikter både för oss och våra partners



Vi söker dig som har


Kunskap och erfarenhet inom Microsoft Azure och Power BI
God förståelse för datamodellering, pipelines och plattformsarkitektur
Förmåga att arbeta självständigt och proaktivt inom dataanalys och plattformsutveckling
Erfarenhet av att utveckla skalbara lösningar och förståelse för hur man bygger för tillväxt
En pågående eller nyligen avslutad utbildning inom t.ex. datavetenskap, systemvetenskap, statistik eller motsvarande
God kommunikativ förmåga på svenska och engelska, i både tal och skrift



Vad vi erbjuder


Ett spännande och tekniskt utvecklande internship i ett snabbväxande insurtechbolag
Möjligheten att bygga BI-lösningar på riktigt – som påverkar både våra interna team och våra externa kunder
Flexibilitet i arbetstid och delvis distansarbete
Ett engagerat och nytänkande team där din kompetens värdesätts
Placering på vårt kontor i centrala Stockholm



Frågor och kontakt

I denna process samarbetar Allina Försäkringar med Amendo Tech. Vid frågor om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta Kiara Bergqvist på kiara.bergqvist@amendotech.se. Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!

Om Amendo Tech

Amendo Tech är det självklara konsult- och rekryteringsföretaget inom tech, IT och digital utveckling.

Amendo Tech är en del av Amendo Group som har arbetat med kompetensförsörjning sedan 2001. I koncernen ingår även Lagotto Executive Search & Interim som är specialiserade på executive search och interima tillsättningar av ledare och specialister, samt Amendo Bemanning och Rekrytering som erbjuder rekryterings- och konsultlösningar inom ekonomi, bank, finans, försäkring, HR och kommunikation.

Följ gärna Amendo Tech på Linkedin.

Title: Business Systems Analyst, Workforce Management
Description:
About Wolt

At Wolt, we create technology that brings joy, simplicity and earnings to the neighborhoods of the world. In 2014 we started with delivery of restaurant food. Now we’re building the delivery of (almost) everything and you’ll find us in over 500 cities in 30 countries around the world. In 2022 we joined forces with DoorDash and together we keep on dreaming big and expanding across the globe.

Working at Wolt isn’t always easy, but it’s definitely exciting. Here you’ll learn more, build more, and ship more than in most other companies. You’ll be challenged a lot, but also have a lot of fun on the way. So, if you’re a self-starter with drive and entrepreneurial spirit, this could be the ride of your life.

At Wolt, people are our most important asset. The People Technology Team helps to deliver and facilitate strategic technology projects within the People Team. This role will be focused on supporting our People Technology function as we continue to optimize the advancement of our organization. We’re looking for business system analysts to help us scale Wolt + DoorDash’s enormous growth. Come help shape a best in class People Technology team!

About The Role

We are looking for a Business System Analyst with demonstrated HRIS experience to assist with strategic initiatives across our organization. Experience with Workday HCM is preferable for this role. You will work cross-functionally to achieve business goals through system configuration, testing and documentation. As a Business System Analyst you will help deliver solutions to support business strategy, and assist in the implementation, maintenance and enhancement of people technology systems.

Please note that this position is initially open through a 12-month contract.

What you’ll be doing


Play an integral role in the configuration, testing, support, and success of People Technology at DoorDash/Wolt as we grow our existing businesses and enter new verticals, and additional countries
Work to uncover underlying issues or business problems and turn those issues into solutions
Identify, prioritize, and implement best practices from a solutions perspective based on gathered requirements
Support system troubleshooting, configuration, testing, and deployment of assigned applications to meet requirements, timelines, and execution standards
Support high-volume data loads via Enterprise Interface Builder (EIB) templates
Provide global production analysis and support (break/fix analysis, reporting, business process administration, etc.)
Work closely with cross-functional teams to ascertain and maintain the best possible configuration solution
Rigorously document system requirements and configuration to build operational excellence
Ensure data integrity by understanding and identifying opportunities to improve, working closely with cross-functional teams
Train end-users and peers on new processes and functionality as needed


Our humble expectations


You have 1+ years of work experience in Workday maintenance/configuration, both domestic and international.
You are passionate about system optimization and employee experience
You are a strong business thinker, able to use ‘first principles’ to solve challenging business problems at their root level
You are data-driven, able to analyze data with strong attention to detail and accuracy, and passionate about telling the story behind the data hence turning the data into configuration
You are a self-motivated, rapid learner, excited about further developing your analytical and problem-solving skills
You are results-oriented, always evaluating whether our team's activities are achieving the desired, measurable impact
You are an owner, always looking for opportunities to learn and better your work product
You are comfortable and thrive in a fast-paced, continually changing team-oriented environment and able to manage multiple deadlines simultaneously.
You have a BA/BS degree in quantitative or business fields, or equivalent work experience
You have an analytical mindset and a “People First” mentality with demonstrated ability to work through complex, ambiguous problems using data and creating configuration solutions based on that data
You have strong written/verbal communication


Next steps

If you are excited about working in a high-growth environment, taking ownership, and being part of an extremely ambitious team, then click below to apply and get the conversation going!

We will be reviewing applications on an ongoing basis, so if this sounds like an opportunity you want to pursue, apply today!

Please note that we do not accept applications coming in via email. Please submit your application in English via our job portal.

Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

We’re committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That’s why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
The world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service is looking for a Data Engineer to join the band in a consultant assignment. The client has transformed music listening forever when launched in 2008.




Period: 2025-08-18 to 2025-12-31 (full-time), with a possibility of extension.




About the role

We are looking for an experienced Data Engineer that will join the client's Data Processing product area, in LilEngine squad, to help the team increase productivity, optionality and flexibility for data practitioners through scalable, portable and reliable data processing platforms, all while maintaining our global cloud cost efficiency. You’ll collaborate with product and engineering to build and support the infrastructure that empowers the teams to process data to solve critical business needs. Above all, your work will impact the way the world experiences music.




What you'll do

Increase developer productivity by building innovative tools that reduce overhead of working with data pipelines, help increase platform reliability, and are cost-efficient.
Help scale the new platform to reach targets that ensure the painless and seamless migration of data pipelines from all across the company to the new stack.
Work with engineers with deep expertise in data and collaborate closely with squads in the company to drive improvements in the data processing ecosystem through support, best-practices and standards.




Who you are

You are an experienced Data Engineer, also proficient in backend development using Java.
You are comfortable working with big data using SQL and data analytics platforms such as BigQuery.
You have experience with one or more higher-level JVM-based data processing frameworks such as Flink, Beam, Dataflow, Spark, etc.
Devops is part of your day-to-day work and you are used to working with cloud-based infrastructure and services, containerised applications.
You have some experience working with Kubernetes and are familiar with its basic concepts.
You have experience of working with data engineering pipelines in Scala and/or Python.
Quality is important to you and you know what it means to ship high-quality code.
You appreciate agile software processes, and sound engineering practices like continuous delivery, defensive programming, and automated testing.
You love working in an environment where you constantly experiment and iterate quickly.
You are comfortable with ambiguity, enjoy working on open ended problems, and believe data is the most powerful tool for informed decision-making.




We are Market Partner

Market Partner is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. You are welcome to our community regardless of who you are, no matter where you come from, or what you look like. We apply ongoing selection and may fill the position as soon as we find the right candidate.

Show more

Title: Analytics Engineer
Description:
Nordnet is a leading pan-Nordic digital platform, bringing the joy of savings and investments to our customers. Our ambition is to inspire, encourage and enable everyone to take their savings to the next level, no matter who they are.

We believe that data is a cornerstone for our future success, and we're building the next generation of banking on Google Cloud Platform (GCP), with our analytics platform having moved to GCP in 2020.

Now we're looking for a passionate Analytics Engineer to be the bridge between business and data technology. At Nordnet, we strive to be data pioneers, devoted to harnessing the potential of data and AI. If you want to transform raw information into clear, meaningful data products that impact how we grow, innovate, and enhance our services, this could be your perfect fit.

We would love it if you feel excited about at least some of these statements:


Designing and building elegant data structures in BigQuery.
Ensuring data is accurate and reliable.
Empowering others by making data models and dashboards accessible and understandable for everyone.
Collaborating with diverse teams, bringing their data needs to life through your expertise.


This is you

You're passionate about data and learning new things, and you are a problem solver who wants to contribute with your experience and ideas. In your work, you are organised, methodical and agile in a way that benefits the team environment and ability to deliver solutions.

To thrive in this role, we believe that most of these criteria describe you:


Have several years of experience as an Analytics Engineer/Business Intelligence Developer/Data Engineer.
Skilled in designing and building data warehouses and analytics platforms
Apply software engineering best practices like code reviews to ensure our work is of high quality.
A clear communicator who can simplify complex concepts with ease.
Exhibit deep SQL knowledge and experience with dbt.
Looker (or similar) knowledge for creating inspiring dashboards.


What We Offer

You would be a part of the Data & Insights department, consisting of smart and skilled Analytics Engineers, Data Engineers, Data Scientists and Data Analysts. Here, you'll not only learn and grow but also contribute with your unique perspective to our success.

We provide our team with a modern tech stack and actively explore the future of data, experimenting with AI to improve how we consume and create data products. You will enjoy the flexibility of hybrid working and a competitive salary and compensation package.

At Nordnet, data is a fundamental part of how we make decisions and innovate. If you're eager to make a difference and work with exciting technology in a supportive and empowering environment, we warmly encourage you to apply!

You are welcome to apply today, but the interviews will start in August.

Application

If you have questions, please contact Alva Hellberg, Talent Acquisition Partner, at alva.hellberg@nordnet.se.

Apply today– we will start interviewing in late August after summer vacations. Please note that we do only accept applications through our recruitment system, hence no email applications will be considered.

We want to inform you that Nordnet conducts mandatory credit and background checks, as well as drug testing as a part of our recruitment process.

We look forward to receiving your application!
Show more

Title: Junior Data Scientist
Description:
At Vattenfall, we don’t just “do energy”, we exist to help our customers power their lives in ever climate smarter ways and enable a fossil free future. If you are looking for interesting challenges and the opportunity to be part of this change, then join our diverse and talented team and make a difference!

At Business Area Markets, business decisions are made around the clock with high frequency, creating vast potential for intelligent automation.

As our new Data Scientist in the Data Science team, you will join a collaborative and skilled team that drives automation of real business cases through data-driven and Machine Learning-based intelligence. We work in a Scrum setup and have in the past years been very successful in forecasting both electricity prices and electricity consumption. Your work will have direct and measurable impact!

We offer a strong work-life balance in an organisation known for its deep competence in math, tech, and business - where innovation and improvements often stem from our specialists and business experts

What You Will Do

Join a team where your models don’t just sit in notebooks - They power real-time decisions in the energy markets.


Machine Learning: Build and operate machine learning models that forecast prices, optimize trading strategies, and drive smarter decisions in volatile energy markets.
Automation: Enable intelligent automation of trading and asset optimization by embedding ML into operational systems.
Analytics: Combine business understanding with analytical and technical skills to understand and solve real-world challenges.
Collaboration: Work closely with team members, stakeholders and domain experts to ensure models are aligned with business needs and continuously improved.
Data & Infrastructure: Ensure data is ML-ready and leverage tools like Databricks, Kafka, and Azure ML to support robust model operation.


Företagsbeskrivning

Vattenfall is a European energy company with approximately 21 000 employees. For more than 100 years we have electrified industries, supplied energy to people’s homes and modernized our way of living through innovation and cooperation. We now want to enable the fossil freedom that drives society forward. To be able to reach this ambitious goal we are looking for talented individuals who, in addition to passion for their own role, also have strong team spirit and want to contribute to supporting a meaningful corporate mission. 

Within Vattenfall, Business Area (BA) Markets optimizes assets and effectively sources and trades commodities, thus ensuring best value for both Vattenfall and our customers. BA Markets is active across Europe with around 450 professionals working from Sweden, Germany, the Netherlands, and the UK.

In BA Markets the mission of the Unit OU Operations is to drive the digital transformation. OU Operations consists of diverse and highly skilled employees from more than 20 countries. We work internationally from our locations in Stockholm, Hamburg, and Amsterdam.

Kvalifikationer

What We Are Looking For

We are after a curious mind who wants to make an impact – Someone who is excited to build end-to-end data science solutions that truly make a difference.


A strong interest in learning about the energy markets and how Machine Learning can be used solve the real-world problems we face.
Strong communication skills and a collaborative spirit.
Python expertise paired with an interest in attaining a software-developer-mindset where you care about good code and stable operation of models.
Experience building Machine Learning models - ideally forecasting of time series.
Experience, or eager to learn how to bring Machine Learning Models into real world production.
An academic degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or similar.
Fluency in English; Swedish is a bonus.


Ytterligare information

We Offer


A welcoming work climate with flat hierarchies, appreciation for own initiative, open discussion culture and zero-tolerance for harassment.
An International and multi-cultural work environment with energetic colleagues
Being part of the wider Analysis community, where we eagerly share knowledge and ideas regarding a wide range analytical topics relevant to the energy market
Opportunities and support for professional growth. For example, the encouragement to do internal rotations to other teams and to visit conferences and trainings
Flexible working hours, an annual 72 hours reduction of working time and free access to gym and training classes in our Stockholm office and top that off, with the opportunity to work 50% from home. 


At Vattenfall we are convinced that striving for diversity helps to build a more profitable, efficient, and attractive company. Therefore we seek a harmonious balance of employees in terms of age, religion, gender identity & expression, sexual identity, disability and ethnic background. Read more on how we work with diversity and inclusion here: https://careers.vattenfall.com/about-us/diversity-and-inclusion/

Location: Stockholm/Solna

For more information about the position you are welcome to contact recruiting manager Erik Svensson, erik.svensson@vattenfall.com For more information about the recruitment process you are welcome to contact recruiter Peter Blixter, +46 722 37 32 02.

Trade union representatives Trade union representatives: Simon Salomonsson (Unionen) and Sven Gunnar Gremlin (Akademikerna). To get in contact with the representatives, please call Vattenfall switchboard +46 8 739 50 00.

We welcome your application no later than 8 September 2025, including CV along with a short motivation (max 100 words) explaining why you are interested in this position.

Since Vattenfall is part of the Swedish critical infrastructure many of our positions are security classed. If this position is security classed the final candidates can be subject to a security vetting process, according to the Swedish legislation.

We look forward to receiving your application!
Show more

Title: Head of Data & Analytics
Description:
We are super excited to announce that our CIO Magnus Ahlberg is now looking for our next Head of Data & Analytics. In this role, you will have the overall responsibility in taking our Data strategy to the next level together with a team of 3 (soon to be 4) great stars.

Our Data & Analytics function is small but growing – currently consisting of one BI Developer, one BI Architect and one Data Analyst. The fundamentals are in place, including tools like Databricks, Tableau, and Power BI. But we’re now entering a new phase where we need stronger alignment, clearer ways of working and a more strategic approach to how data supports product, commercial, and customer success.

There’s an opportunity here to unify and elevate how we work with data across the company – bringing together different approaches under one vision, while continuing to deliver insights that drive real impact.

What You’ll Do


Lead, evolve, and operationalize Voyado’s data & analytics strategy
Be a strategic partner to Product, Tech, and Commercial teams – turning business goals into actionable insights
Own the full data lifecycle: data modeling, collection, architecture, visualization, and storytelling
Guide and coach your team (currently 1 BI Dev, 1 Analyst, 1 BI Arch, 1 Data Engineer Vacancy) and scale it thoughtfully
Drive forward-thinking initiatives like AI-powered insights, customer behavior modeling, and predictive analytics
Push for modern tools and better ways of working across teams – together with Engineering and CIO org
Champion a culture of data literacy and empower non-technical teams with data access and education
Ensure data quality, governance, and compliance as we scale


Who You Are

You’re a hands-on leader with a proven track record of building and scaling data and analytics teams. You thrive in fast-paced, product led environments and are equally comfortable diving deep into technical challenges as you are presenting to stakeholders. With experience from SaaS, Martech, or similar tech-driven companies, you bring a solid understanding of how data drives growth, efficiency, and smarter decisions.

You’re fluent in modern data platforms and tools – at Voyado we use Databricks, Tableau, and Power BI – and you know how to leverage them for real business value. Most importantly, you lead with clarity and curiosity. You know how to bring people along, create momentum and build trust across functions.

If you also bring experience from retail or e-commerce analytics, have worked with ML/AI initiatives, or have insight into scaling data operations in high-growth companies, that’s a big plus but not a requirement.

What's in it for you?

Voyado wouldn’t be the powerful platform it is without the people behind it. We really care for our Voyadoers and some examples of what we can offer you are:


An engaged team with a knowledge-sharing and friendly culture
Summits where we hang out, workshop, discuss, and have a good time together
Opportunities for personal and professional growth and learning in a dynamic and supportive environment.
Work-life balance – we don't have a long work-hours culture, we value engagement over hours worked.
An office-first but flexible hybrid working policy.


Some of our benefits:


30 days of vacation, so you can spend time on the things you love
Beneficial bike lease, including e-bikes
Breakfast buffet on Fridays
Inhouse gym only for Voyadoers
A generous gadget-and-phone package (your choice!)
5000 SEK per year in wellness allowance
A wellness hour you can use every week


About Voyado

Voyado is the ultimate solution for personalization and relevance across all channels—online and offline. Used by retailers and e-commerce companies worldwide, Voyado makes it possible for every brand to engage customers, elevate shopping experiences, and evolve their own businesses.

We are now a company of 300+ colleagues on an exciting journey and have recently established a presence in new markets to strengthen our position in Europe. If you are ready for your next adventure and want to join our team on our expansion throughout Europe and have an interest in customer care, e-commerce, retail, and tech - let's get in touch!

Be yourself 🏳️‍🌈

At Voyado, we believe in gender equality. We are proud sponsors of Womengineer as well as Tjejer Kodar! Read more about Tjejer Kodar & Voyado here



Equality is not only about gender but also about making everyone feel welcome and heard in a multicultural and diverse environment. We at Voyado strive to make everyone feel like they can bring their true self to work every day. Gender-equal and diverse teams have more perspectives on life and bring different ideas to the table which in the end leads not only to making a better working environment but also a better product.

Ready to find out more?

Lovely! 🎉

Before one applies it can always feel like you need a better resume, more polish, or just another year of experience, but we say if you think this sounds like a place where you can shine don't hesitate to send in your resume!

We'd love to get to know you and understand what makes you tick, so write a few lines about what you enjoy about your current role and what would be an exciting challenge for you in the future. We are eager to get to know you and what you love to do, so be yourself and let your passion shine through in your application!

Note: As of right now we are unable to proceed with applicants outside of the EU, and a requirement of eligibility to work at Voyado is the right to work in the EU without limitations. Needless to say, this is something we are actively working on to be able to onboard colleagues from all over the world.

Voyado is the customer experience platform made for retail. We help brands turn every interaction—from first click to repeat purchase—into lasting loyalty.

With AI-powered tools for search, personalization, marketing, and loyalty, we make it easy for retailers to grow and connect with customers in smarter ways.

Loved by 400+ brands, Voyado is on a mission to become Europe’s most beloved retail companion.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
We are excited to welcome our next Data Engineer to our Internal Data & Analytics team where your colleagues will be: Ilaf, Jesper, Patrik, Magnus and our next Head of Data & Analytics. If you’re a curious and proactive person who enjoy taking iniatives, connect data and business needs then this might be just the role for you.

This is a great opportunity for someone with a few years of experience who wants to grow their technical and strategic skills in a role where data is starting to play a bigger role in company-wide decision-making.

What You’ll Do

At Voyado, internal BI is still in an exciting building phase. You’ll help us shape how data is structured, accessed, and used- working both hands-on with data pipelines and collaboratively with stakeholders across the business.

Your day-to-day will include:


Designing and maintaining BI solutions in SQL, helping teams make smarter decisions
Working closely with the business to gather requirements, understand use cases, and define the right datasets
Supporting the transition to self-service reporting by enabling teams with scalable, trusted data models
Creating integrations and handling data flows from source systems to dashboards (ETL/ELT)
Being involved from data extraction all the way to naming and structuring the datasets- you won’t be handed pre-packaged solutions
Taking ownership of smaller BI projects and collaborating in our quarterly BI forum where business needs are prioritized


Who You Are

We believe you have around 2–3 years of experience in a data-related role and are now ready for more ownership and broader influence. You have a problem-solving mindset, enjoy figuring things out, and feel confident working independently.

You might describe yourself as someone who:


Likes to initiate, ask questions, and explore what’s possible, not just execute defined tasks
Enjoys working across teams and building relationships with stakeholders from different parts of the organization
Can translate business needs into structured data and define what a good dataset should look like
Thrives when things aren’t fully set yet. you like being part of building and improving processes
Is comfortable working with SQL, Azure, Git, Power BI, and open to learning more (Databricks and Python are nice-to-haves)


What's in it for you?

Voyado wouldn’t be the powerful platform it is without the people behind it. We really care for our Voyadoers and some examples of what we can offer you are:


An engaged team with a knowledge-sharing and friendly culture
Summits where we hang out, workshop, discuss, and have a good time together
Opportunities for personal and professional growth and learning in a dynamic and supportive environment.
Work-life balance – we don't have a long work-hours culture, we value engagement over hours worked.
An office-first but flexible hybrid working policy.


Some of our benefits:


30 days of vacation, so you can spend time on the things you love
Beneficial bike lease, including e-bikes
Breakfast buffet on Fridays
Inhouse gym only for Voyadoers
A generous gadget-and-phone package (your choice!)
5000 SEK per year in wellness allowance
A wellness hour you can use every week


About Voyado

Voyado is the ultimate solution for personalization and relevance across all channels—online and offline. Used by retailers and e-commerce companies worldwide, Voyado makes it possible for every brand to engage customers, elevate shopping experiences, and evolve their own businesses.

We are now a company of 300+ colleagues on an exciting journey and have recently established a presence in new markets to strengthen our position in Europe. HTML:
We are excited to welcome our next Data Engineer to our Internal Data & Analytics team where your colleagues will be: Ilaf, Jesper, Patrik, Magnus and our next Head of Data & Analytics. If you’re a curious and proactive person who enjoy taking iniatives, connect data and business needs then this might be just the role for you.

This is a great opportunity for someone with a few years of experience who wants to grow their technical and strategic skills in a role where data is starting to play a bigger role in company-wide decision-making.

What You’ll Do

At Voyado, internal BI is still in an exciting building phase. You’ll help us shape how data is structured, accessed, and used- working both hands-on with data pipelines and collaboratively with stakeholders across the business.

Your day-to-day will include:

  • Designing and maintaining BI solutions in SQL, helping teams make smarter decisions
  • Working closely with the business to gather requirements, understand use cases, and define the right datasets
  • Supporting the transition to self-service reporting by enabling teams with scalable, trusted data models
  • Creating integrations and handling data flows from source systems to dashboards (ETL/ELT)
  • Being involved from data extraction all the way to naming and structuring the datasets- you won’t be handed pre-packaged solutions
  • Taking ownership of smaller BI projects and collaborating in our quarterly BI forum where business needs are prioritized

Who You Are

We believe you have around 2–3 years of experience in a data-related role and are now ready for more ownership and broader influence. You have a problem-solving mindset, enjoy figuring things out, and feel confident working independently.

You might describe yourself as someone who:

  • Likes to initiate, ask questions, and explore what’s possible, not just execute defined tasks
  • Enjoys working across teams and building relationships with stakeholders from different parts of the organization
  • Can translate business needs into structured data and define what a good dataset should look like
  • Thrives when things aren’t fully set yet. you like being part of building and improving processes
  • Is comfortable working with SQL, Azure, Git, Power BI, and open to learning more (Databricks and Python are nice-to-haves)

What's in it for you?

Voyado wouldn’t be the powerful platform it is without the people behind it. We really care for our Voyadoers and some examples of what we can offer you are:

  • An engaged team with a knowledge-sharing and friendly culture
  • Summits where we hang out, workshop, discuss, and have a good time together
  • Opportunities for personal and professional growth and learning in a dynamic and supportive environment.
  • Work-life balance – we don't have a long work-hours culture, we value engagement over hours worked.
  • An office-first but flexible hybrid working policy.

Some of our benefits:

  • 30 days of vacation, so you can spend time on the things you love
  • Beneficial bike lease, including e-bikes
  • Breakfast buffet on Fridays
  • Inhouse gym only for Voyadoers
  • A generous gadget-and-phone package (your choice!)
  • 5000 SEK per year in wellness allowance
  • A wellness hour you can use every week

About Voyado

Voyado is the ultimate solution for personalization and relevance across all channels—online and offline. Used by retailers and e-commerce companies worldwide, Voyado makes it possible for every brand to engage customers, elevate shopping experiences, and evolve their own businesses.

We are now a company of 300+ colleagues on an exciting journey and have recently established a presence in new markets to strengthen our position in Europe. If you are ready for your next adventure and want to join our team on our expansion throughout Europe and have an interest in customer care, e-commerce, retail, and tech - let's get in touch!

Be yourself 🏳️‍🌈

At Voyado, we believe in gender equality. We are proud sponsors of Womengineer as well as Tjejer Kodar! Read more about Tjejer Kodar & Voyado here



Equality is not only about gender but also about making everyone feel welcome and heard in a multicultural and diverse environment. We at Voyado strive to make everyone feel like they can bring their true self to work every day. Gender-equal and diverse teams have more perspectives on life and bring different ideas to the table which in the end leads not only to making a better working environment but also a better product.

Ready to find out more?

Lovely! 🎉

Before one applies it can always feel like you need a better resume, more polish, or just another year of experience, but we say if you think this sounds like a place where you can shine don't hesitate to send in your resume!

We'd love to get to know you and understand what makes you tick, so write a few lines about what you enjoy about your current role and what would be an exciting challenge for you in the future. We are eager to get to know you and what you love to do, so be yourself and let your passion shine through in your application!

Note: As of right now we are unable to proceed with applicants outside of the EU, and a requirement of eligibility to work at Voyado is the right to work in the EU without limitations. Needless to say, this is something we are actively working on to be able to onboard colleagues from all over the world.

Voyado is the customer experience platform made for retail. We help brands turn every interaction—from first click to repeat purchase—into lasting loyalty.

With AI-powered tools for search, personalization, marketing, and loyalty, we make it easy for retailers to grow and connect with customers in smarter ways.

Loved by 400+ brands, Voyado is on a mission to become Europe’s most beloved retail companion.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Sibling is seeking a Senior AI Platform/Data Engineer for a 12-month freelance assignment in Stockholm. You’ll work on designing, building, and maintaining hybrid data platforms that power advanced ML and AI initiatives. The role spans on-prem and cloud environments, collaborating closely with Data Scientists and ML Engineers to deliver scalable, production-ready solutions.




Key focus areas include building efficient data and ML pipelines (dbt, Prefect, Spark), operationalizing models, applying DevOps and MLOps practices, and enhancing CI/CD capabilities. You’ll work in a Linux/SRE environment with containerized development, Python/SQL coding, and infrastructure-as-code tools (Terraform, Ansible).




We’re looking for someone with 7+ years in Data, DevOps, or ML Engineering, strong system design skills, and proven experience deploying ML models to production.




Location: Stockholm (onsite) | Duration: 12 months | Start: ASAP

Title: Data Analyst - User Identity
Description:
Schibsted Media is at a pivotal point in our strategy. After splitting the company in two parts - Marketplaces (now Vend) and Media - we are embarking with a new way of working ing developing top of the line Media products that more than 6M people love every day.

Data is at the heart of building products people love - and we are also changing how we work with data. We are building a modern data foundation that supports smarter personalization, user engagement, and monetization across our media brands.

We are now looking for a Data Analyst to join our User Data team in Stockholm.

What will you do in this role?

In this role, you will work embedded with our user identity product team which is responsible for our cookie consent, login and identity solutions - alla critical in Schibsted's data collection

You will:


Turn raw events into clarity - Model and analyze login funnels, MFA drop-offs, password-reset loops, and consent acceptance rates
Own the metrics - Define and maintain source-of-truth dashboards for login success, speed, satisfaction, and op-in health
Spot friction fast - Proactively surface anomalies (e.g. spikes in 2FA failures) and partner with engineering to test fixes or new flows
Drive experimentation - Design A/B tests on copy, CTA placement, or step order; measure impact on conversion, engagement and retention
Champion data literacy - Enable self-serve analytics for product and editorial stakeholders; coach teams on reading dashboards and setting KPIs
Keep us compliant - Work with Privacy, Legal, and Data Gocernance to make sure consent metrics reflect GDPR and local regulations


,

Who you are:

You enjoy analysing data and always link insights to an outcome. To you, data is not just rows and columns, but actually journeys and drivers. You are energized by seeing a 0.5-second faster login or a 3 pp rise in consent opt-ins—and you will chase the next win together with your team.

You are curious and collaborative, eager to understand root causes and explore them with your PM, engineer and UX-designer to continuously improve our products.

What we are looking for:

You have experience as a product owner, analyst, or data-savvy project manager, and you know what it takes to develop great data products in complex organizations.


2-4 years of experience in data analytics, product analytics, or growth analytics for consumer-facing digital products
Advanced SQL skills and comfort exploring millions of events in Snowflake (or similar cloud DWH)
Fluency in Tableau, Amplitude, or equivalent BI tools. You can craft intuituve dashboards and narrate the "so what"
Working knowledge of experiment design and statistical evaluation
Curiosity about authentication stacks (SSO, OAuth/OIDC, MFA) and a basic grasp of GDPR/Consent frameworks
You are a clear communicator who can switch from SQL to storytelling and make data feel human
Bonus points for experience with Python, R, DBT or Airflow


Why we enjoy working here:

At Schibsted, we value openness, curiosity, and collaboration. You will be part of a diverse, inclusive workplace that encourages bold thinking and continuous learning. Our work directly supports public interest journalism—and we take that responsibility seriously.

Whether you are enabling better content decisions, driving user personalization, or shaping experimentation at scale, your contributions will help shape the future of digital media in the Nordics.

You will be joining a collaborative, impact-driven team that works across disciplines like technology, product, and editorial. We believe in structured yet flexible ways of working, balancing clear ownership with strong teamwork. Curiosity, openness, and a drive to create value through data are at the heart of how we operate. We support each other, celebrate continuous learning, and are passionate about turning complex challenges into meaningful solutions for our users and brands.

Application process:

Please apply for this position by sharing your CV with us and a letter of motivation. English is our corporate language, but you are welcome to write it in Swedish or Norwegian. Selection of candidates takes place on an ongoing basis during the process.

Title: Decision Analyst
Description:
About The Role

As a Decision Analyst at Instabee, you’ll play a key role in helping us make smarter, faster decisions across the business. You’ll partner with teams across the company from product, operations, to tech and beyond - to understand challenges, gather insights, and co-create solutions. Whether it’s structuring an ambiguous problem, evaluating new data sources, or communicating a compelling recommendation, you’ll bring clarity and impact. This role is perfect for someone who loves solving problems, is comfortable navigating complexity, and sees data as a powerful tool, not an end in itself.

Some of the things you’ll do


Tackle complex and ambiguous problems by bringing structure and taking clear, decisive action
Translate complex data and information into concise, actionable insights using both qualitative and quantitative methods
Collaborate across diverse teams to co-create smart solutions and drive real change
Communicate insights clearly and confidently to stakeholders at all levels, from junior teams to senior leadership
Continuously explore and integrate new internal and external data sources to strengthen our decision-making foundation
Analyze data from multiple sources to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities
Partner with teams to understand business challenges and build tailored tools or frameworks that improve how we work
Act as a go-to person for analytical support—sharing knowledge, guiding ad-hoc analysis, and elevating decision quality across the company


Your future team

You’ll join a tight-knit, cross-functional team working on Instabee’s most critical challenges. We collaborate across departments, drive clarity in ambiguity, and value real-world impact over theoretical perfection. Curiosity, humility, and a strong drive to make things better are what bring us together.

What We’re Looking For


Bachelor’s degree within engineering, information technology, finance, economics or other relevant field
Experience presenting solutions to senior management (for example management consulting or strategy consulting)
Experience working within a data heavy environment for at least 2 years
Experience working with solving business problems and improving ways of working
Experience working with data processing tools including Front End visualization tools (e.g. Tableau, PowerBI, PowerPoint, Google Slides) and generic tools (e.g. SQL, Python, Excel/Google Sheets)
Experience working in different departments (e.g. tech, product, and non-tech departments)


The cherry on top


You bring a strong blend of business and data understanding—and know how to connect the two
You’re curious, always learning, and stay on top of evolving best practices
You care about creating real-world results and know when “good enough” is enough
You’re confident challenging the status quo and backing it up with structured thinking
You communicate clearly and effectively in English—even when things get complex


If this is you, then we can’t wait to meet you!

What You’ll Get

We can promise you that you will be challenged, develop your skills and have the opportunity to work with truly amazing and competent colleagues. If you like change and want to set new processes and ways of working—this is the place for you!

Of course, we have all the necessary and standard benefits in place, but in addition to this, we also offer:

🌇 Sky-High Office: Modern and newly renovated with a 360-degree view around Stockholm

🐶 Puppy Friendly: Bring your dog to work—we’ve got a whole floor for our furry friends!

🏓 Fun & Games: Ping pong, shuffleboard, foosball—even a karaoke room!

👶 Parental Pay: Paid leave for six months to spend time with your little one

🎂 Birthday Day Off: Celebrate your birthday with a well-earned break

⏰ Flexible Hours: Hybrid setup and hours that work with your life

🥐 Tech Breakfast Wednesdays: Midweek inspiration and tasty bites

👾 Tech Demos: Showcasing innovations from around the company

💻 Modern Tech Stack: Work with cutting-edge technology daily

Diversity and inclusion

Diversity and inclusion are very important to us, and we are committed to creating an inclusive work environment. We want to be a workplace where everyone’s perspectives and opinions are valued, and we are dedicated to creating opportunities for all employees to thrive and reach their full potential.

Instabee, with consumer-facing brands Budbee, Instabox, and Porterbuddy, was founded in 2022, but the collective experience dates back much further. Today, Instabee is present in six markets, serving thousands of online merchants and millions of consumers with easy home deliveries or convenient parcel locker deliveries, using the best fuel available.

With smart tech, a focus on the environment, and a secure supply chain, Instabee has become the key partner of online merchants and the obvious choice for end-consumers, backed by notable investors such as Kinnevik, Creades, and EQT Ventures, among others.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Inom arbetet med utveckling av våra tariffer ingår det förbättring av vår kostnadsmodellering, automatisering av dataflöden och efterlevnad med lagar och aktuella föreskrifter. Gruppens största leverans är att årligen ta fram priser som dels ger bolaget önskade intäkter för året men som även är rättvist och kostnadsriktigt fördelat bland våra kunder i hela nätet. Gruppens roll innebär att vi ofta arbetar i tät dialog med andra intressenter, verksamheten och våra kunder för att kunna förstå samt agera på deras behov. Nu söker vi en erfaren Data Analyst som kan ta våra analyser till nästa nivå.

Ett datadrivet arbetssätt är en nyckel för effektiviserade arbetssätt och för att skapa långsiktiga förutsättningar i arbetet med tariffer och intäktsuppföljning, där vi söker en person som vill driva på och vara med och utveckla vårt datadrivna arbetssätt.

De regelbundna analyser som utförs av gruppen inkluderar flertalet datakällor, interna såväl som externa, vilka i större utsträckning skulle behöva kopplas samman för att göra kärnfulla analyser. Under 2024 påbörjades ett arbete med att migrera data, samla våra datakällor i ett gemensamt datalager och kartläggning av vad som krävs för att automatisera delar av arbetsflödet. Du kommer vara drivande i arbetet med att möjliggöra ökad datadrivenhet och automatisering och kan komma att få ansvar för att hålla ihop utvecklingsarbetet inom analysområdet kopplat till tariffer och intäkter. Detta kräver samarbete med många olika delar av verksamheten, där ett nyfiket arbetssätt och stark problemlösande förmåga är viktiga nycklar i rollen

Företagsbeskrivning

Vattenfall Eldistribution står mitt i energiomställningen och har en central roll i den kraftfulla elektrifiering som just nu sker på samhällsnivå där nätkapaciteten behöver fördubblas inom de närmsta 10 åren. Omställningen innebär kraftigt ökade kundinteraktioner där avdelningen Tariff och Intäkt har en viktig roll i att utveckla och optimera våra tariffstrukturer för att möta framtidens behov. Vi är idag 9 kollegor och planerar nu att växa med nya medarbetare – däribland en erfaren Data Analyst till vårt kontor i Solna eller Luleå.

Kvalifikationer

För att vara framgångsrik i rollen tror vi att du har:


Flertal års erfarenhet av programmering i Python eller liknande programmeringsspråk
Flertal års erfarenhet av att bygga effektiv och tydlig kod för att automatisera arbetsflöden, från strukturering av inputfiler, bearbetning och slutligen visualisering av data
Flertal års erfarenhet av att analysera stora datamängder
Erfarenhet av statistiks modellering och prognoser
Erfarenhet av visualiseringsprogram som Power BI
Erfarenhet av arbete med datakvalitet; identifiera och adressera brister samt initiera förbättringsinitiativ
Relevant akademisk examen
Goda kunskaper i att förmedla budskap/sätta samman presentationer
Goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska, i både tal och skrift


Vi ser det som ett plus om du även har tidigare erfarenhet och/eller insikt i energibranschen. Då avdelningens roll är att förstå vilka behov som finns hos verksamheten inom tariffutvecklingsområdet, så är din kommunikations- och relationsbyggande förmåga både internt och externt viktig. Du har en nytänkande och analytisk sida och styrka i att lösa problem och omvandla insikter till konsekvenser. Vi tror också att du är snabbfotad och initiativtagande för att kunna hantera bredden på rollen.

Ytterligare information

Förutom att du får vara med och forma framtidens smarta energisamhälle erbjuder vi dig ett utvecklande och omväxlande arbete med många kontaktytor. För oss på Vattenfall är det viktigt att arbete och privatliv har en god balans, därför erbjuder vi flexibilitet i arbetet samt möjlighet till att arbeta hemifrån vid behov. Vi har även en hel del andra personalförmåner som exempelvis arbetstidsförkortning, förmånliga tjänstepensionsavtal, föräldraledighetstillägg med mera. Läs mer om våra förmåner här.

Placeringsort

Solna, Luleå

För mer information om själva tjänsten kontakta rekryterande chef Lina Aglén, lina.aglen@vattenfall.com. För frågor om rekryteringsprocessen kontakta rekryterare Julia Norberg, julia.norberg@vattenfall.com

Fackliga representanter via Vattenfalls växel, 08 739 50 00. Christian Ericsson – Ledarna, Anne-Marie Sjöbohm – Akademikerna, Asim Nokic – Unionen, Ulf Tengman – SEKO.

Välkommen med din ansökan senast 2025-08-24. Urval och intervjuer sker löpande. Vi tar endast emot ansökningar via vår webbplats. Vi tar inte emot personligt brev i ansökan. Du söker snabbt och enkelt genom att svara på urvalsfrågor och bifoga ditt CV.

Vi är övertygade om att mångfald bidrar till att bygga ett mer lönsamt och tilltalande företag och strävar efter att vara goda förebilder när det gäller mångfald. Vattenfall arbetar aktivt för att alla medarbetare ska ha samma möjligheter och rättigheter oavsett ålder, etnisk eller kulturell bakgrund, könstillhörighet, religion/tro, sexuell läggning eller funktionsförutsättning. Läs mer om hur vi arbetar med mångfald och inkludering här.

Då säkerheten för Vattenfall och dess anställda är avgörande kommer vi innan varje anställning genomföra en ”pre-employment screening”. Dessa kontroller baseras på din roll som du kommer att fylla inom Vattenfall.

Vattenfall är en del av Sveriges kritiska infrastruktur, därmed är många av våra tjänster säkerhetsklassade. Är denna tjänst säkerhetsklassad kommer säkerhetsprövning genomföras innan anställning, i enlighet med säkerhetsskyddslagen.

Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
Show more
HTML:
Inom arbetet med utveckling av våra tariffer ingår det förbättring av vår kostnadsmodellering, automatisering av dataflöden och efterlevnad med lagar och aktuella föreskrifter. Gruppens största leverans är att årligen ta fram priser som dels ger bolaget önskade intäkter för året men som även är rättvist och kostnadsriktigt fördelat bland våra kunder i hela nätet. Gruppens roll innebär att vi ofta arbetar i tät dialog med andra intressenter, verksamheten och våra kunder för att kunna förstå samt agera på deras behov. Nu söker vi en erfaren Data Analyst som kan ta våra analyser till nästa nivå.

Ett datadrivet arbetssätt är en nyckel för effektiviserade arbetssätt och för att skapa långsiktiga förutsättningar i arbetet med tariffer och intäktsuppföljning, där vi söker en person som vill driva på och vara med och utveckla vårt datadrivna arbetssätt.

De regelbundna analyser som utförs av gruppen inkluderar flertalet datakällor, interna såväl som externa, vilka i större utsträckning skulle behöva kopplas samman för att göra kärnfulla analyser. Under 2024 påbörjades ett arbete med att migrera data, samla våra datakällor i ett gemensamt datalager och kartläggning av vad som krävs för att automatisera delar av arbetsflödet. Du kommer vara drivande i arbetet med att möjliggöra ökad datadrivenhet och automatisering och kan komma att få ansvar för att hålla ihop utvecklingsarbetet inom analysområdet kopplat till tariffer och intäkter. Detta kräver samarbete med många olika delar av verksamheten, där ett nyfiket arbetssätt och stark problemlösande förmåga är viktiga nycklar i rollen

Företagsbeskrivning

Vattenfall Eldistribution står mitt i energiomställningen och har en central roll i den kraftfulla elektrifiering som just nu sker på samhällsnivå där nätkapaciteten behöver fördubblas inom de närmsta 10 åren. Omställningen innebär kraftigt ökade kundinteraktioner där avdelningen Tariff och Intäkt har en viktig roll i att utveckla och optimera våra tariffstrukturer för att möta framtidens behov. Vi är idag 9 kollegor och planerar nu att växa med nya medarbetare – däribland en erfaren Data Analyst till vårt kontor i Solna eller Luleå.

Kvalifikationer

För att vara framgångsrik i rollen tror vi att du har:

  • Flertal års erfarenhet av programmering i Python eller liknande programmeringsspråk
  • Flertal års erfarenhet av att bygga effektiv och tydlig kod för att automatisera arbetsflöden, från strukturering av inputfiler, bearbetning och slutligen visualisering av data
  • Flertal års erfarenhet av att analysera stora datamängder
  • Erfarenhet av statistiks modellering och prognoser
  • Erfarenhet av visualiseringsprogram som Power BI
  • Erfarenhet av arbete med datakvalitet; identifiera och adressera brister samt initiera förbättringsinitiativ
  • Relevant akademisk examen
  • Goda kunskaper i att förmedla budskap/sätta samman presentationer
  • Goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska, i både tal och skrift

Vi ser det som ett plus om du även har tidigare erfarenhet och/eller insikt i energibranschen. Då avdelningens roll är att förstå vilka behov som finns hos verksamheten inom tariffutvecklingsområdet, så är din kommunikations- och relationsbyggande förmåga både internt och externt viktig. Du har en nytänkande och analytisk sida och styrka i att lösa problem och omvandla insikter till konsekvenser. Vi tror också att du är snabbfotad och initiativtagande för att kunna hantera bredden på rollen.

Ytterligare information

Förutom att du får vara med och forma framtidens smarta energisamhälle erbjuder vi dig ett utvecklande och omväxlande arbete med många kontaktytor. För oss på Vattenfall är det viktigt att arbete och privatliv har en god balans, därför erbjuder vi flexibilitet i arbetet samt möjlighet till att arbeta hemifrån vid behov. Vi har även en hel del andra personalförmåner som exempelvis arbetstidsförkortning, förmånliga tjänstepensionsavtal, föräldraledighetstillägg med mera. Läs mer om våra förmåner här.

Placeringsort

Solna, Luleå

För mer information om själva tjänsten kontakta rekryterande chef Lina Aglén, lina.aglen@vattenfall.com. För frågor om rekryteringsprocessen kontakta rekryterare Julia Norberg, julia.norberg@vattenfall.com

Fackliga representanter via Vattenfalls växel, 08 739 50 00. Christian Ericsson – Ledarna, Anne-Marie Sjöbohm – Akademikerna, Asim Nokic – Unionen, Ulf Tengman – SEKO.

Välkommen med din ansökan senast 2025-08-24. Urval och intervjuer sker löpande. Vi tar endast emot ansökningar via vår webbplats. Vi tar inte emot personligt brev i ansökan. Du söker snabbt och enkelt genom att svara på urvalsfrågor och bifoga ditt CV.

Vi är övertygade om att mångfald bidrar till att bygga ett mer lönsamt och tilltalande företag och strävar efter att vara goda förebilder när det gäller mångfald. Vattenfall arbetar aktivt för att alla medarbetare ska ha samma möjligheter och rättigheter oavsett ålder, etnisk eller kulturell bakgrund, könstillhörighet, religion/tro, sexuell läggning eller funktionsförutsättning. Läs mer om hur vi arbetar med mångfald och inkludering här.

Då säkerheten för Vattenfall och dess anställda är avgörande kommer vi innan varje anställning genomföra en ”pre-employment screening”. Dessa kontroller baseras på din roll som du kommer att fylla inom Vattenfall.

Vattenfall är en del av Sveriges kritiska infrastruktur, därmed är många av våra tjänster säkerhetsklassade. Är denna tjänst säkerhetsklassad kommer säkerhetsprövning genomföras innan anställning, i enlighet med säkerhetsskyddslagen.

Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!

Title: SDR Graduate Assessment Day- (London, Cape Town and Stockholm)
Description:
🚀 Virtual Assessment Day - Launch Your EngageTech Career

📅 Date: Thursday 14th August
🕒 Time: 2:00 PM - 4:00 PM (GMT)
🌍 Location: Online (invite-only)
📍 Hiring Regions: London, Stockholm, Cape Town


Are you looking to break into the world of tech sales? Ready to join a fast-paced, high-growth SaaS company where your potential is valued and your impact is real?

We're inviting ambitious, money driven, energetic individuals to our Virtual Assessment Day — a unique opportunity to fast-track your way into a career as a Sales Development Representative at EngageTech.


🌟 What to Expect

Learn about the EngageTech offering, our company, and our mission
Take part in Individual and interactive group exercises, show your understanding of EngageTech and our offering (a full break down will be covered prior to the event)
Showcase your communication, creativity, and commercial thinking (this is your chance to stand out amongst the crowd)
Meet our team and discover what a day in the life of a Sales Development Representative (SDR) looks like



✅ Why Join Us?

Clear career progression and a 3-month world-class training that sets you up for success
Uncapped earning potential 
Work within a passionate, vibrant and highly motivated sales team
Be a part of a business with a global reach, we have 7 offices across the world and are continuing to grow!
Be part of an industry shaping the future of business tech, we help businesses to scale and grow qualified sales pipeline. Offering you the exposure to become an expert on a range of different technologies.



Requirements


Recent graduates or early-career professionals (no experience required but sales experience is desireable)
Confident communicators with a growth mindset
Driven individuals who thrive in target-driven environments
Driven by progression; we have a promote from within culture and look for future leaders in the business during our hiring process
Fluent in English (bonus if you speak additional European languages)
You must reside or be able to relocate to the following areas; London, Stockholm or Cape Town




Benefits



Benefits dependent on location.

Show more

Title: Business Intelligence-konsult inom e-handel
Description:
Vill du hjälpa framgångsrika e-handelsbolag att optimera sin verksamhet genom data och analys?

 

Kabeljo är ett litet konsultbolag med stor kompetens inom data och analys med fokus på e-handel. Genom teknisk expertis och djup branschkunskap, levererar vi rapporter, analyser och insikter som underlag till bättre datadrivna affärsbeslut.

 

Vi önskar nu stärka vårt team på fyra konsulter med ytterligare en teknisk, trevlig och vetgirig person som brinner för att skapa insikter genom data. Som BI-konsult hos Kabeljo bör du vara gilla logisk problemlösning, att ha flera bollar i luften samt uppskatta kundkontakt. Du kommer att arbeta tätt ihop med våra duktiga konsulter och själv driva och ansvara för egna projekt och kunder. Kabeljo har en platt organisation, korta beslutsvägar och erbjuder konkurrenskraftiga villkor med stor frihet under ansvar.

 

Våra kunder kommunicerar på svenska, vilket ställer krav på att våra konsulter gör detsamma.




Vi ser gärna att du som söker har erfarenhet av något eller några av följande:

- Microsoft Power BI / Fabric

- Qlik Sense

- Python

- API:er

- SQL

 

Tjänsten är placerad i Alvik, Stockholm.

 

Välkommen med din ansökan och bli en del av vårt trevliga och kompetenta team!

Show more

Title: Associate - Stockholm
Description:
As part of Northzone's continuous growth, we are excited to expand our investment team in Stockholm by hiring a new Associate. We are looking for an outstanding individual with the intellect and drive to find, win over, and support the world's best entrepreneurs - and who, like us, feel lucky to have such a rewarding job.

What you'll be doing:


Sourcing - uncovering new deals and forming relationships with entrepreneurs across multiple sectors and markets
Diligence - supporting market, financial, and commercial DD alongside the existing investment team
Networking - representing Northzone in the Nordic and broader European ecosystem, connecting with founders, investors, operators, and customers both 1-on-1 and at events
Thesis building - developing new ideas in new markets that will lead to your sector expertise over time
Portfolio support - working with our existing founders and their teams, increasing your exposure as you spend time with us, on strategic work in and around the portfolio


We encourage all Northzoners to build relationships across all of our offices, with multiple opportunities a year to meet in person and maintain the culture that we're proud of. We also encourage all new members of the team to build new initiatives. Over time, we offer the opportunity to leverage your investor toolkit to build leadership skills and grow within the organization.

About Northzone

Northzone (northzone.com) is a global multi-stage venture capital firm built on decades of experience spanning multiple economic and disruptive technology cycles. Founded in 1996, we've raised more than ten funds. We're currently investing out of a $1.2bn fund to partner with founders across sectors, including AI, SaaS, healthcare, fintech, consumer, and everything in between. We're proud to be an early partner to daring entrepreneurs who want to shape the world. We've had the privilege to work with generational companies like Spotify, Klarna, Spring Health, Personio, Thirty Madison, Trustpilot, and many more. We emphasize a transparent, meritocratic, and entrepreneurial culture, and we have offices across the world in New York, London, Stockholm, Amsterdam, and Berlin.

Requirements

We're looking for:


A natural networker - do you know where the best founders are? How plugged in are you to the tech world? Do you have a natural love for connecting with change-makers?
An analytical superstar - how easily do you spot commercial trends? Are you able to derive information and decisions from very little data? How quickly can your gut decide if something is exciting or not?
A low-ego self-starter - are you able to thrive without needing close management? Do you find yourself drawn into new areas by your own curiosity? Do you always strive for greatness while also celebrating others' success?
Someone at the start of their career - do you have 2-3 years of experience in a high-intensity and rigorous environment such as banking/consulting/VC
Experience in VC or high-growth tech startup is a plus
Right to work in Sweden


We welcome those from all walks of life at Northzone, and celebrate those who haven't always taken the beaten path. We want people driven by curiosity with an entrepreneurial mindset, ready to embrace the uncertainty of this world and the investment ecosystem. We encourage you to apply even if you don't fit all the above criteria.

Benefits


Competitive compensation
25 days holiday
Generous parental leave
Private Health Insurance
Several off-sites with the team each year
Wellness budget
Show more

  • Wellness budget

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Born autonomous. Born electric.

Since 2016, our technology has connected global communities with the things they need – and all without the emissions. We’re made up of experts in multiple fields and that’s how we’ve developed a new way to move goods. This is technology purpose-built for the industry. This is safer, cleaner, and more reliable movement.

We are Einride and this is how we build a better future.

Want to be part of transforming road freight – for good? Einride is showing the world a new way to move, based on the latest digital, electric and autonomous technologies. Through freight capacity as a service, we enable businesses around the world to accelerate towards their sustainability goals.

Founded in 2016, Einride became the first company in the world to deploy a cab-less autonomous electric vehicle on a public road (Sweden, 2019). In 2022, we were the first to successfully operate such a vehicle on a US public road. Today our award-winning technology has been launched across 8 countries (and counting). Our clients are some of the world’s biggest shippers, including Fortune 500 companies. We are also operating Sweden’s largest truck dedicated public charging network and counting.

In this role, you will be joining one of the teams working on our freight management platform for electric transport. The platform includes systems for handling vehicle telematics and backends, systems and interfaces for transport planning, and machine learning models for energy consumption. We are looking for an enthusiastic, humble and creative Data Engineer who is passionate about creating simple, beautiful and helpful solutions to empower the transport industry to go electric.

As a Data Engineer at Einride you will build data pipelines using real-time data from vehicles and logistics systems to enable actionable insights around sustainability and performance

You will


Build high quality data pipelines to power dashboards, business reports and machine learning models
Work with external and internal data consumers to understand and predict their needs in terms of datasets
Develop strategy and architecture for collecting, organizing and leveraging data
Foster data engineering craftsmanship and mentor junior data engineers


We Expect You To


Have extensive experience in working hands-on with real-world datasets
Are fluent in modern, cloud-native data engineering tools. We use SQL, BigQuery, dbt, Dagster and Google Pub/Sub among others.
Have experience with some general-purpose programming language such as Python, Java or Go
Are eager to champion data engineering best practices and guide colleagues in their adoption


Ideally You Also Bring


Experience with data engineering and data architecture in Google Cloud Platform
Experience from setting up data flows that provide automated verification and error handling


This position is full-time and based in Stockholm. We recommend you submit your application as soon as possible as selection and interviews are held continually.

Please note that as part of our standard recruitment process, we conduct a background control on the final candidate for this role. This may include verification of education, employment history, any relevant professional certifications or other information that may be of our interest.

At Einride, we are innovators, building solutions the world has never seen before – but urgently needs. That’s why we take action, and it’s why we are always eager to be challenged. We know that our best innovations come from having a diverse mix of people, including those of different experiences, career paths, and walks of life. By coming together and sharing our perspectives openly – by disagreeing, discussing, and committing – we deliver greater impact.
Show more
