Title: SQL Database Developer
Description:
Xensam: SAM Disrupters

Xensam is the leading provider of AI-powered, cloud-hosted Software Asset Management technology. We’re looking for key players to join us as we scale our impact and build the Xensam team together. We take our culture seriously and strive to maintain the excellence, energy & enthusiasm that flows through the organization today.




We look for candidates who are passionate about what they do and ready to work the Xensam way. We know that experience counts, but we also know that it’s you, the person behind the experience, that makes it count.




About The Role

As our Database Developer at Xensam, you will play a crucial role in ensuring the performance, integrity, and security of our company's databases. You will work closely with our development and operations teams, providing support and guidance to optimize our SQL/PostgreSQL database systems, as well as implementing efficient data models.




The ideal candidate is passionate about database management, possesses at least 3-5 years of hands-on experience with PostgreSQL, and thrives in an environment that values freedom of work and the ability to get things done.




Responsibilities

You will take ownership by maintaining and managing our SQL/PostgreSQL database systems, performing routine database administration tasks, such as database monitoring, troubleshooting, and optimization. You will also collaborate with development and operations teams to design and implement efficient database structures and schemas. Other responsibilities that you will have:

Engage in database concept refinement, data modeling, and the fine-tuning of SQL queries for optimal system performance.
Monitor database performance and proactively identify and resolve performance bottlenecks.
Troubleshoot and resolve database-related issues, including query optimization and data consistency problems.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop and enforce database standards and best practices.
Stay up to date with industry trends and advancements in SQL and database administration.




Qualifications

3-5 years of professional experience working with databases.
Strong proficiency in SQL/PostgreSQL database administration and performance tuning.
Excellent understanding of database concepts, data modeling, and SQL query optimization.
Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to analyze complex database-related issues.
Proven ability to work independently, take ownership of projects, and meet deadlines.
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.
Strong proficiency in written and spoken English.




Bonus points for

SQL/PostgreSQL certification (e.g., SQL/PostgreSQL Certified Professional) is a plus.
Experience with other database technologies, such as Microsoft SQL Server, MySQL, Oracle Database, MongoDB etc.
Experience in the field of software licensing generally, or Software Asset Management specifically.




What You Get

A dynamic position embracing "freedom under responsibility".
Three days in-office (with remote work on Mondays and Fridays).
A generous work culture with free access to drinks and snacks, office massages, and more.
If sales targets are met, all employees enjoy an annual destination trip.
Join an ambitious and diverse team, and work with cutting-edge technology in the fastest-growing SAM software on the market.
An opportunity to shape your career growth while contributing to the company’s success.
Other location-specific benefits.




At Xensam, Our Core Values Define Our Culture

Rebellious: We encourage a spirit of freedom and initiative within responsibility.

Humane: We foster a caring, inclusive environment that values diversity and respects individuality.

Harmonious: We promote work-life balance, creating a pleasant, supportive workplace.




Join Xensam for a balanced, collaborative, and growth-focused work environment. If you're a team player ready to thrive, APPLY now!




As part of our recruitment process, we conduct background checks on final candidates to fulfill our commitments to customers and ensure a safe work environment.

Show more
HTML:
Xensam: SAM Disrupters

Xensam is the leading provider of AI-powered, cloud-hosted Software Asset Management technology. We’re looking for key players to join us as we scale our impact and build the Xensam team together. We take our culture seriously and strive to maintain the excellence, energy & enthusiasm that flows through the organization today.


We look for candidates who are passionate about what they do and ready to work the Xensam way. We know that experience counts, but we also know that it’s you, the person behind the experience, that makes it count.


About The Role

As our Database Developer at Xensam, you will play a crucial role in ensuring the performance, integrity, and security of our company's databases. You will work closely with our development and operations teams, providing support and guidance to optimize our SQL/PostgreSQL database systems, as well as implementing efficient data models.


The ideal candidate is passionate about database management, possesses at least 3-5 years of hands-on experience with PostgreSQL, and thrives in an environment that values freedom of work and the ability to get things done.


Responsibilities

You will take ownership by maintaining and managing our SQL/PostgreSQL database systems, performing routine database administration tasks, such as database monitoring, troubleshooting, and optimization. You will also collaborate with development and operations teams to design and implement efficient database structures and schemas. Other responsibilities that you will have:

  • Engage in database concept refinement, data modeling, and the fine-tuning of SQL queries for optimal system performance.
  • Monitor database performance and proactively identify and resolve performance bottlenecks.
  • Troubleshoot and resolve database-related issues, including query optimization and data consistency problems.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop and enforce database standards and best practices.
  • Stay up to date with industry trends and advancements in SQL and database administration.


Qualifications

  • 3-5 years of professional experience working with databases.
  • Strong proficiency in SQL/PostgreSQL database administration and performance tuning.
  • Excellent understanding of database concepts, data modeling, and SQL query optimization.
  • Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to analyze complex database-related issues.
  • Proven ability to work independently, take ownership of projects, and meet deadlines.
  • Excellent communication skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.
  • Strong proficiency in written and spoken English.


Bonus points for

  • SQL/PostgreSQL certification (e.g., SQL/PostgreSQL Certified Professional) is a plus.
  • Experience with other database technologies, such as Microsoft SQL Server, MySQL, Oracle Database, MongoDB etc.
  • Experience in the field of software licensing generally, or Software Asset Management specifically.


What You Get

  • A dynamic position embracing "freedom under responsibility".
  • Three days in-office (with remote work on Mondays and Fridays).
  • A generous work culture with free access to drinks and snacks, office massages, and more.
  • If sales targets are met, all employees enjoy an annual destination trip.
  • Join an ambitious and diverse team, and work with cutting-edge technology in the fastest-growing SAM software on the market.
  • An opportunity to shape your career growth while contributing to the company’s success.
  • Other location-specific benefits.


At Xensam, Our Core Values Define Our Culture

Rebellious: We encourage a spirit of freedom and initiative within responsibility.

Humane: We foster a caring, inclusive environment that values diversity and respects individuality.

Harmonious: We promote work-life balance, creating a pleasant, supportive workplace.


Join Xensam for a balanced, collaborative, and growth-focused work environment. If you're a team player ready to thrive, APPLY now!


As part of our recruitment process, we conduct background checks on final candidates to fulfill our commitments to customers and ensure a safe work environment.

Title: Game Data Analyst - Games
Description:
At Embark Studios, as a Game Data Analyst, you will play a crucial role in our team of data professionals, focusing specifically on gaming analytics for our first-person shooter game. You will be instrumental in providing insights and support for our game titles, leveraging data to optimize player experience, and providing actionable insights for the game development team. This position presents an exciting opportunity to merge your love for gaming with your expertise in data analytics.

Example Of Responsibilities


Collaborate and work closely with game designers and business stakeholders
Research and develop metrics and performance indicators
Extract, analyze, and communicate insights from gameplay data
Design telemetry logging
Communicate results clearly and concisely to stakeholders from both game and commercial teams



We would love if you have


Strong proficiency in SQL and experience with database querying, preferably using tools such as BigQuery
Excellent analytical skills with the ability to translate data into meaningful insights and recommendations
Proficiency in Python scripting for data manipulation and analysis
Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to collaborate effectively across teams and communicate complex concepts to non-technical stakeholders
Experience from working in a fast-paced environment where your skills depend on personal independence and agility
Experience with game analytics and a strong interest in first-person shooter games
Professional English communication skills.



At Embark we offer competitive salaries, passionate colleagues to share knowledge with and much more, but most of all we invite you to take part of a journey into the unknown, to build creative, surprising and beautiful experiences together.

We welcome game makers of all sex, class, colour, age, gender identity, education, religion, opinion, culture, nation of origin, language, sexual orientation, shape, size, and ability.

Did we leave anyone out? Well, we welcome you, too! We think that the gaming industry is made better when everyone has a seat at the table.

Be yourself at Embark and make games while doing so. Please apply with confidence. We can’t wait to hear from you (in English)!

If this role doesn't quite match what you're looking for, feel free to apply to us via our "Open Application."

Title: Business Intelligence (BI) Developer
Description:
Job Description:

At Dentsu Data Sweden, we transform data into powerful insights that drive marketing innovation for some of the world’s most iconic brands. We’re looking for a Senior BI Developer with 3–5 years of experience to join our dynamic team and lead the development of cutting-edge business intelligence solutions. If you're passionate about data, storytelling through dashboards, and collaborating with cross-functional teams, this is your opportunity to make a real impact!

Key Responsibilities


Lead the full lifecycle of BI projects—from architecture and design to development, testing, and deployment.
Act as the BI subject matter expert, defining best practices and ensuring high-quality data models and reporting layers.
Collaborate with clients and internal teams to gather requirements and deliver tailored dashboards and reports.
Design and maintain interactive dashboards using Power BI and other visualization tools.
Develop and manage data pipelines across SQL Server, Snowflake, and BigQuery.
Ensure data quality and structure for use in advanced analytics and econometric models.
Optimize dashboard performance and maintain solutions as data sources evolve.
Manage user access and report scheduling within BI platforms.
Communicate complex data insights clearly to both technical and non-technical audiences.



Qualifications


3–5 years of experience in BI development and dashboard creation.
Strong proficiency in SQL and experience with databases like SQL Server, Snowflake, and BigQuery.
Expertise in Power BI; familiarity with other visualization tools is a plus.
Experience with ETL tools (Supermetrics preferred).
Knowledge of cloud platforms such as Google Cloud Platform (preferred), Azure, or AWS.
Programming experience in Python (preferred) and/or R.
Understanding of media planning and buying is a plus.
Familiarity with AdTech platforms such as Google Ads, DV360, and Google Analytics is advantageous.
Excellent communication skills in both Swedish and English.
Team-oriented with a collaborative mindset and a passion for sharing knowledge.
Ability to present complex information in a clear, structured, and engaging way.



What We Offer:


An international work environment with colleagues from across the globe
A challenging role in a fast-growing market
Plenty of fun at work: table football, table tennis, team events, parties, and more
40 annual well-being hours, on top of 30 annual vacation days
Extensive learning and development opportunities, both in-person and online
A hybrid work model: 3 days in the office, the rest from home
Competitive salary and great benefits
Possibility to work from other EU/EES country up to 30 days per year
Opportunity to spend time on yourself during working hours; 40h wellbeing time and 40h personal development
Possibility to work 1 h less per day during summer (8-week period)
Collective agreements
30 days holiday entitlement



About DD & Dentsu

Dentsu Data is Dentsu's center of excellence in data science, research, and business intelligence. Our vision is to become Sweden's leading consultants in data by leveraging data to inspire people-centred transformations that shape society. Our Business Science team offers services in data strategy and consulting, data engineering, business intelligence and advanced modelling (econometrics). DD operates in Stockholm and Gothenburg.

DD is part of Dentsu Sweden AB, which is part of a global communication network with 71,000 employees in more than 145 countries. We offer our employees the opportunity to work with several market-leading brands and exciting customers. Of course, we offer great colleagues, attractive career opportunities, modern benefits, unique and industry-leading talent programs. Here, each individual's strengths are encouraged, and you get the opportunity to be yourself, develop and reach your full potential. In all brands in the Dentsu Group, we are constantly working to develop our employees and leaders, and thus there are good development opportunities both at regional, Nordic and international level. We are happy to tell you more about the above in connection with any interview. All our Swedish companies are environmentally certified according to the Swedish Environmental Base and we work actively with our social and environmental responsibility as an employer and fellow human beings. 

Diversity and Inclusion

At dentsu we believe in the power of diversity. We welcome all applications regardless of age, disability, gender reassignment, marital or civil partner status, pregnancy or maternity, race, colour, nationality, ethnic or national origin, religion or belief, sex, or sexual orientation.

Additional information:

Please do not hesitate to send in your application and CV/LinkedIn profile as soon as possible.

Location:

Stockholm

Brand:

Dentsu Media

Time Type:

Full time

Contract Type:

Permanent

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
🚀 Let’s Build the Future of Recruitment Together

At Teamtailor, we believe that building happy teams is the foundation of a thriving business. As a leading employer branding and recruitment platform, used by over 10,000 companies and 200,000 users worldwide 🌍 we’re on a mission to shape the future of hiring. Now, we’re inviting you to be part of that journey.




Working with us means joining a young and fast-growing tech company with a truly international mindset and a strong sense of purpose. This is more than just a job. It is a chance to make a real impact, take on meaningful responsibilities, and play an active role in the growth of both our product and our company. You will also be part of a vibrant and diverse team where different backgrounds and perspectives are celebrated. We believe work should be both inspiring and fun.




💼 What We’re Looking For

We’re expanding our Data Team and looking for a skilled and experienced Data Engineer to join us on our journey. If you enjoy building reliable data pipelines, cleaning messy datasets, and making data ready for analysis and action, you’ll feel right at home here.

✅ You Bring:

3–5 years of experience in Data Engineering or a similar role
Strong knowledge of dbt, SQL, and data modeling best practices.
Solid experience with Python, especially for building data workflows and working with APIs.
A proactive mindset around data cleanliness, automation, and system reliability.
A positive attitude. You see opportunities where others see obstacles.
Ability to work independently and take ownership of tasks with minimal supervision.
Comfortable collaborating across teams in a fast-paced, product-driven environment.
Fluent English (written and spoken).




⭐ Bonus Points If You Have:

Experience working with Google Cloud Platform (GCP)




🛠️ What You’ll Do

Design, build, and maintain data pipelines using dbt for transformation and modeling.
Manage data flowing in and out of our platform.
Set up and maintain data quality checks and alerting systems.
Create and maintain data warehouse tables, ensuring data is clean, trusted, and accessible.




💜 What Teamtailor Offers You

The chance to work at one of Europe’s fastest-growing SaaS companies 🚀
A fantastic team that supports and lifts each other 💛
Competitive salary and pension package
An annual company trip abroad and regular team events 🎉
Wellness allowance to support your healthy lifestyle 🏋️ ♀️
Show more

Title: Solution Analyst
Description:
Born autonomous. Born electric.

Since 2016, our technology has connected global communities with the things they need – and all without the emissions. We’re made up of experts in multiple fields and that’s how we’ve developed a new way to move goods. This is technology purpose-built for the industry. This is safer, cleaner, and more reliable movement.

We are Einride and this is how we build a better future.

Want to be part of transforming road freight – for good? Einride is showing the world a new way to move, based on the latest digital, electric and autonomous technologies. Through freight capacity as a service, we enable businesses around the world to accelerate towards their sustainability goals.

Founded in 2016, Einride became the first company in the world to deploy a cab-less autonomous electric vehicle on a public road (Sweden, 2019). In 2022, we were the first to successfully operate such a vehicle on a US public road. Today our award-winning technology has been launched across 8 countries (and counting). Our clients are some of the world’s biggest shippers, including Fortune 500 companies. We are also operating Sweden’s largest truck dedicated public charging network and counting.

Your mission when joining the Solution EMEA team at Einride will be to analyze customers' transport demand to identify the most suitable scope for electrification, design transport solutions and build long term transformation road maps. You will team up with colleagues within the team and collaborate with several other parts of the company. In your daily work you will leverage smart tools and constantly seek to expand your skill set with advanced analysis methods.

You Will


Drive and coordinate pre-studies in close collaboration with customers & Einride colleagues
Analyze data and develop short- to long-term electrification roadmaps for our customers
Calculate business cases and develop electric and autonomous-electric solutions for customers through analysis of transport/logistics data
Provide insights and recommendations by identifying, analyzing, and interpreting trends or patterns in complex data sets
Conduct research and technical/business analysis, developing presentations and reports that tell a compelling story
Support customer discussions with senior stakeholders


What We Expect Of You


Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Engineering, Business, or similar
1+ years’ experience in consulting, finance, or relevant experience in other quantitative role in a high growth start up
Highly analytical with ability to communicate clearly and concisely
Self starter with demonstrated conceptual thinking skills
Team player working effectively with people at all levels in an organization
Strong interest in topics including e-mobility, transport, logistics, supply chain, etc.
Proficiency in Microsoft Excel or Google Sheets
Experience in relevant programming languages/tools such as Python/Pandas, R/Stata, Matlab/Scilab/Octave, etc. is a requirement


This is a full-time position based in Stockholm. You will be part of a truly diverse, high performing team with a common passion for sustainability and making things happen in an innovative way. You're welcome to submit your application at any time, the selection process will begin in August.

At Einride, we are innovators, building solutions the world has never seen before – but urgently needs. That’s why we take action, and it’s why we are always eager to be challenged. We know that our best innovations come from having a diverse mix of people, including those of different experiences, career paths, and walks of life. By coming together and sharing our perspectives openly – by disagreeing, discussing, and committing – we deliver greater impact.
Show more

Title: Power BI Specialist
Description:
Insurance is all about life. And it’s all about data. At If we are developing technical solutions that have the power to turn misfortunes into possibilities and dreams into reality. We are now looking for a Power BI Specialist with passion for data to help us accelerate within business intelligence (BI).

About The Role

The role will report to Head of Data & Analytics, Business Area Commercial. The daily work will be organized in an agile team responsible for our own If Analytics Academy providing inspiration, training, and hands on support for all our key analytical tools across our business areas (read more about it here). The main objective for this role is to increase the usage of Power BI by enabling more people in the organization to do more analytics on their own. And to help you in this quest you will be cheered for and supported by one of the largest communities of over 200 data professionals in the Nordics.

Responsibilities include:


Assess and understand training needs of the organization to tailor training programs to address specific requirements and skill levels.
Create and maintain standard digital course offerings for Power BI and key data assets
Conduct engaging and interactive Power BI training sessions for individuals and groups, both in-person and virtually.
Provide one-on-one coaching and support to individuals seeking assistance with Power BI functionality, data modeling, and report/dashboard creation.
Collaborate with subject matter experts to ensure the training content aligns with industry best practices and the organization's business objectives.
Stay up to date with the latest Power BI features, updates, and best practices to continuously improve the training curriculum.
Provide ongoing support, answering questions, addressing concerns, and troubleshooting issues related to Power BI usage.
Contribute to the development and maintenance of a Power BI knowledge base and documentation for easy reference and self-guided learning.



About Us

We strive to be an organization where you can develop and be challenged, both personally and within analytics. We are team players with a strong drive and ambition to always deliver the best results - and we take pride in having fun along the way. Together we are a large Nordic community of technology and data professionals - supporting and pushing each other forward. To learn more how we work and think around technology, data and analytics, please visit our Tech blog: https://medium.com/if-tech.

We offer

In the same way that we place high demands on you as an employee, we also expect you to place high demands on us as an employer.

Here are some of the benefits of working at If:


An including work environment where everyone is welcome
Career and development opportunities in the biggest insurance company in the Nordics
Social activities, as well as highly skilled professional environment
Possibility of hybrid workplace
Health promoting workplace with e.g., wellness allowance and various sports activities
Great insurance benefits



Who are you?

We think you are a person who are outgoing with good communication skills and enjoy a role with many contact points. You are passionate about business intelligence (BI), like solving problems and helping others succeed. We value that it is fun to go to work, so it's important that you spread a positive energy and share your knowledge with colleagues and others you meet.

You also have


Patience, adaptability, and a passion for helping others learn and succeed with Business Intelligence.
Good problem-solving skills and the ability to explain complex concepts in a clear and understandable manner.
Good training and facilitation skills, with the ability to deliver engaging and effective training sessions to individuals and groups.
Good knowledge of data visualization principles and best practices for designing visually appealing and insightful reports and dashboards.
Experience with Power BI tool
Experience with developing digital educational material and programs is a plus.



Additional facts and the recruitment process:

Application deadline: Last day to apply is 24th of August. However, screening and interviewing will begin immediately.
To apply for the position: Please attach your CV. A cover letter is not required—instead, we ask you to answer a few short questions as part of the application process. Please notice that we are not able to process any applications outside of our recruitment system (Workday).
Work location: Stockholm, Oslo, Copenhagen, Turku or Espoo.

Traveling: Some traveling within the Nordic and Baltic countries might be required
Start: By agreement.

Final candidates will undergo a background check before employment.

For more information, please contact Head of Data & Analytics for Business area Commercial Håkon Grønning Strand (hakon.gronning.strand@if.no).

We look forward to your application!

About Us

We are If. Our purpose is to give people confidence today to shape their tomorrow.

To make this possible, trust is our backbone. We stay ahead and challenge ourselves to grow. And we always put our hearts into it – because it takes more than bright minds to make brilliant things happen.

We are the leading insurance company in the Nordics/Baltics and a stable employer with 7,900 dedicated professionals. But most importantly, we are protectors of people, enablers of companies and encouragers of dreams. With our joint force of expertise and engagement we always stand by our customers’ side. Giving them the security and the confidence to be curious, explore new worlds, start new businesses and live their lives.

We are an equal opportunity employer, convinced that a diverse and inclusive work culture boosts innovation and the growth of intellectual capital in many ways. It doesn’t matter who you are, where you come from, or what you look like. It is the different perspectives, backgrounds, and experiences each of us have and share, that will make a difference.

Come and join us!
Show more
HTML:
Insurance is all about life. And it’s all about data. At If we are developing technical solutions that have the power to turn misfortunes into possibilities and dreams into reality. We are now looking for a Power BI Specialist with passion for data to help us accelerate within business intelligence (BI).

About The Role

The role will report to Head of Data & Analytics, Business Area Commercial. The daily work will be organized in an agile team responsible for our own If Analytics Academy providing inspiration, training, and hands on support for all our key analytical tools across our business areas (read more about it here). The main objective for this role is to increase the usage of Power BI by enabling more people in the organization to do more analytics on their own. And to help you in this quest you will be cheered for and supported by one of the largest communities of over 200 data professionals in the Nordics.

Responsibilities include:

  • Assess and understand training needs of the organization to tailor training programs to address specific requirements and skill levels.
  • Create and maintain standard digital course offerings for Power BI and key data assets
  • Conduct engaging and interactive Power BI training sessions for individuals and groups, both in-person and virtually.
  • Provide one-on-one coaching and support to individuals seeking assistance with Power BI functionality, data modeling, and report/dashboard creation.
  • Collaborate with subject matter experts to ensure the training content aligns with industry best practices and the organization's business objectives.
  • Stay up to date with the latest Power BI features, updates, and best practices to continuously improve the training curriculum.
  • Provide ongoing support, answering questions, addressing concerns, and troubleshooting issues related to Power BI usage.
  • Contribute to the development and maintenance of a Power BI knowledge base and documentation for easy reference and self-guided learning.


About Us

We strive to be an organization where you can develop and be challenged, both personally and within analytics. We are team players with a strong drive and ambition to always deliver the best results - and we take pride in having fun along the way. Together we are a large Nordic community of technology and data professionals - supporting and pushing each other forward. To learn more how we work and think around technology, data and analytics, please visit our Tech blog: https://medium.com/if-tech.

We offer

In the same way that we place high demands on you as an employee, we also expect you to place high demands on us as an employer.

Here are some of the benefits of working at If:

  • An including work environment where everyone is welcome
  • Career and development opportunities in the biggest insurance company in the Nordics
  • Social activities, as well as highly skilled professional environment
  • Possibility of hybrid workplace
  • Health promoting workplace with e.g., wellness allowance and various sports activities
  • Great insurance benefits


Who are you?

We think you are a person who are outgoing with good communication skills and enjoy a role with many contact points. You are passionate about business intelligence (BI), like solving problems and helping others succeed. We value that it is fun to go to work, so it's important that you spread a positive energy and share your knowledge with colleagues and others you meet.

You also have

  • Patience, adaptability, and a passion for helping others learn and succeed with Business Intelligence.
  • Good problem-solving skills and the ability to explain complex concepts in a clear and understandable manner.
  • Good training and facilitation skills, with the ability to deliver engaging and effective training sessions to individuals and groups.
  • Good knowledge of data visualization principles and best practices for designing visually appealing and insightful reports and dashboards.
  • Experience with Power BI tool
  • Experience with developing digital educational material and programs is a plus.


Additional facts and the recruitment process:

Application deadline: Last day to apply is 24th of August. However, screening and interviewing will begin immediately.
To apply for the position: Please attach your CV. A cover letter is not required—instead, we ask you to answer a few short questions as part of the application process. Please notice that we are not able to process any applications outside of our recruitment system (Workday).
Work location: Stockholm, Oslo, Copenhagen, Turku or Espoo.

Traveling: Some traveling within the Nordic and Baltic countries might be required
Start: By agreement.

Final candidates will undergo a background check before employment.

For more information, please contact Head of Data & Analytics for Business area Commercial Håkon Grønning Strand (hakon.gronning.strand@if.no).

We look forward to your application!

About Us
We are If. Our purpose is to give people confidence today to shape their tomorrow.

To make this possible, trust is our backbone. We stay ahead and challenge ourselves to grow. And we always put our hearts into it – because it takes more than bright minds to make brilliant things happen.

We are the leading insurance company in the Nordics/Baltics and a stable employer with 7,900 dedicated professionals. But most importantly, we are protectors of people, enablers of companies and encouragers of dreams. With our joint force of expertise and engagement we always stand by our customers’ side. Giving them the security and the confidence to be curious, explore new worlds, start new businesses and live their lives.

We are an equal opportunity employer, convinced that a diverse and inclusive work culture boosts innovation and the growth of intellectual capital in many ways. It doesn’t matter who you are, where you come from, or what you look like. It is the different perspectives, backgrounds, and experiences each of us have and share, that will make a difference.

Come and join us!

Title: Dataanalytiker till enheten dataanalys
Description:
Vill du vara med och lösa en av de största samhällsutmaningarna? Trivs du i en miljö av innovationsanda, framåtdriv och starkt samhällsengagemang? Hos oss får du vara med och bygga upp en ny myndighet från grunden och bidra till att förhindra välfärdsbrott och den organiserade brottslighetens framväxt. Du får en arbetsgivare som månar om din utveckling och ger dig stort eget ansvar och mandat.

Beskrivning

Vi erbjuder en roll som innebär praktiskt arbete med analys av data. För att lyckas i uppdraget ska du ha god kännedom om välfärdssystemen och gärna erfarenhet av utveckling av riskbaserade urvalskontroller. Tjänsten är placerad på enheten för Dataanalys.

Arbetsuppgifter

Som dataanalytiker arbetar du i team med att analysera data och utveckla urvalsmodeller och kontroller vars syfte är att identifiera utbetalningar från välfärden som har ökade risker att vara felaktiga. Du bidrar också aktivt till att ta fram och vidareutveckla processer och arbetssätt.

Vi söker dig som har


Utbildning som arbetsgivaren bedömer som relevant för tjänsten
Minst tre års aktuell arbetslivserfarenhet av att självständigt formulera frågor mot större datamängder och bedöma deras kvalitet
Minst tre års aktuell arbetslivserfarenhet av kvalificerat analysarbete, företrädesvis inom välfärdsområdet
Minst tre års aktuell erfarenhet av att arbeta med data- och analysverktyg, inklusive erfarenhet av att bearbeta, strukturera och visualisera stora informationsmängder
Minst tre års aktuell erfarenhet av att arbeta med SQL, Python eller motsvarande språk för databashantering och analys.
Mycket god förmåga att formulera dig i tal och skrift på svenska



Det är meriterande om du har


Erfarenhet av att samarbeta med olika typer av verksamheter såsom juridik, säkerhet och teknik
Erfarenhet av att arbeta i eller med tvärfunktionella team
Erfarenhet av att samverka med andra myndigheter
Erfarenhet av utredningar
Kunskap om avancerade brottsupplägg riktade mot välfärdssystemen, inklusive förståelse för hur brotten genomförs och kan identifieras.



Efterfrågade förmågor och färdigheter

För att lyckas i rollen är du strukturerad och mål- och resultatinriktad. Du har gott omdöme och god samarbetsförmåga, du är pedagogisk och har en väl utvecklad problemlösande analysförmåga.

Arbetet ställer krav på att du har god förmåga att förstå och analysera komplexa problemområden. Vi fäster stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper. I din roll kommer du behandla särskilt känsliga och sekretessreglerade uppgifter vilket ställer höga krav på korrekt hantering och ett högt säkerhetsmedvetande.

Övrigt

Tjänstgöringsorten är i Stockholm. Myndigheten finns i moderna lokaler i närheten av Gullmarsplan. Befattningen är placerad i säkerhetsklass vilket kräver svenskt medborgarskap. Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning på heltid som inleds med provanställning på sex månader. Du kan komma att krigsplaceras på myndigheten.

I denna rekrytering söker du med ditt CV utan personligt brev. I ansökningsformuläret kommer du istället för ett personligt brev att få svara på några frågor gällande din bakgrund.

Är du intresserad?

Vill du veta mer om tjänsten

Vill du veta mer om tjänsten, kontakta enhetschef Mark Sayar på 0721-488307 eller enhetschef Niclas Cederberg på telefon 0730-298547. Vi tar gärna emot samtal från dig som är intresserad av jobbet, men tackar nej till dig som säljer annonser och rekryteringstjänster.

Anställningsform: tillsvidare med provanställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 1 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100% | Ort: Stockholm | Län: Stockholms län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: 2025/23 | Kontakt: Niclas Cederberg enhetschef 010-5727576, | Publicerat: 2025-07-28 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-08-18
Show more

Title: Data Analyst PLG (Remote Europe)
Description:
n8n is a workflow automation platform that uniquely combines AI capabilities with business process automation. We give technical teams the flexibility of code with the speed of no-code, backed by a passionate community of builders. With 500+ integrations and fair-code principles, we're revolutionizing how businesses connect their systems and processes.

We were founded end of 2019 and currently:


🧑‍🤝‍🧑 We’re a diverse team of + 120 talented people
🚀 Our annual recurring revenue is growing over 7x year-over-year
⭐️ With +118k GitHub stars, we are in the top 50 most popular projects of all time on Github
🍾 We were the 25th fastest growing startup last year and 4th BtoB SaaS Rising 100 this year in Europe according to Sifted
🌱 We were Sequoia's first seed investment in Germany, and most recently secured our $60M Series B (February '25, led by Highland)


Join n8n to help us unlock the next level of product-led growth through data.

At n8n, we’re building the most powerful automation platform for technical teams. Our unique blend of low-code flexibility and full-code control gives builders unmatched speed and scalability — backed by one of the world’s most active developer communities. We're building a self-serve motion that’s already powering millions of automations across companies of all sizes. Now, we’re looking for a sharp and curious PLG & Growth Data Analyst to help us deeply understand and optimize our self-serve user funnel — from acquisition through expansion.

🎯 Your main goal will be to enable data-driven ARR growth by uncovering insights that optimize self-service user acquisition, activation, retention, and expansion.

To get there, here’s how you’ll make an impact:

🔍 Become the expert on our PLG funnel


Understand the current self-serve user journey, from signup to expansion, and map drop-off points.
Own and evolve our PLG funnel analytics to track activation, conversion, retention, and monetization.
Conduct quarterly business reviews and funnel performance analyses to identify trends and risks.


🧪 Power experimentation and growth


Analyze the results of PLG experiments and advise teams on what’s working — and what’s not.
Continuously refine our PQL definitions based on behavioral signals and user segmentation.
Evaluate pricing plan performance across user segments and surface monetization opportunities.


🛠 Build tools that make data accessible and actionable


Design and maintain dashboards that track self-serve KPIs and enable rapid decision-making.
Build and scale self-service tools and documentation to help teams answer product and growth questions.
Partner with product, marketing, and analytics to ensure shared metrics and clarity across the funnel.


🤝 Enable cross-functional success


Work closely with Product, Growth, Marketing, and Engineering teams to inform their priorities with data.
Serve as a trusted partner in shaping PLG strategy by identifying new opportunities for activation and expansion.
Champion a culture of experimentation and data-informed decision-making across n8n.


Requirements

Must-haves


🧠 Self-serve PLG analytics experience: You have 4–5 years in data roles at high-growth B2B SaaS companies with a strong self-serve motion. You’ve directly analyzed user behavior across the activation, monetization, and retention funnel, and have helped shape the product strategy through PQL models, funnel mapping, and in-product experimentation.
📐 Experimental mindset: You’ve proposed, designed, and analyzed experiments that drove tangible growth outcomes.
🗣️ Cross-functional communication: You’re known for translating complex data into crisp insights that influence Product, Marketing, and Engineering teams.
🧮 Strong analytical toolkit: You’re highly proficient in SQL and experienced with BigQuery, DBT, Metabase, and Google Sheets.
🤖 Bias for automation & AI: You’re excited about using automation and AI to streamline workflows and unlock new insights.
📚 Academic foundation: You hold a Master’s degree in a quantitative field (e.g. Computer Science, Statistics, Economics, or similar).


Nice-to-haves


👾 Experience in devtool or community-led growth environments: You understand the unique patterns of usage and activation in technical audiences.
🔧 Familiarity with n8n: You’ve used our product — or are excited to dive in and explore what makes it so powerful.
🚀 Startup-first mindset: You’re energized by ambiguity, fast decision cycles, and the ability to ship impact quickly.
📊 AB testing expertise: You’ve designed and interpreted A/B and multivariate tests in SaaS products with scale.


Why join us?

At n8n, your work won’t disappear into a slide deck. You'll have direct impact on how we scale our ARR, build our data foundations, and shape the future of product-led growth in one of Europe’s fastest-growing startups. You’ll join a supportive, remote-first team that values autonomy, experimentation, and continuous learning.

Sound like a challenge you’re excited to take on?

Apply now — and help us build the future of automation.

n8n is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

We can sponsor visas to Germany; for any other country, you need to have existing right to work.

Our company language is English.

You care about diversity and inclusion? We do too! Check out our Diversity, Inclusion and Belonging initiatives at n8n (https://www.notion.so/n8n/Diversity-inclusion-and-belonging-n8n-c1bec2fff536422d868b1a438d990e35).

Location disclaimer: If you see multiple job postings for the same role, it is most likely because we're hiring remotely for this role and posting in different locations to make sure every potential candidate can see the role. Please apply to the location you're the most likely to work from in the future.

Benefits


Competitive compensation 💸 – We offer fair and attractive pay.
Ownership 💪 – Our core value is to “empower others,” and we mean it—you’ll get a slice of n8n with equity.
Work/life balance 🏖️ – We work hard but ensure you have time to recharge:
Europe: 30 days of vacation, plus public holidays wherever you are.
US: 15 vacation days, 8 sick days, plus public holidays wherever you are.
Health & wellness 🩺 –
Europe: We provide benefits according to local country norms.*
US: Comprehensive medical (PPO 1200), dental, and vision plans.
Future planning 💰 –
Europe: We provide pension contributions according to local country norms.*
US: 401(k) retirement plan.
Financial security 🛡️ –
Europe: We provide benefits according to local country norms.*
US: Short-term & long-term disability insurance, life & AD&D coverage, and additional hospital coverage.
Career growth 📈 – We hire rising stars who grow with us! You’ll get €1K (or equivalent) per year to spend on courses, books, events, or coaching to level up your skills.
A passionate team 🤩 – We love our product, and we prove it with regular hackathons where we see who can build the coolest thing with it!
Remote-first 🌏 – Our team works remotely across Europe, with regular off-sites for team bonding. Some roles, like sales in the US, are hybrid—please check the job description.
Giving back 🤝 – We're big fans of open source, and you'll get $100 per month to support projects you care about.
Transparency 🙏 – We all know what everyone’s working on, how the company is doing—the whole shebang.
An ambitious but kind culture 😍 – People love working here—our eNPS for 2024 is 94!
Country-specific details are provided in your contract.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Data Insight Lead - Storkøbenhavn




Er du passioneret omkring data og analyse?
Ønsker du at spille en central rolle i en dynamisk virksomhed med vækstambitioner?
Trives du med at rådgive ledelsen, optimere forretningsprocesser og levere værdifuld indsigt gennem dataanalyse og strategi?




Og vil du være en del af en vækstrejse i et selskab, hvor faglighed, menneskelighed og forretningssans går hånd i hånd - Så er du måske den nye Data Insight Lead vi søger til VetGruppen.




Virksomheden:

VetGruppen er en landsdækkende aktør med +50 dyreklinikker- og hospitaler, som hver dag hjælper tusindvis af kæledyrsejere og deres dyr. Deres vision er at være den foretrukne dyrlægepartner for deres kunder – og de er i vækst!




Til at understøtte deres vækst søger VetGruppen en Data Insight Lead til deres hovedkontor i Brøndby. Du bliver en central figur i gruppens udvikling og en nøgleperson i at drive datadrevne beslutninger på tværs af organisationen. Vi leder efter dig, som har en stærk og tillidsvækkende analytisk forretningsprofil, brænder for at analysere og præsentere data på et professionelt højt niveau på tværs af forretningsområder og tager et naturligt ejerskab over it-systemer og datastrukturer.




Du vil arbejde fra hovedkontoret med mulighed for hjemmearbejde. Stillingen refererer ind til VetGruppens COO.




Din rolle:

Som Data Insight Lead bliver du ansvarlig for at drive og udvikle dataindsigt og analyse på tværs af forretningen. Du vil spille en afgørende rolle for at sikre, at VetGruppen udnytter deres data optimalt, så de kan træffe de bedste beslutninger og optimere deres forretningsprocesser. Med tæt samarbejde med både forretningen og finans vil du være med til at forme deres datadrevne strategier.




Dine ansvarsområder:

Dataudtræk og visualisering: Løfte og tage ejerskab for dataudtræk og visualisering på tværs af systemer.
Tværgående samarbejde: Involvere forretningens interessenter i dataanalyse og datavisualisering for at løse datakritiske problemstillinger.
Master Data: Påtage dig en ansvarlig rolle for master data og være et datafyrtårn i organisationen.
Sparring og rådgivning: Dialog og sparring med både interne teams og eksterne BI-partnere om løsninger og rådgivning på dataområdet.
Datamodenhed: Bidrage til at styrke forretningens datamodenhed og fungere som en faglig sparringspartner for organisationen.




Vi tilbyder:

En spændende rolle i en virksomhed med stor vækst og ambitioner.
Et professionelt, men afslappet arbejdsmiljø med flad struktur og fokus på både faglighed og samarbejde.
Mulighed for at arbejde selvstændigt og tage ansvar for dataområdet på tværs af funktioner.
Fleksible arbejdsforhold med mulighed for hjemmearbejde et par dage om ugen.




Din profil

Vi forestiller os, at du har følgende erfaring og kompetencer:




Uddannelse: Relevant videregående uddannelse.
Erfaring med data og analyse: Minimum 2-3 års erfaring fra en rolle med data og analyse, enten via intern dataafdeling eller fra konsulentbranchen. Fordel hvis du har samarbejdet tæt med C-level og/eller direkte med forretningen, så du har bidraget til beslutningsprocesser baseret på data.
Power BI og Excel: Superbruger i både Power BI og Excel.
Master Data: Erfaring med ejerskab af master data og forståelse for dens betydning for organisationen.
Forretningssans: Stærk forretningssans og evne til at anvende dataanalyse til at understøtte beslutningstagning.
Selvstændighed og stakeholder-involvering: Du arbejder selvstændigt, med med stærke samarbejdsevner, og sikrer effektiv leverance på tværs af interessenter i en kompleks organisation.




Ansøgning

Er du klar til at tage ansvar for virksomhedens dataindsigt og være med til at forme fremtidens beslutningsgrundlag hos VetGruppen? Så glæder vi os til at modtage dit CV.




Har du spørgsmål eller vil du høre mere om stillingen, kan du kontakte Engagement Manager Rikke Nilsson på 22117609 eller via e-mail: rn@hammerandersen.com. Alternativt kan du kontakte Business Unit Director Jakob Kelstrup på 31146934.

Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Turn data into insights that drive smarter decisions across a global organization

Are you passionate about transforming data into business value? Join our Global IT team and help shape how BioMar uses data to inform decisions and drive strategic progress across our global organization. Your work will bring clarity to complex questions and help colleagues make better decisions every day.

We are looking for a Data Analyst to support our journey toward becoming a more data-driven organization. You’ll play a key role in unlocking the full potential of our BI platform, BioMetrics, built on Microsoft Azure and using Tableau for reporting and visualization. BioMetrics connects people with the data they need to move the business forward.

At BioMar, the role of Data Analyst is titled IT Solution Lead, and this will be your official title once you join us.

Make a difference in how we turn business questions into actionable answers

In this role, your focus will be on delivering the right data in clear, interactive dashboards and reports that bring business matters into sharp focus. By designing BI solutions that are not just informative but truly actionable, you’ll help colleagues quickly grasp key insights and take the right steps to move the business forward.


Partner with colleagues across the business to understand and translate their needs into data requirements
Design and maintain insightful dashboards, reports, and visualizations using Tableau or similar tools
Use strong problem-solving skills to work through complex business challenges and data
Improve reporting processes and ensure data quality across our BI platform
Align BI products with strategic goals and business value


Bring your experience and curiosity to build better data solutions

You are someone who thrives in complexity, takes ownership, and enjoys working closely with diverse colleagues. You know that successful BI is about more than just numbers - it’s about making things easier to understand, easier to act on, and more impactful. You are proactive, structured, and committed to continuous improvement.


At least 5 years of experience working with data and BI in a professional setting
Hands-on experience with Tableau or similar tools, as well as SQL and Azure-based environments
A structured communicator who can work with both technical and non-technical colleagues
A relevant academic degree in IT, Business Intelligence, Computer Science, or similar
Fluent in written and spoken English; Spanish is a plus, but not required


Be part of a collaborative, forward-thinking environment

At BioMar, innovation and collaboration are at the heart of everything we do. In this role, you’ll have the opportunity to influence how data is used across our global company - and help us meet our mission of advancing sustainable aquaculture.

You’ll work with dedicated professionals across disciplines and regions in a supportive environment that values learning and initiative. We offer flexibility, professional development, and a chance to make your mark on a company with purpose.

Ready to apply or have questions?

We look forward to hearing from you. If you have any questions about the position, feel free to reach out to our HR Business Partner, Emilie Louise Svenning, on +45 2065 2997. The application process is ongoing, so we encourage you to apply as soon as possible. Please include your CV when applying.

About BioMar

More than half of the seafood consumed globally comes from aquaculture. At BioMar, we are committed to developing and delivering efficient, sustainable, and healthy aquaculture feed solutions. Innovation and partnerships are at the heart of everything we do, and we are proud that our highly skilled people share this commitment. With feed factories in 13 countries across 4 continents, we supply feed to over 90 countries, supporting more than 45 different species of fish and shrimp. Join us on our journey to innovate aquaculture.

Powered by Partnership. Driven by Innovation.

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do you thrive at the intersection of data and strategy? Are you excited about turning complex analytics into impactful marketing insights? Then you might be our new Marketing Data Analyst, ready to join our dynamic and international marketing team!

First, who on earth is Dalux?

Dalux is an innovative Contech company committed to push the boundaries of how technology can secure a smarter and more efficient construction and real estate industry. Today we provide our user-friendly digital tools and BIM Technology (3D information models) to leading contractors and advisors in more than 147 countries. And we are not slowing down our expansion journey anytime soon, so this is a great time to join us and directly influence the future of Dalux! Today we are present in 24 countries and counting, and therefore this is a great time to join us, and directly influence the future of Dalux!

Awesome! But what will my new role be?

In this role, you’ll work at the intersection of data and marketing, analyzing and interpreting data from a wide variety of marketing channels such as ads, social media, website performance, webinars, events, and more. Your insights will drive decision-making, shape marketing strategies, and optimize performance across the organization.

Your responsibilities will include:


Collecting, analyzing, and interpreting data from various marketing sources (e.g., Google Analytics, Google Ads, social platforms, events, webinars).
Developing and maintaining dashboards and reports using tools like Power BI, SQL, and Access.
Providing actionable insights to optimize campaign performance and achieve marketing goals.
Collaborating with Performance Marketing and other teams (Content, Events, Commercial Revenue Operations) to align on data-driven strategies.
Monitoring and reporting on KPIs, campaign ROI, and trends to guide both short-term and long-term planning.
Identifying areas of opportunity and proposing data-informed strategies for growth and efficiency.


Sure, sounds exciting! How can I be considered for this role?

You have +5 years of experience in marketing data analysis or a related field, with proficiency in Power BI, SQL, and Microsoft Access. Strong knowledge of Google Analytics and Google Ads dashboards, as well as analytical and problem-solving skills, are essential. Experience visualizing data for non-technical stakeholders and strong collaboration skills are also key.

Preferred qualifications include experience in performance marketing or commercial revenue operations, familiarity with A/B testing, and additional data visualization tools.

If you’re collaborative, curious, and eager to learn, you’ll thrive in our supportive and creative environment.

Why Choose Dalux?

At Dalux, we care—not just about our work and customers but about each other. We believe in creating a work environment that is light-hearted, informal, and welcoming, with room for everyone. Forget fancy titles and rigid dress codes; we’re here to make your work life both rewarding and enjoyable.

At our HQ in Østerbro, you’ll join a team of 17 skilled colleagues dedicated to driving high customer engagement. Networking with our users is our passion, and we deliver great content, engaging events, and cutting-edge ConTech insights.

Being part of a social company, you’ll also enjoy activities like wine tasting, running club, knitting club, and more. At Dalux, your personal and professional growth is important to us.

Application deadline:

As soon as possible
Show more

Title: Data Analyst - Maternity Cover (7 months)
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Scheduling isn't simply filling shifts. It's finding the sweet spot that enables businesses to grow and team members to enjoy the perfect work/life balance.






At Planday from Xero, we aim to use Agentic AI to build a future where managers can seamlessly free up invaluable time for their business and teams. We're not just building software: we're on a mission to make shift work more human, to change work/life balance from a luxury to a reality for all shift workers. We're using advanced technology to help humans reach their full potential. At work and in life.






Founded in 2004, Planday is headquartered in Copenhagen, Denmark and helps create perfect schedules for hundreds of thousands of users across the world.






As a Data Analyst, you'll be reporting directly to our Head of Data & Analytics and will play a strategic role in transforming complex data into actionable insights that directly fuel our business growth and critical decisions.


You'll craft compelling data narratives, turning raw information into valuable assets that guide product development and key strategic choices.


Collaborating across teams, you'll uncover pivotal metrics and deep customer insights, empowering informed decisions throughout Planday. Through impactful visualizations and persuasive communication, you'll ensure these insights resonate with stakeholders at all levels.


Furthermore, you'll leverage advanced analytical techniques to pioneer predictive modeling and automation, fostering a culture of data-driven innovation that is central to Planday's continued success.






This role is a maternity cover role for about 7 months.







What you'll do

Collaborate cross-functionally with product, commercial, and leadership teams to define, track, and report critical metrics, delivering comprehensive customer insights.
Design and maintain robust data models that transform raw data into high-value assets, ensuring accuracy and quality.
Develop impactful, hands-on solutions, visualizations, and dashboards across the business, primarily utilizing Tableau to communicate insights effectively.
Leverage proficiency in Python, R, and SQL for advanced data manipulation, statistical analysis, and ensuring high data quality.
Apply advanced statistical analysis techniques for summarizing, interpreting, and predicting data, alongside machine learning concepts for predictive modeling techniques.
Translate complex data into clear, actionable narratives through compelling data storytelling, impactful presentations, and strong interpersonal communication.
During your time with us we’re expecting key projects to include: Product-Market-Fit analysis, customer lifecycle insights, as well as supporting product teams.







Success looks like

Exceptional data models that consistently deliver accurate, high-quality data assets, underpinning strategic initiatives.
Proactive delivery of actionable insights and critical metrics that directly lead to informed decisions and tangible business improvements for product and commercial teams.
Development and implementation of intuitive and highly impactful visualizations and dashboards that significantly elevate data-driven decision-making across Planday.
Insights and recommendations that are consistently trusted and acted upon by product and commercial teams, stemming from rigorous analysis and robust data practices.
Clear and compelling communication of complex data insights, fostering understanding and alignment among stakeholders, resulting in measurable positive business impact.
Proactive problem-solving and innovative thinking in addressing data-related challenges, leading to continuous improvement and advancement in our analytical capabilities.
Successful exploration and implementation of advanced analytical techniques, including machine learning, to unlock new opportunities and generate groundbreaking insights.







What you'll bring with you

Proven experience in Python, R, and advanced SQL (including window functions, CTEs) for advanced data management and statistical analysis.
Proficiency in crafting compelling data stories, leveraging visualization tools like Tableau to transform complex datasets into clear, impactful visualizations that resonate with diverse stakeholders.
Proven capability in product opportunity sizing, metric development, and building robust metric trees to guide product strategy and evaluation.
Demonstrated ability to lead and optimize data wrangling and cleaning processes across multiple, complex projects.
Exceptional communication skills, capable of translating complex data insights into compelling narratives through data storytelling and high-impact presentations for both technical and non-technical audiences.
A highly analytical mindset, consistently identifying and solving complex data challenges with innovative solutions that directly drive data-driven strategic decisions.
Practical application of machine learning fundamentals to solve specific business problems through predictive modeling.







At Planday, we offer you

Benefits like pension, health insurance and generous vacation
Flexible remote work
Strong social culture with lots of team and company activities
Meaningful work – everyone at Planday contributes to improving the lives of shift workers around the globe
Healthy work-life balance and autonomous approach to work. We trust in you and your abilities







Finally, our offices are not just workplaces (although they are pretty nice and well-located, we have to say!). Plandayers are open and welcoming and at Planday, everyone has the freedom and support to show their true self at work.






At Planday, we firmly believe that diversity and inclusion are the cornerstones of innovation and a vibrant workplace culture, and we highly value the strength that diverse backgrounds offer.






As an equal opportunity employer, we strive to create an equitable experience for all our candidates throughout the process. Please let us know if you need reasonable accommodation during the application or interview process.


All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to any personal characteristics.

Show more

    • Proven capability in product opportunity sizing, metric development, and building robust metric trees to guide product strategy and evaluation.
    • Demonstrated ability to lead and optimize data wrangling and cleaning processes across multiple, complex projects.
    • Exceptional communication skills, capable of translating complex data insights into compelling narratives through data storytelling and high-impact presentations for both technical and non-technical audiences.
    • A highly analytical mindset, consistently identifying and solving complex data challenges with innovative solutions that directly drive data-driven strategic decisions.
    • Practical application of machine learning fundamentals to solve specific business problems through predictive modeling.



At Planday, we offer you

    • Benefits like pension, health insurance and generous vacation
    • Flexible remote work
    • Strong social culture with lots of team and company activities
    • Meaningful work – everyone at Planday contributes to improving the lives of shift workers around the globe
    • Healthy work-life balance and autonomous approach to work. We trust in you and your abilities



Finally, our offices are not just workplaces (although they are pretty nice and well-located, we have to say!). Plandayers are open and welcoming and at Planday, everyone has the freedom and support to show their true self at work.



At Planday, we firmly believe that diversity and inclusion are the cornerstones of innovation and a vibrant workplace culture, and we highly value the strength that diverse backgrounds offer.



As an equal opportunity employer, we strive to create an equitable experience for all our candidates throughout the process. Please let us know if you need reasonable accommodation during the application or interview process.

All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to any personal characteristics.

Title: HR Data Analyst
Description:
Are you eager to work with data analytics and HR? Want to help us take our data work to the next level in an HR department overseeing more than 5000 employees internationally? And does it sound good to work for a company owned by a foundation with a strong social purpose, donating more than 10 million Euros yearly to children and youth at risk? Then keep reading – this could be your thing!




About the job

Egmont's Corporate HR team is looking for someone to help us build a stronger data foundation. As our HR Data Analyst, you'll be essential in ensuring we have accurate, well-organised data to meet internal and external reporting requirements. Furthermore, you’ll help our divisions making better, data-driven decisions.




You'll be creating reports for both local and corporate management and supporting our local HR teams with their data needs. We're looking for someone who can make data accessible and useful across companies and HRIS systems. You'll be involved in building solutions to streamline and improve our data handling. Likewise, it is important that you can explore ways to automate our data processes freeing up time for more strategic HR initiatives.




Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

- Gather and consolidate data from various HRIS systems ensuring data validity and accuracy for reporting and analysis.

- Develop and maintain automated and ad hoc HR reports, including those related to pay equity and workforce demographics.

- Identify opportunities for automation and process standardisation to improve data quality.

- Collaborate with local HR teams to identify data needs and ensure alignment with group-level reporting requirements (e.g., pay transparency, CSRD).

- Collaborate with local IT teams to guide the development and maintenance of API integrations for data flow between HRIS systems and Egmont’s HR data hub.

- Analyse HR data to identify trends, patterns and insights for business improvements

- Oversee Egmont’s engagement survey, including secure validity in respondent data and administration in survey tool.




By fulfilling these responsibilities, you'll play a key role in enabling data-driven decision-making across our HR function and contributing to the success of Egmont's divisions.




What you’ll bring:

- A relevant degree or equivalent experience demonstrating a strong understanding of business principles and data analysis.

- Working experience in data management is desirable, particularly within an HR context.

- Proficiency in data analysis tools such as Excel, Power BI, etc.

- Good at building relationships and working with different teams across an organisation.

- Experience working in an international and decentralised organisation would be great.

- Fluent in English and one of the Scandinavian languages.

- Experience with data processing and API integrations in Python or similar is a plus.

- Knowledge of data querying in SQL or similar is a plus.




What can you expect:

You’ll be part of our Corporate HR function consisting of 10 HR professionals. In addition, you’ll collaborate with HR representatives working locally at division- or company level across all operating countries. We value a supportive environment that allows you to manage your responsibilities effectively. Moreover, we encourage cross-functional collaboration at all levels, giving you the opportunity to interact with a wide range of stakeholders and contribute to a variety of projects.




If you have any questions regarding the position please contact: HR Data Manager, Trond Svela Sand (+45 21 84 44 65; trond.sand@egmont.com).

If you are passionate about data analysis and want to make an impact in HR, we would love to hear from you.




Work address:

Vognmagergade 11

Copenhagen K, DK, 1148

Denmark




Please submit your application (CV and cover letter) as soon as possible. We will conduct interviews on an ongoing basis. Please use "Apply Now" on this site. We do not receive applications sent by e-mail.




Application deadline is 31/08/2025.




About Egmont

Egmont is a leading Nordic media group focused on strong content and platforms within film, tv, cinema, streaming, gaming, e-commerce, marketing services, educational platforms, magazines and books. Proud owner of strong companies like Nordisk Film, TV 2 in Norway, Lindhardt og Ringhof and Story House Egmont. Being a foundation, all profit is reinvested in our media companies and donated to help improve the lives of vulnerable children and young people and support film talents.

We bring stories to life.

Show more

Title: Data Analyst – Business Improvement
Place: Esbjerg, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do you want to be a part of a dedicated team working with Business Improvements across of Semco Maritime? Do you have a solid understanding of data, and do you have what it takes to match this with business needs? Do you want to work in a dynamic organizational setting, where every day is different? If so, we want to hear from you!

Your position

In your new position as Data Analyst in the Business Improvement department, you will be a valuable member of a dynamic team working with business improvements through digital transformation. You will work closely together with the business and develop needed digital improvements supporting Semco’s growth strategy.

Your place of work will be in Esbjerg, Denmark. The position is full-time, and you can expect Attendance at our office in Esbjerg on daily basis.

We are a team where a mindset for continuous improvement and optimization are key. As well as being agile towards supporting the business needs.

Your Tasks & Responsibilities

As a Data Analyst, you will be part of a team developing the needed digital data tools supporting Semco Maritime growth.

Your Tasks Will Include But Are Not Limited To


Support the organization with ad-hoc data analyses
Operational automation of manual workflows
Management of individual stakeholder needs
Maintenance of existing portfolio of solutions


Your Profile & Qualifications

We are looking for a newly graduated with relevant education, with solid understanding of data. It will be beneficial if you have knowledge of the entire Microsoft Power Platform like Power BI, Power apps, Power Automate etc.

You have a great overview, the ability to see the big picture, a structured approach, and are a team player.

You find it easy to work independently and take the initiative. You have drive and are motivated by a fast-track environment. You have a positive mindset and care deeply about the success of your work, your colleagues and the wider objectives set by the organization. You are able to communicate with others on a good and efficient basis and engage in the development of the department.

We expect you to have excellent written and verbal communication skills in Danish and English.

Technical Skills Knowledge of or basic understanding of concepts relating to the Microsoft power platform

MS Power Platform


MS Power Automate – Not mandatory, but beneficial
MS Power BI – Intermediate or above average.
MS Power Apps


Other Relevant Skills


SQL – basic
Excel incl. Power Query and VBA Coding


Welcome to Semco Maritime

At Semco Maritime, we create change. For people. For projects. And for the global energy sector. With us, you will join a community of over 2,500 of the most dedicated thinkers and doers in the energy industry who are driving real change and making their own personal mark on the global energy landscape.

While everyone knows why the energy transition is vital, we are concerned with the journey. How to get there. By providing the answers needed to make change real. Because we believe that global energy ambitions can only be realized through hard work and clever pragmatic solutions. This is what we do. This is what we invite you to participate in.

Safety is at the core of everything we do, and we are committed to protecting our people, partners, and the planet as we work towards a sustainable energy future.

So yes, working for us will change the energy sector – and may well change you too.

Care to join the movement?

Change. With us.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
About Us

Templafy is the next gen document generation platform that automates all document creation across organizations. Our platform eliminates manual document work allowing companies to drive governance, efficiency and ultimately business results. Templafy supports millions of users and enables over 800 enterprise customers such as KPMG, IKEA, BDO and more.

Founded in Copenhagen, Denmark, in 2014, Templafy’s success is built by our 60+ employee nationalities found at offices around the world. We believe when people feel they belong, have a voice, and feel heard, they are happier and perform better, and that way, everyone wins. Our innovation, diversity, and unique product have raised over 200 million in funding from Insight Venture Partners, Seed Capital, Dawn Capital, Damgaard Company and Golub Capital.




Who Will You Be Working With

You will be part of the Analytics & Insights product team—a cross-functional group of data engineers, analysts and software engineers dedicated to turning product data into clear, actionable intelligence that guides strategic decisions. Day to day you’ll partner with Engineering to keep our data pipelines and models robust, collaborate with Product Managers to design meaningful telemetry and experiments, and provide timely analyses to colleagues in Sales, Customer Success and Strategy so they can better serve our customers.




The deliverables you create—dashboards, self-service reports and concise narrative analyses—will inform decisions across the company, influencing both product direction and commercial conversations. Your success will rest on upholding data quality, championing best-practice analytics and keeping a diverse set of stakeholders aligned on common goals. If you enjoy translating complex data into insights people can act on, and you thrive in a highly collaborative environment, this team is the place to be.




How We Work

At Templafy, we cultivate an office-first, collaborative culture where strong relationships and teamwork fuel innovation. We operate in a highly collaborative environment, working closely with Product, Engineering, Sales, Customer Success, and Strategy to keep our data models robust and aligned with business goals.




We value data quality, best-practice analytics, and experimentation, and empower teams to self-organize around impactful work. Our hybrid model encourages in-office engagement, fostering a sense of community and shared purpose. We maintain a flat hierarchy where everyone’s voice is valued and great ideas are welcomed from any level.




Beyond day-to-day work, we emphasize learning and personal growth, providing time and resources for certifications, explorative internal projects, and thought leadership through meetups and talks. At Templafy, we’re not just building software—we’re shaping the future of how enterprises create and manage documents.




Technologies we use

Data Platform: Azure Synapse, Azure Data Lake, SQL Databases, Azure Functions, Synapse Analytics, dbt, Purview
Programming Languages: Python, SQL, Jinja, etc.
Data Reporting: Power BI, Excel, DAX
Hosting: 100% Azure




What We Expect From You

We’re looking for a senior data analyst who brings curiosity, a sharp eye for detail, and a product-focused mindset to help us unlock insights and guide data-informed decisions. You should have a strong analytical foundation and a track record of turning complex data into actionable recommendations.

You have at least 5 years of experience in data analysis or a related field, with proven expertise in writing complex SQL and working with large datasets.
You're comfortable using statistical programming languages such as R or Python and are familiar with modern data transformation tools like dbt.
You have hands-on experience with data visualization platforms such as Power BI, Tableau, or Looker, and are confident in presenting insights clearly to both technical and non-technical audiences.
Your strong communication skills help you translate data into narratives that drive product thinking and decision-making.
You’re structured in your approach, proactive in identifying opportunities for impact, and thrive in cross-functional environments where collaboration is key.
It would be an advantage if you have a background in statistics and machine learning.




Benefits

Employee equity program
Private health insurance
Company lunch contribution
Phone and broadband covered by company
Centrally located office – easy access to public transportation
Company events and team activities
Calm and classpass apps
Flexible work environment




Templafy is a workplace of belongingness. To us this means that you have a voice, you dare to speak up, and your voice is heard. We focus on offering an environment that allows all employees to feel that they belong regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, gender, gender identity, genetic information, parental or pregnancy status, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, or other status.

Show more
