Title: Student Worker, Procurement Data Analyst
Place: Billund, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description

Are you interested in shaping the future of LEGO’s purchasing through innovative AI solutions?

"Bring your digital and data expertise to the LEGO Group’s Procurement team! Help us harness the power of AI platforms to enhance our purchasing processes to buy better, faster, and more sustainably.”


Core Responsibilities

This student worker role is designed to help you build a strong foundation in both data analytics and procurement operations, setting you up for a successful career in either discipline. You will learn to





Prepare, clean, and maintain high-quality procurement data to support digitalisation and AI readiness.
Understand and promote data integrity and best practices in data management.
Design and build automated applications and workflows using Microsoft Power Platform (Power BI, Power Apps, Power Automate).
Learn key procurement processes such as sourcing, contract management, and supplier management, through hands-on involvement in activities delivered by the Procurement Centre of Excellence.
Participate in Supplier Risk Assessments, contributing to how we evaluate and manage supplier performance and exposure.
You’ll be surrounded by professionals who will mentor and support you, while giving you real responsibilities from day one.




Play your part in our team succeeding

The Procurement Centre of Excellence is responsible for delivering operational efficiencies from the LEGO Group’s Procurement systems and processes for the Global Procurement team.

The student worker reports to the Director of Procurement Transformation and will play a key role in preparing for the introduction of artificial intelligence into procurement digital solutions. The role will focus on ensuring the quality, structure, and availability of data needed to support these innovations, while also contributing to the core procurement activities delivered by the Centre of Excellence team.

The Procurement organization is based across the LEGO hubs and sites; Billund, Singapore, Shanghai, Enfield, London, Shenzhen, and in other manufacturing locations Czech Republic, Hungary, China and Mexico. This position will be based in Billund, Denmark and will be for 12 months.

Do you have what it takes?





It is a prerequisite that you are enrolled in an educational institution during your employment as a student worker.
You are a student in procurement, Supply Chain, IT, business, data science, engineering, or other related field.
Are interested in data, digital tools, and procurement operations.
Some familiarity with Microsoft Excel and ideally some exposure to Microsoft Power BI, Power Apps, or Power Automate (training will be provided).
Proactive mindset with attention to detail and a drive to solve problems.
Strong collaboration and communication skills in an international environment.
Ability to build strong stakeholder relationships.
Capacity to thrive in a fast-paced, challenging, and unpredictable environment.
Understanding of Operational Procurement.
High tolerance to work across multiple functions.
Ability to work in a global team.
English at fluent level is required.




Applications are reviewed on an ongoing basis. However, please note we do amend or withdraw our jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to any advertised closing date. So, if you're interested in this role we encourage you to apply as soon as possible.

What’s in it for you?

Here is what you can expect

Family Care Leave - We offer enhanced paid leave options for those important times.

Insurances – All colleagues are covered by our life and disability insurance which provides protection and peace of mind.

Wellbeing - We want our people to feel well and thrive. We offer resources and benefits to nurture physical and mental wellbeing along with opportunities to build community and inspire creativity.

Colleague Discount – We know you'll love to build, so from day 1 you will qualify for our generous colleague discount.

Bonus - We do our best work to succeed together. When goals are reached and if eligible, you'll be rewarded through our bonus scheme.

Workplace - When you join the team you'll be assigned a primary workplace location i.e. one of our Offices, stores or factories. Our hybrid work policy means an average of 3 days per week in the office. The hiring team will discuss the policy and role eligibility with you during the recruitment process.

Children are our role models. Their curiosity, creativity and imagination inspire everything we do. We strive to create a diverse, dynamic and inclusive culture of play at the LEGO Group, where everyone feels safe, valued and they belong.

The LEGO Group is highly committed to equal employment opportunity and equal pay and seeks to encourage applicants from all backgrounds (eg. sex, gender identity or expression, race/ethnicity, national origin, sexual orientation, disability, age and religion) to apply for roles in our team.

The LEGO Group is fully committed to Children’s Rights and Child Wellbeing across the globe. Candidates offered positions with high engagement with children are required to take part in Child Safeguarding Background Screening, as a condition of the offer.

Thank you for sharing our global commitment to Children’s Rights.

Just imagine building your dream career.

Then make it real.

Join the LEGO® team today.
Show more

Workplace - When you join the team you'll be assigned a primary workplace location i.e. one of our Offices, stores or factories. Our hybrid work policy means an average of 3 days per week in the office. The hiring team will discuss the policy and role eligibility with you during the recruitment process.

Children are our role models. Their curiosity, creativity and imagination inspire everything we do. We strive to create a diverse, dynamic and inclusive culture of play at the LEGO Group, where everyone feels safe, valued and they belong.

The LEGO Group is highly committed to equal employment opportunity and equal pay and seeks to encourage applicants from all backgrounds (eg. sex, gender identity or expression, race/ethnicity, national origin, sexual orientation, disability, age and religion) to apply for roles in our team.

The LEGO Group is fully committed to Children’s Rights and Child Wellbeing across the globe. Candidates offered positions with high engagement with children are required to take part in Child Safeguarding Background Screening, as a condition of the offer.

Thank you for sharing our global commitment to Children’s Rights.

Just imagine building your dream career.

Then make it real.

Join the LEGO® team today.

Title: Analyst
Description:
Do you enjoy simplifying complexity, working with many stakeholders, and helping people succeed through better digital tools? Are you able to listen, challenge, and guide decision-making in areas where opinions are strong and diverse? Do you see the value in working with data?

If so, BESTSELLER TECH is looking for you to join our Master Data team as our new Analyst.

YOUR TEAM

Join BESTSELLER TECH’s Master Data team – a dedicated and collaborative group based in Brande and Aarhus. We meet weekly in person, thrive on strong partnerships, and take pride in building and owning our own systems. Together, we make sure data is structured, governed and geared for the future.

You’ll work closely with teams across sourcing, retail coordination, country admin, TECH and finance. Our current priorities include improving data quality, reducing duplicates, cleaning up outdated processes, and assigning clear ownership across core entities. Long-term, we’ll also explore new technologies to strengthen our foundation further.

YOUR ROLE

As our new Analyst, you will bridge business and technology to improve the way BESTSELLER handles its most critical data—covering customers, suppliers, users, and locations. Your core mission will be to understand how our business works, identify where we can do better, and collaborate with developers to create sustainable and scalable solutions.

You will take part in the entire lifecycle: from early dialogue and process understanding to defining user stories, supporting testing, and guiding rollouts. You'll help us turn manual, fragmented work into structured, automated processes that support our brands and functions worldwide.

More specifically, you will


Analyze business needs and system landscapes to propose efficient, scalable solutions.
Collaborate across global teams to align on priorities and outcomes.
Participate in or lead workshops to align expectations, challenge assumptions, and uncover root causes of data challenges.
Support the delivery and rollout of features, including communication, documentation, and change support.
Help drive a more data-driven culture through knowledge sharing, training, and structured guidance with our stakeholders.
Assist in driving and expanding a shared Data Governance framework across Master Data entities.


YOUR PROFILE

You are a people-oriented problem solver with a curious mindset and a passion for meaningful change. You thrive in complex environments and feel energised by the opportunity to improve how things work – and how they could work better. You’re confident facilitating dialogue across diverse teams and turning input into action. You ask the right questions, challenge assumptions, and make progress – even when perspectives vary.

We imagine you bring:


Experience working with data – such as modeling, structuring, and organizing complex datasets.
A strong analytical mindset and the ability to uncover improvement opportunities through business process analysis.
Solid communication skills and an ability to guide stakeholders.
Comfortable educating users and stakeholders about master data management principles and how to apply them in daily operations.
Experience with SQL and process design or system development is an advantage.
Fluent in English, both written and spoken.


WE LOOK FORWARD TO HEARING FROM YOU

If you have any questions about the position, please feel free to contact Jacob Zachariasen at +45 52 15 10 61. To apply, send us your CV as soon as possible and no later than 1st of September 2025. We review and interview candidates on an ongoing basis and reserve the right to close the job ad once we find the right candidate.

Location: Brande or Aarhus.

About Bestseller Tech

We are more than 400 people strong, located in Denmark, Spain and Rwanda. We are excited about what we do, but there’s more to us than our tech stack. We are young at heart and thrive in a flat organization. Our teams are agile and empowered with end-to-end responsibility. We want to be at the forefront of the newest technologies, and we move forward together. Every day. If you want to play a significant part in empowering our business, then welcome to BESTSELLER TECH. BESTSELLER TECH is part of the worldwide fashion company BESTSELLER. For more information, please go to www.bestseller.com.
Show more

Title: Quantitative Researcher
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Huge opportunity for sell-side researchers to join a buy-side firm with clear progression to trader and PM seats at a leading commodities firm.




Overview

Join an asset modelling team building in-house pricing libraries for commodity options. Design, implement and productionise stochastic models that drive valuation, optimisation and risk for complex optionality in commodity assets.




The Firm

Build best-in-class, proprietary optimisation models rather than buying off the shelf.
High autonomy, pragmatic culture and genuine work–life balance.
Clear path to broaden into options trading or complex risk ownership as the platform scales.
Team track record in profitable commodity trading with ambition to lead model-driven decision making.




What you will do

Develop and extend options pricing libraries for commodities, with calibration and sensitivities.
Build stochastic models for assets and storages, including model choice, assumptions and risk implications.
Implement automatic differentiation to compute Greeks and accelerate calibration.
Partner with risk and trading to embed models into decision making and PnL attribution.
Own code from research to production with testing, performance tuning and documentation.




Requirements

Strong mathematics background in stochastic calculus and probability, with ability to apply theory.
Experience pricing exotic derivative libraries, not just using black-box libraries.
Solid coding skills in Python; exposure to C++ or Java is a plus.
Front-office quant experience in derivatives pricing or complex risk preferred.
2+ years professional experience.
MSc or PhD in a mathematic or quantitative field.
Experience with automatic differentiation frameworks for Greeks.
Options risk management know-how and interest in trading around complex risk.
Familiarity with energy options is a plus, not required.




Fit clarifications

Not e-trading or market making. Focus is modelling and valuation for options optimisation.
Backgrounds from front-office banking or competitors working on storage modelling are relevant.




Location

Denmark primary site. Flexibility for limited remote work.




Compensation

Base €80 - €120k
Bonus: capped at 200% of base. Potential formulaic PnL cut on the asset book at 0.X% depending on seniority and scope.

Show more

Title: Senior Specialist, eCommerce Analytics & Insights
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you passionate about driving eCommerce growth through data-driven insights and digital innovation?

If you have a strategic mindset, a deep understanding of digital analytics, and a talent for turning complex data into clear, actionable insights, you might be the perfect fit for our Senior Specialist, eCommerce Analytics & Insights role at Pandora’s Global Office in Copenhagen.

As a Senior Specialist in eCommerce Analytics & Insights, you will play a pivotal role in shaping the future of our digital performance. You’ll lead the development and implementation of best-in-class website analytics practices, ensuring that data is not only accurate and reliable but also deeply embedded in our commercial decision-making processes.

You will act as the key liaison between Adobe data engineering teams and the broader analytics community, translating business needs into technical solutions and ensuring seamless collaboration across functions. Your insights will directly influence strategic initiatives, helping Pandora deliver exceptional digital experiences and drive measurable business impact.

In this role, you’ll also champion data governance, oversee data quality assurance, and lead the creation of advanced dashboards and visualizations tailored to senior stakeholders. You’ll work closely with regional eCommerce teams and internal partners to anticipate and exceed their analytics needs, while fostering a culture of continuous improvement and innovation. We are looking for a highly analytical, commercially minded individual with a strong foundation in digital analytics, stakeholder management, and data storytelling. If you thrive in a fast-paced, cross-functional environment and are passionate about the power of data to drive growth, we’d love to hear from you.

Key responsibilities:


Define and evolve best-in-class commercial website analytics practices aligned with Pandora’s digital transformation agenda
Act as the primary bridge between Adobe data engineering and commercial analytics teams
Integrate Adobe Analytics insights into core business workstreams to influence strategic decisions
Drive data integrity initiatives across all tracking and reporting mechanisms. Analyse, document and resolve inconsistencies while controlling business impact through stakeholder management. Lead advanced data analysis and visualization efforts, delivering insights through dashboards and reports with multi-system data inputs.
Build strong partnerships with regional eCommerce and internal teams to elevate performance reporting and consolidate strategic data needs into clear technical development requirements.
Promote continuous learning and innovation within the analytics function
Mentor colleagues and elevate the organization’s analytical maturity



Ideally, you have:


4–5 years of experience in website analytics, with at least 4 years owning or managing analytics systems
A Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Data Engineering, Economics, or a related field (or equivalent experience)
Proven ability to translate complex commercial needs into actionable analytics improvements
Experience with Adobe Analytics (certification is a plus)
Familiarity with data visualization tools such as Power BI
Strong understanding of eCommerce KPIs and the commercial impact of digital analytics



Furthermore, we hope to see that you are:


A strategic thinker with exceptional critical thinking and problem-solving skills
Detail-oriented with a high level of accuracy in data interpretation
A clear communicator who can translate data into compelling stories for diverse audiences
Skilled at building trust and partnerships across technical and commercial teams
Proactive, self-motivated, and accountable for delivering results
Proficient in Microsoft Office, especially Excel and PowerPoint



Your new team

Pandora is a company with a big heart, and we take great pride in treating our people well. You’ll join a passionate, ambitious team within an international, high-impact function.

Additional Information

Global Career Band: 5A

Did we get your attention?

If you see yourself in the position and would like to become a part of Pandora’s future, please do not hesitate to apply. We look forward to hearing from you! We process applications on a continuous basis, which is why we encourage you to send your application as soon as possible. You can also read more about Pandora on our corporate site www.pandoragroup.com.

Icing on the cake

You will be working out of our beautiful Head Office in Copenhagen V, established in 2016 and designed to unite and inspire our teams. Besides our beautiful interior design, we are also proud of our LEED Gold Certification for Energy and Environmental Design. This means that we use as few natural resources as possible and that we use them with respect. The result is a professional and dynamic space that is unique, comfortable and inspirational – and delivers a true Pandora experience to anyone who works here or comes to visit.

About Pandora

Pandora is the world's largest jewellery brand, specialising in the design, crafting and marketing of accessible luxury jewellery made from high-quality materials. Each piece is created to inspire self-expression, allowing people to share their stories and passions through meaningful jewellery. Pandora jewellery is sold in more than 100 countries through 6,800 points of sale, including more than 2,700 concept stores.

Headquartered in Copenhagen, Denmark, Pandora employs 37,000 people worldwide and crafts its jewellery using only recycled silver and gold. Pandora is committed to leadership in sustainability and has set out to halve greenhouse gas emissions across its value chain by 2030. Pandora is listed on the Nasdaq Copenhagen stock exchange and generated revenue of DKK 31.7 billion (EUR 4.2 billion) in 2024.

Recognised by the Financial Times as one of Europe’s Best Workplaces and ranked #1 among Danish companies, Pandora is committed to building an inclusive and diverse workplace. We believe that reflecting the diversity of society in how we engage with our customers is essential to fulfilling our purpose: to give a voice to people’s loves. We are dedicated to nurturing a culture where everyone feels respected, valued, and empowered to thrive.
Show more

We are dedicated to nurturing a culture where everyone feels respected, valued, and empowered to thrive.

Title: Business Intelligence Studentermedhjælper
Place: Odense, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Hos Visuel Data hjælper vi virksomheder med at gøre komplekse data enkle, visuelle og værdiskabende. Vi er i vækst – og nu leder vi efter en nysgerrig og struktureret studentermedhjælper, der vil have praktisk erfaring i krydsfeltet mellem data, kommunikation og virksomhedsledelse.




🧩 Dine opgaver kan bl.a. være:

Bidrage til datavisualisering og præsentationer i Microsoft Power BI
Kommunikere med kunder og afdække deres behov
Assistere med analyser, research og talnørderi




🎯 Vi forestiller os, at du:

Er i gang med en relevant videregående uddannelse inden for business (fx erhvervsøkonomi, økonomi, finans, supply chain, produktion)
Kan lide at arbejde med tal, logik og matematik
Arbejder struktureret og er nysgerrig af natur
Har gode kommunikationsevner – både på dansk og engelsk




💡 Vi tilbyder:

Et fleksibelt studiejob med mulighed for faglig udvikling
Indblik i, hvordan forskellige virksomheder drives, og hvordan data kan optimere deres drift
Muligheden for at blive en ægte Power BI-ninja
Et uformelt arbejdsmiljø med højt til loftet og plads til idéer
Show more

Title: Data Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Azure Data Engineer




Som Data Engineer hos cVation bygger du dataplatforme, datawarehouses og MLOps løsninger i skyen for vores kunder. Vi bruger teknologier som Databricks, Fabric, Spark, Azure Machine Learning, Data Factory og Azure Synapse. Vi søger profiler med erfaring inden for enten MLOps, datawarehouses eller dataplatforme, som vil bygge innovative dataløsninger.




cVation er et dansk udviklings- og konsulenthus, som bygger avancerede cloudløsninger på Azure med afsæt i markedets hurtigste og mest agile metoder. cVation blev stiftet i 2014, har modtaget tre Børsen Gazeller og vundet Microsofts Partner Award for App Innovation tre år i træk. Vi arbejder dedikeret med agile arbejdsmetoder, DevOps og Test Driven Development. Vi sætter en ære i at levere software af den højeste kvalitet, og tager desuden principperne fra DevOps og software engineering med i vores dataprojekter, hvilket betyder, at tests, Infrastructure as Code og automatisering er i fokus.




Hvilken rolle får du?




Du kommer til at arbejde på et af vores dataprojekter med et projektteam bestående af arkitekter, software udviklere og DevOps specialister. Du vil have fuldt fokus på ét projekt og være tilknyttet ét team ad gangen.




Din rolle bliver at




rådgive om og bygge datawarehouse/dataplatformsløsninger i skyen
rådgive om og bygge løsninger indenfor MLOps
bidrage til design og implementering af den optimale Azure infrastruktur
sikre, at alt opsætning og provisionering sker som infrastructure as code, fx. Terraform
fuldautomatiseret overvågning og skalering af løsninger




Hvad forventer vi af dig?




Du har en videregående uddannelse i software engineering, human centered AI el lign. fra DTU, ITU eller KU samt erfaring i data engineering
Du har enten fullstack MLOps erfaring, kan skrive Python og har lyst til data engineering-delen - eller måske kommer du i stedet med erfaring i at bygge datawarehouse og dataplatforme.
Du vil gerne arbejde med de nyeste teknologier i Azure
Du har erfaring med - og vil gerne blive klogere på - flere af følgende teknologier: Data Factory - Databricks - Fabric - Spark - Azure Synapse - Azure Machine Learning - MLflow - Data Warehouse - Data platform - Python - Azure DevOps, Powershell, Azure CLI, ARM templates, YAML, Bicep, Terraform, Git
Du vil gerne indgå i et agilt setup, hvor krav og retning hurtigt kan ændres, men hvor medbestemmelse og frihed er i højsædet
Du er flydende i skrift og tale på dansk og engelsk, og trives med at have den daglige kontakt med kunden
Du har evnen til at omsætte kundebehov til handling




Det vil være en fordel, hvis:

Du er vant til at arbejde som konsulent i et udviklingsteam i tæt samarbejde med arkitekter og software udviklere




Som person er du selvstændig, ansvarsbevidst, initiativrig, eksekverende og serviceminded. Du er drevet af at lære nyt og vild med at holde dig ajour med de nyeste metoder og teknologier. Du er engageret og motiveret i alt hvad du foretager dig. Hvis du også er glad for at sparre med dygtige kollegaer og trives med at løfte i flok, vil du passe perfekt ind hos os.




Hvad tilbyder vi?




Du kommer til at indgå i vores voksende team, hvor høj faglighed, innovation og arbejdsglæde er i højsæde. Det høje faglige niveau blandt dine kollegaer giver en unik mulighed for at arbejde med de bedste, og vi tager din faglige udvikling alvorligt. Vi har en flad organisation med et minimum af administration, hvor ledelsens døre altid er åbne, og der er god plads til både bordfodbold, fredagsbar, frokost på kajen og et aktivt liv udenfor arbejdstid. Flere gange om året afholder vi hackathons, hvor vi i teams dykker ned i præcis de emner, som udviklerne finder interessante. En del af vores kultur er også, at vi gerne ser alle komme med input til hvordan vi kan optimere, udvikle og forbedre cVation.




Hvorfor vælge os som din nye arbejdsplads?




Vores fundament er løsninger bygget på Microsoft Azure Cloud. Alle vores medarbejdere mestrer cloud-native udvikling og DevOps. Vi arbejder i projekter og engagerer os hands-on i fælles teams med vores kunder for at sikre kvalitet og effektiv videndeling.




Vi er passionerede omkring at hjælpe vores kunder med at få det maksimale ud af cloudteknologien. For os er cloud ikke blot infrastruktur eller et nyt datacenter i skyen. Teknologien giver virksomheder mulighed for at skabe væsentligt mere værdi og arbejde med agilitet og innovation på en helt ny måde.




Vi har været med fra starten, da cloud blev udviklet og tilgængeligt. Vi tilbyder således vores årelange erfaring og dybe cloud ekspertise samt en værktøjskasse med alle vores best practices i form af accelerationsplatformen CADD. Den dækker over gennemprøvede værktøjer, rammeværk, effektive udviklingsmetoder og færdige automatiseringskomponenter. Alt dette for at sikre, at projekter kommer hurtigt og sikkert fra start.




Du vil blive en del af en virksomhed, som tror på, at alle har betydning, og at det skal være sjovt at gå på arbejde hver dag. Du vil få kollegaer, der er interesseret i at lære og har ønske om at blive de bedste til det, de gør. Vi tilbyder derfor gode muligheder for at udvikle dig.




Interesseret?




Klik på Easy Apply knappen, hvis du vil arbejde med de nyeste teknologier. Hvis du har under 5 års erfaring, bedes du også vedhæfte dine karakterblade i samme fil som dit CV. Vi behandler din ansøgning fortroligt og arrangerer løbende interviews.




Har du spørgsmål til jobbet, eller vil du høre mere om cVation, er du meget velkommen til at kontakte:




Maiken Pelby, Head of People & Culture, T/ 42612828, map@cvation.com




Vi ser frem til at høre fra dig!

Show more
HTML:
Azure Data Engineer


Som Data Engineer hos cVation bygger du dataplatforme, datawarehouses og MLOps løsninger i skyen for vores kunder. Vi bruger teknologier som Databricks, Fabric, Spark, Azure Machine Learning, Data Factory og Azure Synapse. Vi søger profiler med erfaring inden for enten MLOps, datawarehouses eller dataplatforme, som vil bygge innovative dataløsninger.


cVation er et dansk udviklings- og konsulenthus, som bygger avancerede cloudløsninger på Azure med afsæt i markedets hurtigste og mest agile metoder. cVation blev stiftet i 2014, har modtaget tre Børsen Gazeller og vundet Microsofts Partner Award for App Innovation tre år i træk. Vi arbejder dedikeret med agile arbejdsmetoder, DevOps og Test Driven Development. Vi sætter en ære i at levere software af den højeste kvalitet, og tager desuden principperne fra DevOps og software engineering med i vores dataprojekter, hvilket betyder, at tests, Infrastructure as Code og automatisering er i fokus.


Hvilken rolle får du?


Du kommer til at arbejde på et af vores dataprojekter med et projektteam bestående af arkitekter, software udviklere og DevOps specialister. Du vil have fuldt fokus på ét projekt og være tilknyttet ét team ad gangen.


Din rolle bliver at


  • rådgive om og bygge datawarehouse/dataplatformsløsninger i skyen
  • rådgive om og bygge løsninger indenfor MLOps
  • bidrage til design og implementering af den optimale Azure infrastruktur
  • sikre, at alt opsætning og provisionering sker som infrastructure as code, fx. Terraform
  • fuldautomatiseret overvågning og skalering af løsninger


Hvad forventer vi af dig?


  • Du har en videregående uddannelse i software engineering, human centered AI el lign. fra DTU, ITU eller KU samt erfaring i data engineering
  • Du har enten fullstack MLOps erfaring, kan skrive Python og har lyst til data engineering-delen - eller måske kommer du i stedet med erfaring i at bygge datawarehouse og dataplatforme.
  • Du vil gerne arbejde med de nyeste teknologier i Azure
  • Du har erfaring med - og vil gerne blive klogere på - flere af følgende teknologier: Data Factory - Databricks - Fabric - Spark - Azure Synapse - Azure Machine Learning - MLflow - Data Warehouse - Data platform - Python - Azure DevOps, Powershell, Azure CLI, ARM templates, YAML, Bicep, Terraform, Git
  • Du vil gerne indgå i et agilt setup, hvor krav og retning hurtigt kan ændres, men hvor medbestemmelse og frihed er i højsædet
  • Du er flydende i skrift og tale på dansk og engelsk, og trives med at have den daglige kontakt med kunden
  • Du har evnen til at omsætte kundebehov til handling


Det vil være en fordel, hvis:

  • Du er vant til at arbejde som konsulent i et udviklingsteam i tæt samarbejde med arkitekter og software udviklere


Som person er du selvstændig, ansvarsbevidst, initiativrig, eksekverende og serviceminded. Du er drevet af at lære nyt og vild med at holde dig ajour med de nyeste metoder og teknologier. Du er engageret og motiveret i alt hvad du foretager dig. Hvis du også er glad for at sparre med dygtige kollegaer og trives med at løfte i flok, vil du passe perfekt ind hos os.


Hvad tilbyder vi?


Du kommer til at indgå i vores voksende team, hvor høj faglighed, innovation og arbejdsglæde er i højsæde. Det høje faglige niveau blandt dine kollegaer giver en unik mulighed for at arbejde med de bedste, og vi tager din faglige udvikling alvorligt. Vi har en flad organisation med et minimum af administration, hvor ledelsens døre altid er åbne, og der er god plads til både bordfodbold, fredagsbar, frokost på kajen og et aktivt liv udenfor arbejdstid. Flere gange om året afholder vi hackathons, hvor vi i teams dykker ned i præcis de emner, som udviklerne finder interessante. En del af vores kultur er også, at vi gerne ser alle komme med input til hvordan vi kan optimere, udvikle og forbedre cVation.


Hvorfor vælge os som din nye arbejdsplads?


Vores fundament er løsninger bygget på Microsoft Azure Cloud. Alle vores medarbejdere mestrer cloud-native udvikling og DevOps. Vi arbejder i projekter og engagerer os hands-on i fælles teams med vores kunder for at sikre kvalitet og effektiv videndeling.


Vi er passionerede omkring at hjælpe vores kunder med at få det maksimale ud af cloudteknologien. For os er cloud ikke blot infrastruktur eller et nyt datacenter i skyen. Den dækker over gennemprøvede værktøjer, rammeværk, effektive udviklingsmetoder og færdige automatiseringskomponenter. Alt dette for at sikre, at projekter kommer hurtigt og sikkert fra start.


Du vil blive en del af en virksomhed, som tror på, at alle har betydning, og at det skal være sjovt at gå på arbejde hver dag. Du vil få kollegaer, der er interesseret i at lære og har ønske om at blive de bedste til det, de gør. Vi tilbyder derfor gode muligheder for at udvikle dig.

Title: ESG & Impact Analyst
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
We’re looking for a sharp, curious ESG & Impact Analyst to help shape how we measure what matters.




As a venture house spanning evergreen investment company PSV Foundry and the two individual VC funds PSV Tech and PSV Hafnium, we bring two decades of experience in VC fund building, startup investing and portfolio management to the table. Born out of DTU – The Technical University of Denmark – we’re not here to box-tick compliance. We’re all in on the one-to-one correlation between impact and business success. In this role, you’ll be key to making that connection real.




This is a hands-on role, ideal for someone who wants to work at the frontier of impact, tech, and venture. You’ll get a front-row seat to a vibrant community of founders and ecosystem players, and the chance to leave your fingerprints on something that’s built to scale.




What you’ll (actually) be doing

You’ll be working alongside our Head of ESG & Impact, directly supporting our mission to make ESG and Impact data useful, actionable, and founder-friendly. Your work help lay the foundation for how future startups across the Nordics, and possibly beyond, integrate impact strategy into their core business.




You’ll assist founders in understanding sustainability expectations, navigating early-stage ESG & Impact challenges, and co-creating simple, scalable impact strategies. Think; practical input on KPIs, diversity metrics, responsible AI use – and practical, founder-first playbooks.




You’ll support VC funds through due diligence processes, build and verify emissions baselines for target companies, and turn ESG-speak into clear, actionable reporting that matters to LPs. Think: Scope 3 progress across PSV, tailored impact frameworks aligned with funds strategies, policies that make sense for early-stage investing, systems to track, aggregate, and improve both financial and impact KPIs - from first deal to exit.




You’ll manage the backend of our ESG & Impact reporting process – collecting the right data, ensuring regulatory alignment (hello SFRD, CSRD and the Taxonomy), and improving how we use that data sheet to sharpen strategy and decision-making. Think: regular data collection, structuring, and analysis of ESG & Impact data – ensuring data accuracy and timely reporting to internal and external stakeholders.




You’ll assist in peer research on ESG regulation, impact trends, and responsible investment practices to keep PSV ahead of the curve.




What we think you bring

Let’s be honest we’re not hiring your CV. We’re hiring your brain. Your bias for action. Your “I haven’t tried it before, but I Googled it, or maybe more relevant, I asked the chat and made it work” kind of energy.




We want you who turns messy questions into clarity without asking for a 40-slide brief. The one who looks at a dashboard and thinks: Cool, but how does this help founders actually do better stuff?




We think this might look like:

You’re a BSc or MSc student in something like data science, sustainability, innovation, economics, or something similar that sounds clever on Linkedin.




You’re a student who flinches at the phrase “business as usual” and physically recoils when someone brings up CSR like it’s still 2006.




You’re “structured”, “data-driven”, and “know your way around a spreadsheet (don’t we all, after crying over one too many Google Sheets?)




You’re familiar with frameworks like the GHG Protocol and accounting, Sustainable Finance Disclosure Regulation, Taxanomy assessments etc. – aka the alphabet soup of sustainability.




You’re a person who “cares deeply about people and planet” and dreams in systems-thinking slides




In fewer words, if you’re someone who can hold a climate report and a commercial mindset in the same hand, then we really want to talk.




We’d love to hear from you - even if you don’t tick every box. This is just our best attempt to describe the role realistically. We don’t care about traditional credentials if your drive and mindset are aligned. Sometimes, the right person is someone we haven’t yet had the imagination to look for.

Title: Business Insights & Report Specialist
Description:
We are seeking an experienced Business Insight & Reporting Specialist with expertise in Power BI Reporting/Front-end to join our Data & Digitalization team. This role will be instrumental in developing, maintaining, and optimizing reporting solutions that drive business insights, using a combination of tabular models and diverse data sources. The individual will also be a key player in implementing our data strategy. 
 

The role:

This role will focus on designing dynamic performance reports and dashboards, mainly using Power BI, to provide valuable insights for business evaluation and strategic planning. The right candidate will collaborate with senior leadership from all departments and IT teams to ensure data integrity and accessible reporting.

Furthermore, you will:

Design and deliver Power BI reports and dashboards highlighting KPIs on a strategic, tactical and an operational level.
Provide regular and ad-hoc reporting to support the whole business to become more data driven.
Collaborate with teams to align reports with organizational goals.
Develop interactive reports and dashboards integrating data from multiple sources using Power BI.
Ensure reports are accessible and actionable, supporting business users in decision-making.
Maintain comprehensive documentation for reports, models, and data processes.
Implement controls to ensure data quality and manage access protocols.
 


The Team:

The Data & Digitalization team consists of three sub-departments: Applications, Data Strategy & Governance and BI & Architecture. You will be in the BI & Architecture team with four colleagues. All of them are located at the Aarhus office. However, you will be working closely together with Data Strategy & Governance and Applications. You will be working with and reporting for the senior leaders to support strategic decision-making based on Power BI reports.


Qualifications:

The ideal candidate will have strong experience in Power BI Front-end development, with a demonstrated ability to track, analyze, and communicate financial and operational performance metrics to support informed decision-making across the business.
 

Furthermore, you have:

A Bachelor’s or master’s degree in Business Intelligence, Finance, Data Science, UX Design, or a related field.
5+ years of experience in Power BI front-end, financial reporting, or business intelligence, with a strong focus on performance management reporting.
Proven expertise in Power BI, including creating visually compelling, report and dashboards development, data modelling, DAX, and Power Query.
Worked with tabular models and the creating of semantic models.
In-depth knowledge of financial and operational performance metrics and experience reporting on KPIs such as revenue, margins, costs, and profitability.
Excellent problem-solving skills with a proactive approach to identifying and addressing reporting issues.


What will make you stand out:

Power BI certification (e.g., Microsoft Certified: Data Analyst Associate).
Experience with Microsoft Fabric.
Understanding of SQL for querying data sources and enhancing reporting capabilities.
 


We offer

At Stibo System, we offer more than just a job. We put people first and inspire you to become the best version of yourself.

We care about our colleague’s work-life balance, and we offer flexibility through a hybrid work model

International: A growing global company, worldwide career opportunities, and multicultural teams

Well-being: A caring and inspiring environment, promoting a happy and healthy lifestyle through a wide range of facilities and activities
 



Join Stibo Systems, where we embrace 'All Kinds of Data Minds.' 

Stibo Systems is a global company with a Nordic heritage. We help companies transform into digital leaders through market-leading multidomain master data management that delivers transparency. Through our solution, large brands (our customers) connect data across their products, customers, stores, employees, suppliers, digital assets and much, much more.


Our people are key to our success and at Stibo Systems, you'll find an environment that values data driven, creativity, curiosity, and analytical thinking. We're committed to making you feel trusted, invested in, and connected, fostering a workplace where every data mind thrives. Be part of our journey to digital leadership!


Interested?

We invite candidates for interviews on a continuous basis, so please apply as soon as possible.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
As the world pushes toward net zero emissions, there's a growing need to electrify more of our energy use and scale up renewable generation, but that shift isn't without its challenges!




High levels of renewables like solar and wind can disrupt both the physical operation of power grids and the economics of energy markets.




Our focus is tackling these complexities through faster, smarter, and more automated energy trading. By combining deep market insight, strong analytics, and a solid presence in key markets, we stay agile and ready to capture the commercial opportunities that come with a rapidly changing energy landscape.




What will your role involve?




Creating efficient data pipelines to collect, process, and store data from various sources, ensuring data quality and reliability
Integrating data from different systems and sources, ensuring data consistency and accuracy
Designing and implementing data models to support analytical and reporting needs, optimising for performance and scalability
Collaborating with cross-functional teams to design and maintain data architecture, including data warehousing and storage solutions
Identifying opportunities to improve data processing and storage efficiency and implement performance enhancements
Staying updated with industry trends and emerging technologies in data engineering to drive innovation and improvement




What are we looking for in you?




Proficiency in coding and scripting languages (e.g., Python, SQL) for effective data manipulation and analysis
Experience with Databricks and Azure
Experience in developing, implementing, and maintaining data pipelines and infrastructure to facilitate advanced data analysis
A strong understanding of data cleaning, transformation, and integration processes
Experience within the energy or power industry is beneficial




What can you expect?




To join a small, supportive, and senior team who enjoy to share knowledge and try new things together
Access to the latest technologies and encouragement to experiment
An opportunity to contribute to new & innovative solutions in power trading in real-time
Opportunities for career growth and progression – whether you see yourself as a future leader or diversifying your technical skillset
Competitive compensation package
A modern office in central Aarhus
A place where your contributions are recognised and make a meaningful impact on your colleagues & the success of the company




For any questions, contact Lucy on l.whiting@tenthrevolution.com

Title: Data & Business Intelligence Intern
Place: Gladsaxe, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you passionate about data-driven decision-making? Do you want to work on cutting-edge analytics and contribute to shaping the future of forecasting digitalization at Novo Nordisk? If you are ready to be part of innovating, optimizing and creating impactful data solutions, we want you on our team! Read more and apply today.

Your new role

As a Data & Business Intelligence Intern you will:



Contribute to the digitalisation of forecasting processes and outputs, ensuring reliable and state-of-the-art analytics reports for the forecasting function and its customers.
Support in innovating data infrastructure and visualization tools to create a single source of truth for global users.
Contribute to the development and improvement of data pipelines to enable efficient and sustainable data ingestion, processing, modelling, and output serving.
Draft ongoing reports and data visualisations (e.g., dashboards, heat maps) to aid data storytelling for forecasting team.




Your new department

Strategic Forecasting is part of Portfolio Strategy & Access within the Product & Portfolio Strategy. Based in a fast-paced and dynamic environment, the department focuses on analysing market dynamics, identifying trends, and forecasting market development. We provide insightful analysis to senior management, enabling data-driven decision-making in the organization. Join our team and be part of a collaborative and innovative culture where your work will make a real difference.

Your Skills & Qualifications

The candidate should have the following or developing qualifications:



Currently studying for master’s degree in Business Intelligence, Computer Science, Business Analytics, Data Science or other relevant fields, and will remain a student for the full duration of the internship.
Experience in various business intelligence and visualization tools (e.g. Power BI and Fabric).
Knowledge in IT & Analytics cloud architecture.
Knowledge in data management (especially SQL) is a strong plus.
Fluency in both verbal and written English and solid communication skills.




We invite motivated and forward-thinking candidates eager to make a meaningful impact through data-driven insights to apply for this exciting opportunity.

Working at Novo Nordisk

Every day we seek the solutions that defeat serious chronic diseases. To do this, we approach our work with an unconventional spirit, a rare determination, and a constant curiosity. For over 100 years, this unordinary mindset has seen us build a company unlike any other. One where a collective passion for our purpose, mutual respect, and a willingness to go beyond what we know delivers extraordinary results.

What We Offer

There is, of course, more on offer here than the uniqueness of our culture and the extraordinary results we produce. Being part of a global healthcare company means opportunities to learn and develop are all around us, while our benefits are designed with your career and life stage in mind.

More information

You are welcome to contact Director of AI and Advanced Analytics Ani Afyan Semerdjian at aisj@novnordisk.com , if you have questions about the role. Be advised Ani will not support queries about your recruitment status.

Deadline

17 August, 2025

You do not need to attach a cover letter to your application, but please include a few lines about your motivation in your resume or CV. In addition, please refrain from adding a photo in your CV. This makes for a better and less biased process.

We commit to an inclusive recruitment process and equality of opportunity for all our job applicants.

At Novo Nordisk we recognize that it is no longer good enough to aspire to be the best company in the world. We need to aspire to be the best company for the world and we know that this is only possible with talented employees with diverse perspectives, backgrounds and cultures. We are therefore committed to creating an inclusive culture that celebrates the diversity of our employees, the patients we serve and communities we operate in. Together, we’re life changing.
Show more
HTML:
Are you passionate about data-driven decision-making? Do you want to work on cutting-edge analytics and contribute to shaping the future of forecasting digitalization at Novo Nordisk? If you are ready to be part of innovating, optimizing and creating impactful data solutions, we want you on our team! Read more and apply today.

Your new role

As a Data & Business Intelligence Intern you will:


  • Contribute to the digitalisation of forecasting processes and outputs, ensuring reliable and state-of-the-art analytics reports for the forecasting function and its customers.
  • Support in innovating data infrastructure and visualization tools to create a single source of truth for global users.
  • Contribute to the development and improvement of data pipelines to enable efficient and sustainable data ingestion, processing, modelling, and output serving.
  • Draft ongoing reports and data visualisations (e.g., dashboards, heat maps) to aid data storytelling for forecasting team.



Your new department

Strategic Forecasting is part of Portfolio Strategy & Access within the Product & Portfolio Strategy. Based in a fast-paced and dynamic environment, the department focuses on analysing market dynamics, identifying trends, and forecasting market development. We provide insightful analysis to senior management, enabling data-driven decision-making in the organization. Join our team and be part of a collaborative and innovative culture where your work will make a real difference.

Your Skills & Qualifications

The candidate should have the following or developing qualifications:


  • Currently studying for master’s degree in Business Intelligence, Computer Science, Business Analytics, Data Science or other relevant fields, and will remain a student for the full duration of the internship.
  • Experience in various business intelligence and visualization tools (e.g. Power BI and Fabric).
  • Knowledge in IT & Analytics cloud architecture.
  • Knowledge in data management (especially SQL) is a strong plus.
  • Fluency in both verbal and written English and solid communication skills.



We invite motivated and forward-thinking candidates eager to make a meaningful impact through data-driven insights to apply for this exciting opportunity.

Working at Novo Nordisk

Every day we seek the solutions that defeat serious chronic diseases. To do this, we approach our work with an unconventional spirit, a rare determination, and a constant curiosity. For over 100 years, this unordinary mindset has seen us build a company unlike any other. One where a collective passion for our purpose, mutual respect, and a willingness to go beyond what we know delivers extraordinary results.

What We Offer

There is, of course, more on offer here than the uniqueness of our culture and the extraordinary results we produce. Being part of a global healthcare company means opportunities to learn and develop are all around us, while our benefits are designed with your career and life stage in mind.

More information

You are welcome to contact Director of AI and Advanced Analytics Ani Afyan Semerdjian at aisj@novnordisk.com , if you have questions about the role. Be advised Ani will not support queries about your recruitment status.

Deadline

17 August, 2025

You do not need to attach a cover letter to your application, but please include a few lines about your motivation in your resume or CV. In addition, please refrain from adding a photo in your CV. This makes for a better and less biased process.

We commit to an inclusive recruitment process and equality of opportunity for all our job applicants.

At Novo Nordisk we recognize that it is no longer good enough to aspire to be the best company in the world. We need to aspire to be the best company for the world and we know that this is only possible with talented employees with diverse perspectives, backgrounds and cultures. We are therefore committed to creating an inclusive culture that celebrates the diversity of our employees, the patients we serve and communities we operate in. Together, we’re life changing.

Title: Senior Client Insights Analyst
Place: Taastrup, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
The Opportunity

Are you passionate about turning data into impact, with reports that actually make a difference? At the intersection of neuroscience, AI, and marketing, Neurons partners with some of the world’s leading brands - across industries, agencies, and platforms - offering a unique chance for a talented Insights Analyst to shape how top names make smarter creative and strategic decisions every day.

Your work here won’t just be “reports”; it will shape how clients see, understand, and act on their creative performance. You’ll work across key commercial insight services: from high-level meta-analyses of client testing data to scalable implicit research solutions that enable faster, sharper decisions. You won’t just deliver insights, you’ll bring clarity, confidence, and momentum to every client interaction, making Neurons an indispensable part of their marketing strategy.

And you’ll evolve around our cross-functional core—neuroscientists, PMs, AI engineers, commercial talents, visionaries and innovators, and BI experts—wiring the very neurons that energize every insight, that make Neurons who we are.

Your Impact


Lead high-impact brand strategy: Scale analysis into narrative-driven reports that steer executive creative and marketing decisions.
Drive Explore innovation: Own the design and delivery of streamlined implicit tests that fuel speed, clarity, and commercial growth while championing new methodologies.
Empower commercial teams: Co-present critical insights, advise on strategic positioning, and lead high-value engagements with integrity and long-term partnership in mind.
Define strategic wins: Initiate and steer cross-functional projects where your insight and vision shape enterprise-level solutions.
Be the insight architect: Serve as Neurons’ knowledge authority. Craft advanced frameworks, scale delivery methods, and mentor junior analysts.


Who You Are


You’re an insights-driven thinker and high-impact, proven performer, who transforms complex data into beautiful narratives and impactful decisions, and drives those decisions into sustained momentum.
You thrive in both structure and ambiguity, consistently bringing clarity and strategic direction when others are still figuring out where to begin.
You zoom in and out with exceptional ease - just as confident spotting intricate patterns in data as you are shaping and communicating the overarching strategic narrative.
Curious, compelling, and authoritative, you guide and inspire others with a blend of sharp strategic thinking, clear executive-level direction, and calm confidence.
You’ve built an impressive craft in senior research, analytics, or agency senior roles and you’re ready to make a profound and visible impact across the entire business and with key clients.


About Neurons

Neurons is a SaaS leader in applied neuroscience and AI. Our platform AI predicts consumer responses - attention, emotion, cognition, and memory - with a level of accuracy previously only possible through lengthy testing and post-hoc analysis. By harnessing the latest science and powerful AI models, we enable brands to understand, predict, and influence consumer behavior faster and at a greater scale.

Behind the scenes, our science is continuously supported by our implicit testing solutions that enable our revolution, and our clients to quickly validate creative and campaign direction through scientifically grounded online studies. Together, our tools give customers a powerful mix of speed, scale, and science.

Our Mission: To empower organizations everywhere with evidence-based, predictive insights that drive confident decisions and breakthrough outcomes.

Why Join Us?


Work at the absolute cutting edge. Your insights will shape enterprise-wide creative and go-to-market plans across regions, directly influencing decisions by VPs, executives, and brand stewards at some of the world’s most iconic brands.
Collaborate closely with pioneering neuroscientists, elite AI engineers, and visionary business leaders.
Enjoy a culture of learning, ownership, and impact. Backed by remote flexibility and competitive compensation.
Get access to unparalleled datasets and advanced tools, and help set the public agenda for AI and neuroscience in marketing.


Ready To Make A Difference?

Apply now with a portfolio or sample of your most impactful client insights, strategic reports, or enablement work. Let’s push the boundaries of what’s possible, together.

We are a company that takes pride in the health & well-being of all our employees, with initiatives such as yoga practice, healthy breaks, and mental health resources.

We enjoy coming together for our Friday Hygge, where you might find us singing karaoke, playing bingo, video games or board games.

Other benefits include:


In-house lunch
Pension Plan
Private Health insurance
Parental leave benefits
Quarterly company events
Team Events
Show more

Apply now with a portfolio or sample of your most impactful client insights, strategic reports, or enablement work. Let’s push the boundaries of what’s possible, together.

We are a company that takes pride in the health & well-being of all our employees, with initiatives such as yoga practice, healthy breaks, and mental health resources.

We enjoy coming together for our Friday Hygge, where you might find us singing karaoke, playing bingo, video games or board games.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
We're looking for a hands-on Data Platform Engineer to join a high-impact team building a scalable AWS-based data platform for a trailblazer in AI governance and analytics. You’ll collaborate across engineering, DevOps, and compliance teams to drive performance, observability, and data integrity across systems.




Responsibilities

Architect and evolve a scalable, high-availability cloud infrastructure on AWS
Build robust data platforms to support large-scale analytics and governance tools
Implement automation through Infrastructure as Code and CI/CD workflows
Lead container orchestration with Kubernetes, Docker, Helm, and ArgoCD
Support data infrastructure compliance, performance tuning, and reliability
Ensure alignment with cloud security and data governance standards




Ideal Candidate

3+ years of AWS infrastructure and DevOps experience
Deep expertise with Kubernetes, Docker, and tools like Terraform or Pulumi
Programming experience in Python and Typescript
Familiarity with distributed data systems and SQL optimisation
Fluent in English
Problem-solver with a collaborative and pragmatic mindset




This role offers a competitive salary, flexible hybrid working, and a chance to grow within an innovative company shaping the future of trustworthy AI and data infrastructure.

Show more

Title: Student Analyst
Place: Bredebro, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you driven by analyzing, solving and communicating clear, actionable recommendations to problems and challenges? Do you want to work with and translate market, industry, competitor and consumer analysis in a global organization?

Look no further and use your analytical mindset by joining ECCO’s Consumer & Market Intelligence team as a Student Analyst in Copenhagen.

ECCO’s Consumer & Market Intelligence team is looking for a motivated and analytical student analyst to join the company's efforts to drive growth through a data-driven and consumer-centric mindset. Based in our Copenhagen office, you will work with stakeholders across departments and regions, providing valuable market, industry, competitor and consumer insights.

You will have the chance to utilize and develop your quantitative and qualitative analytical skillset, improve your data storytelling abilities and build on your business acumen in a global context. You will be an integral part of key business process by supporting decision-makers with crucial insights and recommendations in a timely manner, making sure that the organization is continuously up to date on the market, industry, competitor and consumer landscape. Furthermore, you will included in ad-hoc projects in collaboration with different functional areas throughout the ECCO Group.

Tasks & Responsibilities

Your primary tasks will include:


Assist with data collection, cleaning and analyses of market, industry, competitor and consumer trends.
Create reports and presentations to communicate findings to a broad variety of stakeholders throughout ECCO’s global footprint.
Support the team on various ad-hoc projects and administrative tasks.
Being an integral part in overseeing and utilizing external data providers.
Being involved in building business cases in a cross-functional setting.


The role is part-time, and the expected workload is 15-20 hours per week with flexibility around your studies and exam periods, and willingness to travel if necessary.

Profile

The ideal candidate for the position can say yes to the following:


Enrolled in a relevant bachelor’s/master’s degree (Business Administration, Economics, Finance, Marketing, etc.), preferably having just embarked on your master’s or being at least on the 3rd semester of your bachelor’s.
A strong business acumen and analytical approach to problem-solving.
High degree of proactiveness and confidence.
Attention to detail and curiosity to challenge status quo.
Proficient in English (both written & verbal). Additional language skills are an advantage but not required.
Proficient in Excel and PowerPoint. Prior experience with data visualization software (Power BI) and SQL (Snowflake) is an advantage but not required.
Willingness to take responsibility for projects and deliverables.


A position with global impact

Joining ECCO’s Consumer & Market Intelligence team, you will be part of a new and still expanding team based across our Global HQ in Bredebro/Tønder and office in Copenhagen. However, your daily work and tasks will see you engage with stakeholders across the globe – spanning from Asia through Europe to North America – making you a part of a multicultural workplace, with different cultures, perspective and ideas that you can learn and grow from.

You will open a door rich with opportunities to pursue future career opportunities across functions or location globally upon graduation. We believe in continuous learning and development professionally, but also personally.

Are you up for the challenge?

Applications and interviews will be reviewed ongoingly until the right candidate is found, so do not hesitate to send over your application!

For additional information, please do not hesitate to reach out to Gabrina Tan (Senior Analyst, Consumer & Market Intelligence) on +45 4012 6475.

Imagining yourself at ECCO? Get a glimpse of what your new exciting career entails on

CREATE THE FOOTPRINTS OF TOMORROW

At ECCO, you become part of a meaningful, developing and multicultural workplace. You join a global family of more than 23,000 people who are proud to create the footprints of tomorrow.

Headquartered in Denmark, we are a family-owned company that offers international opportunities. Our offices and facilities have an informal culture and relaxed dress code - our shoe code is slightly stricter.

Join us and we guarantee lifelong learning - the speed of progress is up to you. So, if you´re curious, passionate and ready to make an impact, you´ll fit right in.
Show more

Title: Register in our candidate data base
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Veo is a global leader in AI-based sports camera technology. Our innovative, fully automatic camera solution enables sports teams to record matches and training sessions without a camera operator. We’re democratizing the world of sports by granting video analysis for teams on all levels—a privilege that used to be only for the few. More than 40,000 clubs in 90+ countries record their games every week.

Growing as fast as we do in Veo means that every day is different, exciting, and challenging, both on the front line and in the back office.

But that’s not the most remarkable thing about us.

The coolest thing is our people. We’ve attracted some of the brightest minds in the industry. They are the reason we can create a great product and do it while enjoying ourselves.

Does your dream job at Veo not appear on the list, then sign up in our candidate data base and we will get in contact with you if the right opportunity arises for you.

At Veo, you'll be part of a thriving work environment where every day brings new excitement. Our rapid growth ensures a diverse and ever-changing atmosphere. We believe in work-life balance and providing a positive culture that allows you to thrive personally and professionally.

Our Copenhagen office mirrors our innovative technology – with an indoor ball court, rooftop terrace, and well-equipped gym. We have created a facility that supports connecting disciplines across the business, facilitates creative thinking, and gives the space to engage with colleagues, our global partners, and the entire Veo community.

Diversity and differences are valuable assets for us. We value diversity and inclusion and welcome people from all backgrounds. If you’re excited about this role but your experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we still encourage you to apply.

Values We Hold at Veo:

Dare - We take initiative, stay curious, and challenge the status quo in our work.

Own it - We drive impact by identifying opportunities, taking responsibility, and confidently executing.

Level up - We embrace growth, continuously learning and shaping our skills.

Play as a team - We collaborate across a diverse organization, leveraging shared insights for stronger outcomes.

Customer Centric - We deliver value by having close partnerships and a deep understanding of our customers (internally and externally)

We’re committed to building a diverse, inclusive, and authentic workplace. And you may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.
Show more

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
I have a new role for an experienced Data Engineer to work for a leading digital transformation partner, driving innovation with tailored IT solutions, expert consulting, and secure technology for businesses across diverse industries worldwide, who are going through an exciting growth phase.




There are based both in Denmark and this is a Hybrid position.




Responsibilities:

Create and optimize data platforms: Microsoft Fabric and Azure
Help future-proof customers' data platforms through cloud migration projects.
Use various technologies and resources to achieve desired results: SQL Server, Azure Databricks, Azure Data Factory, Data Lake, Lakehouse, etc.
Collaborate throughout the development cycle – from ideation and requirements to development, testing and delivery, to ensure the Business Intelligence of the future.




Tech Stack - Microsoft Technologies




Salary - Up to 70,000 SEK p/m Depending on experience




Qualifications:

Minimum 5 years experience as a Data Engineer
Experience with Microsoft tool (Power BI / SQL / Databricks / Azure / Fabric)
Fluent Danish & English




This is a great opportunity for anyone that's looking for growth opportunities with one of the worlds biggest consultancies

Title: Insights Trainee
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Company Description

Data science studiejob hos Publicis Groupe

Besidder du en solid matematisk profil med interesse for analyse, indsigter og strategi? Drømmer du om en karriere inden for konsulentbranchen, hvor du udforsker store datamængder for at opdage sammenhænge og indsigter, som du anvender til at levere strategisk rådgivning til nogle af landets største virksomheder samt internationale kunder? Så er du måske vores nye Junior Data Scientist!

Du vil blive en del af et ambitiøst Insights team, der stræber efter at blive de bedste inden for vores fag, hvor vi løbende arbejder med banebrydende projekter inden for marketingvidenskab. Vi er et travlt og målrettet team med en uformel omgangstone, hvor stærke kollegiale relationer vægter højt. Vi løfter i flok og har mange tværfaglige projekter, hvorfor intern sparring og kompetenceudvikling danner grundstenen for vores måde at arbejde på. Dette gælder også vores studentermedhjælpere, og du vil have mulighed for at skrive din kandidatafhandling i forlængelse af arbejdet, hvor teamet vil stå til rådighed med leveringen af data og løbende sparring.

Om jobbet

I Publicis Insights kommer du til at arbejde med mange aspekter inden for markedsanalyse og forbrugerindsigter. Du vil have din primære arbejdsgang i tæt samarbejde med resten af Insights teamets konsulenter hvor du vil komme til at arbejde med vores spritnye dataplatform.

Som Junior Data Scientist, kommer du primært til at supportere konsulenterne i teamet med udførelse af dataopgaver til forbruger- og markedsanalyser til bureauets kunder.

Stillingen er 15-20 timer om ugen med opstart hurtigst muligt.

Din Arbejdsdag Vil Typisk Bestå Af Nedenstående Arbejdsopgaver


Databearbejdning i Python, R, Excel eller Alteryx
Validering og kvalitetstjek af data
Udarbejdelse af analyser som kan præsenteres af teamets konsulenter
Ad hoc markedsanalyser eller analyser om forbrugeradfærd i f.eks. Index Danmark


Hvad vi leder efter


Du er i slutningen af din bachelor eller lige startet på din kandidat i fx Data Science, Matematik, Erhvervsøkonomilign.
Du er superbruger af Office-pakken.
Du er udpræget analytisk med forståelse af datastruktur.
Du har kendskab til Alteryx, Python, R og/eller SPSS.
Det vil være en fordel, men ikke et krav, at du har erfaring med et dataanalyse- og visualiseringsværktøj, såsom Power BI eller Tableau.
Du har drive, engagement og er opsøgende, samt ikke er bange for at påtage dig ansvar, som du selvstændigt trives med at bære.
Du kan formulere dig klart og tydeligt på både dansk og engelsk - både i skrift og i tale.
Du er villig til at arbejde med korte deadlines og mere intensivt i perioder med spidsbelastning.


Hvad kan vi tilbyde dig?


Et lærerigt arbejdsmiljø med fokus på personlig og faglig udvikling, hvor du selv er med til at definere retningen for egen udvikling samt egne interesseområder.
Et selvstændigt og ansvarsfuldt job i et team med stærke ambitioner og mål.
Fleksible arbejdstider, som du selv planlægger inden for det aftalte timeantal, samt særlig fleksibilitet i eksamensperioder.
Mulighed for at skrive kandidatafhandling i forlængelse af arbejdet, hvor teamet vil stå til rådighed med leveringen af data og løbende sparring.
Gode kollegiale relationer i et livligt kontormiljø placeret i hjertet af København K med masser af sociale og faglige arrangementer.


Er du interesseret?

Så ser vi frem til at modtage din ansøgning! Hvis du har spørgsmål til jobbet, er du velkommen til at kontakte Maya Jensen på maya.jensen@publicisgroupe.com.

Vi holder løbende samtaler, så send din ansøgning hurtigst muligt. Ansøgningen skal sendes sammen med dit cv og eventuelle referencer.

Om Publicis Groupe

Publicis Groupe er den andenstørste medie- og reklamebureaugruppe i verden med over 85.000 specialister. Vi har en holistisk tilgang til at løse vores kunders udfordringer, da vi forener vores ekspertise inden for medier, kreativitet, data og teknologi og tilbyder integrerede løsninger, transformative ideer og overbevisende forbrugeroplevelser. Vi kalder det Power Of One.

På vores danske kontor sidder vi 60 medarbejdere fokuseret på at levere integrerede løsninger til vores lokale og internationale kunder inden for medier, kreativitet, data & teknologi samt forskning & strategi. Vi er stolte vindere af mange priser og nomineringer, både i Danmark og internationalt. Men intet gør os stoltere end at arbejde med kunder og brands som Salling Group, Elgiganten, Mondelez, Renault, Nestlé, Disney, Pfizer, Haleon og mange flere.

Vores fantastisk kontor er lokaliseret i centrum af København tæt placeret på bus, Metro og togstation.
Show more
HTML:
Company Description

Data science studiejob hos Publicis Groupe

Besidder du en solid matematisk profil med interesse for analyse, indsigter og strategi? Drømmer du om en karriere inden for konsulentbranchen, hvor du udforsker store datamængder for at opdage sammenhænge og indsigter, som du anvender til at levere strategisk rådgivning til nogle af landets største virksomheder samt internationale kunder? Så er du måske vores nye Junior Data Scientist!

Du vil blive en del af et ambitiøst Insights team, der stræber efter at blive de bedste inden for vores fag, hvor vi løbende arbejder med banebrydende projekter inden for marketingvidenskab. Vi er et travlt og målrettet team med en uformel omgangstone, hvor stærke kollegiale relationer vægter højt. Vi løfter i flok og har mange tværfaglige projekter, hvorfor intern sparring og kompetenceudvikling danner grundstenen for vores måde at arbejde på. Dette gælder også vores studentermedhjælpere, og du vil have mulighed for at skrive din kandidatafhandling i forlængelse af arbejdet, hvor teamet vil stå til rådighed med leveringen af data og løbende sparring.

Om jobbet

I Publicis Insights kommer du til at arbejde med mange aspekter inden for markedsanalyse og forbrugerindsigter. Du vil have din primære arbejdsgang i tæt samarbejde med resten af Insights teamets konsulenter hvor du vil komme til at arbejde med vores spritnye dataplatform.

Som Junior Data Scientist, kommer du primært til at supportere konsulenterne i teamet med udførelse af dataopgaver til forbruger- og markedsanalyser til bureauets kunder.

Stillingen er 15-20 timer om ugen med opstart hurtigst muligt.

Din Arbejdsdag Vil Typisk Bestå Af Nedenstående Arbejdsopgaver

  • Validering og kvalitetstjek af data
  • Udarbejdelse af analyser som kan præsenteres af teamets konsulenter
  • Ad hoc markedsanalyser eller analyser om forbrugeradfærd i f.eks. Index Danmark

Hvad vi leder efter

  • Du er i slutningen af din bachelor eller lige startet på din kandidat i fx Data Science, Matematik, Erhvervsøkonomilign.
  • Du er superbruger af Office-pakken.

  • Du har kendskab til Alteryx, Python, R og/eller SPSS.
  • Det vil være en fordel, men ikke et krav, at du har erfaring med et dataanalyse- og visualiseringsværktøj, såsom Power BI eller Tableau.
  • Du har drive, engagement og er opsøgende, samt ikke er bange for at påtage dig ansvar, som du selvstændigt trives med at bære.
  • Du kan formulere dig klart og tydeligt på både dansk og engelsk - både i skrift og i tale.
  • Du er villig til at arbejde med korte deadlines og mere intensivt i perioder med spidsbelastning.

Hvad kan vi tilbyde dig?

  • Et lærerigt arbejdsmiljø med fokus på personlig og faglig udvikling, hvor du selv er med til at definere retningen for egen udvikling samt egne interesseområder.
  • Et selvstændigt og ansvarsfuldt job i et team med stærke ambitioner og mål.
  • Fleksible arbejdstider, som du selv planlægger inden for det aftalte timeantal, samt særlig fleksibilitet i eksamensperioder.
  • Mulighed for at skrive kandidatafhandling i forlængelse af arbejdet, hvor teamet vil stå til rådighed med leveringen af data og løbende sparring.
  • Gode kollegiale relationer i et livligt kontormiljø placeret i hjertet af København K med masser af sociale og faglige arrangementer.

Er du interesseret?

Så ser vi frem til at modtage din ansøgning! Hvis du har spørgsmål til jobbet, er du velkommen til at kontakte Maya Jensen på maya.jensen@publicisgroupe.com.

Vi holder løbende samtaler, så send din ansøgning hurtigst muligt. Ansøgningen skal sendes sammen med dit cv og eventuelle referencer.

Om Publicis Groupe

Publicis Groupe er den andenstørste medie- og reklamebureaugruppe i verden med over 85.000 specialister. Vi har en holistisk tilgang til at løse vores kunders udfordringer, da vi forener vores ekspertise inden for medier, kreativitet, data og teknologi og tilbyder integrerede løsninger, transformative ideer og overbevisende forbrugeroplevelser.
