Title: Senior Data Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Vi arbejder kontinuerligt på at være en endnu mere datadreven organisation, og nu kan du være med på rejsen! Her får du muligheden for at blive en af vores eksperter i Power BI og spille en nøglerolle i udviklingen af fremtidens rapportering og i rådgivning af kollegaer på tværs af hele lufthavnen.

Du bliver en del af Data & Analytics, hvor vi er Center of Excellence med ansvar for analyse- og Power BI governance. Vi samarbejder tæt med dygtige analytikere i forretningen, som selv udvikler mange af deres løsninger. Vores rolle er at sikre kvalitet, ensartethed og støtte med rådgivning, undervisning og sparring.

Om at være Senior Data Analyst

Som Senior Data Analyst er du vores go-to person, når rapportering skal gå på tværs af forretningen, eller når ingen andre har taget bolden. Du planlægger og faciliterer workshops, hvor du med nysgerrighed og skarpe spørgsmål hjælper forretningen med at finde ud af, hvad de egentlig har brug for. Du er ikke bange for at udfordre, og du sørger for, at intet bliver overset.

Vi arbejder agilt med en dedikeret Product Owner, der holder styr på backloggen, prioriterer opgaver og sikrer fremdrift via Azure DevOps.

Derudover arbejder vi strategisk med citizen development for at demokratisere rapportering og data, og enable vores kollegaer til selv at udvikle løsninger i Power BI. Det gør vi også i høj grad med vores data community, DataHub, hvor du sammen med teamet har en vigtig rolle i at drive det til næste niveau og sikre udbredelse af best practices og viden på tværs i lufthavnen.

Vi ser frem til, at du bidrager med at

✈️Udvikle Power BI løsninger – især de større og koncernkritiske

✈️Drive vores Community of practice DataHub – inkl. oplæg og community engagement

✈️Sikre fremdrift i vores data literacy indsatser og identificere nye

✈️Definere og dokumentere best practices for udvikling, test og dokumentation af Power BI rapporter

✈️Udarbejde guidelines og undervise forretningen i brugen af Power BI.

Om hvordan du lykkes i jobbet

Du lykkes på den korte bane, når du forstår forretningens behov og kan lave Power BI løsningen ud fra hvad de har behov for og ikke ”bare”, hvad de vil have.

På den længere bane lykkes du, når du bidrager med din store erfaring og udvikler dig til vores absolutte ekspert ved løbende at holde dig opdateret på nye Power BI features og har lysten til at prøve dem af.

Du har formentlig en uddannelse indenfor IT eller dataanalyse, men det er ikke et krav. Det vigtigste er, at du har solid erfaring med Power BI og en stærk interesse for at arbejde med data.

Du motiveres af at gøre en forskel, både gennem dine egne løsninger og ved at hjælpe andre med at lykkes. Du trives med at dele din viden bl.a. gennem undervisning og community-aktiviteter.

Om afdelingen

Vi er et nyere, stadigt voksende team med en central rolle i at løfte datamodenheden.

Teamet består af både erfarne og nye kollegaer, og vi prioriterer både faglighed og fællesskab. Udviklingen i vores branche går stærkt, og derfor investerer vi løbende i kompetenceudvikling, bl.a. gennem konferencer, hackathons og interne læringsinitiativer.

Samtidig har vi det sjovt sammen på teamevents og torsdagsbarer, og vi tror på at stærke relationer skaber bedre resultater.

Om Sofie, din nye leder

Din nye leder er selv ny i CPH med opstart 1. oktober, men du vil møde hende til samtalerne så I lærer hinanden at kende. Her er, hvad hun siger om sig selv og sin ledelsesstil:

”Det er vigtigt for mig at have en åben og ærlig dialog med mine medarbejdere, med et særligt fokus på, at teamet selvstændigt skal kunne levere resultater. For mig betyder det, at du får meget ansvar og ejerskab for det du har lyst til at udvikle dig indenfor, både personligt og fagligt. Samtidig vægter jeg, at vi har det godt, så jeg gør en del ud af at sætte trivslen højt bl.a. ved at være tilgængelig når du har brug for det. ”

Om os | Hvad tilbyder vi

Du bliver en del af en helt særlig atmosfære og en organisation, der hver dag arbejder engageret for, at vores passagerer får den bedste rejseoplevelse.

Udover pension og IT-udstyr tilbyder vi

✈️Frihed til planlægning af dine opgaver – med mulighed for at arbejde hjemmefra efter aftale med din leder

✈️Fri parkering, cykelservice, bilrengøring og rabataftaler

✈️Fysioterapi og træningslokale, yoga, rådgivning fra træner mv.

✈️Sundhedssikring – børn er dækket automatisk

✈️Individuelle check-in samtaler.

Om ansøgningen | Stig ombord på dit nye job

Vi ser frem til at læse din ansøgning, så send den gerne snarest muligt og senest den 29. august 2025.

Ansøgninger modtages kun via vores rekrutteringssystem.

Har du spørgsmål til jobbet inden da, kan sende en mail til Tenna Ørum Kristensen, Director – Data & Analytics - tenna.oerum-kristensen@cph.dk.

Det er en forudsætning for ansættelse, at du kan blive politigodkendt, ligesom du skal kunne opretholde politigodkendelsen gennem hele din ansættelse.
Show more

Title: Data Center Engineer
Description:
***Position open solely for freelance/contract work***




We are seeking an experienced Freelance Field Service/Data Centre Engineer to provide on-site break/fix support for enterprise networking, server, and storage hardware within secure data centre environments. The role involves collecting spare parts from the warehouse, travelling to the data centre, and performing hardware replacements or repairs under the guidance of remote support teams.




This is a hands-on, hardware-focused position that requires multi-vendor expertise, attention to detail, and the ability to operate in high-security environments. Candidates are required to work on a dispatch (on-demand) basis.




Key Responsibilities




Travel to the warehouse to collect spare parts before each job and transport them to the designated data centre.
Perform hardware replacements, installations, and upgrades on networking, storage, and server systems.
Work under guidance from remote technical teams to troubleshoot and resolve incidents.
Adhere to all security and site access protocols.
Maintain accurate documentation of work performed, parts used, and issue resolution steps.
Escalate issues to remote support or vendor as needed.
Ensure proper handling and return of defective parts.




Required Experience & Skills




7+ years residency in [Denmark/EU] to meet security clearance requirements.
3–5 years’ experience in field service, break/fix, or datacenter operations.
Proven ability to handle and service multi-vendor hardware, including:
Networking: Cisco Catalyst series (2960S, 4506, 4507R, 4900, 6506, 7604, 7613S), Cisco 2821, AIR-CT5508, WS-SVC-ASA-SM1-K9=, Brocade DXC 8510, Brocade DCX.
Servers: HP ProLiant DL360/DL380, HPE BL660c, HP Synergy 480 (Gen9/Gen10), Dell PowerEdge 2950, IBM System x3650 M3, SUN Enterprise T2000/T5120.
Storage & SAN: HP D3700, HP 5700/5900/5930 switches, HP Brocade BladeSystem SAN Switch, HP BladeSystem SAS, HP BLC7000 series, HP SN3000B.
Familiarity with cabling, racking/stacking, blade chassis maintenance, and module swaps.
Comfortable following remote troubleshooting instructions and using vendor diagnostic tools.
Strong documentation and communication skills.




Preferred Certifications




Cisco CCNA or CCNP (Routing & Switching or Data Centre)
HPE ASE/ATP certifications (Servers, Storage, Synergy)
Brocade/Broadcom SAN or DCX certifications
CompTIA Server+ / Network+
Vendor-specific hardware accreditations (Dell, IBM, SUN)




Additional Requirements




Valid driver’s license and ability to travel between the warehouse and the datacenter.
Ability to lift and handle hardware components.
Flexibility for after-hours or weekend work if required.
Strong adherence to security and confidentiality protocols.

Title: Data Center Engineer
Description:
Job Requirements:




1. Good general understanding of IT principles such as Networks, Hardware and Domains.

2. Knowledge of Infrastructure (Data Center and Network) hardware architecture as to understand the procedure shared by L3 teams during troubleshooting, H&E support.

3. Knowledge of server/client operations in a domain environment including Active Directory.

4. Understanding of current and legacy hardware Infrastructure platforms.

5. Hands-on experience in installation and troubleshooting Infrastructure (DC & Network) equipment's, Rack and Stack of the equipment/cable.

6. Good Hands-on Experience in IMAC and Break-fix activities related to Infrastructure environment.

7. Ability to identify Excellent the right defective spares and replace them with provided good spares as instructed and by physical observations.

8. Knowledge of TCP/I P standards and networking.

9. Experience with Tape Management activities.

10. Excellent knowledge of best practices around management, control, and monitoring of server infrastructure.

11. Familiarity with backup and recovery software and methodologies.

12. Updating and Recording of activities in relevant IT Ticket Management System.

13. Coordinating and agreeing attendance time and date with key stakeholders.

14. Provide support either through phone, remote tools, or in person at onsite.

15. Perform installation as needed either through physical or network medium.

16. Coordinate actual activity date and timings including arrival and departure times.

17. Carry all necessary tools, laptops etc. which might be needed to support issues in the infrastructure environment.

18. Labelling, Patching and Asset Tagging activities.







Deployment / In-Scope Configuration Items




• Servers (Virtual & Physical)

• Storage & Backup Devices

• Server Appliances

• Hyper Converged Infrastructure (E.g. Nutanix, Cisco UCS)

• Tape Storage Units

• Power Distribution Units rated 3KVA and below

• SAN Fabric Switches

• Network Switches

• KVM Units

• WAN Optimization Devices

• Firewalls

• Access Points

• Routers

• Physical Cabling

• Cable Management

• Cables which connect the device to itself, a peripheral, or a power/network port







Break-fix / Technical Tasks List




• Power Cycling

• Running Diagnostics Commands

• Conducting whole unit replacement

• Inserting/Removing Media

• Replacing Defective Components

• Assist with fault diagnosis and investigation

• Configuring Remote Access

• Basic Storage Array Configuration

• Replacing faulty cables

• Tape Management and Maintenance

• Rebooting routers, servers, storage devices or other equipment

• Providing loop-back cables in order to test circuits remotely

• Re-seating or replacing components or cables

• Cleaning fibers

• Identify/Analyze fiber issues by using OTDR/LSPM/VFL

• Installing loop backs

• Racking and de-racking and upgrade of any device installed.

Job Requirements:


1. Good general understanding of IT principles such as Networks, Hardware and Domains.

2. Knowledge of Infrastructure (Data Center and Network) hardware architecture as to understand the procedure shared by L3 teams during troubleshooting, H&E support.

3. Knowledge of server/client operations in a domain environment including Active Directory.

4. Understanding of current and legacy hardware Infrastructure platforms.

5. Hands-on experience in installation and troubleshooting Infrastructure (DC & Network) equipment's, Rack and Stack of the equipment/cable.

6. Good Hands-on Experience in IMAC and Break-fix activities related to Infrastructure environment.

7. Ability to identify Excellent the right defective spares and replace them with provided good spares as instructed and by physical observations.

8. Knowledge of TCP/I P standards and networking.

9. Experience with Tape Management activities.

10. Excellent knowledge of best practices around management, control, and monitoring of server infrastructure.

11. Familiarity with backup and recovery software and methodologies.

12. Updating and Recording of activities in relevant IT Ticket Management System.

13. Coordinating and agreeing attendance time and date with key stakeholders.

14. Provide support either through phone, remote tools, or in person at onsite.

15. Perform installation as needed either through physical or network medium.

16. Coordinate actual activity date and timings including arrival and departure times.

17. Carry all necessary tools, laptops etc. which might be needed to support issues in the infrastructure environment.

Title: Graduate Data Scientist
Place: Vester Hassing, North Denmark Region, Denmark
Description:
The Company

Veovo is a market leader in Airport Smart Technology. With a global footprint of customers and capabilities that cover Airport Operations, Revenue management and Passenger Flow. Some of the world’s largest airports rely on Veovo.  Focused on driving airport performance, our solutions enable airports to handle more aircraft and more passengers, with less delays and less queues. Our platforms are built on a modern tech stack, often delivered from the cloud as SaaS and leveraging intelligence to enable our customer to “go brilliantly”.

Our clients span continents, but all share one thing in common~ they’re big names in airport excellence, with even bigger digital goals. With offices in the UK, Poland, Denmark, New Zealand and the US, Veovo offers a world of opportunity

At Veovo we strive to deliver predictable collaborative solutions that are the platform of great airports. At Veovo we strive to deliver predictable collaborative solutions that are the platform of great airports.

The Opportunity

We focus on solutions in the analysis of queue and movement patterns as well as capacity forecasts. Our product, is cloud-based system that collects and analyzes data via proprietary (Bluetooth / WiFi) sensors, as well as third-party data sources such as camera, radar, infrared counters, coils, boarding cards, calendars, etc.

The solution primarily helps airports to forecast passenger appearance, optimize staff resources, reduce queue and travel times, and improve the experience for the passengers. In addition, we also create solutions for road traffic, railway stations, ports, ski resorts and amusement parks, with similar work and end-results.

Are you ready to be part of the team that brings our brilliant solutions "live" around the world?

The size of our installations are growing rapidly, and we are therefore seeking a skilled analytical person, who can help implement our solutions to help airports predict passenger arrival and flow. The implementation covers requirements, design, and calibration of the system. The calibration is carried out in-house via the setup of our filtering engine.

The Specifics


Identify valuable data sources and automate collection processes
Undertake preprocessing of structured and unstructured data
Analyze large amounts of information to discover trends and patterns
Build predictive models and machine-learning algorithms
Combine models through ensemble modeling
Present information using data visualization techniques
Propose solutions and strategies to business challenges
Collaborate with engineering and product development teams


What we are looking for


Knowledge of R, SQL and Python; familiarity with Scala, Java or C++ is an asset
BSc/BA in Computer Science, Engineering or relevant field
Analytical mind and business acumen
Experience in data mining
Problem-solving aptitude
Excellent communication and presentation skills


What we offer in return


A job in a growing industry.
Employment immediately or by agreement.
An exciting position in a company with good working conditions with an open, direct and informal tone
A company where ideas are accelerated into action, and everyone can play a part in the development.
Excellent opportunities for personal and professional development through independent work assignments.
Workplace~ Hækken 2, Vester Hassing, 9310 Vodskov
37 hours working week


Show more

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Vil du være med til at sætte retningen inden for Jyske Banks fremtidige datafundament og bidrage til udviklingen af løsninger, der optimerer vores datahåndtering? Er du klar til at forme Jyske Banks Data Warehouse?

Jobbet

Du vil arbejde i et erfarent udviklingsteam, Data Warehouse - Bank, der udvikler, driver og vedligeholder Jyske Banks Data Warehouse. Vores mission er at udstille data, til at sikre at Jyske Bank kan træffe de bedst mulige beslutninger. Teamets opgaver løses i tæt samarbejde med vores interessenter.

I teamet arbejder vi med:



At forbedre det eksisterende Data Warehouse med nye datadomæner for at imødekomme interessenternes behov
At sikre balance mellem kvalitet og udviklingshastighed
At indgå i dialog med forretningsenhederne om ønsker til datamodeller, forretningslogik og præsentation af data, så det kan nedbrydes i logiske leverancer
En agil organisering med SCRUM events, som sikrer en medledende og løsningsorienteret teamkultur, med solidt fokus på videndeling og personlig udvikling.
Support og drift af Jyske Banks Data Warehouse



Vi er professionelle og gør os umage hver dag, og har et stort fokus på at det skal være sjovt at gå på arbejde. Vi forventer at alle bidrager med konstruktiv feedback og input til løsninger. Du vil få et grundigt introduktionsforløb, så du har det bedst mulige udgangspunkt for at komme godt i gang med opgaverne.

Vores ønsker:

Vi forventer, at du har en relevant videregående uddannelse på kandidatniveau og en stor interesse for Data Warehouse i en forretningsmæssig kontekst. Alternativt har du opnået tilsvarende akademiske færdigheder gennem erfaring. Du kan have et solidt kendskab til backend arkitektur og generelle udviklingsmetodikker.

Derudover forventer vi, at du:



Kender til Data Warehouse begreber og teknologier.
Har erfaring med SQL Server teknologi, T-SQL og SAS som programmeringssprog.
Har udviklet i ETL-værktøjer som SAS DI Studio eller lignende dataintegrationsværktøjer.
Bidrager med videndeling i teamet, hvor kompetenceudvikling og kontinuerlig læring er i fokus.
Har en solid forståelse for de nyeste teknologiske trends og værktøjer inden for Datawarehouse og formår at omsætte denne viden til forretningsmæssig værdi.
Er nysgerrig, dygtig analytisk og trives i et samarbejdsorienteret miljø, hvor du bidrager engageret med din faglige indsigt.



Det forventes desuden, at du er i stand til at formidle dig selv tydeligt på dansk.

Teamet Data Warehouse Bank holder til i Jyske Banks hjemsted i Silkeborg, samt i Glaskuben (Kalvebod Brygge 3, København), og du vælger selv hvilken lokation der passer dig bedst.

Hverdagen er organiseret i et hybrid setup, men vi prioriterer også at samle de to lokationer for at sikre sammenhængskraften i teamet.

Ansøgning

Vi oplever mangfoldighed som en fordel i vores opgaveløsning og i vores fællesskab. Derfor opfordrer vi alle til at søge.

Vi ser frem til at modtage din ansøgning, hvor du beskriver netop dine færdigheder i forhold til jobbet. Send et motiveret CV til os inden ansøgningsfristen d. 17. august.

HR Partner Stine Odgaard Ranum, vil tage sig af din ansøgning

Mere information

Interesseret? Har du spørgsmål om jobbet, så kan du ringe og få mere at vide:

Jesper Schaadt

Chapter Lead Afdeling: Data Warehouse

Telefon: 25 65 26 70
Show more

Title: Quantitative Power Analyst
Description:
Turn complex data into decisive action in the Nordic power market.




We’re growing our Nordic Power Trading team and looking for a Quantitative Power Analyst who’s ready to take ownership of high-impact projects at the intersection of data, models, and market moves. You’ll work where numbers meet decisions – building tools, refining forecasts, and translating massive datasets into trading strategies with real PnL impact.




This isn’t a place for red tape or slow lanes. You’ll get autonomy, direct access to the trading desk, and fast feedback loops so your ideas don’t just sit in a deck – they hit the market.




What you’ll do

Own and improve our fundamental stack model to guide trading strategies in the Nordic power market
Transform diverse data sources (price signals, weather forecasts, fundamentals) into robust forecasts and trading signals
Build and maintain high-performance tools and models that connect data, analysis, tech, and decision-making
Collaborate with traders to test and implement ideas that drive measurable results
Work across trading, tech, and data teams to deliver solutions that shape our market performance




Your team

You'll join our Nordic Power Trading team – five skilled teammates with diverse roles. We combine deep market knowledge, analytical skills, and bold ideas to seize opportunities with a strong "can-do" attitude. Our team culture is engaging, driven and collaborative – we support each other, challenge ideas, and enjoy achieving shared goals. From the start, you'll be given responsibility, hands-on learning and the opportunity to shape decisions that matter.




What you bring

Strong Python programming skills for data wrangling, analysis, and model building
A solid grasp of time-series modeling, forecasting techniques, and econometrics
A quantitative background – MSc in Economics, Math-Econ, Finance, Engineering, or similar
Experience with large, complex datasets (e.g., power, weather, market data)
Fluent English – written and spoken




Bonus points if you have

Energy sector experience (especially power trading or weather fundamentals)
Exposure to real-time or automated trading systems
Understanding of stack modeling




How you work

You take ownership and push ideas from concept to impact
You question assumptions – including your own – to get to the right answer
You care about precision and quality, because your work drives decisions
You keep evolving, testing new ideas, and learning from feedback
You collaborate openly and play for the team




What you can expect from us

Ownership and influence – trust, responsibility, and the freedom to execute
Cutting-edge tools – shape your own workflows and work with advanced data infrastructure
A high-performing team – ambitious colleagues who challenge, support, and celebrate each other
A strong culture – grounded in honesty, transparency, and rethinking the way things are done
Room to grow – whether it’s deep technical mastery or a move toward trading, we’ll back you







If this sounds like your next move, apply now – and see how far your skills can go at InCommodities.

Show more

Title: Data Engineer
Place: Gentofte, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Group

Global Operations >>> Technology >>> Data & Insights

Reports To

Head of Data & Insights

LOCATION:

Hybrid/Remote (Based in country with STG Offices}

Position Summary

Do you want to make a real impact — not just write code, but build something that matters?

As a Data Engineer, you’ll help fuel global transformation; your work will bring clarity to chaos, connecting scattered data into a single source of truth that powers our next generation planning platform, o9.

If you’re driven by purpose, hungry to grow, and excited to see your work make a visible difference, this is where you belong.

As a Data Engineer, you will build and improve data pipelines for the o9 planning tool, ensuring clean, governed, and ready-to-use data from various sources. You’ll also contribute to broader platform development, supporting our data warehouse and other analytics initiatives.

You’ll be part of a global company on a bold data-driven transformation — shifting from gutfeel to insight, from silos to clarity. Your work will help shape how we plan, decide, and act at every level. This isn’t just about building pipelines; it’s about building trust in data, unlocking scale, and enabling smarter decisions across the business. You’ll play a real part in turning data into a true driver of change — and that change starts with you.

Key Responsibilities


Developing and maintaining data pipelines that deliver refined, high-quality data to our o9 planning platform
Consolidating and transforming data from multiple internal and external systems for planning and analytics use
Supporting and enhancing our data warehouse infrastructure , ensuring consistency and reliability of source data
Applying data validation rules , quality checks, and governance standards throughout the pipeline
Implementing and maintaining monitoring , alerting, and documentation to ensure system transparency and stability
Collaborating with team members and stakeholders to continuously improve workflows, tools, and technical practices


Who We Are Looking For

A hands-on builder who thrives in a structured but evolving environment, that enjoys making things work — not just once, but reliably, and at scale.

You take pride in delivering clean, maintainable pipelines and are comfortable following guidance, standards, and best practices set by more senior engineers.

You’re curious, eager to learn, and ready to grow your craft by working on real-world data challenges with business impact.

Key Skills & Experience


Solid understanding of data warehousing concepts such as ETL/ELT, data modeling and data patterns such as SCD, CDC, snapshots, partitioning etc.
Solid experience developing data pipelines using modern tools and frameworks
Proficiency in T-SQL and scripting languages like Python or PowerShell
Hands-on familiarity with cloud platforms (Azure, AWS, or GCP)
Understanding data integration and transformation across varied source systems
Basic knowledge of data governance, quality, and security principles
A team-oriented mindset with a willingness to collaborate and ask questions
Attention to detail and a structured, quality-focused approach to building pipelines
Clear communicator who can explain what you're doing and why
Adaptable to changing priorities and tools in a dynamic environment
Proactive learner who seeks out feedback and improvement opportunities


Supplementary Skills & Experience


Experience working with SAP S/4HANA data structures , SAP BDC or Datasphere
Hands-on experience with Databricks or Microsoft Fabric
Hands-on experience with o9 Solutions or similar planning platforms
Exposure to planning-related use cases like forecasting, supply chain, or finance
Familiarity with data warehouse architecture and data modeling concepts
Interest in automation, CI/CD pipelines, or infrastructure-as-code for data


OUR VALUES


A focused mission: enable smarter planning through trusted data
Real impact on business operations, not just behind-the-scenes work
A collaborative, learning-focused team environment
Modern tools, a cloud-first stack, and a platform that’s always improving
Flexibility in how and where you work — remote, hybrid, or onsite
Show more

  • A collaborative, learning-focused team environment
  • Modern tools, a cloud-first stack, and a platform that’s always improving
  • Flexibility in how and where you work — remote, hybrid, or onsite

Title: Student Assistant - Data Engineering
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
About Again

At Again, we are tackling one of the planet’s most pressing issues— waste CO2 —by transforming emissions into the solution. Our innovative approach involves fermenting industrial waste gases into carbon-negative chemicals, thereby turning harmful emissions into valuable, emission-free green chemicals. With each tonne of product we create, we remove over 2 tonnes of carbon from the atmosphere. Backed by over $100 million in funding from top venture capital investors and the European Union’s Horizon 2020 programme, we’re poised for rapid growth and global impact. If you think we’re doomed - think Again

What you'll do


Continuous updating of databases for experimental data, ensuring integrity and completeness of raw and metadata
Writing basic data wrangling and analysis scripts
10-15 hours per week, consistent availability 2 days per week required, flexible around class schedule and exams periods.


About You


Undergraduate degree in a subject with data science/coding component (e.g. data science, statistics, computational biology)
Coding experience in R and/or Python and ideally SQL
Understanding of best practices in data management
Strong attention to detail, ability to work independently
Preferred:
Some knowledge of biology/experimental data
Basic experience with cloud data storage and cloud computing

What we promise you?


You get to work with a group of passionate scientists, working on challenging and meaningful projects
An inclusive, empowering and engaging work environment
This will be the journey of a lifetime – we are serious about our mission to reduce over 1 gigaton of CO₂ and you can play a pivotal role in making that happen


If you have questions regarding the role, we would love to hear from you. Feel free to reach out at hej@again.bio. We look forward to hearing from you.

Title: Process Data Scientist
Place: Hillerød, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
We are looking for a Process Data Scientist to help us translate our manufacturing and supporting processes pain points, into first class Manufacturing Intelligence Use Cases via data analytics /science. If you thrive by being a key stakeholder in establishing the site’s process data, then you just might be a great colleague to our highly skilled Process Analytics organization.

Your New Role

The Process Data Scientist is a critical role within FUJIFILM Biotechnologies Denmark (FDBD) as the business is expanding and we are introducing new technologies, programs, and customers continuously – with data excellence being one of the mission enablers. We will provide ongoing support to our new site in Holly Springs, NC, USA.

You will be a key stakeholder in establishing the site’s process data usage and analytics value chain, whilst being the owner of already validated monitoring applications, e.g., an electronic chromatogram review setup and machine learning batch performance models. We continuously strive to identify opportunities to improve internal systems and practices, as well as provide direction and development of digital/data offerings to our partners.

Your Primary Tasks Will Be


Support process investigations, root cause analysis, optimization with data support and analysis
Process Analytics systems support to manufacturing across all product modalities
Develop, validate, and deploy ETL pipelines and help build the process data ecosystem
Support process trending, continued process verification (CPV) and annual product reviews (APQR)
Support development of applications with models for process characterization and scale-up/out
Develop, validate, and deploy multivariate batch monitoring models
Support innovation and systems improvement initiatives in the Process Analytics space



The Skills & Knowledge We Hope You Possess


You have a master’s degree in in a relevant science or engineering discipline (i.e., Engineering, Bioinformatics or similar) with 2 years of industry experience or a Bachelors in the same area with 4 years of industry experience.
You have working-knowledge of SQL and a solid understanding of data science and the Python data science ecosystem (NumPy, SciPy, pandas, Scikit-learn, Jupyter Notebook).
Familiarity with SIMCA-online, TIBCO Statistica, Visual Basic and Git version control are a plus.
It would be considered an advantage if you also have GMP experience, having worked on delivering GxP applications.



We value candidates who are naturally curious, greet people with a smile, and possess a can-do attitude. You demonstrate humility and respect for those around you. As someone who is pragmatic and structured, you have a keen focus on quality and enjoy working independently. You are proactive in dynamic entrepreneurial environments. Most importantly, you possess strong communication skills and appreciate the support of a cross-functional team.

The team

The Process Analytics team is embedded in the Process Science (PS) organization and provide leadership and subject matter expertise to existing production-ready process data business processes, while also seeking to develop and introduce new Manufacturing Intelligence in clinical, PPQ and commercial processes primarily in the large-scale Cell Culture manufacturing.

We are a growing team of highly professional dedicated scientists/engineers with data management and data science expertise - but also broad experience within pharmaceutical development and manufacturing of monoclonal antibodies.

The work environment is international and informal. The role is based in our Hillerød, Denmark location, and we offer a flexible work arrangement where a defined number of working hours can be carried out in the employee’s home.

We keep a high pace and focus on a vital work life balance while having fun. We put a strong emphasis on psychological safety through trust and empowerment within our teams and hope that this is something that speaks to you as well.

Application

Has this sparked your interest, then please upload your CV and cover letter as soon as possible, as we screen candidates on a continuous basis and call in for interviews.

The Company

FUJIFILM Biotechnologies is an industry-leading Biologics Contract Development and Manufacturing Organization (CDMO) with locations in Hillerød, Denmark, Teesside, UK, RTP, North Carolina and College Station, Texas, USA. We use our skills, dedication, and ambition to enable impact for the world’s most innovative biotech and biopharma companies reimagining healthcare’s potential. We work across the entire lifecycle of our customers’ products – enabling success throughout. Every cure, vaccine, biologic, and advancement we contribute to starts with our people and our passion. We fuel one another’s passion, help accelerate progress, expand capabilities, strengthen innovation, and improve processes to improve lives.

We offer the chance to be part of a global workplace where passion, drive and commitment are met with opportunities for professional and personal development. Deeply committed to diversity and inclusion, we ensure that everyone no matter their background or gender has an opportunity to develop. We take pride in enriching our communities, caring for our environment, and cultivating a world of opportunity for future generations.

We aim to foster a collaborative, innovative and rewarding environment, where diverse perspectives and people come together united by a common purpose and shared values. We pursue our fullest potential as individual contributors and team members. We strive to be the employer of choice and offer a competitive compensation and benefit package.

FUJIFILM Biotechnologies Denmark (FDBD) is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, sex, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identify or any other protected class.

To all agencies: Please, no phone calls or emails to any employee of FUJIFILM about this requisition. All resumes submitted by search firms/employment agencies to any employee at FUJIFILM via-email, the internet or in any form and/or method will be deemed the sole property of FUJIFILM, unless such search firms/employment agencies were engaged by FUJIFILM for this requisition and a valid agreement with FUJIFILM is in place. In the event a candidate who was submitted outside of the FUJIFILM agency engagement process is hired, no fee or payment of any kind will be paid.

In the event a candidate who was submitted outside of the FUJIFILM agency engagement process is hired, no fee or payment of any kind will be paid.

Title: Data Engineer
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
”Stop og se her en spændende mulighed for dig, der vil være med til at sikre, at PFA’s data warehouse fortsat fungerer optimalt og leverer værdiskabende data til kollegaer på tværs af organisationen. Du kan også se frem til at træde ind i et team med et kanon sammenhold, en moderne arbejdsplads og gode rammer”, siger Andreas Nierhaus, der er leder for ’Forretningsdata’ i PFA.

Du skal give stabilitet til PFA’s data backbone

Der er tale om en tidsbegrænset stilling på et år, hvor du bliver en del af teamet ’Forretningsdata’, der vedligeholder og videreudvikler PFA’s data warehouse. Vi leverer dagligt data, der understøtter arbejdet for mange kolleger og afdelinger i PFA. Derudover leverer vi også data til danske myndigheder og styrelser. Din indsats vil sikre, at vi får en endnu mere stabil dataplatform, som vil gøre det nemmere at udstille nye data til vores brugere. Hos os får du en spændende og varieret hverdag i et erfarent og agilt team med engagerede data engineers. Vi arbejder tæt sammen, giver plads til fordybelse i egne opgaver, samtidig med at sparring med dine kolleger aldrig er langt væk. En typisk dag begynder med, at du gennemgår nattens loads. Er der en fejl i vores kode, analyserer du fejlen, udvikler en løsning og sender en kode-pakke til implementering. Du har også dage, hvor du tilføjer nye data og funktioner til eksisterende løsninger, diskuterer nye løsninger med kolleger og interessenter og bidrager til at scope nye opgaver.

Dine nøgleopgaver er at:


vedligeholde og videreudvikle det eksisterende data warehouse
forbedre kvaliteten af vores løsninger ved tidligt at indgå i opgavedefinition og dialog med interessenter
sparre og samarbejde med teamet om data engineering opgaver.


Du har erfaring og kan kommunikere på flere niveauer

Vi har brug for dig, der:


er en erfaren data engineer, der har 100% styr på Microsofts’ warehouse verden og kan se dig selv sikre, at PFA’s dataleverancer kører stabilitet, optimalt og bliver tilpasset nye behov
har flere års erfaring med SQL og SSIS
har erfaring med optimering af eksisterende SSIS løsninger
kan kommunikere tekniske emner til ikke-tekniske interessenter
kan omsætte ikke-tekniske krav til tekniske løsninger.


De støttende rammer og kollegialt samarbejde er afgørende

Dit nye team er meget velfungerende. Vi har et godt sammenhold i teamet, og vi sætter pris på hinanden og hinandens færdigheder. Vores leder er lyttende og giver dig konkrete og tydelige svar. Og så får du den frihed, der er nødvendig for at kunne arbejde som ekspert i dit felt. Som kollega i PFA mærker du fra dag 1, at vi har fokus på godt kollegaskab, din udvikling, sundhed, trivsel og arbejdsglæde. Du kan se frem til gode arbejdsforhold – fx byder køkkenet på frokost til alle kostpræferencer, og du kan købe take away med hjem. Du har mulighed for at arbejde hjemme op til to dage om ugen, ret til at gå ned på 80% arbejdstid og personalegoder med en solid lønpakke, arbejdsgiverbetalt pension og feriefrihed. Du kan også se frem til at arbejde i et flot og velfungerende domicil på Nordhavn i København, få meter fra Metroen og havnemiljøet. Socialt har vi mange tilbud som yoga, løbehold, fredagscafé og medarbejderklubber.

Du behøver ikke skrive en lang ansøgning – send bare dit CV

Du behøver ikke sende en ansøgning. Vedhæft blot dit CV og tilføj et par linjer i dit resumé om, hvorfor du er interesseret i jobbet. Hvis du har spørgsmål, er du selvfølgelig velkommen til at ringe til Andreas Nierhaus, der er leder af Forretningsdata i PFA, på tlf.: 24 80 17 41. Vi ser frem til at høre fra dig og senest den 31. august 2025.

Vi samarbejder for at vores kunder kan leve et godt liv – både nu og i fremtiden

I PFA bliver du en del af noget stort – både som kunde og som kollega. Vi er omkring 1500 kolleger, der hver dag samarbejder for at gøre en positiv forskel for vores mere end 1,3 mio. kunder og samfund. Vi arbejder for at sikre økonomisk tryghed og sundhed gennem arbejdsliv og gode seniorliv for PFA er med vores kunder hele livet.
Show more

Title: Business Intelligence Developer
Place: Hvidovre Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
NTG Nordic Transport Group (NTG)

NTG is listed on Nasdaq OMX Nordic and is one of the fastest-growing freight forwarders in Europe. Since the Group’s foundation in Denmark in 2011, our unique partnering-model has successfully expanded NTG to a revenue of more than DKK 9 billion in 2024, presence in +25 countries and ~100 companies. Our culture is characterized as entrepreneurial, trusting, and accountable.




About the Role

We are currently looking for a Business Intelligence Developer to join our newly established BI team at our Global Headquarters in Hvidovre (Copenhagen), Denmark. You will play a key role in designing, developing, and maintaining BI solutions that support strategic decision-making across the organization.




Key Responsibilities

Model and develop data models in PowerBI and Fabric
Ensure data accuracy, consistency, and security across BI platforms
Collaborate with stakeholders to gather requirements and translate them into technical solutions
Support ad hoc reporting and data analysis needs




Requirements

Strong analytical mindset
Proven experience with Power BI development and deployment
Strong understanding of data modeling and DAX
Ability to communicate complex data insights clearly to non-technical stakeholders
Ability to work independently and as part of a team
Fluency in English



Candidates will be viewed favourably if they possess:

Experience with Microsoft Fabric
Experience with financial reporting or prior work experience in the freight forwarding industry
Fluency in Danish




Application Process

Interested candidates are encouraged to apply as soon as possible. Please submit your application by the 31st of August. Please note that we do not provide relocation assistance. For any questions about the position, feel free to contact Head of Group Business Intelligence Tomasz Kotarski (tko@ntg.com).

Title: Data Engineer
Company: Recruit IT - Rekruttering af IT specialister
Place: Kolding, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Data Engineer til Sunset Boulevard – vær med til at sætte retningen for dataintegrationer og performanceoptimering




Vil du være med til at bygge fundamentet for datadrevne beslutninger, der direkte påvirker forretningens drift, medarbejderbonusser og gæsteoplevelser? Har du solid erfaring med SQL, Azure og integrationer – og trives du, når du både kan optimere eksisterende løsninger og udvikle nye? Så er det måske dig, vi søger på vegne af vores kunde, Sunset Boulevard i Kolding.




Om rollen




Som Data Engineer hos Sunset Boulevard bliver du en del af den kommercielle afdeling i et lille, specialiseret team, der brænder for at omsætte data til reel forretningsværdi. Du får ansvaret for backend-delen af virksomhedens dataplatform, hvor du især skal sikre stabile integrationer og udvikle det tekniske fundament for Qlik Sense-rapporteringen, som bruges aktivt i alle restauranter og på alle kontorer.




Du vil arbejde tæt sammen med BI-manageren, som har ansvaret for Qlik og analyser, og du får frihed til at påvirke retningen for teknologivalg og arkitektur. Derudover bliver du en central spiller i udviklingen af en ny integrationsplatform, som skal løfte virksomhedens datainfrastruktur til næste niveau.




Hos Sunset Boulevard får du en arbejdsplads med en unik 4-dages arbejdsuge, der er blevet praktiseret i 5 år, og hvor fokus på fordybelse og effektivitet er en integreret del af kulturen. Hver dag er der fast fordybelsestid, møder har klare agendaer og beslutningsfokus – og pseudoarbejde er skåret væk.




Dine primære opgaver bliver at:




Sikre stabile og skalerbare integrationer mellem Azure-dataplatformen og on-prem servere (NAV/BC)
Udvikle og vedligeholde ETL-processer, transformeringslag og integrationer via Azure Data Factory og Azure Functions
Arbejde med SQL, samt Python til at modellere, rense og berige data
Udvikle API-integrationer til interne og eksterne systemer
Klargøre data til Qlik Sense-rapportering, som bruges til performance­måling, finansiel rapportering, markedsanalyser m.m.
Bidrage til opbygningen af en fremtidig integrationsplatform
Understøtte høj datakvalitet og sikre, at datagrundlaget er robust nok til forretningskritiske beslutninger




Sunset Boulevard forestiller sig, at du…




Har stærke kompetencer inden for SQL, Azure Functions og Python
Har erfaring med Azure Data Factory og gerne Qlik
Har arbejdet med dataintegrationer, ETL og API-udvikling
Er teknisk stærk, men også kan se data i en forretningsmæssig kontekst
Trives i et miljø med frihed under ansvar, hvor du får stor indflydelse på løsningerne
Er struktureret, kvalitetsbevidst og tager ansvar for at komme helt i mål med opgaverne




Sunset Boulevard tilbyder




En unik 4-dages arbejdsuge, hvor fokus på effektivitet og fordybelse giver bedre resultater og mere fritid
En central rolle i en virksomhed, hvor data har direkte indflydelse på drift og medarbejderbonusser
Stor frihed til at vælge teknologier og præge retningen for dataintegrationer
Et team med høj faglighed, kort vej til beslutninger og en kultur præget af fokus, forberedelse og respekt for alles tid
Attraktive ansættelsesvilkår inkl. pension, sundhedsforsikring og kantineordning







Sunset Boulevard vil gøre det lidt bedre end forventet




Sunset Boulevard er Danmarks største danskejede fastfoodkæde med rødder i Odense, hovedkontor i Kolding og mere end 50 restauranter fordelt over hele Danmark og med enkelte knappenåle i både Grønland, på Færøerne og i Tyskland. Siden 1996 har de haft appetit på mere – og det har de stadig.




Hos dem handler det ikke alene om god, frisklavet mad af gode råvarer – det handler også om mennesker. De tror på stærke relationer, store ambitioner og på, at man lærer mest, når man tør prøve sig frem. Som medarbejder hos Sunset Boulevard er du en vigtig del af et fællesskab, hvor de hjælper hinanden, har det sjovt og hvor de øver sig i at blive lidt bedre – hver dag.




De gør os umage med at skabe mad, der både smager godt og af mere – og går op i, at gæsterne føler sig velkomne, set og forkælet. For dem er det den samlede oplevelse, der tæller.

Show more
HTML:
Data Engineer til Sunset Boulevard – vær med til at sætte retningen for dataintegrationer og performanceoptimering


Vil du være med til at bygge fundamentet for datadrevne beslutninger, der direkte påvirker forretningens drift, medarbejderbonusser og gæsteoplevelser? Har du solid erfaring med SQL, Azure og integrationer – og trives du, når du både kan optimere eksisterende løsninger og udvikle nye? Så er det måske dig, vi søger på vegne af vores kunde, Sunset Boulevard i Kolding.


Om rollen


Som Data Engineer hos Sunset Boulevard bliver du en del af den kommercielle afdeling i et lille, specialiseret team, der brænder for at omsætte data til reel forretningsværdi. Du får ansvaret for backend-delen af virksomhedens dataplatform, hvor du især skal sikre stabile integrationer og udvikle det tekniske fundament for Qlik Sense-rapporteringen, som bruges aktivt i alle restauranter og på alle kontorer.


Du vil arbejde tæt sammen med BI-manageren, som har ansvaret for Qlik og analyser, og du får frihed til at påvirke retningen for teknologivalg og arkitektur. Derudover bliver du en central spiller i udviklingen af en ny integrationsplatform, som skal løfte virksomhedens datainfrastruktur til næste niveau.


Hos Sunset Boulevard får du en arbejdsplads med en unik 4-dages arbejdsuge, der er blevet praktiseret i 5 år, og hvor fokus på fordybelse og effektivitet er en integreret del af kulturen. Hver dag er der fast fordybelsestid, møder har klare agendaer og beslutningsfokus – og pseudoarbejde er skåret væk.


Dine primære opgaver bliver at:


  • Sikre stabile og skalerbare integrationer mellem Azure-dataplatformen og on-prem servere (NAV/BC)
  • Udvikle og vedligeholde ETL-processer, transformeringslag og integrationer via Azure Data Factory og Azure Functions
  • Arbejde med SQL, samt Python til at modellere, rense og berige data
  • Udvikle API-integrationer til interne og eksterne systemer
  • Klargøre data til Qlik Sense-rapportering, som bruges til performance­måling, finansiel rapportering, markedsanalyser m.m.
  • Bidrage til opbygningen af en fremtidig integrationsplatform
  • Understøtte høj datakvalitet og sikre, at datagrundlaget er robust nok til forretningskritiske beslutninger


Sunset Boulevard forestiller sig, at du…


  • Har stærke kompetencer inden for SQL, Azure Functions og Python
  • Har erfaring med Azure Data Factory og gerne Qlik
  • Har arbejdet med dataintegrationer, ETL og API-udvikling
  • Er teknisk stærk, men også kan se data i en forretningsmæssig kontekst
  • Trives i et miljø med frihed under ansvar, hvor du får stor indflydelse på løsningerne
  • Er struktureret, kvalitetsbevidst og tager ansvar for at komme helt i mål med opgaverne


Sunset Boulevard tilbyder


  • En unik 4-dages arbejdsuge, hvor fokus på effektivitet og fordybelse giver bedre resultater og mere fritid
  • En central rolle i en virksomhed, hvor data har direkte indflydelse på drift og medarbejderbonusser
  • Stor frihed til at vælge teknologier og præge retningen for dataintegrationer
  • Et team med høj faglighed, kort vej til beslutninger og en kultur præget af fokus, forberedelse og respekt for alles tid
  • Attraktive ansættelsesvilkår inkl. pension, sundhedsforsikring og kantineordning

Title: Senior Product Analyst
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
At Too Good To Go, we have an ambitious goal: to inspire and empower everyone to fight food waste together.

40% of all food produced in the world is wasted. And that has a huge impact on the health of our planet, with 10% of greenhouse gas emissions coming from food waste.

We’re more than an app: we are a certified B Corporation with a mission to empower everyone to take action against food waste, so alongside our marketplace app, we create educational tools, explore new business solutions - such as our Retail Technologies offering, and influence legislation to help reduce food waste.

We’re growing fast: Our community of 116 million registered users and 243,000 active partners across 19 countries, have together already prevented 431+ million meals from going to waste - avoiding over 1.165.000 tonnes of CO2e!

Your mission

At Too Good To Go we interact with our users and partners through Product Teams dedicated to our consumer apps and our partner platform. As a Senior Product Analyst, your mission is to provide analytical and product expertise to ensure that we are continuously delivering value to our Independent Partners and the business. You will analyse large volume data sets in order to deliver high-level insights and actionable recommendations, and work with prototyping new concepts and means of utilising data as a value-add.

The Role


Partner with the product manager to drive strategy based on insights from analyses and experiments
Conduct quantitative research to uncover opportunities and insights relevant for your product team
Setup, run and document experiments on features and ideas
Establish, and monitor common metrics that align with team goals and product strategy
Ensure features are tracked, tested and documented
Ensure that the product team understands and has access to the metrics and insights from your analysis.
Ensure all stakeholders, including those outside of your immediate team are well informed about relevant insights and experiments


Requirements


Proven experience in effectively communicating analytical findings, influencing decision-making processes with data-driven insights
Experience working with SQL and Python (or R)
Exposure to working with digital consumer facing products, ideally marketplaces or e-commerce platforms
Experience handling basic automations, calling API’s etc. in Python
Experience with event tracking in Amplitude, Mixpanel, Looker or similar is a plus
Sound knowledge of conducting experiments and forming hypotheses
Technical curiosity - we want you to be comfortable asking questions - we encourage a mindset to ‘dig deeper’
Full professional proficiency in English
Established background in a data related product role, we are ready to welcome candidates that may not be currently holding a Senior position


Our values


We win together: Food waste is a big beast to fight. We can do it if we win together as Waste Warriors with no ego. We believe in a #oneteam.
We raise the bar: We always push for more. We work smart, smash barriers and elevate one another.
We keep it simple: Our ambitions are bold but our solutions are simple.
We build a legacy: We’re proud of the change we’re driving.
We care: We always look out for each other. Caring is also about the way we do business. We do the right thing.


What We Have To Offer


An opportunity to work in a global social-impact company and certified B Corporation! where you can see a real and tangible impact in your role.
To be an integral part of our Data & Analytics team. We are eager for you to make an impact and contribute to the role of analytics across key decisions and our solution processes. Your insights are valuable, and we are here to listen.
Work-life balance is important to us! Focus on the job to be done, not the hours spent, there is no need for overtime.
We trust in our employees and encourage an autonomous environment that provides several opportunities for employees to contribute, develop and take ownership of their work in a way that works for them.
To be part of an international company, with over 1,300+ colleagues across 19 countries that are on the same important mission.
An informal environment, working alongside 190+ passionate people within Tech & Product
We celebrate our differences and our successes and have a strong values-driven team culture.
We work in a hybrid set-up and value in office work weekly.
We may be able to support you with a working visa in Copenhagen, please be prepared to discuss this topic further as your first stage interview.


How To Apply


We take recruitment very seriously, so please carefully read everything we have written above. Please also check our website and international media in order to get a good overview of Too Good To Go.
Submit your CV and Cover letter in English.
Please note that we only accept applications coming through our platform. No CV or Cover Letter will be accepted by email or LinkedIn direct messaging.


Job Ref

A Movement for Everyone

We want to inspire and empower everyone to fight food waste together. With that mission, it’s only natural that we want to build a diverse and inclusive team of highly capable individuals who are passionate about doing things in a better way. We strongly believe we all excel and are more creative when we’re allowed to be ourselves, and we’re committed to a culture where all of us belong.

We are an equal opportunity employer and all employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need. If you need reasonable accommodation at any point in the application or interview process, please let us know.


Show more

Title: Junior Data Scientist (student) at Choreograph
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Choreograph søger en Junior Data Scientist med passion for at omsætte data til indsigter

Er du vild med økonomi, statistik og matematisk modellering? Trives du med at finde mønstre i data og omsætte dem til meningsfulde indsigter i Python – eller andre statistiske programmeringssprog? Så er det måske dig, vi leder efter. Vi søger en bachelor- eller kandidatstuderende, der ved siden af sin videregående uddannelse ønsker at være en del af regnekraften bag rådgivningen til Nordens største virksomheder.

Hvem er vi?

Choreograph er en del af WPP Media, som er Nordens største bureaugruppe. Vi arbejder med rådgivning inden for marketing, media og salg. I data science-delen af Choreograph er udgangspunktet for vores rådgivning altid forskellige former for matematisk og statistisk analyse – herunder salgsmodeller, media buying-algoritmer, geografiske eksperimenter, dashboards m.m. Vi arbejder tæt sammen i et fagligt stærkt og anerkendt team, hvor nøgleordene er innovation, selvstændighed og faglig stolthed. Læs mere om os her: Choreograph

Jobbet

Vores kunder har store datasæt, komplekse problemstillinger og sammen skal vi omsætte de analytiske resultater til konkrete anbefalinger. En del af den tekniske udfordring er, at datamængderne konstant vokser og bliver stadig mere komplekse. Du skal være med til at løse denne udfordring. Sammen med en data scientist skal du på professionel vis håndtere kundens data, levere rådgivning og præsentere anbefalinger, som optimerer kundens investeringer baseret på et solidt analytisk grundlag.

Din daglige rutine som studentermedhjælper vil hovedsageligt være at opdatere, automatisere og klargøre data til analyser, samt opsætte indledende resultater i PowerPoint og PowerBI, alt imens du opbygger solid viden om branchen og de anvendte metoder.

Faglige og personlige kvalifikationer

Du er blandt årgangens skarpeste inden for økonomi, matematisk optimering, databehandling, statistik og/eller økonometri. Efter et introduktionsforløb, hvor du bliver fortrolig med vores anvendte datakilder og systemer, vil du selvstændigt arbejde med databehandlingen og udarbejdelse af præsentationer – i takt med, at du stifter bekendtskab med branchen, vil du få muligheden for at bistå i rådgivningen til virksomhederne og derved udvikle dine færdigheder som konsulent.

Vi forestiller os, at du:


Er i gang med en uddannelse, der giver et solidt fundament inden for økonomi og statistik
Har arbejdet med Microsoft Office-pakken (særligt PowerPoint og Excel), har kendskab til programmeringssprog som Python, og enten har erfaring med - eller interesse for - at arbejde med cloud-løsninger som Google BigQuery og SQL-baserede databaser
Er grundig, trives med at arbejde selvstændigt, og er god til at overholde deadlines
Har en vis forståelse for statistisk programmering og evt. dashboardløsninger


Vi tilbyder

Et fagligt udfordrende studiejob på ca. 15-20 timer om ugen i et engageret og dynamisk team med mere end 60 dygtige kollegaer fra hele Norden. Vi er en social gruppe, der holder af at tilbringe tid sammen uden for arbejdstiden blandt andet med padel, funktionel træning, karaoke, i fredagsbaren samt ture til udlandet, hvor vi til oktober planlægger en tur til Budapest.

Vi har højt til loftet og forventer at vores medarbejdere arbejder selvstændigt og er proaktive. Det er vores klare ambition, at du efter at have færdiggjort din uddannelse har mulighed for og lyst til at blive en del af vores organisation som fastansat.

Vores kontor ligger på Holmbladsgade 133, bag Kløvermarken på Amager, i gåafstand til Lergravsparken Metro. Vi har en fremragende kantine, hvor vi også tilbyder morgenmad, samt en masse sociale arrangementer i løbet af året, attraktive personalegoder og meget mere.

Ansøgning

Hvis ovenstående passer på dig, så send din ansøgning, CV og relevante dokumenter via linket på denne side. Har du spørgsmål til stillingen, er du velkommen til at kontakte vores Talent Lead Johan Hillers på johan.hillers@WPPMedia.com

Vores kontor ligger på Holmbladsgade 133, bag Kløvermarken på Amager, i gåafstand til Lergravsparken Metro. Vi har en fremragende kantine, hvor vi også tilbyder morgenmad, samt en masse sociale arrangementer i løbet af året, attraktive personalegoder og meget mere.

Ansøgning

Hvis ovenstående passer på dig, så send din ansøgning, CV og relevante dokumenter via linket på denne side. Har du spørgsmål til stillingen, er du velkommen til at kontakte vores Talent Lead Johan Hillers på johan.hillers@WPPMedia.com

requisitionid:13178

Title: Softwareudvikler med SQL-kompetencer og fokus på data
Description:
Til vores kunde DCS ApS i Trige, nord for Aarhus, søger vi en erfaren og dedikeret softwareudvikler med stærke SQL-kompetencer og fokus på data.




Du får en central rolle i at optimere virksomhedens databaseløsninger og udvikle effektive, skalerbare systemer.




Du får ansvaret for data i virksomheden, og du kommer til i tæt samarbejde med ledelse og virksomheden at videreudvikle og styrke brugen af data.




Hos DCS ApS sælger de IT- og elektronikprodukter for mere end 1,2 milliarder om året gennem deres mange digitale platforme. Deres kunder dækker alt fra de største, nordiske og europæiske online forhandlere til de mindre, lokale forhandlere i Danmark. Siden 1994 har DCS ApS været med til at sætte den digitale dagsorden. Deres domæne blev registreret i 1996, hvor de åbnede en af Danmarks allerførste webshops – og eCommerce, data og digitale systemer er stadig én af grundstenene i deres forretning.




Virksomheden beskæftiger i dag cirka 80 medarbejdere og har en kultur præget af iværksætterånd, hvor der er stor fokus på samarbejde. Du bliver del af deres it-team, hvor de pt. er fire backend softwareudviklere med fokus på interne systemer og to udviklere i Polen, som har fokus på deres webshops.




Hos DCS ApS får du en central rolle i at optimere virksomhedens dataarkitektur og sikre, at dataudnyttelsen på tværs af systemerne er optimal.

Du vil få ansvaret for at få et overblik over virksomhedens data og databaser, analysere datakvalitet og sikre, at data er tilgængelig og anvendelig for de relevante afdelinger og systemer. Ligeledes vil du arbejde med at udvikle og optimere SQL-forespørgsler, stored procedures, triggers og funktioner for at understøtte forretningsbehovene. Du er selv med til at analysere og definere opgaverne, så engagement og selvstændighed vægtes højt.




Du har ansvaret for at implementere tekniske løsninger, der kan styrke den operationelle drift og forretningsmæssige beslutningstagning ved at sikre hurtig og effektiv adgang til data.

I tæt samarbejde med ledelsen og øvrige afdelinger vil du bidrage til at videreudvikle og optimere virksomhedens datadrevne processer og sikre, at data understøtter virksomhedens strategi og mål.




Du vil få ansvar for at drive og koordinere alle de projekter, der involverer dataopsamling, -opbevaring og -anvendelse. Dette kan omfatte implementering af nye dataintegrationsløsninger og systemer, samt vedligeholdelse og optimering af eksisterende systemer.




Du vil referere direkte til CMO, Thomas Kirkeby og kommer til at arbejde tæt sammen med ham. Virksomheden er organiseret i en flad struktur, hvor ledelsen besidder stærke IT- og datamæssige kompetencer. De har en agil tilgang til systemudvikling, hvor løbende justeringer af datagrundlaget spiller en central rolle.




Dine faglige og personlige kvalifikationer

Vi forventer, at du har en relevant IT-uddannelse og mindst 3-5 års professionel erfaring med lignende ansvarsfulde stilling. Gerne flere års erfaring.




Du er teknisk stærk og har indgående erfaring med SQL og SQL-databaser, herunder CTE-tabeller, SQL-cursors, -triggers og stored procedures. Det er også en fordel, hvis du har et bredt kendskab til teknologier og udviklingssprog – f.eks. kendskab til PowerBI, SQL Reporting Service, C#/.NET, Docker m.v.

Data- og databasemiljøet er opbygget som en kombination af egne systemer omkring Microsoft Dynamics C5, med integrationer til blandt andet Apport WMS, nShift Cnet og Icecat. Projektstyring håndteres via Asana som projektstyringsværktøj.




At du har forretningsforståelse og kan koble data, systemer og forretning sammen vil være naturligt i denne rolle i tæt sparring med indkøb, salg og ledelse.




Som person er du selvkørende, nysgerrig og har stor passion for data. Du har lyst til at gøre en forskel og hjælpe forretningen gennem gode dataløsninger af høj kvalitet.




DCS ApS tilbyder

En spændende og fagligt udfordrende stilling, hvor du får et stort ansvar og mulighed for at udvikle og præge dataretningen hos en ambitiøs virksomhed, hvor data er højt prioriteret – hvilket afspejles i gode karrieremuligheder for den rigtige profil.

Du bliver en del af et stærkt kollegialt team og får engagerede kollegaer på tværs af virksomheden. Både ledelse og alle afdelinger er datadrevne, hvorfor dit arbejde vil blive meget værdsat.




Mere om virksomheden

DCS ApS holder til i Trige, nord for Aarhus, i deres 6.500 m2 store kombinerede lager- og administrationsfaciliteter. Siden etableringen i 1994 har de løbende tilpasset sig markedet for at fastholde deres stærke position, som betyder, at de kan tilbyde deres kunder et unikt setup.




Måske kender du dem fra deres to primære webshops, DCS.dk og Compumail.dk, hvor de tilbyder B2B- og B2C-kunder mere end 250.000 forskellige IT- og elektronikprodukter på tværs af brands som Lenovo, Logitech, Jabra, Apple, Samsung og mange flere.

I 2022 indviede DCS ApS deres nye topmoderne lager- og administrationsfaciliteter.




Interesseret?

Vi hos Bloom glæder os til at modtage din ansøgning og CV snarest. Samtaler afholdes løbende, og ansættelse sker, når vi har fundet den rette kandidat. Har du spørgsmål vedrørende stillingen, er du velkommen til at kontakte seniorkonsulent Dorte Pape på tlf. 3160 9365 eller via dp@bloom.dk.




Hvis du søger jobbet via ’Easy Apply’ skal du ikke forvente et svar på din ansøgning. Det vil du altid få, hvis du søger via jobannoncen på https://bloom.dk/jobs/softwareudvikler-med-sql-kompetencer-og-fokus-paa-data-347/




Vi glæder os til at høre fra dig!

Til vores kunde DCS ApS i Trige, nord for Aarhus, søger vi en erfaren og dedikeret softwareudvikler med stærke SQL-kompetencer og fokus på data.


Du får en central rolle i at optimere virksomhedens databaseløsninger og udvikle effektive, skalerbare systemer.


Du får ansvaret for data i virksomheden, og du kommer til i tæt samarbejde med ledelse og virksomheden at videreudvikle og styrke brugen af data.


Hos DCS ApS sælger de IT- og elektronikprodukter for mere end 1,2 milliarder om året gennem deres mange digitale platforme. Deres kunder dækker alt fra de største, nordiske og europæiske online forhandlere til de mindre, lokale forhandlere i Danmark. Siden 1994 har DCS ApS været med til at sætte den digitale dagsorden. Deres domæne blev registreret i 1996, hvor de åbnede en af Danmarks allerførste webshops – og eCommerce, data og digitale systemer er stadig én af grundstenene i deres forretning.

Title: Quantitative Researcher
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Huge opportunity for sell-side researchers to join a buy-side firm with clear progression to trader and PM seats at a leading commodities firm.




Overview

Join an asset modelling team building in-house pricing libraries for commodity options. Design, implement and productionise stochastic models that drive valuation, optimisation and risk for complex optionality in commodity assets.




The Firm

Build best-in-class, proprietary optimisation models rather than buying off the shelf.
High autonomy, pragmatic culture and genuine work–life balance.
Clear path to broaden into options trading or complex risk ownership as the platform scales.
Team track record in profitable commodity trading with ambition to lead model-driven decision making.




What you will do

Develop and extend options pricing libraries for commodities, with calibration and sensitivities.
Build stochastic models for assets and storages, including model choice, assumptions and risk implications.
Implement automatic differentiation to compute Greeks and accelerate calibration.
Partner with risk and trading to embed models into decision making and PnL attribution.
Own code from research to production with testing, performance tuning and documentation.




Requirements

Strong mathematics background in stochastic calculus and probability, with ability to apply theory.
Experience pricing exotic derivative libraries, not just using black-box libraries.
Solid coding skills in Python; exposure to C++ or Java is a plus.
Front-office quant experience in derivatives pricing or complex risk preferred.
2+ years professional experience.
MSc or PhD in a mathematic or quantitative field.
Experience with automatic differentiation frameworks for Greeks.
Options risk management know-how and interest in trading around complex risk.
Familiarity with energy options is a plus, not required.




Fit clarifications

Not e-trading or market making. Focus is modelling and valuation for options optimisation.
Backgrounds from front-office banking or competitors working on storage modelling are relevant.




Location

Denmark primary site. Flexibility for limited remote work.




Compensation

Base €80 - €120k
Bonus: capped at 200% of base. Potential formulaic PnL cut on the asset book at 0.X% depending on seniority and scope.

Title: HR Data Analyst
Description:
Are you eager to work with data analytics and HR? Want to help us take our data work to the next level in an HR department overseeing more than 5000 employees internationally? And does it sound good to work for a company owned by a foundation with a strong social purpose, donating more than 10 million Euros yearly to children and youth at risk? Then keep reading – this could be your thing!




About the job

Egmont's Corporate HR team is looking for someone to help us build a stronger data foundation. As our HR Data Analyst, you'll be essential in ensuring we have accurate, well-organised data to meet internal and external reporting requirements. Furthermore, you’ll help our divisions making better, data-driven decisions.




You'll be creating reports for both local and corporate management and supporting our local HR teams with their data needs. We're looking for someone who can make data accessible and useful across companies and HRIS systems. You'll be involved in building solutions to streamline and improve our data handling. Likewise, it is important that you can explore ways to automate our data processes freeing up time for more strategic HR initiatives.




Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

- Gather and consolidate data from various HRIS systems ensuring data validity and accuracy for reporting and analysis.

- Develop and maintain automated and ad hoc HR reports, including those related to pay equity and workforce demographics.

- Identify opportunities for automation and process standardisation to improve data quality.

- Collaborate with local HR teams to identify data needs and ensure alignment with group-level reporting requirements (e.g., pay transparency, CSRD).

- Collaborate with local IT teams to guide the development and maintenance of API integrations for data flow between HRIS systems and Egmont’s HR data hub.

- Analyse HR data to identify trends, patterns and insights for business improvements

- Oversee Egmont’s engagement survey, including secure validity in respondent data and administration in survey tool.




By fulfilling these responsibilities, you'll play a key role in enabling data-driven decision-making across our HR function and contributing to the success of Egmont's divisions.




What you’ll bring:

- A relevant degree or equivalent experience demonstrating a strong understanding of business principles and data analysis.

- Working experience in data management is desirable, particularly within an HR context.

- Proficiency in data analysis tools such as Excel, Power BI, etc.

- Good at building relationships and working with different teams across an organisation.

- Experience working in an international and decentralised organisation would be great.

- Fluent in English and one of the Scandinavian languages.

- Experience with data processing and API integrations in Python or similar is a plus.

- Knowledge of data querying in SQL or similar is a plus.




What can you expect:

You’ll be part of our Corporate HR function consisting of 10 HR professionals. In addition, you’ll collaborate with HR representatives working locally at division- or company level across all operating countries. We value a supportive environment that allows you to manage your responsibilities effectively. Moreover, we encourage cross-functional collaboration at all levels, giving you the opportunity to interact with a wide range of stakeholders and contribute to a variety of projects.




If you have any questions regarding the position please contact: HR Data Manager, Trond Svela Sand (+45 21 84 44 65; trond.sand@egmont.com).

If you are passionate about data analysis and want to make an impact in HR, we would love to hear from you.




Work address:

Vognmagergade 11

Copenhagen K, DK, 1148

Denmark




Please submit your application (CV and cover letter) as soon as possible. We will conduct interviews on an ongoing basis. Please use "Apply Now" on this site. We do not receive applications sent by e-mail.




Application deadline is 31/08/2025.




About Egmont

Egmont is a leading Nordic media group focused on strong content and platforms within film, tv, cinema, streaming, gaming, e-commerce, marketing services, educational platforms, magazines and books. Proud owner of strong companies like Nordisk Film, TV 2 in Norway, Lindhardt og Ringhof and Story House Egmont. Being a foundation, all profit is reinvested in our media companies and donated to help improve the lives of vulnerable children and young people and support film talents.

We bring stories to life.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
We're looking for a hands-on Data Platform Engineer to join a high-impact team building a scalable AWS-based data platform for a trailblazer in AI governance and analytics. You’ll collaborate across engineering, DevOps, and compliance teams to drive performance, observability, and data integrity across systems.




Responsibilities

Architect and evolve a scalable, high-availability cloud infrastructure on AWS
Build robust data platforms to support large-scale analytics and governance tools
Implement automation through Infrastructure as Code and CI/CD workflows
Lead container orchestration with Kubernetes, Docker, Helm, and ArgoCD
Support data infrastructure compliance, performance tuning, and reliability
Ensure alignment with cloud security and data governance standards




Ideal Candidate

3+ years of AWS infrastructure and DevOps experience
Deep expertise with Kubernetes, Docker, and tools like Terraform or Pulumi
Programming experience in Python and Typescript
Familiarity with distributed data systems and SQL optimisation
Fluent in English
Problem-solver with a collaborative and pragmatic mindset




This role offers a competitive salary, flexible hybrid working, and a chance to grow within an innovative company shaping the future of trustworthy AI and data infrastructure.

  • Architect and evolve a scalable, high-availability cloud infrastructure on AWS
  • Build robust data platforms to support large-scale analytics and governance tools
  • Implement automation through Infrastructure as Code and CI/CD workflows
  • Lead container orchestration with Kubernetes, Docker, Helm, and ArgoCD
  • Support data infrastructure compliance, performance tuning, and reliability

This role offers a competitive salary, flexible hybrid working, and a chance to grow within an innovative company shaping the future of trustworthy AI and data infrastructure.

Title: Join our database for healthcare jobs in Denmark
Description:
Join our database for healthcare jobs - your next opportunity awaits

The Danish healthcare system is constantly seeking skilled and dedicated healthcare professionals. Exciting opportunities open regularly across various roles in the whole country, and we are looking for you.

Make your profile visible to recruiters

By signing up for our database, you'll ensure your professional profile is accessible to healthcare recruiters across Denmark.

Why work in Denmark?

Denmark offers an exceptional quality of life, blending professional fulfillment with personal happiness:


Work-life-balance: Spend quality time with your family and friends thanks to Denmark's flexible and supportive work environment.
Free welfare services: Education, childcare, and health care services are free, ensuring a strong foundation for you and your family
Relaxed lifestyle: Experience the laid-back Danish way of living, where well-being takes centre stage.


Primary Or Secondary Sector - The Choice Is Yours

The Danish healthcare system comprises two sectors:


Primary Sector: Municipality-driven care, including general practitioners, rehabilitation services, and community care
Secondary Sector: Region-driven care provided by hospitals and specialized treatment facilities


Take the next step in your career while embracing what the "pretty good life" in Denmark has to offer. Ensure recruiters see your skills and experience by signing up for our database today!

This job database by the national recruitment campaign "A State of Denmark" is run by Copenhagen Capacity. Your data can be shared with employers in Denmark so that you can be contacted with specific job offers. By applying you confirm that you are informed about our privacy policy and legal information about data processing for research purposes.
