Title: Senior Data Specialist
Description:
Senior Data Specialist:




Do you want a role that lets you be part of the bigger picture?

Using advanced data solutions to help move towards a net zero dream?

Being part of a dynamic team filled with specialists?




If you answered yes to any of the above then I strongly recommend you consider this role!




I am looking for a skilled data specialist to come and be an anchor for energy data, come join a cutting-edge energy trading company based in Aarhus that’s redefining how data powers the green energy revolution. With a small, highly specialized team with a big mission: to optimize energy trades using advanced data solutions while reducing greenhouse gas emissions.




Tasks will include:




Create efficient data pipelines to collect, process, and store data from various sources, ensuring data quality and reliability.
Integrate data from different systems and sources, ensuring data consistency and accuracy.
Design and implement data models to support analytical and reporting needs, optimizing for performance and scalability.
Build and maintain ETL processes to transform raw data into meaningful insights for business stakeholders.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design and maintain data architecture, including data warehousing and storage solutions.
Identify opportunities to improve data processing and storage efficiency and implement performance enhancements.
Implement data governance best practices to ensure data security, compliance, and privacy.
Resolve data-related issues, provide support to data consumers, and ensure data availability and reliability.
Maintain clear and comprehensive documentation of data engineering processes, workflows, and solutions.
Collaborate with data scientists, analysts, and other stakeholders to understand data requirements and deliver data solutions that meet business needs.




To succeed in a role like this I need someone who is not only ambitious and driven but analytical, wanting to provide the most value out of data.




You must be able to communicate fluently in English.

With an office based in the heart of Aarhus, I want someone who wants to be part of the buzz and collaborating with colleagues.




So if you have:




Proven experience in data science, analytics, or engineering—ideally in trading, energy, or finance
Strong skills in Python, SQL, and cloud-based data platforms (Azure being the focus)
A passion for clean energy and a drive to make a real-world impact
A collaborative mindset and a love for solving complex problems in a close-knit team




Let's chat!

d.nichol@tenthrevolution.com

Show more
HTML:
Senior Data Specialist:


Do you want a role that lets you be part of the bigger picture?

Using advanced data solutions to help move towards a net zero dream?

Being part of a dynamic team filled with specialists?


If you answered yes to any of the above then I strongly recommend you consider this role!


I am looking for a skilled data specialist to come and be an anchor for energy data, come join a cutting-edge energy trading company based in Aarhus that’s redefining how data powers the green energy revolution. With a small, highly specialized team with a big mission: to optimize energy trades using advanced data solutions while reducing greenhouse gas emissions.


Tasks will include:


  • Create efficient data pipelines to collect, process, and store data from various sources, ensuring data quality and reliability.
  • Integrate data from different systems and sources, ensuring data consistency and accuracy.
  • Design and implement data models to support analytical and reporting needs, optimizing for performance and scalability.
  • Build and maintain ETL processes to transform raw data into meaningful insights for business stakeholders.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design and maintain data architecture, including data warehousing and storage solutions.
  • Identify opportunities to improve data processing and storage efficiency and implement performance enhancements.
  • Implement data governance best practices to ensure data security, compliance, and privacy.
  • Resolve data-related issues, provide support to data consumers, and ensure data availability and reliability.
  • Maintain clear and comprehensive documentation of data engineering processes, workflows, and solutions.
  • Collaborate with data scientists, analysts, and other stakeholders to understand data requirements and deliver data solutions that meet business needs.


To succeed in a role like this I need someone who is not only ambitious and driven but analytical, wanting to provide the most value out of data.


You must be able to communicate fluently in English.

With an office based in the heart of Aarhus, I want someone who wants to be part of the buzz and collaborating with colleagues.


So if you have:


  • Proven experience in data science, analytics, or engineering—ideally in trading, energy, or finance
  • Strong skills in Python, SQL, and cloud-based data platforms (Azure being the focus)
  • A passion for clean energy and a drive to make a real-world impact
  • A collaborative mindset and a love for solving complex problems in a close-knit team


Let's chat!

d.nichol@tenthrevolution.com

Title: Join our database for healthcare jobs in Denmark
Description:
Join our database for healthcare jobs - your next opportunity awaits

The Danish healthcare system is constantly seeking skilled and dedicated healthcare professionals. Exciting opportunities open regularly across various roles in the whole country, and we are looking for you.

Make your profile visible to recruiters

By signing up for our database, you'll ensure your professional profile is accessible to healthcare recruiters across Denmark.

Why work in Denmark?

Denmark offers an exceptional quality of life, blending professional fulfillment with personal happiness:


Work-life-balance: Spend quality time with your family and friends thanks to Denmark's flexible and supportive work environment.
Free welfare services: Education, childcare, and health care services are free, ensuring a strong foundation for you and your family
Relaxed lifestyle: Experience the laid-back Danish way of living, where well-being takes centre stage.


Primary Or Secondary Sector - The Choice Is Yours

The Danish healthcare system comprises two sectors:


Primary Sector: Municipality-driven care, including general practitioners, rehabilitation services, and community care
Secondary Sector: Region-driven care provided by hospitals and specialized treatment facilities


Take the next step in your career while embracing what the "pretty good life" in Denmark has to offer. Ensure recruiters see your skills and experience by signing up for our database today!

This job database by the national recruitment campaign "A State of Denmark" is run by Copenhagen Capacity. Your data can be shared with employers in Denmark so that you can be contacted with specific job offers. By applying you confirm that you are informed about our privacy policy and legal information about data processing for research purposes.

Title: Data Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you passionate about building scalable data products and enabling data-driven decision making across a global organization? Do you thrive in a collaborative, fast-paced environment where your work directly influences strategic outcomes? If so, we have an exciting opportunity for you!

Shape the Future of Data at Pandora

Pandora is on a mission to harness the power of data to drive business transformation and deliver meaningful impact across the organization. As a Data Engineer, you will be part of a growing Data & Analytics function, working closely with product managers, architects, and stakeholders across the business to build high-quality data and BI products on our global Azure PaaS data platform.

This is your chance to play a pivotal role in building modern, scalable data infrastructure and pipelines, enabling self-service analytics, reporting, and innovation at scale.

Key Responsibilities

Data Product Development & Engineering


Design, build, and deploy scalable, high-performing data solutions on Pandora’s Azure-based data platform.
Create and maintain robust data pipelines that automate manual processes, optimize data delivery, and improve data quality.
Own and monitor your data products, ensuring continuous performance and business impact.
Apply a “build-once, consume-many” mindset to enable reusable data solutions that serve the wider business.



Collaboration & Business Impact


Work within cross-functional teams to deliver data features that support commercial use cases and strategic decision making.
Translate business requirements into technical designs and data models.
Partner with stakeholders across global teams to understand their needs and solve complex data challenges.



Innovation & Best Practices


Contribute to evolving our cloud-based data platform, moving from IaaS to modern Azure PaaS tools like Databricks, ADF, Synapse, and Data Lake.
Follow software engineering best practices including DevOps, CI/CD, unit testing, and version control with Git.
Stay current with trends in data engineering and bring forward new ideas to improve our data ecosystem.



Key Qualifications

What You Bring to the Team


Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Information Management, Statistics, or related field.
5+ years of experience as a Data Engineer or in a software engineering role with a data focus.
Proven hands-on experience with tools like Databricks, Azure Data Factory, Data Lake, Synapse, SQL Server, T-SQL/U-SQL, and DAX.
Strong programming skills in Python, Scala, Java, or similar.
Experience with DevOps, CI/CD pipelines, Git, and unit testing frameworks.
Proficiency in working with large datasets, data modeling, and building data pipelines in cloud environments (preferably Azure).
Agile mindset and experience working in Scrum-based teams.
Strong communication skills and ability to present technical solutions to non-technical stakeholders.
Fluent in English.



Nice to Have


Experience with big data technologies like Spark or Hadoop.
Familiarity with real-time data processing tools such as Kafka or Spark Streaming.



Why Pandora?

At Pandora, innovation, sustainability, and inclusion are at the heart of everything we do. As part of our Data Engineering team, you’ll have the opportunity to shape the foundation of our data strategy while working with a global team of experts across Europe, India, and Thailand.

You’ll be empowered to take ownership, explore new technologies, and continuously improve how we use data to drive value across the business.

Additional Information


This role is based in our Global Office in Copenhagen, Denmark
Global Career Band 5



Did we get your attention?

We hope this opportunity excites you and encourages you to apply. If you see yourself in this position and believe Pandora is the right fit, we’d love to hear from you.

We process applications on a continuous basis, so we encourage you to apply as soon as possible. Learn more about us at www.pandoragroup.com.

Icing on the cake

You’ll work from our beautiful Head Office in Copenhagen V, designed to foster creativity, collaboration, and sustainability. Our office holds a LEED Gold Certification for environmental design, minimizing natural resource use while delivering a truly inspirational workspace.

About Pandora

Pandora is the world's largest jewellery brand. The company designs, manufactures, and markets hand-finished jewellery made from high-quality materials at affordable prices. Pandora jewellery is sold in more than 100 countries through 6,500 points of sale, including more than 2,500 concept stores.

Headquartered in Copenhagen, Denmark, Pandora employs over 32,000 people globally and crafts its jewellery at two LEED-certified facilities in Thailand, using primarily recycled silver and gold. Pandora aims to be carbon neutral by 2025 and is part of the Science Based Targets initiative to reduce emissions across its full value chain. The company is listed on the Nasdaq Copenhagen stock exchange and reported revenue of DKK 28.1 billion in 2023.

At Pandora, we are committed to building an inclusive, diverse workplace where everyone’s contributions are valued and respected. We believe in giving a voice to people’s loves—both through our products and our culture.
Show more

Title: Er du den socialrådgiver/socialformidler, vi har ledt efter?
Description:
Vi er et lille, dedikeret team i Stevns Kommune, og vi har en vigtig opgave: at hjælpe og støtte voksne borgere, der er socialt udsatte, psykisk skrøbelige eller har et handicap.

Nu søger vi en socialrådgiver/socialformidler, der kan arbejde selvstændigt, men samtidig værdsætter det tætte samarbejde, vi har i vores team.

Voksen handicap er en del af Myndighedsafdelingen, hvor myndighedsarbejdet for voksne under serviceloven og ældreloven er samlet.

Hvad får du hos os?


Du kommer til at arbejde med servicelovens bestemmelser for voksne. I din stilling ligger også arbejdet med kompensationsydelser, som du skal dele med en kollega
Du får mulighed for at bruge både din sociale og økonomiske viden – vi har nemlig en økonomikonsulent tilknyttet teamet to dage om ugen ligesom vi har en kontraktforhandler, vi deler med vores kolleger på børne/ungeområdet
Vi sidder dør om dør med vores udfører på området og har stor glæde af det tætte naboskab
Vi er en lille kommune, så her kender vi hinanden godt. Samarbejdet er tæt, og vi er hurtige til at hjælpe hinanden, både fagligt og personligt
Du bliver en del af et stabilt og dygtigt team, hvor der er plads til udvikling
Som ny kollega vil vi sørge for en introduktion, der er skræddersyet til dig


Hvem er du?

Vi håber, du har erfaring fra det specialiserede område, men det er ikke et krav. Det vigtigste er, at du har en socialfaglig uddannelse, og er dygtig både i kontakten med borgerne og med det administrative arbejde. Du skal kunne ”sætte dig for bordenden” i møder og holde hoved koldt i perioder med spidsbelastninger.

Vi søger en kollega, der har lyst til at udvikle sig og være med til at videreudvikle vores område. Teamet består af syv rådgivere og en faglig koordinator. Vores arbejde er meget selvstændig, og vi tilrettelægger selv vores arbejdsdag.

Vi Tilbyder


Selvstændigt arbejde, hvor du har stor frihed til at tage ansvar
Et tværfagligt og støttende team, der har styr på både det socialfaglige og økonomiske
Mulighed for hjemmearbejde og fleksible arbejdstider
Et introduktionsprogram, der er skræddersyet til dig, så du hurtigt føler dig hjemme
Et sted, hvor samarbejde er nøglen, og vi ser det som en styrke at arbejde tæt sammen


Hvis du har lyst til at være med til at gøre en forskel for borgere i Stevns Kommune, så send os din ansøgning. Vi glæder os til at høre, hvordan du kan bidrage til vores team.

Stillingen er på 37 timer om ugen. Der er flextid og mulighed for hjemmearbejde.

Kørekort er en nødvendighed i jobbet.

Hvis du nysgerrig eller har spørgsmål er du velkommen til at kontakte fagkoordinator Søren Kolinger på tlf.: 21 18 33 51 eller e-mail: sorenkol@stevns.dk eller myndighedsleder Inge Bagge på tlf.: 24 37 08 90 eller e-mail ingepett@stevns.dk (ferie til den 18. august 2025).

Ansøgningsfristen er mandag den 15. september 2025. Ansøg via linket nedenfor.

Vi forventer af afholde samtaler tirsdag den 23. september 2025.

Arbejdstid: Dag

Ansøg her

Retur til søgning
Show more

Title: Data Center Engineer
Description:
***Position open solely for freelance/contract work***




We are seeking an experienced Freelance Field Service/Data Centre Engineer to provide on-site break/fix support for enterprise networking, server, and storage hardware within secure data centre environments. The role involves collecting spare parts from the warehouse, travelling to the data centre, and performing hardware replacements or repairs under the guidance of remote support teams.




This is a hands-on, hardware-focused position that requires multi-vendor expertise, attention to detail, and the ability to operate in high-security environments. Candidates are required to work on a dispatch (on-demand) basis.




Key Responsibilities




Travel to the warehouse to collect spare parts before each job and transport them to the designated data centre.
Perform hardware replacements, installations, and upgrades on networking, storage, and server systems.
Work under guidance from remote technical teams to troubleshoot and resolve incidents.
Adhere to all security and site access protocols.
Maintain accurate documentation of work performed, parts used, and issue resolution steps.
Escalate issues to remote support or vendor as needed.
Ensure proper handling and return of defective parts.




Required Experience & Skills




7+ years residency in [Denmark/EU] to meet security clearance requirements.
3–5 years’ experience in field service, break/fix, or datacenter operations.
Proven ability to handle and service multi-vendor hardware, including:
Networking: Cisco Catalyst series (2960S, 4506, 4507R, 4900, 6506, 7604, 7613S), Cisco 2821, AIR-CT5508, WS-SVC-ASA-SM1-K9=, Brocade DXC 8510, Brocade DCX.
Servers: HP ProLiant DL360/DL380, HPE BL660c, HP Synergy 480 (Gen9/Gen10), Dell PowerEdge 2950, IBM System x3650 M3, SUN Enterprise T2000/T5120.
Storage & SAN: HP D3700, HP 5700/5900/5930 switches, HP Brocade BladeSystem SAN Switch, HP BladeSystem SAS, HP BLC7000 series, HP SN3000B.
Familiarity with cabling, racking/stacking, blade chassis maintenance, and module swaps.
Comfortable following remote troubleshooting instructions and using vendor diagnostic tools.
Strong documentation and communication skills.




Preferred Certifications




Cisco CCNA or CCNP (Routing & Switching or Data Centre)
HPE ASE/ATP certifications (Servers, Storage, Synergy)
Brocade/Broadcom SAN or DCX certifications
CompTIA Server+ / Network+
Vendor-specific hardware accreditations (Dell, IBM, SUN)




Additional Requirements




Valid driver’s license and ability to travel between the warehouse and the datacenter.
Ability to lift and handle hardware components.
Flexibility for after-hours or weekend work if required.
Strong adherence to security and confidentiality protocols.

Show more

Title: Business Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you good at connecting the dots between business processes and how they are brought to life using data & technology? Are you passionate about retail, supply chain, merchandising & manufacturing? Do you consider yourself suitably placed at the junction of people, process & technology and well poised to leverage your position to drive meaningful business results? If yes, then we might have an exciting opportunity for you!

About The Team

Pandora’s Supply Chain Technology department is looking for a Business Analyst to support the ‘Integrated Planning’ product line – it is a suite of products supporting key capabilities within Merchandising, Supply Chain & Manufacturing Planning. As our new colleague you will be part of our Agile ways-of-working and will be working across our value streams, with a strong focus on Order Capture (wholesale/retail) & Replenishment.

In this role, you will be an expert in and understand the key drivers and complexities of driving technology innovation and capability building in an extremely competitive market, with particular focus on ongoing initiatives at Pandora around ERP modernization & bringing in a new E2E Integrated Planning solution.

As a Business Analyst within Integrated Planning, you will be responsible for understanding as-is business processes within the realm of Merchandising Planning, as well as help envision the future as Integrated Planning embarks on its digital transformation journey. Reviewing and providing input into solutions and then coordinating and supporting the communication and delivery of those requirements with relevant parties would be a key part of your job. With our strong focus on quality, we also expect that you will play a role in creating and executing test cases, validating with our end users and communicating issues back to your product teams so that we ensure that our solutions are scalable, simple and drive operational excellence.

As mentioned earlier, the role is centered around Merchandising Planning, and hence you would be working closely with Pandora’s Global Merchandising & Supply Chain business team. You will be a member of one of the product teams within Integrated Planning product line, which is focused on optimizing product availability & sell-out forecast accuracy by providing capable and reactive planning solutions that can scale for complexity. Aspects of the role would be operational & commercial-focused, and would involve business user training and onboarding to our suite of existing and incoming new products.

Your role as a Business Analyst:


Assisting the product owner with prioritization of development work within your agile team
Process development and optimization
Collaborate with business users (e.g Supply Planners) to understand planning requirements, and help map them back to product roadmap & backlog
Work with teams across the organization to ensure processes and data are in place to support initiatives
Track releases and support with testing and validation
Configure planning applications to match needs of the user community
Work with owners of interfacing systems to manage dependencies
Work with owners of interfacing systems to manage dependencies
Work closely with Engineering Chapter within Supply Chain Technology, and quickly gain understanding of technology landscape within Integrated Planning
Be a strong proponent of CICD framework
Business value and progress towards strategic targets within your area
Quality and security, including functional test coverage and defects, security compliance



What you need to succeed:


3-5 years of experience as a Business Analyst preferred, with prior exposure to and expertise in working within merchandise planning & allocation functions (replenishment, order capture, interaction with ERP)
Experience from retail, fashion, FMCG industry preferred
Bachelor's degree in sciences, engineering, technology or economics
Prior experience working in an Agile setup
Experience in the development of documentation of business process, requirements and business cases in non-technical language, clearly articulating benefits
Experience conducting interviews and workshops for requirements gathering and validation including working with internal customers and both internal and external technical experts
Knowledge of information systems development, testing principles, project methodologies



Additional Information

Global Career Band 5B

Did we get your attention?

If you see yourself in the position and would like to become a part of Pandora’s future, please do not hesitate to apply. We look forward to hearing from you! We process applications on a continuous basis, which is why we encourage you to send your application as soon as possible.  You can also read more about Pandora on our corporate site www.pandoragroup.com.

Icing on the cake

You will be working out of our beautiful Head Office in Copenhagen V, established in 2016 and designed to unite and inspire our teams. Besides our beautiful interior design we are also proud of our LEED Gold Certification for Energy and Environmental Design. This means that we use as few natural resources as possible and that we use them with respect. The result is a professional and dynamic space that is unique, comfortable and inspirational – and delivers a true Pandora experience to anyone who works here or comes to visit.

About Pandora

Pandora is the world's largest jewellery brand, specialising in the design, crafting and marketing of accessible luxury jewellery made from high-quality materials. Each piece is created to inspire self-expression, allowing people to share their stories and passions through meaningful jewellery. Pandora jewellery is sold in more than 100 countries through 6,800 points of sale, including more than 2,700 concept stores.

Headquartered in Copenhagen, Denmark, Pandora employs 37,000 people worldwide and crafts its jewellery using only recycled silver and gold. Pandora is committed to leadership in sustainability and has set out to halve greenhouse gas emissions across its value chain by 2030. Pandora is listed on the Nasdaq Copenhagen stock exchange and generated revenue of DKK 31.7 billion (EUR 4.2 billion) in 2024.

Recognised by the Financial Times as one of Europe’s Best Workplaces and ranked #1 among Danish companies, Pandora is committed to building an inclusive and diverse workplace. We believe that reflecting the diversity of society in how we engage with our customers is essential to fulfilling our purpose: to give a voice to people’s loves. We are dedicated to nurturing a culture where everyone feels respected, valued, and empowered to thrive.
Show more
HTML:
Are you good at connecting the dots between business processes and how they are brought to life using data & technology? Are you passionate about retail, supply chain, merchandising & manufacturing? Do you consider yourself suitably placed at the junction of people, process & technology and well poised to leverage your position to drive meaningful business results? If yes, then we might have an exciting opportunity for you!

About The Team

Pandora’s Supply Chain Technology department is looking for a Business Analyst to support the ‘Integrated Planning’ product line – it is a suite of products supporting key capabilities within Merchandising, Supply Chain & Manufacturing Planning. As our new colleague you will be part of our Agile ways-of-working and will be working across our value streams, with a strong focus on Order Capture (wholesale/retail) & Replenishment.

In this role, you will be an expert in and understand the key drivers and complexities of driving technology innovation and capability building in an extremely competitive market, with particular focus on ongoing initiatives at Pandora around ERP modernization & bringing in a new E2E Integrated Planning solution.

As a Business Analyst within Integrated Planning, you will be responsible for understanding as-is business processes within the realm of Merchandising Planning, as well as help envision the future as Integrated Planning embarks on its digital transformation journey. Reviewing and providing input into solutions and then coordinating and supporting the communication and delivery of those requirements with relevant parties would be a key part of your job. With our strong focus on quality, we also expect that you will play a role in creating and executing test cases, validating with our end users and communicating issues back to your product teams so that we ensure that our solutions are scalable, simple and drive operational excellence.

As mentioned earlier, the role is centered around Merchandising Planning, and hence you would be working closely with Pandora’s Global Merchandising & Supply Chain business team. You will be a member of one of the product teams within Integrated Planning product line, which is focused on optimizing product availability & sell-out forecast accuracy by providing capable and reactive planning solutions that can scale for complexity. Aspects of the role would be operational & commercial-focused, and would involve business user training and onboarding to our suite of existing and incoming new products.

Your role as a Business Analyst:

  • Assisting the product owner with prioritization of development work within your agile team
  • Process development and optimization
  • Collaborate with business users (e.g Supply Planners) to understand planning requirements, and help map them back to product roadmap & backlog
  • Work with teams across the organization to ensure processes and data are in place to support initiatives
  • Track releases and support with testing and validation
  • Configure planning applications to match needs of the user community
  • Work with owners of interfacing systems to manage dependencies
  • Work with owners of interfacing systems to manage dependencies
  • Work closely with Engineering Chapter within Supply Chain Technology, and quickly gain understanding of technology landscape within Integrated Planning
  • Be a strong proponent of CICD framework
  • Business value and progress towards strategic targets within your area
  • Quality and security, including functional test coverage and defects, security compliance


What you need to succeed:

  • 3-5 years of experience as a Business Analyst preferred, with prior exposure to and expertise in working within merchandise planning & allocation functions (replenishment, order capture, interaction with ERP)
  • Experience from retail, fashion, FMCG industry preferred
  • Bachelor's degree in sciences, engineering, technology or economics
  • Prior experience working in an Agile setup
  • Experience in the development of documentation of business process, requirements and business cases in non-technical language, clearly articulating benefits
  • Experience conducting interviews and workshops for requirements gathering and validation including working with internal customers and both internal and external technical experts
  • Knowledge of information systems development, testing principles, project methodologies


Additional Information

Global Career Band 5B

Did we get your attention?

If you see yourself in the position and would like to become a part of Pandora’s future, please do not hesitate to apply. We look forward to hearing from you! We process applications on a continuous basis, which is why we encourage you to send your application as soon as possible.  You can also read more about Pandora on our corporate site www.pandoragroup.com.

Icing on the cake

You will be working out of our beautiful Head Office in Copenhagen V, established in 2016 and designed to unite and inspire our teams. Besides our beautiful interior design we are also proud of our LEED Gold Certification for Energy and Environmental Design. This means that we use as few natural resources as possible and that we use them with respect. The result is a professional and dynamic space that is unique, comfortable and inspirational – and delivers a true Pandora experience to anyone who works here or comes to visit.

About Pandora

Pandora is the world's largest jewellery brand, specialising in the design, crafting and marketing of accessible luxury jewellery made from high-quality materials. Each piece is created to inspire self-expression, allowing people to share their stories and passions through meaningful jewellery. Pandora jewellery is sold in more than 100 countries through 6,800 points of sale, including more than 2,700 concept stores.

Headquartered in Copenhagen, Denmark, Pandora employs 37,000 people worldwide and crafts its jewellery using only recycled silver and gold. Pandora is committed to leadership in sustainability and has set out to halve greenhouse gas emissions across its value chain by 2030. Pandora is listed on the Nasdaq Copenhagen stock exchange and generated revenue of DKK 31.7 billion (EUR 4.2 billion) in 2024.

Recognised by the Financial Times as one of Europe’s Best Workplaces and ranked #1 among Danish companies, Pandora is committed to building an inclusive and diverse workplace. We believe that reflecting the diversity of society in how we engage with our customers is essential to fulfilling our purpose: to give a voice to people’s loves. We are dedicated to nurturing a culture where everyone feels respected, valued, and empowered to thrive.

Title: Business Intelligence Developer
Place: Hvidovre Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
NTG Nordic Transport Group (NTG)

NTG is listed on Nasdaq OMX Nordic and is one of the fastest-growing freight forwarders in Europe. Since the Group’s foundation in Denmark in 2011, our unique partnering-model has successfully expanded NTG to a revenue of more than DKK 9 billion in 2024, presence in +25 countries and ~100 companies. Our culture is characterized as entrepreneurial, trusting, and accountable.




About the Role

We are currently looking for a Business Intelligence Developer to join our newly established BI team at our Global Headquarters in Hvidovre (Copenhagen), Denmark. You will play a key role in designing, developing, and maintaining BI solutions that support strategic decision-making across the organization.




Key Responsibilities

Model and develop data models in PowerBI and Fabric
Ensure data accuracy, consistency, and security across BI platforms
Collaborate with stakeholders to gather requirements and translate them into technical solutions
Support ad hoc reporting and data analysis needs




Requirements

Strong analytical mindset
Proven experience with Power BI development and deployment
Strong understanding of data modeling and DAX
Ability to communicate complex data insights clearly to non-technical stakeholders
Ability to work independently and as part of a team
Fluency in English



Candidates will be viewed favourably if they possess:

Experience with Microsoft Fabric
Experience with financial reporting or prior work experience in the freight forwarding industry
Fluency in Danish




Application Process

Interested candidates are encouraged to apply as soon as possible. Please submit your application by the 31st of August. Please note that we do not provide relocation assistance. For any questions about the position, feel free to contact Head of Group Business Intelligence Tomasz Kotarski (tko@ntg.com).

Show more

Title: Student Analyst, Data & Sustainability, Copenhagen
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
At Urban Partners we believe that ‘powering the progress of cities and citizens’ is our opportunity to contribute to a more sustainable and equitable world. We do this by investing in assets, companies, technologies, and solutions. 

Becoming our new Student Analyst in the Sustainability team, you will have a unique opportunity to support Urban Partners in managing climate risks and opportunities. If you get energy from working for an internationally growing company and want to be part of making a difference, you may be our new team member.

The team

You will become a part of our Sustainability Team of 10 people, and you will support the team in analysing climate risk and opportunities, work on projects that decarbonize and improve the sustainability of urban ecosystems across our investment strategies.

We are a place where people truly work together as a team, valuing each other’s differences and the importance of each and every team member. Professional and personal development is something we give high priority, and with us you will develop by receiving and giving feedback from colleagues and by sparring with your team members. You will be a part of a powerhouse of brilliant and caring people raising the bar for the industry.

The position

Responsibilities

We expect that you can work about 15-20 hours per week with the opportunity to be flexible during exams. You will be supporting the company’s industry-leading sustainability professionals with primary responsibilities including:


Data analysis within transitional & physical climate risk
Research & development within decentral renewable energy solutions
Supporting strategic work within decarbonization roadmaps and action plans
Supporting GHG management & reporting aligned with leading standards such as SBTi


Qualifications

We expect that you are a 3rd or 4th year Bachelor's or Master’s student within economics, finance, data science, renewable energy or, similar, with excellent grades. You are interested in climate data management and business development and have strong communication skills and analytical capabilities. Besides, we hope that you are/have:


Skilled in Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint. Experience with Power BI is preferred
Fluent in English
A strategic thinker that can navigate in high-complexity
A self-driven team-player
Highly organized and able to monitor and process many “moving parts” in a structured and effective manner (e.g., across several touchpoints with partners, managing and prioritizing inbound questions and requests)
Curious constant learner. Knowledge within renewable energy / sustainability is preferred, and interest in the area is required
Positive person that appreciates humor in the team
Some work or volunteer experience. Relevant work experience is a plus but not a requirement


What We Offer


Make a difference by helping create urban spaces and places that enrich people’s lives in the most sustainable way
Lead the industry with an innovator that is pioneering new approaches while raising standards and inspiring the industry
Learn and grow as part of a powerhouse of brilliant people where teamwork, feedback and different ways of thinking are at the core
Be your whole self in a purpose-driven culture with a strong sense of belonging, based on trust, celebration and caring for each other


Join Us

If you are interested, please let us know more about you as soon as possible, and no later than 1st of September 2025.
Show more

Title: SOC Analyst
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
We are growing fast as a company and do our best to bring our SaaS cloud-based backup services to the global audience. 

Our platform is designed to provide customers with an immutable historical archive of their primary data in systems such as Microsoft 365, Google Workspace, Salesforce, Entra ID, Dynamics 365, and Zendesk. It aims to protect them against everything, starting from ransomware to simple accidents. 

Most of our back-end components are written in clean, modern C++ using mainly purpose-built components and STL. Several components that deal with business processes and data mining are built using Common Lisp. Everything runs on Linux. 

Backing up billions of objects over foreign APIs using imperfect networks on systems with finite memory and making it all happen in as little time as possible is no small feat. 

We are a product-centered company, and cybersecurity is one of our main priorities.

If you think solving complex problems is fun, we have strong indications that we will not run out of challenging problems any time soon. Come join us for the fun!

Primary Responsibilities:


Develop and optimize SIEM rules, fine-tuning alerts to reduce false positives
Create and maintain playbooks for incident handling and ensure knowledge transfer to manager analysts
Working on connecting new log sources, log optimization, and parsing.
Perform threat hunting, root cause analysis, and forensics
Lead incident response efforts and coordinate across IT, security, and management teams
Act as a spare SOC engineer


Skills and Qualifications:


4+ years of experience in SOC environments or equivalent (monitoring)
Obligatory expertise in SIEM solutions (MS Sentinel, Wazuh) with demonstrated ability to create, optimize, and manage rules
Hands-on experience with malware analysis, reverse engineering, and forensics.
Advanced knowledge of incident response frameworks (NIST, SANS) and tools (e.g., EDR, IDS, IPS, centralized antivirus etc.)
Strong knowledge of security standards (ISO 27001, NIST) and ability to map them to incident handling procedures
Leadership and mentorship skills, with a proven track record of training and upskilling junior analysts
Relevant certifications: CSA, CISSP, GIAC, OSCP, CEH, or equivalent will be an advantage


A fair and transparent recruitment process

During the recruitment process, you can expect the following stages:

CV screening, Recruitment interview, Recruitment feedback review, Technical interview, Technical task (optionally),  and Final interview.

You will be assessed according to the criteria below:  

      Technical Skills:


Incident Response: Proficient in investigating, analyzing, and mitigating complex security incidents.
Threat Hunting: Hands-on experience with proactive threat hunting methodologies and tools.
Forensic Analysis: Skills in endpoint, network, and memory forensic investigations. Malware Analysis: Capable of conducting static and dynamic malware analysis.
SIEM Mastery: In-depth knowledge of SIEM platforms (e.g., MS Sentinel, Wazuh, including rule creation, query optimization, and reporting.
Automation: Familiarity with SOAR platforms and scripting (Python, Bash, PowerShell) for automating routine tasks.
Threat Intelligence: Ability to operationalize threat intelligence and correlate indicators with incidents.


Soft Skills:


Analytical and Problem-Solving Skills: A systematic approach to identifying and resolving complex issues.
Teamwork and Collaboration: Proven ability to work effectively in cross-functional teams.
Communication Skills: Capability to communicate technical details clearly to non-technical stakeholders.


Language:  


English is a preferred language, and we expect you to be fluent in it, both written and spoken.


Logical Thinking:


Structured Problem Solving: Ability to break down complex security issues into actionable steps.
Decision-Making Skills: Making informed and reasoned decisions under pressure.
Pattern Recognition: Identifying unusual patterns and behaviours in data or systems.
Scenario-Based Thinking: Proficiency in simulating and analyzing hypothetical threat scenarios.


We offer:


Competitive salary.
Pension scheme.
A modern, energetic global work environment.
Flexible work-life balance supported by a hybrid working model.
Regular team-building activities.
Opportunities for professional development and career advancement.
Compensation is based on experience and skill set.


About Us:

Founded in 2007, Keepit is a global leader in SaaS data backup. Headquartered in Copenhagen, Denmark, we operate across Europe, the US, Australia, and New Zealand. Our vendor-neutral backup solutions ensure that customer data is securely stored in our own resilient data centres.

Recognised as a Leader in Forrester’s New Wave for SaaS Data Protection, Keepit stands out for its broad coverage, usability, security, privacy, and innovative roadmap.

We kindly ask you not to provide us with any sensitive categories of personal data when applying for a job with us. When applying for the vacancy, Keepit will process your personal data, and therefore we recommend that you also read our privacy policy, which describes our processing of personal data and your rights as a data subject.

If you notice any misconduct or irregularities that fall within the scope of our whistleblowing procedure, please click here to report them.

Title: Student Worker, Procurement Data Analyst
Place: Billund, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description

Are you interested in shaping the future of LEGO’s purchasing through innovative AI solutions?

"Bring your digital and data expertise to the LEGO Group’s Procurement team! Help us harness the power of AI platforms to enhance our purchasing processes to buy better, faster, and more sustainably.”


Core Responsibilities

This student worker role is designed to help you build a strong foundation in both data analytics and procurement operations, setting you up for a successful career in either discipline. You will learn to





Prepare, clean, and maintain high-quality procurement data to support digitalisation and AI readiness.
Understand and promote data integrity and best practices in data management.
Design and build automated applications and workflows using Microsoft Power Platform (Power BI, Power Apps, Power Automate).
Learn key procurement processes such as sourcing, contract management, and supplier management, through hands-on involvement in activities delivered by the Procurement Centre of Excellence.
Participate in Supplier Risk Assessments, contributing to how we evaluate and manage supplier performance and exposure.
You’ll be surrounded by professionals who will mentor and support you, while giving you real responsibilities from day one.




Play your part in our team succeeding

The Procurement Centre of Excellence is responsible for delivering operational efficiencies from the LEGO Group’s Procurement systems and processes for the Global Procurement team.

The student worker reports to the Director of Procurement Transformation and will play a key role in preparing for the introduction of artificial intelligence into procurement digital solutions. The role will focus on ensuring the quality, structure, and availability of data needed to support these innovations, while also contributing to the core procurement activities delivered by the Centre of Excellence team.

The Procurement organization is based across the LEGO hubs and sites; Billund, Singapore, Shanghai, Enfield, London, Shenzhen, and in other manufacturing locations Czech Republic, Hungary, China and Mexico. This position will be based in Billund, Denmark and will be for 12 months.

Do you have what it takes?





It is a prerequisite that you are enrolled in an educational institution during your employment as a student worker.
You are a student in procurement, Supply Chain, IT, business, data science, engineering, or other related field.
Are interested in data, digital tools, and procurement operations.
Some familiarity with Microsoft Excel and ideally some exposure to Microsoft Power BI, Power Apps, or Power Automate (training will be provided).
Proactive mindset with attention to detail and a drive to solve problems.
Strong collaboration and communication skills in an international environment.
Ability to build strong stakeholder relationships.
Capacity to thrive in a fast-paced, challenging, and unpredictable environment.
Understanding of Operational Procurement.
High tolerance to work across multiple functions.
Ability to work in a global team.
English at fluent level is required.




Applications are reviewed on an ongoing basis. However, please note we do amend or withdraw our jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to any advertised closing date. So, if you're interested in this role we encourage you to apply as soon as possible.

What’s in it for you?

Here is what you can expect

Family Care Leave - We offer enhanced paid leave options for those important times.

Insurances – All colleagues are covered by our life and disability insurance which provides protection and peace of mind.

Wellbeing - We want our people to feel well and thrive. We offer resources and benefits to nurture physical and mental wellbeing along with opportunities to build community and inspire creativity.

Colleague Discount – We know you'll love to build, so from day 1 you will qualify for our generous colleague discount.

Bonus - We do our best work to succeed together. When goals are reached and if eligible, you'll be rewarded through our bonus scheme.

Workplace - When you join the team you'll be assigned a primary workplace location i.e. one of our Offices, stores or factories. Our hybrid work policy means an average of 3 days per week in the office. The hiring team will discuss the policy and role eligibility with you during the recruitment process.

Children are our role models. Their curiosity, creativity and imagination inspire everything we do. We strive to create a diverse, dynamic and inclusive culture of play at the LEGO Group, where everyone feels safe, valued and they belong.

The LEGO Group is highly committed to equal employment opportunity and equal pay and seeks to encourage applicants from all backgrounds (eg. sex, gender identity or expression, race/ethnicity, national origin, sexual orientation, disability, age and religion) to apply for roles in our team.

The LEGO Group is fully committed to Children’s Rights and Child Wellbeing across the globe. Candidates offered positions with high engagement with children are required to take part in Child Safeguarding Background Screening, as a condition of the offer.

Thank you for sharing our global commitment to Children’s Rights.

Just imagine building your dream career.

Then make it real.

Join the LEGO® team today.
Show more
HTML:
Job Description

Are you interested in shaping the future of LEGO’s purchasing through innovative AI solutions?

"Bring your digital and data expertise to the LEGO Group’s Procurement team! Help us harness the power of AI platforms to enhance our purchasing processes to buy better, faster, and more sustainably.”


Core Responsibilities

This student worker role is designed to help you build a strong foundation in both data analytics and procurement operations, setting you up for a successful career in either discipline. You will learn to



  • Prepare, clean, and maintain high-quality procurement data to support digitalisation and AI readiness.
  • Understand and promote data integrity and best practices in data management.
  • Design and build automated applications and workflows using Microsoft Power Platform (Power BI, Power Apps, Power Automate).
  • Learn key procurement processes such as sourcing, contract management, and supplier management, through hands-on involvement in activities delivered by the Procurement Centre of Excellence.
  • Participate in Supplier Risk Assessments, contributing to how we evaluate and manage supplier performance and exposure.
  • You’ll be surrounded by professionals who will mentor and support you, while giving you real responsibilities from day one.



Play your part in our team succeeding

The Procurement Centre of Excellence is responsible for delivering operational efficiencies from the LEGO Group’s Procurement systems and processes for the Global Procurement team.

The student worker reports to the Director of Procurement Transformation and will play a key role in preparing for the introduction of artificial intelligence into procurement digital solutions. The role will focus on ensuring the quality, structure, and availability of data needed to support these innovations, while also contributing to the core procurement activities delivered by the Centre of Excellence team.

The Procurement organization is based across the LEGO hubs and sites; Billund, Singapore, Shanghai, Enfield, London, Shenzhen, and in other manufacturing locations Czech Republic, Hungary, China and Mexico. This position will be based in Billund, Denmark and will be for 12 months.

Do you have what it takes?



  • It is a prerequisite that you are enrolled in an educational institution during your employment as a student worker.
  • You are a student in procurement, Supply Chain, IT, business, data science, engineering, or other related field.
  • Are interested in data, digital tools, and procurement operations.
  • Some familiarity with Microsoft Excel and ideally some exposure to Microsoft Power BI, Power Apps, or Power Automate (training will be provided).
  • Proactive mindset with attention to detail and a drive to solve problems.
  • Strong collaboration and communication skills in an international environment.
  • Ability to build strong stakeholder relationships.
  • Capacity to thrive in a fast-paced, challenging, and unpredictable environment.
  • Understanding of Operational Procurement.
  • High tolerance to work across multiple functions.
  • Ability to work in a global team.
  • English at fluent level is required.



Applications are reviewed on an ongoing basis. However, please note we do amend or withdraw our jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to any advertised closing date. So, if you're interested in this role we encourage you to apply as soon as possible.

What’s in it for you?

Here is what you can expect

Family Care Leave - We offer enhanced paid leave options for those important times.

Insurances – All colleagues are covered by our life and disability insurance which provides protection and peace of mind.

Wellbeing - We want our people to feel well and thrive. We offer resources and benefits to nurture physical and mental wellbeing along with opportunities to build community and inspire creativity.

Colleague Discount – We know you'll love to build, so from day 1 you will qualify for our generous colleague discount.

Bonus - We do our best work to succeed together. When goals are reached and if eligible, you'll be rewarded through our bonus scheme.

Workplace - When you join the team you'll be assigned a primary workplace location i.e. one of our Offices, stores or factories. Our hybrid work policy means an average of 3 days per week in the office. The hiring team will discuss the policy and role eligibility with you during the recruitment process.

Children are our role models. Their curiosity, creativity and imagination inspire everything we do. We strive to create a diverse, dynamic and inclusive culture of play at the LEGO Group, where everyone feels safe, valued and they belong.

The LEGO Group is highly committed to equal employment opportunity and equal pay and seeks to encourage applicants from all backgrounds (eg. sex, gender identity or expression, race/ethnicity, national origin, sexual orientation, disability, age and religion) to apply for roles in our team.

The LEGO Group is fully committed to Children’s Rights and Child Wellbeing across the globe. Candidates offered positions with high engagement with children are required to take part in Child Safeguarding Background Screening, as a condition of the offer.

Thank you for sharing our global commitment to Children’s Rights.

Just imagine building your dream career.

Then make it real.

Join the LEGO® team today.

Title: Google Workspace Specialist
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
We're an award-winning Google Cloud partner. We're the experts in transforming businesses and shaping the future of cloud technology. Join us and collaborate with top minds, build groundbreaking solutions, and make a real difference for our clients. Enjoy extensive professional development, global reach, and a supportive, Google-inspired culture. If you're passionate about the cloud, this is where you want to be.

With over 13 years of experience in Google Cloud under our belt, offices in 18 countries and more than 600 experts, we have deployed practical innovation alongside Google. We focus on infrastructure modernisation, data management, smart analytics, application modernisation, and AI & machine learning.

Curious about our projects? We got you: Check out our success stories

Job Description

As a Google Workspace Specialist, you will work within the Google Workspace Service Delivery team to help our customers with their support needs. You will be responsible for becoming a trusted advisor for all things Google Workspace for our customer base. In this role, you will leverage your deep understanding of Google Workspace to drive successful customer outcomes.

You will be involved in customer projects both technical and change management focused and will help to perform migrations to Google Workspace. You will provide onboarding, training and best practice guidance on how to use the tools at their disposal, accommodating different levels of customers’ technical expertise. In order to assure their satisfaction you will resolve arising technical issues, either by yourself or in cooperation with our team of experts. You will be working with many varied customers from scale ups, retail, technology, gaming and entertainment, to the public sector. Regular customer touchpoints will allow you to maintain a solid overview on the customer status and identify possible business development opportunities.

Responsibilities:


Execute the technical aspects of Google Workspace implementation projects, including migrations, integrations, and custom configurations.
Provide technical troubleshooting and problem resolution for complex Google Workspace issues.
Analyze customer environments to recommend and implement optimal Google Workspace configurations and best practices.
Provide onboarding and training to customers
Collaborate with internal teams and external stakeholders to ensure successful project delivery and customer satisfaction.
Stay abreast of the latest Google Workspace features, updates, and technical advancements.
Identify opportunities for technical improvements and strategic evolution within customer Google Workspace environments.



Qualifications


Good knowledge of Google Workspace solutions, preferably confirmed by certification.
Experience with managing Microsoft 365 and similar solutions is a big bonus!
Excellent communication and presentation skills befitting a customer-facing role.
Ability to provide high-quality customer onboarding and training.
Ability to communicate and explain complex technical concepts to varied audiences.
Previous experience with IT network or systems administration.
Previous experience in support and/or service desk role.
Fluent English is required; proficiency in one of the Scandinavian languages is preferred.



Additional Information

Why Choose Devoteam G Cloud?


Innovative Impact: Work on the forefront of cloud technology at a globally recognized leader in Google Cloud solutions.
Direct Google Connection: Collaborate closely with Google teams, shaping the future of cloud and AI.
Unleash Your Expertise: Thrive in a fast-paced environment where sharing knowledge and success is paramount.
End-to-End Impact: Drive complete business transformations, from strategy to implementation and beyond.
Accelerate Your Career: Grow within a Google-inspired culture, gaining specialisations and certifications.



We do plenty of activities, like meet-ups, hackathons, and partnerships. Don’t lose any of them: follow us on LinkedIn

Benefits


Encouragement and support for training and certification, in the form of coaching from other team members, cost coverage, and financial incentives.
Challenging and rewarding assignments, many of which are end-to-end.
A hybrid work model as standard, with flexible working hours and location to support your work-life balance.
An international, diverse, and inclusive team.
A human-centric and value-based company culture.
Full provision of work tools.
A variety of social events.



Our culture is based on continuous learning and career development, supported by a genuine, inclusive, and expert team that really loves pizza.

Want to know more about life at Devoteam? Check our Instagram page

Is this not the right position for you? Don’t worry, we have plenty of opportunities! Check out our Career page
Show more

Title: Assistent Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Ønsker du at kickstarte din karriere og komme foran andre i din årgang? Brænder du for at investere i din professionelle og personlige udvikling, samt er du interesseret i at komme helt tæt på, hvordan man bygger og driver virksomheder. Vil du være del af et exceptionelt team af talentfulde og drevne mennesker med stor erfaring i at bygge succesfulde virksomheder? I så fald kan du være den rigtige til vores Talent Internship Program.

Om os

Private Equity Insights er verdens førende Private Equity-fællesskab. Vi forbinder og udvikler mere end 240.000 investeringsprofessionelle over hele verden gennem vores platforme, der omfatter konferencer, webinars, magasiner og nyhedsrapporter.

Private Equity Insights er en del af United Media, der fokuserer på at opbygge store industrier inden for medier og konferenceprodukter inden for sektorer som forsikring, HR, private equity, detailhandel osv. Fra i dag har vi organisk lanceret 8 medievirksomheder og erhvervet en.

Dine Opgaver

Du vil arbejde ud af vores HQ i København, hvor du vil få en mentor som tager del i din udvikling. Din opgaver vil variere og kan bl.a. indeholde:


Drive og udvikle vores process for Leads til vores salgsteam med fokus på at øge antal og kvalitet
Støtte vores kontakt til medlemmer for at udvikle vores medlemsrejse
Understøtte vores finance team med rapportering og hjælpe med inddrivelse af penge
Kommunikation på SoMe eks. LinkedIn posts, osv.


Hvad vi tilbyder dig

Vi har en lang track record for at vores interns efterfølgende får arbejde i nogle af de største konsulenthuse, investment banks og private equity fonde. Herunder Mckinsey, Blackstone, Goldman Sachs, BCG mm.

Som del af vores Talent Internship Program bliver du del af et skræddersyet program som er bygget til at udvikle talent indenfor forretning og entreprenørskab, og som historisk har udviklet CEOs og andre ledere til vores virksomheder. Du får muligheden for et betalt internship, hvor du vil opleve:


Indsigt i hvordan man bygger og driver virksomheder ved at være del af lokalet, når beslutninger træffes
Et givende professionelt netværk af ambitiøse talenter, inspirerende mennesker og C-level erhvervsledere
Muligheden for at kickstarte din karriere med ansvar for vigtige projekter som vil skubbe dig ud af din komfort zone


Hvad vi forventer fra dig

Du besidder exceptionel arbejdsmoral og "high sense of urgency". Du besidder et stort drive og ønsker at være den bedste til det du gør. Du tager ejerskab over dine opgaver, er proaktiv i dine handlinger og følger dine forpligtelser og opgaver til dørs. Du er ydmyg og deler vores passion for at bygge virksomheder.

Vi forventer også at du:


Har gennemført STX, HHX eller HTX med top karakter
Har erfaring fra at arbejde deltid eller fra andre ekstra aktiviteter


Ansøgningsfrist: 1. september 2025 eller indtil alle pladser er fyldt.

Hvis du har nogen spørgsmål, er du velkommen til at kontakte William Jørck på (+45) 22392014 eller wj@presidents.eu
Show more

Title: IT Support Specialist - Microsoft 365 & Cloud
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
At Altia, we are growing towards the future, and we want you to be a part of it. If you aspire to establish yourself as a IT Support Specialist – Microsoft 365 & Cloud Tools , keep reading!

🔹𝗢𝘂𝗿 𝗖𝗼𝗺𝗽𝗮𝗻𝘆🔹

Altia is a high-value digital transformation services company that has undertaken, changed, and reformulated international projects for nearly a thousand clients. These clients are leaders in their sectors and have realized that their businesses can be revolutionized through digitalization. With 30 years of experience, Altia has proven to be a robust company with a future, innovation capacity, and adaptability.

🔹𝗧𝗵𝗲 𝗣𝗿𝗼𝗷𝗲𝗰𝘁🔹

You will join a key support project for a European Agency, providing first-level IT support in a Microsoft 365 environment. All communication and documentation will be in English. This is a great opportunity to work in an international and user-focused IT service setting, with exposure to modern Microsoft cloud tools and collaborative technologies.

Responsibilities

Provide 1st level support to end users on Microsoft 365 services, including Outlook, SharePoint, OneDrive, and Teams.

Troubleshoot user issues related to account access, file sharing, and application performance.

Support onboarding/offboarding processes: user account creation, permissions management, and access configuration.

Document procedures and create internal knowledge base articles for recurring issues.

Collaborate with 2nd-level support teams for incident escalation when necessary.

Ensure excellent communication with users and timely resolution of incidents in line with SLA.

Technical Stack & Tools

Microsoft 365: Outlook, SharePoint Online, OneDrive, Teams

Administration tools: Microsoft Admin Center, Azure AD (basic), Endpoint Manager (Intune)

Ticketing systems: ServiceNow or similar ITSM platforms

Documentation: Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint), Confluence or SharePoint

Communication: Microsoft Teams, Outlook

IT Frameworks: Basic familiarity with ITIL v4 (Incident Management, Request Fulfillment)

🔹𝙒𝙚 𝙖𝙧𝙚 𝙤𝙛𝙛𝙚𝙧𝙞𝙣𝙜🔹

⚡High-impact project in Europe

👫 Collaborative work environment

🚀 Career Plan

📘 Training Plan

💸 Flexible Compensation

🔹𝗬𝗼𝘂🔹

A new team member for our team with at least 3 years of full experience with the previously mentioned technologies, demonstrating significant experience.

Interest, commitment, and a willingness to contribute.
Show more

Title: Finance Analyst
Description:
We are Lenovo. We do what we say. We own what we do. We WOW our customers.

Lenovo is a US$69 billion revenue global technology powerhouse, ranked #196 in the Fortune Global 500, and serving millions of customers every day in 180 markets. Focused on a bold vision to deliver Smarter Technology for All, Lenovo has built on its success as the world’s largest PC company with a full-stack portfolio of AI-enabled, AI-ready, and AI-optimized devices (PCs, workstations, smartphones, tablets), infrastructure (server, storage, edge, high performance computing and software defined infrastructure), software, solutions, and services. Lenovo’s continued investment in world-changing innovation is building a more equitable, trustworthy, and smarter future for everyone, everywhere. Lenovo is listed on the Hong Kong stock exchange under Lenovo Group Limited (HKSE: 992) (ADR: LNVGY).

This transformation together with Lenovo’s world-changing innovation is building a more inclusive, trustworthy, and smarter future for everyone, everywhere. To find out more visit www.lenovo.com, and read about the latest news via our StoryHub.

Finance Analyst Job Posting

Join our dynamic Finance department in Copenhagen as a Financial Analyst, where you'll play a crucial role in supporting the Nordic Region. At Lenovo, we value innovation, collaboration, and growth, and we're looking for talented individuals to join our team.

You will report to the Nordic CFO and work with three senior controllers and a profit manager. The role is primarily based in Denmark, where you will work in the same office as most of the team.

Responsibilities

Business Management and Controls:


Monthly/quarterly closing activities
Support senior controllers with standard and ad hoc business reporting and analysis
Manage destination pricing
End-to-end management of copyright process
Focal for governmental reporting
Manage non-standard billings (e.g., employee purchases, proforma invoices)


Expense Management


Oversee the Regional Accounts Payable Process Execution
Manage P-Card (corporate credit card) approvals and monthly closing activities
Address procurement questions and processes
Oversee asset management processes and yearly inventory status
Conduct ad hoc expense analysis
Serve as the demo pool focal point


Profit Management


Support the Nordic Profit Manager with pricing controls for major bids
Conduct analytics and standard bid reviews
Submit funding requests and track investments
Forecast and track funding


Candidate Profile


Recently graduated or early-career professionals with a desire to become a finance controller in an international company
Degree in Finance and/or Business Administration with a strong analytical discipline
Advanced Microsoft Excel skills
Fluent in English
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills
Organized and methodical with attention to detail
Good verbal and written communication skills


What Lenovo Can Offer You

1 additional vacation week covered by Lenovo


Lenovo LifeWorks - employee assistance program
Home Internet covered by Lenovo
Grow@Lenovo platform for internal development
Monthly massages in the office!
Fruit basket every day Opportunities for career development and growth
An international team with a high focus on gender diversity


If you're ready to take your career to the next level and join a dynamic team, apply now!. We look forward to hearing from you.

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any federal, state, or local protected class.
Show more

  • Serve as the demo pool focal point

Profit Management

  • Support the Nordic Profit Manager with pricing controls for major bids
  • Conduct analytics and standard bid reviews
  • Submit funding requests and track investments
  • Forecast and track funding

Candidate Profile

  • Recently graduated or early-career professionals with a desire to become a finance controller in an international company
  • Degree in Finance and/or Business Administration with a strong analytical discipline
  • Advanced Microsoft Excel skills
  • Fluent in English
  • Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills
  • Organized and methodical with attention to detail
  • Good verbal and written communication skills

What Lenovo Can Offer You

1 additional vacation week covered by Lenovo

  • Lenovo LifeWorks - employee assistance program
  • Home Internet covered by Lenovo
  • Grow@Lenovo platform for internal development
  • Monthly massages in the office!
  • Fruit basket every day Opportunities for career development and growth
  • An international team with a high focus on gender diversity

If you're ready to take your career to the next level and join a dynamic team, apply now!. We look forward to hearing from you.

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any federal, state, or local protected class.

Title: Er du den socialrådgiver/socialformidler, vi har ledt efter?
Description:
Vi er et lille, dedikeret team i Stevns Kommune, og vi har en vigtig opgave: at hjælpe og støtte voksne borgere, der er socialt udsatte, psykisk skrøbelige eller har et handicap.

Nu søger vi en socialrådgiver/socialformidler, der kan arbejde selvstændigt, men samtidig værdsætter det tætte samarbejde, vi har i vores team.

Voksen handicap er en del af Myndighedsafdelingen, hvor myndighedsarbejdet for voksne under serviceloven og ældreloven er samlet.

Hvad får du hos os?


Du kommer til at arbejde med servicelovens bestemmelser for voksne. I din stilling ligger også arbejdet med kompensationsydelser, som du skal dele med en kollega
Du får mulighed for at bruge både din sociale og økonomiske viden – vi har nemlig en økonomikonsulent tilknyttet teamet to dage om ugen ligesom vi har en kontraktforhandler, vi deler med vores kolleger på børne/ungeområdet
Vi sidder dør om dør med vores udfører på området og har stor glæde af det tætte naboskab
Vi er en lille kommune, så her kender vi hinanden godt. Samarbejdet er tæt, og vi er hurtige til at hjælpe hinanden, både fagligt og personligt
Du bliver en del af et stabilt og dygtigt team, hvor der er plads til udvikling
Som ny kollega vil vi sørge for en introduktion, der er skræddersyet til dig


Hvem er du?

Vi håber, du har erfaring fra det specialiserede område, men det er ikke et krav. Det vigtigste er, at du har en socialfaglig uddannelse, og er dygtig både i kontakten med borgerne og med det administrative arbejde. Du skal kunne ”sætte dig for bordenden” i møder og holde hoved koldt i perioder med spidsbelastninger.

Vi søger en kollega, der har lyst til at udvikle sig og være med til at videreudvikle vores område. Teamet består af syv rådgivere og en faglig koordinator. Vores arbejde er meget selvstændig, og vi tilrettelægger selv vores arbejdsdag.

Vi Tilbyder


Selvstændigt arbejde, hvor du har stor frihed til at tage ansvar
Et tværfagligt og støttende team, der har styr på både det socialfaglige og økonomiske
Mulighed for hjemmearbejde og fleksible arbejdstider
Et introduktionsprogram, der er skræddersyet til dig, så du hurtigt føler dig hjemme
Et sted, hvor samarbejde er nøglen, og vi ser det som en styrke at arbejde tæt sammen


Hvis du har lyst til at være med til at gøre en forskel for borgere i Stevns Kommune, så send os din ansøgning. Vi glæder os til at høre, hvordan du kan bidrage til vores team.

Stillingen er på 37 timer om ugen. Der er flextid og mulighed for hjemmearbejde.

Kørekort er en nødvendighed i jobbet.

Hvis du nysgerrig eller har spørgsmål er du velkommen til at kontakte fagkoordinator Søren Kolinger på tlf.: 21 18 33 51 eller e-mail: sorenkol@stevns.dk eller myndighedsleder Inge Bagge på tlf.: 24 37 08 90 eller e-mail ingepett@stevns.dk (ferie til den 18. august 2025).

Ansøgningsfristen er mandag den 15. september 2025. Ansøg via linket nedenfor.

Vi forventer af afholde samtaler tirsdag den 23. september 2025.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Senior Data Analyst (Fully Remote)

We’re looking for a Senior Data Analyst to play a key role in driving strategic insights and evolving our data environment. This fully remote position offers the opportunity to collaborate across departments, supporting both day-to-day operations and broader strategic initiatives—especially as we modernise systems and strengthen our reporting capabilities.

Our current data stack includes SQL Server and Power BI, with complex data models and pipelines. Projects will span business intelligence, data science, and advanced analytics. If you’re someone who can quickly get to grips with existing systems, understand data logic, and communicate insights clearly, this role could be a great fit.

Key Responsibilities

Partner with stakeholders to identify analytical needs and deliver clear, actionable insights.
Collaborate across teams to uncover growth opportunities and provide statistical and business analysis.
Design, develop, and maintain data models, dashboards, and reports using SQL Server and Power BI.
Support the development of a modern data strategy, including system upgrades and migrations.
Help standardise metrics, documentation, and reporting logic across the organisation.

What You’ll Bring

Advanced SQL skills, with hands-on experience working in SQL Server environments.
Strong ownership mindset and a proactive, solutions-focused approach.
Proven experience designing and maintaining Power BI dashboards and data models.
Ability to work with complex datasets and apply business logic to analytical outputs.
Excellent communication skills—you can clearly explain data insights to technical and non-technical audiences.
Solid grounding in statistics, exploratory data analysis, and predictive modelling.
Bonus: Experience with ERP systems or large-scale data migrations.
Bonus: Background in e-commerce or service-oriented operations.

Show more

Title: Data Analyst - Excel, Power BI
Description:
Data Analyst - Excel, Power BI

Data Analyst - Excel, Power BI




The location of the role is Paddington, London (hybrid working).

The duration of the contract is 8 months.

The pay rate on offer is £300 - £350 per day (via Umbrella agency).




The client is a multinational high-street retailer.

Business area: Food Packaging




Key accountabilities and measures

Provide analytical support and reports based on data research and analysis to the Compliance Team to drive data consistency and accuracy
Resolve commercial and technical queries for all stakeholders and provide appropriate commentary to ensure clarity on root cause and avoid any reoccurrence
Deliver efficient analytical reports and insights through data research and analysis to support the Compliance Team in driving data submissions accuracy
Effective co-ordination of data gathering processes to ensure alignment with external and internal reporting requirements
Collate and maintain data reports within agreed standards
Liaise internally and externally with departments, suppliers, and compliance agencies
Ensure timely transfer of raw sales data and packaging information from different business areas
Assist compliance team with data verification for reporting and ensuring data declarations completed and submitted to schedule
Monitor and audit data quality and report any issues to key stakeholders
Identify problems and recommend solutions to improve the processes and ways or working.
Ongoing training to confidently work with the business’ systems GMOR, SAP, PLM, FIND, Business objects, etc.
Resolve administrative problems and inquiries with reporting from the compliance agencies
Prepare written responses to routine enquiries
Raise any system issue logs with Tech support and ensure resolution the completion
Raise Purchase Orders and maintain the Compliance Invoicing tracker for the function.




Key skills and experience

Excellent knowledge and practical skills of Excel (PivotTables, VLOOKUP) and other Microsoft Office programs - Power BI
Ability to simultaneously manage, prioritise and deliver multiple projects/priorities on time
Strong delivery focus with great attention to detail, routine process, and completion of tasks.
Commitment to continuous improvement of digital and data skills
Confident and professional verbal and written communication skills
Takes initiative and comfortable working autonomously
Ability to initiate and build strong relationships with own team, across functions and channels
